column9: I've had the mirena for almost 2 months now, I absolutely love it, the insertion wasn't too painful, about 10 minutes after though I had really bad cramping, it lasted a few hours that was it, the next day a little cramping just in the morning and that was it, I spotted about 3 wks not heavy at all, just wore pantiliners, still wear them everyday just in case, my husband could feel it the first time we had sex after I had it put in, sometimes I can feel the strings and sometimes not when I am checking it. I kind of did everything backwards after I got it inserted then I looked at the reviews I heard good and horror stories, I was thinking about having it removed but decided to wait and glad I did, everyones body reacts differently and I think pain wise it depends on your doctor. I have sooo much more energy then I did before my moodswings and crazy emotions from my other birthcontrol are gone, hope this helps everyone!!!

column2: dollydd88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Very painful insertion. Constantly have cysts that rupture. Acne that has scared my face, I never had skin problems previous to the Mirena. No sex drive and it is ruining my marriage along with my unexplained laziness and mood swings. Having sex has been painful but tolerable. Until 2 weeks ago and it was extremely painful followed by bleeding which I haven't done since my period stopped  3 months in. But this week was my last battle with this thing, extreme abdominal and lower back pain and I can not feel the strings. My husband also informed me that things didn't feel right down there when we had sex last week. I will have my mirena removed this week and my doctor will not talk me out of it like she did a year and half ago. I just pray it hasn't moved out of place or caused damage!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had an allergic reaction to Mirena. Dizziness, nausea, lethargy, and forgetfulness. I had it in for 1 month and after 2 weeks the symptoms started. For the last 2 weeks they got progressively and scarily worse. I called the Doc yesterday and she brought me right in to have it removed. It's very rare for a reaction like this, but if you have any negative reactions to the drugs in the pill, you will most likely have the same reaction from Mirena. I know 2 women who love it, and 4 who have had it removed before 6 months from the side effects. Not great odds.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I experienced a lot of cramping after insertion. I experienced constant low-grade infection while wearing. I had gobbs of thick mucus exit my vagina after removal. I have urea plasma infection now, caused premature rupture of membranes in last pregnancy, constant infection problems!

column2: sickandtired, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the IUD for 1 year and I loved it in the beginning because it stopped my monthly cycles all together.  I experienced slight pain when I had it inserted, but it didn't last long.  My problem has been weight gain and mood swings; I would have these prior to my cycles. Slowly I started gaining weight--I've done everything from Weight Watchers, exercising w/personal trainer, to diet pills and still has not done anything but GAINED weight!!  After trying everything, heard my friends bad experience, and read this site--I came to determine that it is the IUD that is causing me to NOT lose this weight.  I have an appointment scheduled in two days to have the MIRENA REMOVED.  I will be sure to update my progress once it has been removed!

column2: Jeannie9979, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've had my IUD for almost 7 months. I have 3 children and we were on the fence about having another one in a few years. I'm awful about remembering to take daily medications and thought this was the way to go. The insertion of the IUD was easy, no discomfort or pain. It took around 10 minutes for it.  About 20 minutes after I had left my OB's office I began to have cramps, and heavy bleeding. Since I am breastfeeding my baby I had not had a period since he was born 4 months before, and the IUD made me have a 4 month long period that was all over the flow board. Some days it was heavy, and the next day I would be spotting. Once I had gotten past that first huge period its been wonderful. No issues with breastmilk supply, my son is 10 months old now and is primarily nursed, no formula.  My periods are irrgular, but that's not a big issue. I do have some night sweats, but I was having them before I had my IUD. Checking the strings is easy, they feel like fishing line so they are easy to locate. My sex drive is pretty low-level, but I believe my breastfeeding is the cause of that.  Overall its easier than taking a pill everyday, and my husband can't feel it when we have sex.  once I had gotten the first 4 months behind me it's been a breeze. So for me and my husband its been a good fit into our lives. He even 'helps'me check my strings, lol.

column2: cmac, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had a terrible experience with BC. I have been on 4 different types in one year. I would do great on the BC for about 3mo. And then i would start having my period in the middle of the month. I was on three pills and then nuva ring. I was only on that for one month because i knew that mirena was my best option. I was very worried for the insurtion becasue i have never had kids. It was painful but it only lasted a minute and then i had cramps for a few hours afterwords. (take ibvproven before)I didnt bleed very much but i still am having a regular period but it is very light that i don't even have to hardly use a tampon. It is frustrating still having my period each month but i love not having to think about BC. The only major side effect i have come across is depression only the week before i get my period. For me its a terrible week. I am a regular exerciser but during that time i have no ambition to do anything, workout, do house chores, and i react to everything, i am overly emotional. its like my normal PMS times ten. I have been waiting for these side effects to go away. Im going to ask my Dr. on my one year visit which is coming up in a few months. I will not take it out because i paid $800 out of pocket for it. I would recommend this to any woman who has a regular partner, my only suggestion would be to be aware of what you are getting yourself into. It is so hard to know how your body will respond. But it is a great way to prevent pregnancy. I have not had any weight gain. My acne is still bad even though i have derm face wash and lotion. I hardly ever have cramping and the best thing even though i get periods each month still is that they are so light. Would recommend to most.

column2: mom of twins, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This birth control gave me abdominal pain, and frequent bleeding, especiallyl after intercourse. This birth control was not for me.

column2: acr2784, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for six months. I always have back pain, cramps, and constantly feel bloated. If Mirena didn't cost me $1,400.00, I would have already taken it out.  My sister has had Mirena for 4 1/2 years and has worked wonders for her.  She has no problems. I thought it would work the same for me. Every person's body acts differently to Mirena, so it's hard to say how one would feel after having Mirena placed. My experience has not been good at all.  I also experienced pain when my doctor was placing Mirena in.  The nurse told me that I would not feel any pain. I felt a lot of pain! My doctor had a hard time putting it in place and tried more than 8 times before giving me a break to breath.  After my break, it took her twice to get it in.  I read that it might have been painful because I had a c-section and was not dilated as much. I can't wait to have this taken out of me!

column2: fdaw, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for about a 2 months now.  I had a baby in November last year.  I was terrified to get it inserted and had myself very worked up and worried.  The procedure itself was not painful at all!  I had no cramping during or after.  But now I have been bleedng since i had it put in and it's pretty heavy.  I contacted my doctor and her nurse said to take Ibuprofen every 6 hours to see if that would help it stop. (that was 2 weeks ago)  It still hasn't yet.  And it is still pretty heavy.  I am actually waiting for her office to call me back now.  I'm a little worried that something is not right and I will have to have it removed, because other than this problem, I love it, and would recommend it to anyone.

column2: nicole, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 23 yr old with no children, and when I started to date my long-time boyfriend I tried OrthoTryCyclen as a form of contraception and i hated it, I was angry all the time and I had no sex drive what so ever. I went to the Dr. to try something else that would be better for me. They put my on NuvaRing,after a while I lost all libedo, and I started bleeding a lot longer then i usually did. I started at a 2 week period and then it turned into 3 weeks, eventually i was bleeding non stop all month long. So i went back to the Dr. and they told me that I had only been on it for a few months and i needed to "let my body get used to it." It was ruining my relationship with my boyfriend. The inside of my vagina was so sore and irritated that it hurt to have sex or even put in tampons. I decided to go to another Dr. and she told me to take out the ring immidiately. We talked about my options and at first I was hesitant about putting something foreign in my body, but after i researched every kind of birthcontrol there is, I decided that an IUD was best for me. My Dr. recomended Mirena over Paragard due to my heavy cramping and bleeding. I went that next week and got an appointment for a consultation at planned parenthood and the nurse and I determined that i was a good candidate. The Nurse wanted me to know the possible side effects before I had it inserted and it freaked me out, a lot, but it couldnt have been worse then what i was already going through, so i took the risk. That friday I got it inserted, it was really painful, but worth it. I had uncomfortable cramping for about an hour after the appointment, but i took a nap and woke up feeling much better. The next few days I had minor cramping but ibuprofin was enough to control the pain. My bleeding stopped after 2 or 3 days and i got my sex life back. I have had it in about a month now and i am very happy with it. I would recommend it to anyone as long as you do your research and know what is going on with your body.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I wanted to discuss my experience bc before having Mirena inserted I searched the internet and saw mostly terrifying experiences.  I would recommend Mirena to ANYONE!  Insertion was slighly uncomfortable, but no worse than a large period cramp, spotting for about a week after that was intense along with cramps, but nothing that is unbearable (especially when you consider one week compared to 5 years of cramps!!!) and I am now into my 2nd month.  My period is very slight and no cramping.  I have totally forgotten it is even in there and love the freedom it's afforded.  I have had terrible weight gain with other forms of BC, so this was a large concern; so far no weight gain, no mood swings, no acne, no bad side effects at all!  My boyfriend cannot feel anything at all.  It was the best decision I've made about birth control.

column2: Lemur, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am forty years old, I have a seven-year old daughter, and I just had Mirena inserted yesterday. I know it is early but after reading the boards I felt compelled to share my experience.  I read this board before getting Mirena and I was TERRIFIED.  I took ibuprofen beforehand, and when I saw the instruments on the table I thought I would pass out.  The entire procedure took less than ten minutes.  There was some cramping when the nurse swabbed my cervix and then when she inserted the IUD, but it was short-lived.For the rest of the day I waited for the pain, but it didn't come.  This morning I have had some dull aches, but nothing worse than period cramps.  The doctor recommended that I get it inserted while on my period, so I can't distinguish the bleeding and cramping from anything that doesn't happen during my regular period.I will post another time about any side effects I do or do not have.  In the meantime, I wanted to comfort those who may read this board.  Not every experience is bad.  So far, mine is fine; it was much easier than I anticipated.

column2: Jooooooswuck, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love Mirena! As a birth control I will never go back to any other form unless I absolutely HAVE to. I love not having to take a pill every day (since I'm ditzy and empty headed I don't really trust myself to do so), and I know that I don't wan't children anytime soon. I'm in a very committed relationship with my future husband and I currently have 0 children, aged 22. My Insurances covered the cost of the device and installation. I paid about $30.00 each visit to Planned Parenthood (The only place to around Delaware that would implant it). The Installation didn't hurt nearly as bad as I thought (or as bad as everyone online made it seem). It felt like a really bad pinchy cramp while they installed it but nothing that I couldn't tolerate with 800mg of just Ibuprofen in me. I've had ovarian cysts that hurt worse that having this implanted.The after cramps were pretty noticeable but to me it felt just like a regular heavy period of mine. I was able to still go shopping for hours after I had it implanted,and I was very nauseous but I found it worth it for Mirena. I had cramps for about a month, with slight bleeding but nothing too bad or nothing Ibuprofen couldn't handle. I didn't have sex for about three weeks after having it implanted but when I did, me and my fiance sore off condoms right away ;)It has now been a year and a half since I've had it implanted and I couldn't wish for a better birth control. I have almost no side effects (besides maybe sometimes a noticeable sightly smelly discharge right around the time of when my periods are supposed to start).As far as my periods go, I used to have really heavy VERY painful periods. Now I don't have any =)I spot when it's about time for my period is supposed to start, but it's so light that I barely notice it. (nothing a tiny little pad liner can't keep contained). I also cramp around that time as well. I would say my experience with Mirena is wonderful and I would get it again when my five years are up)

column2: cowgirl, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: What a horrible birthcontrol to put out there.  If you never want children this is great... but I wanted to control when I would have my second child with ease.... well the mirena messed my left ovary up, causing two eptopic pregnancies and I am not sure if I will be able to concieve conventionally again.  I was irratible anxxious and very forgetful while using mirena. and I gained 20 pounds in a month...Do not use unless you absolutely don't want kids!!!!

column2: boosarah1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This is my second time using Mirena. I absolutely love it!! I don't have a period, no worrying about taking a pill everyday or going to the clinic for a shot. The only thing I didn't like about the Mirena was when it was inserted. I felt a lot of discomfort, spotted for a few days, and was a little bit bloated. My doctor gave me medicine to dilate my cervix and medicine for pain but I still felt the thing going in and it hurt. After the first few hours, I was back to doing laundry and going back to work the same day. I have had kids and I am not sure if I want more right now so this form of birth control is perfect for my busy life. I am not in a committed relationship so it was a bit difficult to find a doctor to give me the Mirena and I have had a previous ectopic pregnancy and I didn't want another one. I did the research and found that the possibility of me getting pregnant and getting an ectopic was higher off birth control than on the Mirena. I haven't had any side affects on it, just mild weight gain which I maintain by watching what I eat and when I eat. I just don't eat a whole box of cookies and I eat sensibly. I don't exercise much but my career isn't a desk job so I am on my feet a lot. I enjoy the Mirena and would recommend it to everyone. The other reviews found on here are rare because when I asked my doctor about them he said they don't happen very often. My hair is in tact, my periods are gone, my weight is fine, and my sex life hasn't changed. Mirena is a great birth control choice if you want something that isn't permanent that is long lasting and reversible that you don't have to worry about every day. It's awesome!! Good luck in whatever your choice is- and talk to your doctor.

column2: ganae8, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Hell is the first word that comes to mind when I hear the word Mirena. initially I liked it because it stopped my period and took the guess work out of taking a pill etc. about a year in I started getting panic attacks, heart palpatations never suffered it before. horrible insomnia, gained 30lbs with diet and exercise, burning arms and the back of neck, dry eyes, dry mouth, shakiness/trembiling, cramping, migraines and hot flashes/night sweats, Im in my early 20s so knew it wasn't menopause. Had it removed and lost 20 lbs within the first month and a half. got my hormones tested and im not ovulating and im now 8 months post removal, not making any progesterone, my adrenal hormones are through the roof. still working on regulating everything but these women who recommend the mirena keep saying about not listening to the negative reviews. I WISHED I DID. You may not have the negative reactions I have had but I don't think birth control is worth the gamble of getting a year of your life robbed from you. I also encourage you to go to curezone mirena side effects forum. if that doesn't convine you, nothing will. Take it from me, if you don't have your health, you have nothing. :(

column2: zebrapants, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I love this thing! I do not want children, never did, but I cannot do the pill anymore as I am over 35 and smoke. column2: Eisha, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The Mirena coil is one of the most reliable forms of birth control.  Definitely a plus for those of us not planning on kids for quite a while. Curious and tired of the daily pill, I figured I'd venture to this option of birth control.  CONS:1. Insertion was one of the most painful experiences of my life.  I had my nose broken, back injuries, and other very painful occurrences in the last few years.  I'd say this was the worst though.  (Although it may also be attributed to the fact that my GYN didn't use a numbing agent, my uterus is anteverted, and I'm a nulliparous patient.) Took ibuprofen before the procedure - I could not imagine how awful it would have been without it. 2.  Cramps were so bad on the way home I had to pull over several times.  I had to deal with semi-severe cramps for the first week, and so, set a medication schedule to ensure my ibuprofen was always working.3. Although I have not gained any weight, per se, I am always very bloated.  I had problems with bloating before, but not to this extent.  I sometimes look 5 months pregnant, but with my stick-like arms.  Kinda funny looking, haha.3. Purely physical, but my boobs seemed to deflate after switching to Mirena from the ortho-cyclen.  PROS:1. Peace of mind.  VERY reliable form of birth control. Significantly more effective than the pill, especially if you didn't take it at the EXACT same time every day.2. First month period was significantly lighter than usual.  Following periods tapered off until no period!  Score.3. No daily pill-taking.4. Related to #3, but no mood swings or spotting from taking a pill late.  Now, I hear most people have spotting for the first three to six months after insertion.  Fortunately, after the initial semi-traumatic insertion, it's been smooth sailing post-first week.I think the pros outweigh the cons.  I would get it again, just with a different GYN who would care enough to try and make it a little less traumatic.

column2: tia100, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I did a lot of research on medication before having implanted in early October.  I liked the benefit of not having to worry taking birth control daily and not having to get anything else done for 5 years.  I had problems from the start. Insertion was painful but it did not last very long.  I have been spotting ever since I got the iud placed.  I had to go back to my doctor several times and complain and she gave me a supplimental horomone to stop the spotting.  I was spotting everyday that I was not having my menstral cycle.  So it seemed like I was on my period all the time.  The worst side effect ever was that my hair started falling out.  I thought it was stress so I tried all types of stress relief and vitamins to help it.  Finally my hairdresser showed me a blog where thousands of women have complained of the same thing.  Now I have a bald spot at the top of my head!!! I am having it removed in two days can not wait.  I have never had so many problems with birthcontrol.  Be AWARE!! I am a healthy 30 year old women without any health problems and the Mirena has not done nothing but cause me problems and grief!!! My advice to you do not get it!!!! Not worth.. the risk!!!

column2: sdylern, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my little girl July 7th 2011, I am an RN and did my research.... thought Mirena was a great idea and had it put in at 6 weeks postpartum.  By 2 months postpartum about 2 weeks after having Mirena inserted I started having joint pain and stiffness especially in the morning. I attributed this to postpartum adjustment of ligaments, muscles and hormones.  WELL........at 4 months postpartum it had just gotten worse!!! I contacted my MD and she said this was not a normal postpartum symptom. She suggested I see a rhuematologist.  I had some bloodwork done and it was all negative.  My hair has also been falling out but this is a typical hormone transition symptom after pregnancy. Then I gained 15lbs but I had stopped breastfeeding so I attributed it to that.  All this being said my daughter is now 7 monts old, I have been eating 1000 to 1500 calories a day and working out at least one hour a day and cannot lose weight!!! My hair is still falling out, my joint pain and stiffness is horrible (Im 28 by the way), I cant lose weight, Im dizzy, nauseated and having the same symptoms as pregnancy (no Im not pregnant, Ive defineltly checked on that)!!! After searching the web Ive found that many other women have had the same problems due to Mirena.  I called my MD to have it removed ASAP, I hope to update this after I find if my symptoms get better.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena just going on a year now and REALLY am loving it!!! I read so many reviews and was so scared going in to get it inserted but was pleasantly surprised, it was very uncomfortable for about 5 minutes and I did have some pretty intense cramping for a few hours after but nothing I couldn't handle. I went back to work that afternoon. I am 26, with 2 kids and am unsure if I am going to have any more. I have a period for about 2-3 days every 2 or 3 months, which is fabulous!! Even when I have them, they are VERY light. I have noticed I have had some acne, which is not ideal, but to be fair I can't completely say that is the birth control. I recently switched the brand of face wash I use, so hopefully that will help. Either way, to me a little acne is fine, considering the convenience this little thing has given me!! I have the sex drive I had when NOT being on any birth control, so it really is great!! I highly recommend this form of birth control.

column2: Horrified, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It's been 2 years since I had the Mirena inserted due to heavy and irregular periods. I started noticing about a year ago that I became very anxious and sometimes had panic attacks. My doctor put me on Cymbalta and that seemed to help. But then I noticed my hair was starting to fall out a lot more than what would be considered normal. At first I thought it was due to stress and some changes in my life (new job, move to a different state). It's now 1 year later and nothing has changed. It has made me a total "basket case" at times and my relationship with my husband is suffering. Thank god he is so understanding. My hair has thinned to the point that I am actually considering a hair transplant. It's taken over my life. I am getting this thing removed ASAP. I've heard horror stories from different people about the hair loss. Hopefully as soon as I get it out of me I will feel much better. If you have fine hair to begin with, DON'T DO IT!!!!!!

Husband can feel the string every once in a while but not a problem. If it keeps up this way I will be getting another Mirena when this one is removed.

column2: Deannamg1984, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: Love the IUS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on depo for ten years and decided to transition to the Mirena due to some negative side effects from the shot. I travel across ten time zones on a routine basis so the pill was not a viable option, and did not want the random bleeding from the implant. I read many reviews before getting the Mirena and almost backed out based on the negative reviews. I am so glad I went through with the procedure.I have not had children, but have a history of severe and demobilizing cramping associated with periods. Therefore, my pain threshold is fairly high. The insertion was not bad at all. There are two uncomfortable times during the insertion - one when the sounding is done and again when the device is inserted. The pain only lasted for about 20 seconds with each step. Thus, I found this to be very bearable. Who can't handle 40 seconds of pain? What probably made this event a non-event was the prep work I did before the procedure. First, my doc prescribed a cervix softener which I placed intra-vaginally the night before and then the morning of the procedure. Second, I took OTC pain medicine starting the night prior. Third, I found a doctor who had a lot of experience placing the device. Overall, these steps probably helped tremendously. It appears that the depo left my system very quickly, probably because I have a high metabolism owing to my 10+ mile runs every day. I note a normal cycle except my period last for about two hours each month, which is a tremendous relief from my long and painful periods.I did not have many negative side effects from the shot (same hormone as the Mirena), and do not notice any difference with the Mirena. The progesterone can aid in weight gain, but only by increasing your hunger. Thus, you must control how much you are eating and exercising while on this drug rather than simply blaming the medicine.Overall, long-term solutions such as the shot and Mirena have given me my life back. Don't be afraid of all of the negative reviews.

column9: Very effective birth control, I love the fact that once you get Mirena you don't have to worry about it. It is a big sense of relief. column2: cookie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Stopped my periods after 4 months (It's been 8 months since I've had a period, no sign of one yet). I LOVE this thing! I don't have to worry about missing a pill, getting an injection every 3 months, or having a weird plastic rod in my arm that everyone can see. It is low-maintenance and the most effective form of birth control available. I've never been pregnant (it's recommended for women who have given birth) and having it implanted did hurt quite a bit, but the pain lasted less than a minute so it was completely worth it. The only other downside is having to take pregnancy tests every once in a while to make sure (since I don't have periods). It was completely free at Planned Parenthood since I was 21 when I had it implanted (check with your location to see if you qualify for financial assistance!!)I will admit that lately my sexual desire has decreased and it's hard for me to get wet for sex and I am not sure that is because of the birth control or other factors (I am VERY stressed out from work) but I think that is important to mention. My acne hasn't cleared up any, but I never gained any weight. Even with that said, I'd recommend it to anyone who asked! If you start to see any symptoms, you can just have it removed. It uses the same hormone as normal oral contraception so I'm not sure if you'd have better luck with anything other than a copper IUD which makes your periods way worse. Try it for yourself! Personally, I think a cessation of periods is enough of a selling point. You can always have it taken out if you notice any negative changes!

column9: I love this product. I am really sorry for those that it didn't work out, but it also deserves a review from a satisfied user. I've had a Mirena for 9 yrs, I'm on my second one. My periods used to be very heavy, now they last a day or too of light bleeding. I must admit that the first 6 months of use were a nightmare: cramps, insertion was very painful, spotting, etc. I was ready to quit. After 6 months, everything calmed down. I think it is a great birth control method, but you should at least give it 6 months before giving up on it. Oh, and I definitely recommend to take Advil (or something stronger) before having it inserted. It is painful and you are cramping for the rest of the week.

column2: Whit, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: At first I thought the Mirena was the best BC I have ever tried, but now 2 years later I beg to differ. I have gained 30 lbs, constant pelvic pain, weird bleeding, weird discharge, UTI's on a monthly basis, headaches, blurry vision, and bad depression/anxiety. I thought I was going insane with all my physical and mental health problems; but I have talked to mumerous other people that had the Mirena and since they have gotten it out, they feel 100% better. I am getting it out today :)

column2: Kelly, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had it in for almost a year now. When i first had this put in, the cramping during my periods was worse. this lasted for about 5-6 months. Now however, my periods are shorter and the cramping has gone away. I am definitely loosing hair though and I have a decreased interest in sex. I have been getting worse headaches as well, but I got them before so I am not sure if this is due to stress or the medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena inserted at my 6 wk postpartum check-up thinking it would be an easy birth control.  Well, that was not the case, it was so painful to insert that I cried so bad that the doctor felt bad.  Cramp weren't too bad and starting bleedin and haven't stopped.  I go through at least 1 to 2 pads a day and my energy is sapped.  I also developed an infection and constant abdominal pain.  Finally had the darn thing taken out and am gonna switch to the mini-pill.

column2: amoss1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena two weeks ago after having my second child in January of this year. I have been bleeding and spotting ever since, i have headaches everyday and now my vision is starting to bother me. I'm giving this mirena 6 months to see how my body adjusts and if its still like this, good ol pulling out method will be my bc again, i hate pills and all this stuff anyway too many side effects for anything!

column2: camsmom0726, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena inserted in October 2011.  It was very painful when they put it in.  I did not cramp at all though. On the other hand, I have not stopped bleeding since I got it.  I mean it is a lot of blood too.  I am very moody and my hair is falling out.  I called the doctor and she said that the bleeding was normal.  She said I could bleed on and off for a year.  I also asked her about my hair coming out and she said that was not a side effect.  I am also so tired.  I can't even stay awake past 7:30pm.  I like the fact that you don't have to worry about taking pills, but this is a little too much.  There would be no way you can get pregnant or even have sex because you're always bleeding.

column2: mad mama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Iam extremely dissatisfied with this. it may be easyto maintainbuthaving it makes my life so much harder. I have no energy, i havcent gained weigt but i cantseem to lose iteen with prescription diet pills, i have had 2 pregnancyscares because i get the symptoms of pregnancy as i did with my son. I have cysts on my ovaries that put in the emergency room twice. i go tothe dr in december and im scared of wat theyare goingto tell me because if no period is considered a severe symtom then im screwed because i havent had one in almost 2 years. I have absolutely no sex drive an i used to really enjoy sex and when we do have sex he catches the string or hitsd the mirena and its game over!! Im not surprised that ppl dont get pregnant on this. Ive had a lot more back pain since it was put in but i just figured that it was the stress of my son that did it now im not sure so ill find out soon

column2: scool, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena placed yesterday afternoon after 30 days of research and indecision. My dr suggested this product for bleeding and BC. The reiews submitted were frightening to read and I almost decided against it. The insertion was not comfortable but I would not describe it as "pain". Pain is when you ram your pinky toe into a table...that hurts. I had mild cramps for about 30 minutes and very minimal bleeding. I was on day 5 of my period and as of this morning it has stopped. My husdand and I went out to dinner with friends about an hour later and I felt perfectly normal. It is early in the process for me but I have a really positive feeling that this product will work for me. No periods? Worth a shot ladies! Don't be afraid to try it because of scary reviews. The worst part of it was being tense and afraid due to what I had read. My blood pressure was off the chart, but once my dr calmed me down by explaining everything that was going to take place it was easy breezy. Try it!

column2: Wicked, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The insertion was fairly painful, but then again, I haven't had a kid yet, so that was to be expected. Since the insertion, I've had occasional cramping (earlier cramps were worse, now I hardly have them at all) and spotting almost every day. However, the bleeding is considerably less now than it was when it started. I have actually lost 7 lbs since I've had the Mirena put in, but I've also been eating healthier, smaller portions and avoiding food after 8pm. No abnormal acne, anxiety or depression. I can't say I'd do it again, BUT it beats taking pills every day!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 5 months ago I had the Mirenda inserted. Since then, I have had nothing but problems. Now, let me say first that I have always had acne and mood swings and I don't relate those to the Mirena. My problems were the more serious ones. Since I got the Mirena I always had headaches, backaches, stiffness in my back, pelvic pain, nausea, and irregular periods. Then I started bleeding when it wasn't my period and my pelvic pain became severe. I ended up in the emergency room. They told me I had a cyst. They actually encouraged me to keep the dumb thing in! I said no, I wanted it out. So they took it out. Immediately my symptoms started to disappear. Mirena was such a mistake and I will NEVER consider an IUD again. I hope this helps other women who have these symptoms or are considering Mirena. I know I needed advice the whole time I had it.

column2: PR, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got it after my second baby. Its been almost a year since I got it. Ive been having bleeding for almost a year on and off. It stops for a week or two and starts again for 10-15 days. Got fed up and got it removed. Feel way better now.

column2: dimbulb123, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Up front side effects were scary as my body changed to adapt to the Mirena IUD.  It was comforting when I read about others' experiences and I learned that I needed to just be patient to see how my body would react to it.  I have been very happy with this form of birth control.

column2: lacey , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i hate this thing i have had it almost 2 years and it has been the longest 2 years of my life. every day i have had cramps and they are not normal cramps knock me to the ground douubled over. depression i have gained pound after pound no sex drive so tired i cant keep my eyes open i cant even enjoy my daughter or my boyfriend. every day i feel worse. no wonder its birth control u dont want ne one touching u. i was starting to think it was him just not getting the job done but now i get it. i have wondered if i was going crazy.with in the past month i have noticed more side effects acne head aces every day changes in my skin and hair loss arms going numb angry. i have went to the dr several times to talk to them bout the marina and they say it cant be causing my problems and they didnt want to take it out but i have an app to get it out in two days i just want to feel normal again. and if they dont take it out this time i will take it myself thats how much i hate it. i have woke up in the middle of the night and my belly was so swelled that i looked nine months prego again. it was so painfull i wanted to die  worse thing i ever did was choose this as my birth control never again plz really consider it before u do this JUST REMEMBER A PILL its not worth all the side effects  and problems.

column2: Crystal, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Not only have I gained weight I suffer from back pain,headaches,mood swings,cramping, depression,nausea extremly heavy periods on my last year,forgetfulness and now they cant find it I just had Xrays done

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
morgan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I decided to try Mirena out before performing a hysterectomy for endometriosis and polycystic ovarian syndrome. I had my period for 7 consecutive months and was sick of the bleeding.My doctors recommended trying it out before surgery and I complied. However, I had the mirena inserted a month ago and I have been bleeding non-stop and the bleeding has also increased. I also notice a sort of heaviness in my uterus or pelvic cavity and have moderately painful cramps daily. I noticed that my mood has changed and have been more anxious and tearful. I have heard that it is normal and common for the mirena to penetrate the uterine wall and since I have checked placement, I was unable to locate the strings. I called my gyno and go in 2 days to get it removed. I am very unsatisfied with the results.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: IT COME OUT OF PLACE AND I BECAME PREGNANT!! DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
muffie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Terrible experience.  Went on it for abnormal periods and constant bleeding.  Had it inserted.  Still a lot of bleeding, clotting.  Had an u/s.  IUD positioned wrong.  Went back to Dr. She removed it and inserted another one.  Still the same problems.  Missing work because of pain and bleeding.  Called office.  Pain was horrible.They told me to come in, went to bathroom and Mirena IUD came out!!  I gave birth to an IUD!  Walked into the office holding it in kleenex in my hand.  Never again.

column2: Amie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i suffered from heavy  periods and cramping. My doctor suggested Mirana. I starting having a medium flow shortly afterwards that lasted 30 days  not  spotting a serious enough flow where i thought i was going to go broke buying sanitary napkins. the second month they prescribed medicine to stop the flow it took 3 wks to kick in and then only stopped working when i was directed to stop taking the medicine. I am  considering  have it remove asap. I am not happy with it at all. I wished i had researched the side effects more. the constant bleeding caused me to be tired all the time and the  doctors could not  help at with the situation. I have fibroids they say is the reason for the constant bleeding,was not told it may happen. looking forward to a partial historectomy.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had a paraguard IUD for 10 years. LOVE it. No worries at all about birth control. I needed a new one because they only last 10 years and my doctor suggested the Mirena IUD. It was put in in September 2011. I was skeptical but thought I would try it. The pain wasn't bad for me. Beats labor. I think some of the comments on here about the pain are WAYYY  over exaggerated. Totally tolerable for the 10 seconds it lasts. I have had 2 periods right on time and they didn't seem to be different than before. No other bleeding at all. I noticed about a month into it that I was snappy and nasty for a week or two but that went away quick. No acne at all. My problem seems to be weight gain. The nurse at my doctor's office told me more than 5lbs is very uncommon, almost like she didn't believe me. But the scale doesn't lie! I have gained 9 pounds in LESS than 8 weeks. Time to take it out. It's a shame because I was really hoping to do away with ovulating which for me is worse than a period. No such luck. I lost 30 pounds 4 years ago. I maintain my weight. I'm aware of it. I weight myself regulary as it took a lot to loose the 30 and I don't need any help putting it back on! The Mirena is coming out hopefully next week!!!! Going back to the paraguard. I was really had high hopes, though.

column2: Jae, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got mirena inserted a little over 3 weeks ago. A week after getting Mirena I started to feel on edge very snappy (moody) next week I broke out with pimples which I never had ance in my life. Now I have a rash on 80% of my face. On top of all that cramps and spotting since I got the insertion. Getting this out asap..

column2: Mom2Two, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena put in March 2011. At first, things were fine, no acne, mood changes, or weight gain. But over the past 2-3 months, my periods have gone from about a week long to almost the full month straight. I am currently on my second round of progesterone from my doctor to see if that helps the bleeding, as he is now concerned about anemia. My mood has changed from a usually upbeat person, to having bouts of depression frequently. The acne has gotten to the point where only prescription meds will work, as I have tried everything else. My sex drive by itself hasn't decreased, but the exhaustion I feel most of the time puts a damper on any intimacy. I am bloated all of the time, regardless of diet. I am consistently gaining about 1-2 pounds a month, even though nothing has changed with my exercise routine or diet. I was hoping these issues would go away on their own, but now I'm not so sure. I have an appointment next Wednesday to have it removed and get back on Nuvaring. I had high hopes this would work, as it allows me to not have to worry about birth control. I'm not pregnant, nor had any scares this whole time, but I'm tired of the acne and weight gain. I had no problems whatsoever on the Nuvaring, so hopefully my body will get back to normal once this gets removed.

column2: beth21113, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got mirena in may of 2011. The insertion was fairly painful, but I've never had a child, so that's probably why. The doctor actually accidentally pulled it out when trying to trim the strings and had to put in a new one all in one visit. The next month I had pretty bad cramps, but not extreme bleeding. I also developed cystic acne a month later. But it's now the end of october and it's starting to clear up, I'll have scars though. Make sure if you get acne you ask to see a dermatologist! No weight gain for me either. My periods hurt a bit more now, and I have a persistent pain in my lower left side, where my ovary is, from cysts, but they're normal according to my doctor. Overall, for the peace of mind of not having to worry about getting pregnant or remember to take a pill or something, I'm pretty happy with mirena.

column2: Rienks, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The insertion was painless, about 15 minutes afterwards started to get mild cramping. The 3rd day started with mild headaches, dizziness, moodiness, no sex drive and no energy. By the end of 1st week 1 headache every day with spotting. By end of 2nd week severe headaches that come and go hourly causing dizziness, blurred vision. Very upset and depressed, and now started a dry cough with a greenish colored flem. Needless to say husband took it out before it was in any longer. I may not want anymore children right now but this has been the worst 2.5 weeks of my life. Going to doctor on Monday to get this unexplained cough checked out. Would not recommend this to anyone. Finding information about this product was difficult before it was inserted. If i would have known all these side effects before getting it inserted i sure the heck would have never had it inserted. I have my fingers crossed that this cough isn't something serious and hopefully my body will be back to normal soon.

column2: ashleilynn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena insterted June of 2010. It wasnt painful to get inserted however I did have major cramping for a few days. About a week later I starting spotting and then it started to be extremely heavy bleeding. I also had blood clots about 2" big. I kept the mirena in until October 2011. When I first got the mirena I was told there were little to no side effects, but throught the year I gained about 25 pounds, was severly depressed, started growing facial hair, constantly bloated, moody, and I also now have cysts on my ovaries.  My doctor is now monitoring me to see if all of my symptoms could of been from the mirena. Within 2 days I was feeling much happier and not depressed at all. So far thats the only change. Also while on mirena my thyroid has become inactive. I had my thryroid levels tested about a month before mirena and the results were normal. I was tested 6 months later and my levels were outragous as the doctor put it. So basically my experience was horrible and I would not recommend it to anyone.

column2: NS2004, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ridiculous Weight Gain...getting my mirena out asap. I thought at first my weight gain was due to my diet and or exercise, but I did not change either part after getting the mirena. Then I did perfect my eating habits (I was already a pretty healthy eater) and excluded my occasional sweet treat and started doing more cardio (I was doing 3x a week and I increased it to 4-5x a week) and NOTHING worked still gained on average about 2-3 lbs a month.

column2: Yasjan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had it inserted in March 2011 and have been waiting for things to get better and no luck.  I had horrible discharge and constant spotting for the first 4 months and acne(which i never had in my life). As for birthcontrol..there was no sex as I was constantly with pads and tampons!! So i guess it worked!!LOL  As for the last few months nothing has changed except my moods swings are making me feel like i am "crazy".  But i am intelligent enough that its from the Mirena.  Still bleeding 2.5 to 3 weeks out of the month!!  I feel like the world is caving in on me and I feel like I am having panic attacks.  I have never felt this way before.  Also since I had it placed, my hair seems to be falling out like never before.  I think that its a good thing but I am just not able to have it in any longer.  Back in the day I couldn't take the pill either. I called and talked to my Dr and told her I needed it out ASAP!!  Hopefully things will get back to normal when I have it removed in a few days!!  My husband has been so understanding through this which helps!!Its his turn now!!  I am done!!

column2: Pink, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got the put in 3weeks . It was very painful the first couple days after I popped pain pills and slept on a heating pad. The cramps weren't just unbearable but were not comfy at all. I have been bleeding for two weeks straight.Hopefully, things will get better. If not by check-up time it will be getting removed. Needless to say my dude is not very happy, nor am I !!Hormones are raging.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena for almost 5 years.Insertion was slightly painful but bearable.I stopped having periods after 3 months. No cramping, no mood swings, no acne, no weight gain etc. for the past 5 years.Mirena works for me.However I'm  nervous about the removal.I'm sure it will be painful after all this time.I'll be sure to take a pain pill before my appointment.

column2: Sad, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: While using the mirena IUD as a method to assist with endometriosis it became dislodged and cut the lining if my uterus. As I was unaware this had happened this lead to a pregnancy and an infection. Unfortunately the infection led to a miscarriage. I recommend against this type of contraceptive as the results were both physically and emotionally painful.

column2: youngmommy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about a year now and i'm starting to notice some of the bad side affects are not going away like discharge. I do not know if it is the mirena or just my personality but i'm never happy anymore. I don't have sex drive (could also possibly be caused by being attracted to my boyfriend)... and i'm going through bladder infection right now. BUT I'M NOT PREGNANT and that is all that matters. two children at 19 and school... i could not imagine having another child right now...

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have had mirena for 3 weeks now. the insertion was painless, maybe because i took a couple of tylenol before my appt. a little discomfort next two days, but not bad at all. i have had a medium to heavy flow period for a week and a half, normally my periods were no longer than 5 days. i am hoping that when this lengthy period goes away that my following periods will be less or gone. but as far as any other side effects, i have seen none yet, or maybe its too early to tell.

column2: Kayden's Mommy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got my mirena today so im gunna give a review based on insertion...I read so many bad reviews about it being extremely painful and what not but I didnt feel any pain whatsoever , I didnt even get a cramp up until about 10 min. after it was done and the cramps arent horrible but everyone is different...It was my 6wk post-pardom checkup and like i said NO pain at ALL and i am a HUGE wimp when it comes to pain lol so please dont back out just because of horror stories...I hope it works well for me in the long run but Time will tell =)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Lot`s of bleeding and spotting during the first three months.  Spotting is still random after a year and occurs 4+ times a month and still experience some pain.  While everything is random, the bleeding is super light (much better than a week of a heavy period) and do not have to remember to take a pill.  It is important to keep you doctor informed, as he/she should be able to help minimize the problems you are experiencing.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got mirena in May 2007. Since then I have had nothing but problems. When I first got it they told me i could have a constant period for 6-9 weeks. False, it last nine months straight. Now I dont have a period at all. I have severe cramping almost everyday to the point I have had to go to the hospital 3 times. Going to work has also been a problem. Im always tired and my body feels so drained. I do get acne once a month. As for weight gain I didnt gain any weight untill these last 2 months and I gained almost 20lbs. When having sex, I can only be in one position or im in constant pain. I do not recommened this for anyone. Im 21 and thought this would be an easy way to keep for getting pregant. It is, but the problems that come along with it are not worth it. Needless to say I am having it removed after 3 years and $600.

column2: sammiboi1, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted Jan. 2010 after my first son. The insertion didn't hurt but, since then I've had cramping. I would spot for about ten days out of the month and get very bad acne for two weeks. I had zero sex drive and was always tired. My breasts were constantly tender and I put on 12 pounds. Needless to say, it was removed.

column2: regina637, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted in August of 2008. The insertion was painless and the recovery was mild, I had light spotting for a week or so. I read reviews that state some ladies get severe acne or weight gain however I havent noticed an increase in acne. Prior to the IUD I would breakout before my period which is still the case now. I feel that it is very important that I comment on the weight gain alot of women experience. Since inserting the Mirena I have lost 95 pounds - I work out and eat healthy so I cannot relate to the weight issues alot encounter with Mirena. I still get my period montly and have since I got the IUD. I am glad I chose Mirena as my method of BC and plan to continue using this product.

column2: jbanks1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put in begining March 2009. I am 32 and have never had children. They had to try inserting it a second time during the visit, as the first attempt didn't take. It was so painful for me, I almost passed out. The next two days were very crampy for me and I stayed on the couch. It took a few weeks to get used to the feeling of it, but that went away. Here we are almost three years later: although my periods are very light, my periods last about 9 to 10 days. Then I'm free for two weeks until the next one comes. I have facial breakouts for about two weeks around my period. I feel bloated for a good 2 weeks out of the month. The only pro (for me) for this device is that I am child free. I am 99.9% sure I don't want to have children and am not sure what else to try, as I can't see myself going through this any longer.

column2: Becky, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got mirena on 8/4/11 for the last 2 1/2 Month I was spotting, 14 pound extra and acne. I call the doctor and removed it.

column2: kaykay, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After having a miscarriage I had mirena put in the same day, everyone promoted it and the wonders of it. It was painful from day one and continues to be unbearable at times, it has been two months and the clinic insists that its "normal" and will go away. I'm still spotting, bad cramps and have no sex drive. I'm 26, that's just not right and its certainly not healthy for my engagement. Think I'll be going back to regulations bc. This is not working for me. I'll take ovarian cysts over this.

column2: hazel, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got my Mirena inserted 2.5 weeks ago. I decided I no longer wanted to be on the shot - sick of mood swings, wait gain, and more - after nine years. My husband has two children from a previous marriage and we do not want any more. After a lot of discussion with him & my Dr., Mirena is what I decided on.My Dr. suggested I get the shot I was due for, then have the Mirena put in so I was covered for contraception, and in hopes I wouldn't have irregular bleeding. Everything has been great! The insertion was the hardest part, and it wasn't even that bad. Because I've never had children, my Dr. gave me a local (from which I did almost pass out), but I am so glad she did. I didn't feel anything after that. While she had me there, she did a vaginal ultra sound to make sure that the IUD was in the correct place. I took some advil when I got home - had some really minor cramping for the first two days. I mean, part of the reason I was on the shot and now this is because I have bad period and cramping, and this was nothing compared to that. Seriously just a couple of minutes of pain, and a little pressure sometimes, like when you have to use the bathroom. That was only for the first 2 days.I have not had any irregular bleeding, spotting, discharge, discomfort, or problems of any kind. I know I  haven't had it that long, or maybe it's from going right from the shot to this, but I really haven't had a single problem and would recommend it.I have a follow up appointment in about three weeks; my Dr. said if everything is still in place by then, I probably won't have any problems at all, and if I can get through the first few months it'll be worth it. Well, so far so good and nothing to "get through".It is a little hard to find the strings to check that they're where they are supposed to be, but I think that will be easier with practice.Remember that people usually post the horror stories, not the praises!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had a Mirena inserted because I have endromertial hyplasia & am post menapausal. I have had breast cancer 3 times which was ER.I was given Tamoxifen and developed pre canceruous cells in the uterus from the EH. I am now experiencing severe PMS among numeruous other problems. The Mirena is being used to decrease the lining of the uterus wall and preventing uterine cancer, which my Gyneacologist is pleased about but I find it hard to cope with as well as ny other health problems which are high blood pressure,oesteo-arthritis & fibromyalgia which I have had for over ten years. I am 63 years old & do not have any quality of life and my doctors do not seem to care and tell me that there are other people with worse conditions, which I know but this does not help me but make feel worse. I know I should try another doctor but I could not face a barrage of tests again and try new medications which do not seen to help.I have tried dozens of different medications looking for relief but have more side effects & more problems.Could you please advise me what to do as iam at my tether. Regards Pam Sleeman (Australia)

column2: mcamille23, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted after the birth of my second child April 2009. No acne or mood swings have accompanied it... although the weight gain has not been subtle... I don't even know how much I've gained... at least 20-25 lbs.The insertion wasn't overly painful and my periods stopped almost immediately. Recently (about 7 oct 2011) I got a horribly heavy period and the mirena came out, accompanied by a great deal of bleeding and large clots. The doctors said I had a mild hemorrhage, but no perforation or any other problems. I'm debating having another mirena put back in because (other than the weight gain and the painful expulsion) it has been the ideal method for me. I hate having periods and I can't ever remember to take a pill. Don't know what I'm going to do yet, because I'm still bleeding from losing the mirena. I'm going to the MD soon to see what else is available... hopefully with no weight gain involved.

column2: christalkelly1980, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: works great but can't seem to lose weight and i have been not having a period of 18 months now but all of a sudden i've been bleeding alot for 2 weeks and it looks different

column2: danny44, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have not had this very long. I have two babies and we are not sure if we want anymore so we didnt want to do anything that lasted forever. I was afraid to get the mirena because of all the horrible things i read about it. Let me tell u I hardly felt anything. It was only as uncofortable as a pap. I had minor cramping and spotting. I pretty much felt back to myself the next day. I havent had any problems with it so far. I am extreamly happy with this drug.

column2: Dori, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am not happy with the mirena. I have headaches all of the time and my mood is always mad. I feel on edge all of the time.I also gained 5 pounds.

column2: netta3144, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena 9/23/2011. It was painful, because I have a fibriod tumor that was in the way and my doctor had to get pass that, but once he did that it was ok. I had some mild cramping,before the day was over the cramping had stopped. The only thing I have experience is acne, and my period is going into it's second week.Beside those two minor problems it is work fine for me. I think my body have to adjust to it.I will do another review after Oct 23 it will be 30 days.My doctor thought the mirena would help with my fibriods and my cramping.We will see.

column2: Megatron02, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got Mirena placed on 9/16/11.  It was extremely painful, but my doctor had told me it would be.  He wanted to place it when I was on my period, but I had gotten it over labor day weekend when it was impossible to see my doctor.  I actually passed out after it was inserted!  It was the first time I had ever passed out ever!  But I think that was due to my not eating anything.  My doctor made sure I was okay before driving home.  I had cramps for the rest of the day, but felt much better the next.  Now it's been about 3 weeks and I started my first period after insertion.  It seems to be going a little long, and heavier than usual.  Other than that, I have no complaints.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a Mirena success story - I have had Mirena for 3 months.  I have never had a child and am only 23 years old - most doctors only recommend it if you've had a child due to the pain of insertion and chance that it will fall out or move around, but my experience has been amazing.  The insertion process was about 5 minutes - the pain was bad but very brief, and worth the potential 5 years of no periods and birth control!  I just took a book to the Doctor's office and read a few pages to keep my mind off of it.The first 2 days were painful, just overall cramping from the insertion but nothing pain meds couldn't handle.Since then, I have had bleeding/spotting on occasion.  My first period was way lighter than usual (I had very heavy periods before Mirena), but also lasted longer (2 weeks of wearing pantyliners).  The spotting has only gotten better with time, and my periods are almost non-existent already, with mild cramping.On another note - I get migraines, and I did have a series of 5 migraines in 2 weeks that was probably due to the hormone, but since then no migraines at all, and I haven't had any moodiness, weight gain, or other symptoms that are reported for Mirena.Overall, this is a HIGH endorsement for the IUD - I am so glad I decided to do it, and the fact that I had never had a kid didn't seem to make a difference.  All is well and I LOVE not having a daily routine of pills.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I got the birth control in april 2009 after my child was born and I never had a problem until about 1 year ago it started as alot of yeast infections like crazy I had to go to my ob about over other month :( it smelled bad and they said only 5% of women on it get this infection that I was getting. So everythime they gave me pills to take that I would feel like throwing them up after taking them and they worked them a few weeks later it would come back. A few months ago I said to my self im tried of this and then found out I had no insurance! SO I have to deal with it till I can go get it out. weight gain cant lose it loss of sex drive and break outs!! I hate it i rather take my chance n take the pill

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Yeah works great for Periods - but Beware of the Mirena HELL you will experience!  Mood changes and Psychological effects are EXTENSIVE! BEWARE!

column2: Anavanessa_R, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today was my appointment to have Mirena put in. I was up all night reading reviews and was undecided whether to get the Provera or the Mirena. I was on the Provera shot when I was 18 and I had bleeding for 6 months it was definitely annoying and I was scared I was going to bleed to death.... So serious. The procedure today was definitely nerve wrecking, I was just scared of how painful the IUD was going to be. My Dr prepped me and told me about ALL of the side affects. She used the speculum (ouch) then cleaned me up, she then pinched my cervix which was PAINFUL :'( FOR ABOUT 5 MINUTES, she then inserted the Mirena cut the strings Un-pinched my cervix and took the speculum out WHEWWW what a relief that was, 10 minute procedure the most. After that we scheduled my follow-up for 6 weeks later to make sure everything looked good. Im at work right now and I feel completely ok like nothing ever happened. I am bleeding right now but nothing crazy. I guess ill see how it goes. Based on the other reviews Ive read i'm a lil bit scared now whether I should keep it in or not, but then again every woman is different. Hope my experience was helpful... *A.R.*

column2: Living life,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena for over 2 years the 1st try the dr couldnt get it in the 2nd time it was a piece of cake. Mood swings are horrible. But i haven't had a period in 5 months..not sure if thats ok. Overall pretty good.

column2: 4iboi7, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
hbcassie06@gmail.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had mine for 6 months now and found it very convient at first (even though i bled for the first 3 months) but now i have had 3 horrible yeast infections and one baterial infection, im moody all the time, my sex drive is gone, (so whats the point?)  and my weight goes up and down weekly (10-12 lbs) I thought I was crazy and it was all in my head but now after reading so many review from people with similar symptoms I really want this thing out!!!

column2: Syd30, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Insertion was painful, since I have not had children. They had to dilate my cervix to get it in place, which was quite unpleasant. I had spotting for three weeks and developed a bad case of acne (this has cleared up after the 3 month mark). My first period after insertion was twice as long, but lighter than usual. Second period was very light, but lasted two weeks with on and off spotting thereafter (annoying). The main side effect that has remained is cramping. I regularly get cramps when I don't have my period. I also get spotting after exercise quite often, but it's not heavy. I can occasionally feel the device in certain sexual positions and sometimes will have spotting after sex, but not all the time. I'm not going to lie, the adjustment period sucked. Now that I've reached three months, I'm hoping my periods will taper off and the acne completely disappears. I have not had any noticeable weight gain, like others have said. I hope the long term benefits outweigh the short term discomforts. Especially since my insurance only paid for half.

column2: rolmayes, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have not had any problems at all its great

column2: AFitzi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had this device for only seven months due to the horrible side effects that it caused.  I gained weight, developed major acne on my face and back, and was extremely moody.  I also did not have a period for the first four months, which was nice, and then had it for the remaining three months straight.  I ruined almost every pair of my underwear!  I now tell all of my friends that it was the worst decision I've ever made and I'm so happy to be back on birth control pills.

column2: samrouhan, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i had it in for 2 and a half years. i had scar tissue grow around it and it was very painful to get removed. i have been trying to get pregnant for a year now and to no avail i havent gotten pregnant. i dont recommend to use it if you plan on ever having another child again!!

column2: lilmomandwife, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I went on Mirena nearly 2 years ago after giving birth to my second child. I was unwilling to go on regular hormone birth control (had tried pill, patch, and shot) because it had cause moodiness and severe weight gain in the past. Insertion was a little uncomfortable, but lets face it, no object the doctor shoves up there is comfortable. I did NOT have horrible cramps.  I spotted a bit but not hardly enough for a pantyliner. I did however, feel it moving around every once in a while for a few months after. It almost felt like a baby kicking, which was unnerving but after determining that I wasn't pregnant and the Mirena threads were where they should be, I happily enjoyed not having to think about birth control. I did NOT gain weight, I was able to lose 50 lbs after having my daughter. I had mild acne and minor anxiety before Mirena and these were not increased after insertion. I did have one episode of heavy bleeding that lasted for a week maybe a year after insertion. The doctor explained that this can be cause from buildup of uterine lining and it went away on it's own without the need for a heavy dose of birth control pills that my dr recommended. Periods have been mild, sometimes almost none existent. But I have been having them regularly. Overall Mirena is worth consideration, and ease of use is better with already having children it seems. The reviews are all over the board and some people have had bad experiences or side effects but the pamphlet will tell you about the possibility of those occurring.

column2: Mrs. Osteen, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena put in after I turned 20. I know that I am young but was told it would be the best decision based on the fact that no other medication would control or help my heavy and painful periods. I have not had childeren and still do not and having it inserted was probably one of the most painful things I have ever had done. for the first 6 months I hardly had a period or very light bleeding, which was great however the cramps were the same if not worsened. It has caused me to be rushed to the ER twice to to rapid growth of cervical cysts and rupture. Which again is very painful. Now after almost a year it still hurts but I do not want it removed due to the rumored statement that pregnancy is extremely likely after removal. I want kids but not now! If you dont want to get pregnant I would recommend it, I have no doubt that while the iud is in me I will not get pregnant. Which I love, no worries on that part. However with my story I am afraid of it making me infertile (Cause eventually I want kids) and continueing to have long severly painful periods, with no bleeding. I just wanted to share my story because of how different it is, with my age and having no childeren.

column2: LiverChick, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I want to share my both my positive and negative experiences with Mirena. I've had 2 kids, both C-section, so my cervix has never had a baby go through it. Having Mirena installed hurt a bit, but it wasn't anything I couldn't handle; I drove myself home and was fine. The first year or so with it was Great! My periods kept getting lighter and lighter. I didn't have to worry about birth control, the pills, or condoms. I thought, "Who couldn't love Mirena?!" Then, about a year after getting it, my periods stopped completely (YAY!!) No, not yay. Without the flux in hormones anymore, I became an emotional zombie, stuck in PMS b*tch mode. I lost all desire to do anything I ever enjoyed: playing with my kids, playing my piano, reading, even loving my husband. I didn't even want him to Look at me, let alone touch me or have sex with me. My kids were suffering form having a really mean mom, my marriage was suffering, I was suffering. I finally figured out that it was the Mirena and lack of periods causing all of this. I immediately had it removed. That night, I could feel a cloud lifting, my mood was changing! I'm getting back to my real life, laughing again! Enjoying my beautiful kids and husband! Life is good for me again. And I owe it all to getting RID of my Mirena!

column2: Iud no way, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It was unbelievably painful for the insertion 3 years ago. I workout daily and monitor my caloric intake daily. I gained 25 lbs since the merina was first put in. I am severly fatigued. This summer I was admitted into ER for pain in lower pelvis/ ovaries . Had ultrasounds but all looked fine! I started getting bad acne (that I never had before the iud).I did my research and learned other women on the iud had the same problems, even pain in lower ab/pelvis. I had the iud removed within a few hours the pain was completely eliminated!! I would never suggest this method to my fellow female counterparts. Just an awful experience. Please -women do hour research before choosing this method.

column2: Jackie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm 33 and I have always had a strong immunity against illnesses.  That was until I had the Mirena inserted.  First, insertion was excrutiating, but after an hour I was fine.  Within a month I had a blister on my gut? turn into a horrible staph infection.  Antibiotics (AB) for a 2 months along with trips to a wound specialist.  While recovering from that, I got pneumonia, with double ear infection and strep throat at the same time. Never had any of those.  3 mos after insertion, I start raking at my labia,first thought it was yeast, dr. said it was female eczema, itching still continues and have been prescribed 3 diff creams with only temp relief.  Multiple sinus infections, and the start of bronchitis when I couldn't breathe, more (AB).  11 mos after insertion (Now) have a UTI that will not heal, and have run out of AB, 10 days worth.  Called dr today and am having it removed in 4 days.  Aside from the infections, zero sex drive, cannot lose weight, severe backaches, extreme hairloss(as told by my stylist), very emotional, I rarely spotted and had minimal cramps.  I had my tubes tied when I had my twins, but had Mirena inserted 6 mos after because of terrible bleeding.  Im very glad it works for many women, but w/o sounding dramatic this device will kill me lol..  For those of you who want this for the same reason, consider novasure, for bleeding, that will be my next option. jmcfaggan@gmail.com  I put my email because I want to know if anyone else has gone thru some of this, feel free to email me and share your experience

column2: AlwazL8Nakia, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had M inserted on July 18, 2011 at the beginning of that months period. I bled nonstop thru to the next months period with no let up. I figured that would be worth it once my period stopped completely. I have yet to know what september's menstral will bring...I'm hoping nothing! I went for my check up and was told I needed an ultrasound. Got a call that ultrasound came back with no detection of placement so I needed to return once again for a physical check of proper placement. The doctor said he could see it and I shouldn't worry yet some of the side affects I have dealt with thus far have me seriously questioning my choice! Since insertion for one my poor husband has had to deal with the painful stabbing from the strings even after being cut...definitly not the best choice for a well endowed man! I have had over 11 debilitating migraine headaches since insertion which is a lot in a month any migraine sufferer will atest! Periodic cramping that has me still questioning whether this device has worked its way thru my cervix into my abdomine offers no peace of mind! I hate my period but I will only give M two more months to prove its worth or else its outta there!!

column2: marblalock, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena after my second child was born at my 6 week visit. It was indeed very painful and I bled only a couple hours. I had it inserted on sept 7 2010 and on my follow up oct 3 2010 I had gained 10 lbs!!! I had a cycle in oct and nov and did not get another til april. I gained a total of 25 lbs with the Mirena.
