I felt a little pressure (like i do with a pap) and then the slightest little cramp, that I could barley even recognize as a cramp that lasted a sec maybe 2. I only had bleeding that day and was done by the next. I feel great and the relief knowing that I'm protected without thinking about it is so nice. I hope this helps.By the way I have had a couple of children, so I think if you have not (your uteres never been open) then you may experience more cramping (heavey menstrual cramps) and may bleed longer (like a period). So get it done at the begining of your period.

column2: BAND MIRENA, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My Ob/Gyn advised me to use the Mirena..So after delivering my 3 child I had it inserted which was the WORST MISTAKE EVER!!!! Just like others, it was a little painful at first & I bleed for a while but then it stopped for about a year.. I was gaining weight like crazy, very tired all the time... then one nite I became very swollen almost simliar too toxcima..my family & freinds suggusted that I get to the ER right away because it looked like signs of congestive heart failure with the way my legs were sweeling. So after many tests it was found that I was 17 weeks pregnant & unfortunialy the heartbeat stopped (Doctors say it had to have just stopped) because the baby was normal size as a 17weeker would be. My husband works in the union up north & the kids and I are in our home in Florida so according to all the dates it happened when he came home for our youngest 1st Bithday... so since I havent had a period for a year we never had a clue... the hospital sent me home and said I would just have to walk as much as possible and wait for the fetus to come out. It was horrible, 3 weeks later it finally did. I begged for the ER to remove the IUD & they said to go to the doctor who put it in! I called him and explained the situation and all of a suddon they now dont except my insurance(go fiqure)and they would remove it for $300....what a joke...I would never ever in a million years recommend this to anyone!!!

column2: Vstaggs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: The first year, I still had a period but after that i did not have another period until the 5th and final month and year

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD removed about 2 years ago and have not been able to get pregnant since. The main reason I had this removed, was because it shifted while inside and everytime I would bend over or just simply walking i would have sharp pains.  Also, the day I went in to get it removed they almost had to take me to the operating room to get it out. I had to go to 2 different doctors because it was so hard to find.  The pain was worse than labor!!! I had to get a shot in my cervix after an hour of the doctor trying to find it! I would not reccomend getting it!

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I think that every person is different and you need to take that into account when you review a product. Also take into consideration other things that may have cause what you are considering adverse side effects of the drug. I have been on Mirena for almost 2 years and don't have a single complaint. I haven't had the headaches, migraines or weight loss that many others are complainging about. Everyone is unique and so are their interactions with medications. My doctor told me that Mirena was very similar to the medication in Depo Provera which I was on before I switched to Mirena. I wasn't having problems with the Depo, but my doctor wanted a new birth control method because of the length of time I had been on Depo, and it's effect on your bones from long term use. I was happy with the Depo, but switching to Mirena has definitely made my life easier, and scheduling appointments for a shot ever 12 weeks is history. I am a complete Mirena advocate. In three more years, if I still don't have an interest in more children, then I will use Mirena again. GO MIRENA!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had hair loss, abdominal pain, sleepless nights, modd swings and now i am on an antidepressent! I do not recomend this at all!!

column2: jennd, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: As everything does, there are pros and cons to the Mirena.  I have not had a menstral cycle in three years. I have had severe fatigue, headaches, and gained 30 pounds. So emotionally unstable it almost cost me my marriage.....but I am not pregnant.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the mirena for about a year and a half.  Everything was going well until I started getting a discharge.  Then approx. 4 months later, I noticed a horrible smell coming from my vagina and the discharge. I am happily married and have never encountered such an awful weird smell so I was very nervous about it all but discovered it was vaginosis and thought it was really weird since I had never had anything like this before.  The antibiotic seemed to have worked but here we are again about 2 months later and I think I have it again.  I've setup an appointment with my doctor to get checked out but I'm going to ask her to remove it.  My husband is really upset with the whole mirena idea and disagreed with it stopping a period alltogether since our bodies were made to have a period at least once a month.  I think I'll just stick to birth control pills to control my blood flow and cramping, this isn't worth it.

column2: lkj, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Very effective in that it's been three years and I'm not pregnant :)I would not recommend this birth control to women who have had problems with previous bc methods. It caused me to have migraines, weight gain (about 30lbs), constant fatigue, lower back pain, cramping and spotting at least two days a week, not to mention daily bleeding for the first six months it was in. While the Mirena has been in I've felt perpetually pregnant, mood swings and all. I do have a history of unpleasant side effects with bc, though. So as I said before, if you haven't really had problems with other methods I would definitely recommend this to you because it is so convenient.

column2: ~janet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: As long as I'm not in the .00001% group of slipping thru and getting pregnant. I like the idea of not worrying about taking a pill or inserting a foam before or after sex. I will have it replaced after the 5yrs. I've had mine for 3 yrs already . Very happy !

column2: JackieM, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I agree with another poster, there needs to be more research into side effects. I had horrible migraines and headaches that lasted for days on end. During each month, I had a headache 20 out of 30 days. I had dizzy spells, fatigue, and mood swings. When I had it removed it was awful. I bled severely for days. Now that I have been off it for 6 months I have almost no headaches and have not had a single migraine, no longer fatigued or depressed. I am 100% back to normal.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I had this put in because of endometreosis and very bad menstrual times...insertion was not bad at all but had pain medicine before hand ask for the meds I have never had children so I needed the medicine...its not bad and I have a low tolerance for pain

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For 3 years I experienced abnormal monthly spotting, after many different treatment options, and OBGYN's my Dr. recommended Mirena. I had my first one placed in December 2007. While this IUD solved my abnormal spotting, I started to bleed during and after intercourse. I visited my Dr yet again to find out after an ultrasound that my IUD had infiltrated through my uterus, subsequently I had this urgently removed. My Dr. and I decided that since this was a "rare" complication that we would wait 1 month and insert a second IUD. So April 2010 I had another Mirena inserted. All was well until December 2011 and I had mild abdominal pain, which did not resolve. I found myself in the ER with severe pain on Christmas Eve. Turns out my IUD caused me to have Pelvis Inflammatory Disease, a very serious condition and potentially could cause infertility, Yet again my IUD was removed urgently. Among these potentially life threatening conditions I also experienced throughout the 4 years while having my IUD's severe acne, daily mild headaches, and low sex drive. If you are thinking about a Mirena please take my experience with these IUD's and perhaps re-think your decision. I'm a 26 year old Registered Nurse, and hope one day to have a family in the future. It's not known at this point if Mirena has hindered my ability to conceive.

column2: mirenafog, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This product does NOT have enough side effect research! After having the Mirena for 3 months, I had estrogen levels of a man, followed by months of horrible acne,severe mood swings (very scary & not typical for me), dizziness, ringing in the ears,joint pain,sensitivity to light, pallor,fatigue,dry skin,hair loss,confusion,mental cloudiness, palpitations & an episode of temporary vision loss....to name a few. The worst part is trying to explain side effects to your physician on a product that "does not have side effects." I felt great before having the Mirena. I was very active & healthy. After the Mirena, I lost my libido, nearly lost my relationship with my husband & could have possibly lost my job due to the mental cloudiness. I had it removed 2 weeks ago & I'm starting to feel "normal" again. My mental clarity has improved greatly & physically, I feel wonderful. I've figured out how this birth control works....you feel to horrible to have sex & the physical side effects are unattractive (ie.weight gain,acne, hair loss, facial hair etc.) I will never use another product by Bayer. Thanks for marketing the "perfect" birth control to unsuspecting women.

column2: monkey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had been bleeding for 5 months when i finally had an ultrasound performed. I had 1 fibroid said the doctor. I had it removed, I still bled. I had Mirena inserted 3 weeks later to stop the bleeding. I wish i would've listened to my instinct and not had the Mrena inserted because I have: sudden shortness of breath, chest/jaw/left arm pain, confusion, sudden dizziness/fainting, pain/swelling/warmth in the groin/calf, tingling/weakness/numbness in the arms/legs, headaches that are different from those I may have experienced in the past (e.g., headaches with other symptoms such as vision changes/lack of coordination sudden/very severe headaches), slurred speech, weakness on one side of the body, vision problems/changes.Oh, and when I went to the doctor, she said it had nothing to do with the Mirena. She tried to prescribe anti anxiety medicine. I knew I wasnt crazy so I went to 2 different doctors since. Not 1 doctor agrees with me that Mirena has an adverse affect. Went and had another ultrasound performed....(only 1 and a half mos. later) I have several fibroids left in my uterus. Mirena does not work for me and I would take an accidental overflow in public  over the side effects i am experiencing. It is very painful for me too.

column2: anonymous40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am writing as a follow up from my post on 3/3/2011. I proceded to have the tubal ligation. I have already lost 5 lbs and have noticed that I don't retain as much fluid. My depression has lessened. I am glad that I had it removed, however a tubal ligation is permanent. Make sure that you do not want anymore children and remember that any birth control method that involves hormones can have side effects. Why can't we take pills WHEN we want to have a child and not the opposite. (Just dreaming)  :)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: DEPRESSION! the only reason I don't like this IUD, but it's a very dark deep and sad reason... (no acne, no weight gain, almost no period). never had depression before and don't have it now, after removing it!

column2: paintergurl70, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this was the worst b.c ever! I had the worst mood swings, still long if not longer periods, I had hot flashes, mood swings and my memory was like an 80 year old woman, the insertion was god aweful pain and not to mention I had insominia and anxiety. I am so happy I had it taken out that was painless and I have better energy now and instantally feel so much better. I am sleeping through the night for the first time in 3 years. I would not recomend this to my worst enemy! I can only say the only good thing that came of it was not being able to get pregnant, other that that nothing good to say!!!

column2: afkbell, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had my mirena placed 3 years ago. Last week I discovered I was 7 weeks pregnant. My dr. tried to remove the device......didnt happen!!!! As of now, They are not sure where the mirena is at. They can only see a piece of it on an ultrasound. They do not know if the baby will survive.  This is the most awful experience I have been through! Do not use this product!!!!!

column2: cringinglover99, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started this birth control in hopes it would be effective and it would be easier to keep up with instead of taking a pill everyday since I had just had my son.My doctor recommended it so I thought it would be okay. I had a constant period for 5 months and I thought I was still bleeding from having my son, and not b/c of the mirena. But now I know different. I am a lot more moody, and get upset over little things. I am already heavyset so I don't really notice a lot of weight gain, but I know over the two years I have had it I have gaind 20 pounds. I am unsatisfied during sexual activity, it hurts me and my partner. I was told neither of us would even notice it during intercourse, what a lie. I guess it does keep you from getting pregnant if it makes you cringe at the thought of having sex. I want to get it removed as soon as possible. I am really hoping it has not affected my fertility b/c I may want to have another child one day. I also want to comment I have very light periods and no cramps and before mirena I had very heavy periods and constant cramps. SO that is the only true benefit of mirena for me, but I believe the cons outwiegh the pros for this product. If anyone is thinking about this product for their birth control I would recommend using something else like the nuva ring or shot.

column2: jah, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena IUD in for 5 years. No pregnancy, Light to very light periods. no change in appetite/weight. No change in mood swings. possibly a decrease in libido.Overall satisfied

column2: BirthdayGirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was 35 when I had Mirena inserted and had no children yet.  They say to wait until you are on your period to have it inserted.  I was at the middle-end of mine which may have been an issue but I've never experienced such pain in my life.  I'm not squeamish or weak, but I think not having given birth before and not being earlier in my period made this shockingly painful.  My lower abdomen was swollen for several days and I also had mild cramps discomfort.  This all subsided within a a month and for the most part, Mirena is a second thought.   HOWEVER, I am one of those women who still get their period on Mirena.  While it is light, it lasts, including the spotting at the beginning and end, on average 10 days.  Also, I've noticed SIGNIFICANT (I went up a cup) breast size increase in general and during PMS it's out of control.  I also noticed that I'm significantly more emotional before my period.  And while I've had some life changes (I've moved from East to West Coast and don't walk as much)  on Mirena, I've gained a good 10-15lbs that's been impossible to lose.  I've always been able to maintain my weight within 5lbs before Mirena and now even increasing my exercise for the past three months and being very regular about it, weight loss is incredibly difficult.  I got married nine months ago, and for a month before the wedding when I crash dieted (eating VERY little and mostly vegetables/liquids) I was able to lose 15lbs but I was seriously restricting myself (which I gained back eating normally again).  I have healthy eating habits otherwise and indulge occasionally, my eating habits are similar if not better than my pre-Mirena days.  I am now 37 and it's exactly two years since I've been on Mirena.  I don't know if it's just age and my metabolism slowing down, if it's not walking as much but I've never been so frustrated with my body.  I've been on lo dose pills before and I seem to have more control with my weight.  Any others with similar stories?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted 3/11, it started working right away!  The flow of my current cycle was lessoned to just two days- the day I got the IUD and the next day. I need to comment on the pain because many of the reviews scared me.  The pain was MINIMAL.  I did not even winch.  I have had worse menstrual cramps that last a whole lot longer!  Go in with a positive attitude, ask questions and relax.  So far I love the Mirena.

column2: ruja09@verizon.net, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For about a year before I used this birth controle I had been looking for something that would work without me having to remember to take a pill or go into the clinic every three months to pay for an injection. I  wanted to make sure that if I didn't have medical insurance due to job loss or unemployment, that I could still prevent myself from getting pregnant, and this was the best choice. My Husband thought so too. Overall I am very satified with my choice, and for someone with anemia it sure helped me have a normal bloodcount. However I did have disy spells maybe a year or so after insertion,I wuld have hem on and off and then i had my wisdom teeth removed and it stopped so I don't beleaive it was due to the birthcntrole. I hve read others reactions to this drug ad wonder if some ofthese woman made sure they followed the directions before use . usually ifyou donot follow the directions or advice given side affects can be serious!

column2: Paula Lester, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The Mirena is very effective if you do not want to think about birth control everyday.  The insertion hurts like hell (no exageration).  A few days later I began having headaches that lasted for days, some progrssing to migraines.  I had it removed after 6 months.  I have 3 kids and had no problem with fertility; however after the mirena I've had 3 miscarriages back to back. My husband curses this thing everytime a commercial comes on.  I'm a mediacl assistant at an ob-gyn's office and I've seen horrible complications (even tubal pregnancies and women having to get hysterectomies because of movement in the IUD).  All of this is what scared the crap out of me and had mine removed.  I would suggest if you're completely done having kids, but if you want more, I would suggest just taking the pill.

column2: coffeewarmer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It is very effective since it makes you so depressed you do not even want to have sex.  I had mine for almost 2 1/2 years.  I gained 30lbs and have been extremely fatigued.  I had mine removed 3 days ago and am already starting to feel more like myself.  The Dr. told me they have had several people with these same side effects and complaints.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: While there are many things I have loved about Mirena I am not sure it is worth the side effects. Not having a period in college at all was great, especially as an athlete and being prone to anemia. I originally got it to prevent passing out from cramps and it worked great for that too. However I have less energy and am quite sure that it is from the IUD. As I weigh less than 100lbs this is no surprise, almost any dose of anything would be too much for me and these are a one dose fits all answer. It too over a month after I got it before the cramping wen down but after that it never came back =)

column2: happylife, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I LOVE it!!! I'm on my second one. I had the 1st one removed after 5 years and had another one inserted at the same time. It's the best thing since sliced bread! I never have a period. I had one for about 3 months when 1st inserted then no more. I only get tender breast around the time when I would have my period. I can not feel it in there at all. I tell people all the time I will probably have one in till I hit menapause. It's great.

column2: Chris, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I chose this birth control plan so that I wouldn't have to keep up with pills. I got it after the birth of my second child. A little painful when inserted. I had the cramping and I was bleeding for a while. The bleeding then turned to ocassional spotting which was really annoying but its been a little over a year and I don't have my period at all. I don't have any of the side effects (maybe just a little moody but I am bitchy anyway). Overall I love it and will do it again after my 5 years are up.

column2: jessi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I got Mirena back in December I was told I MAY have spotting between periods which would be light and would go away after a few months I was also told my periods would get lighter and shorter and may even stop. I have been having periods that last weeks at a time and are heavier than before having the IUD inserted. I have had horrible cramps which I did not have at all before have the device inserted. I wish I would have stuck with the pill which is what form of birth control I have chosen for the past almost 10 years. I had no idea this would be this much of a pain in the ass... literally. I am nauseous all the time, hungry constantly, severe abdominal pain, headaches, pelvic pain, pain during intercourse, and general all around discomfort. None of this I was warned about by my doctor beforehand. I was told I would not even notice it and neither would my husband... HUGE LIE!!! I have horrific mood swings, depression, swelling in my legs and feet, pain in my legs. Basically every side effect possible. I wish I would have never gotten this done and that I would have done research on my own instead of taking my doctors word on something. Won't make that mistake again. I am calling my doctor tomorrow to make an appointment to come in to have it removed, if they can even remove it and don't end up having to have surgery to take it out considering my doctor cut the strings that they use to remove it too short!!! So thank you to the makers of Mirena... You have made the last 4 months of my life hell... I would NEVER recommend this to anyone!!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only had the mirena for a week, and wish I had read some reviews before getting it done as well. I have to say through the insertion was not painful for me. I do have one child though, but felt more like a pap smear. I havent had any severe side effects thank GOD, but I have experieced headaches, dizziness, cramping and bloating and back aches. No bleeding as of yet. Hopefully that will all go away. Will keep you posted after a few months.

column2: kimdm, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I got the Mirena about 2 1/2 yrs ago and I really wish I would have done my research first. Horrible decision! I have had pretty much every side effect and then some. Horrible mood swings, ZERO sex drive, uncomfortable intercourse, horrible acne, depression, chest pain, breast pain, abdominal pain, extreme fatigue, increased anxiety, increased headaches, dizzyness.  Need i say more??  I had no idea the Mirena was the cause of all these problems until recently.  I have had many tests run to determine why I was having all these problems and no one could figure it out. I am having it removed next week and I am thrilled!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted in January (not even two months ago) and it has been nothing but hell since then! The major thing is the bleeding, I have been bleeding non stop since getting this. I have head aches all the time and I am always hungry and am severly depressed and am a raging bitch. Things before that would irritate me that I would blow off and ignore turn into huge arguments when I was never like that before. I was having some cramping but was something that I could ignore and it would go away but as of today I have had cramping all day and it just keeps getting worse. i wanted something that was worry free and effective but this is not the answer! I am gonna get this thing taken out and try the paragurd. Taking things that have hormones in it is just not good. I am even scared to look at a scale because I know I have gained A LOT of weight because of this! I wish I woulda have read the reviews before hand. The doctors make it seem so simple and so worry free but I have learned your best bet is to read other peoples reviews and listen to them. I have not seen one good review on here about this! So for those of you thinking about getting it DON'T DO IT!

column2: DaniP,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Horrible! I only had it in for 3 days before I started having problems. I have to have it surgically removed because I was 1 of 1000 woman who had a problem with it moving. Somehow it moved and became posterier and is causing me a lot of pain. This pain starts in the front of my pelvis and shoots towards my back side. I had an xray done and it showed that it moved quite a bit. They then did an ultrasound on me and a pelvic exam and they said that it was nowhere to be found! Now it is somewhere in my abdomin. I am definitely no getting it inserted again. I wish I would have read reviews about it before I decided to do it. I am on bed rest now and its really hard for me because I have a 2 1/2 year old and a 6 week old baby. The doctors don't know when they can fit me in to get it removed...the pain meds aren't helping and I am miserable!

column2: Chele, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had the device placed 11 weeks after my son was born. I wanted a method that would not allow me to make spur of the minute choices about conception. My husband and I previously chose two pregnacies based on little planning, and I suffer from severe postpartum depresssion.            I hated the placement procedure... had no idea I would be so miserable with cramps.... and it was uncomfortable for about 6 weeks after: I often felt it.   I stuck it out, though, and was thankful that I did. I love the worry-free effectiveness, and that I have no menses to speak of. I have a normal red-blood cell level for the first time in years.     I plan to have another placed soon, as this one has been in place over 5 years. It may not be for everyone, but it certainly is for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I tried this birth control for nine months.  I have my period for the first two months.  Then I did not get a period at all... which was nice!  I had it removed because I would feel sharp pains during intercourse or just every day movement.  Not only that but at first I was really depressed and then I became even more moody.  JUST was NOT for me!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got mirena inserted over a month ago and two weeks after having it inserted, my uterus pushed the iud out thus causing me pain and extending my period for two weeks when it usually lasts for 5 days. I thought that this was good idea at first because I wanted a bc I didn't have to worry about but now I realize I was better off with the bc pills. Mirena just isn't for everybody. I'm getting mine removed because I'm just not comfortable with it anymore. Good luck to those who still want to use it.

column2: anonymous40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It works well for the prevention of pregnancy. The insertion was somewhat uncomfortable, however within the year since its placement I have become more depressed. I have also gained 25 lbs. without change in my diet or activity level. I am thinking about having it removed and having a tubal ligation performed.

column2: LiZay, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had Mirena put in yesterday & I was really excited about deciding to go through with it. I was talking to the Mid Wife about having it done & she made it sound so easy & carefree! and after reading all of these reviews I'm really regretting my decision! i didnt expect all of pain & bleeding. I do NOT want to gain anymore weight & don't want the loss of hair! I really wish i had researched before i made my decision!!!

column2: sunmoo69, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for 5yrs now and I can say it is a very effective form of birth control, since I am on my period at least twice a month.(little bit of sarcasm) I was already on anti-depressents but did find that my depression got worse.I can't say it's the Mirena, but there are some pretty good arguments to say it might be. I also have hair loss and have gained weight, but again I can't say it's the Mirena.It was very painfull to have it inserted, especially since they put it in and had to take it out to reposition it.Not a good experience there. Every person is different and will have a different experience with some similarities. I had back problems prior to using Mirena and am on some medications that hairloss and weight gain could be side effects, so, again I can't say 100% if it's being caused by the Mirena. It is time to have it removed and I will either have another one put back in or will go with Paragard(after doing extensive research first). I am over 35 and smoke so I am limited to what forms of birth control I can use. The side effects are worth it to me because I do not want to have children. Talk with your doctor and let them know some of the concerns you have and if you do use it, then just let your doctor know if you experience any difficulties. Communication is the best way to go and informing yourself is empowering. Because I don't want to get pregnant and I can't use traditional birth control that could cause blood clots, I am willing to deal with the side effects and that is the decision you will have to make for yourself. Godd Luck to everyone.

column2: kellic, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had Mirena put in 1 1/2 years ago to control my heavy periods.  No birth control needed as I had a tubal ligation 10 years ago.  Slight cramping when it was put in, spotting for the first month, since then, absolutely nothing irregular happening.  For me, this was one of the best decisions I have ever made.  I will gladly have this replaced in 3 1/2 years

column2: leanne , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The IUD itself worked good, but when i had it removed so that we could try for another baby, was very un-successful. still trying to have another baby.... :(   If you plan on having more kids please think twice about getting this, i wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

column2: gracie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Wouldn't recommend to anyone!  Had it put in in '07 (very painful!) and wish I had started reading these posts sooner. With an average weight gain of 20 pounds per year since then, male-like hair growth on my lip and chin, and hot flashes, I'm having it removed next week. I just hope these side effects go away...they are definitely not worth the nicety of not having a period!

column2: Chrissy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD inserted back in April 2010 after my second child. I didn't want to have anymore children soon, so I figured the 5 year plan was perfect. The insertion was extremely painful. My doctor even gave me a shot in my cervix to numb the area which also hurt, but even after it was so called numb I felt like he was ripping flesh!! Terrible experience. So now on and off bleeding for about 5 months then everything was perfect for about 3 months. Now I feel tired all the time started having vaginal discharge everyday all day which caused a yeast infection. I'm miserable and am going to take it out!!!Remember that everyone is different so some people will not respond to the IUD as well as others. So it might work for you , but not me.

column2: ana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The insertion was not painful for me. Having my cervix checked by a dr while being pregnant hurt much worse. The first week was fine, just a little spotting. Then the bleeding started and hasn't stopped. It's been almost five months now. I have gained all 20 lbs back that I lost after giving birth. My doctor gave me an ultrasound and prescribed birth control pills to stop the bleeding(which hasn't worked). I have horrible back pains and cramping, my dr told me it's not the Mirena. After reading all of these reviews I am definitely having it removed asap!

column2: Cinna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Painful!!!

column2: MirenaSUCKS, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I cannot even describe how horrible this medicine is! I was a happy energetic person before I started it and once on it. I became depressed, moody, no sex drive, and bled off and on nonstop. It also gave me Bacterial infections and the smell it gives off is horrible. If I was asked by anyone if I would recommend it I would strongly advise against it. I finally had mine removed a month ago and am now on the road to recovery.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The insertation was rather painful for me;It was like being in active labor for 15 minutes.I do think it was effective preventing  pregnancy,I did notice I do have mood swings from it and some weight gain but I suppose it was worth it.I also did not get my period until 3years from the insertion.

column2: twinmommy09, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had this inserted after I had my twins (first children), that was in Feb. 09. Since then I have very little to no bleeding at all. But I have experinced acne (never had before) and hair loss. And I had really thick hair before. I get really bloated, which is something Ive never experinced in my life. My boyfriend has even mentioned to me that Ive become a bitch since Ive had it. Im usually a fun care free person and dont care to be angry or argue with anyone. I also have little to no sex drive, and Im usually a very sexual person. Im considering have it removed due to how it has made me feel and not to mention some of the things my boyfriend is worried about. He has heard alot of bad things about it. I would say try it if its causing you troubles then have it removed asap but if not its really a wonderful thing.

column2: laflaca, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I call Mirena the devil inside of me!  This medicine has made my life a living hell.  From rashes, mood swings, migranes, to weight gain.  This is absolutely the worst experience of my life.  I had a different or all symptoms daily and my anxiety for eating was uncontrollable.  I finally read many negative stories about this birth control and went to the gynecologist to have it removed.  it's been 6 weeks since and I not only became the same lovable mother and wife, but the migranes went away and have lost 13 lbs. since.  I urge people out there to be very careful about this iud because it can ruin your life!

column2: clovergirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After having my daughter in 8-2009 i decided to get back on a birth control regiment, pills were either making me gain weight or grow facial hair so my doctor suggested mirena. i stayed off the pills for a few months before having mirena inserted and managed to get down to my pre baby weight of 135, after having mirena put in i spotted for about two months before my body started adjusting to the implant. I noticed i started gaining weight, so i altered my diet to less meats more fresh raw vegies, and then the bf mentioned to me "Honey, i think your gaining..." Not long after the spotting started. Then i started getting cramping and pains, the final straw was when i felt like i was in labor, and went to the hospital. They couldnt deterine anything conclusively (small town hospital) so now i have to go to the doc's and see why. I know its the mirena, i;ve never had anything happen like this before. it makes you blimp up and get moody, the pains are random and severe (darn near crippling) and i've actually feared for my future. I just hope this thing doesnt leave me barren, i know my bf has his heart set on a son some day. Thanks mirena, you've really done the job.

column2: wxgirl87, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena placed after having my son. I chose it because it sounded like an easy form of birth control. After I had it placed, I bled for 6 weeks straight. I also had severe cramping and abdominal pain. I have also gained a lot of weight and lost a lot of hair. Overall, I am not satisfied with Mirena.  I would not recommend getting it.

column2: acrawfo5, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Ok, so I had the mirena for a while.  At first i was singing the praises, and then like 1.5 years into the birth control, i felt like a chunky monkey.  And i knew it could be me eating too much, i mean, you cant eat to make your breasts bigger (im sure if you could there wouldnt be a need for breast augmentations).  And I didnt want to do anything.  I was depressed.  Now, keep in mind, i didnt think i was depressed until i realized what i was missing out of life.  I cannot WAIT until i lose the mirena weight.  I have never been pregnant, so when people would ask me if i was, and i had to reply, no its actually the opposite, it kinda sucked.   SO, unless you have an EXTREMELY active lifestyle, and exercise regularly (because i'm sure most of us do), i wouldnt recommend the mirena unless you want to gain weight.  But, i didnt get pregnant, and I didnt have periods all the time (but i didnt know when they would hit either) I'm not on the nuva ring again.  Its the lowest dosage birth control that you dont have to take everyday, in my opinion.

column2: butterfly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: had mirena inplanted Dec 10th and didnt have a period for 2 weeks, then bleeding for 36 days, then stopped for a week and now I have my period again and today is day 8   UUUGGG!  I just want my period to stop!!!!!!!!

column2: nevaeh, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: sore back pain for 2-3 months mestrual cycle is longer than normal head aces stomach pain tiredness ive had mirena for almost three month now and when i first got it done i had the back pain that has gone away now but now i have got the stomach pain head aces feeling sick to my stomach and when i talked about it the my doctor it she never told me that it was gonna me a long tube from my understanding it was only suppose to be the T-shaped thing and now i think the mirena is coming loose and falling out i have had these problems for that last few days i would not recomend this product to any one else just cause of the problems i have had with it and now i think i have gotten pregnate on the mirena

column2: Lovely1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: There was very minimal cramping after insertion and I had spotting pretty much everyday for the first month, but after that things are great.  When I have my period I only need to use a liner because it has lessened my flow considerably.  The only thing that I wish is that it is a little more afforable.  My husband and I enjoy our sex lives knowing we are safe.

column2: KJ, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 31 yr old who has tried multiple BCPs and Nuvaring.  I have had Mirena placed in Sept 09 to control irregular bleeding which I'd had since age 12. It wasn't a question of IF i'd have breakthrough bleeding during the month, but when. I'v had both irritability and depression during the month with the best days being 1-2 days after it starts. I fought w my mom a lot and she could always tell when I was on my period during a fight and when I wasn't. I've taken multiple pills including: ovcon, desogen, ortho-tricyclen, demulen, mircette, and yasmin.  NONE helped with my mood and some made it significantly worse and none completely stopped the breakthrough bleeding.  Nuvaring was wonderful for my moods and regulated my cycle, but couldn't keep me from bleeding during extremely stressful times.  On Mirena, I've had my period maybe four times and it's super light.  The BEST thing about it is that my moods have improved dramatically.  I've cried less times in the last year than since my period began.  Once every few months vs. once every few days.  I give a tolerability a reduced score because the migraines are way worse although infrequent.  They were rough the first few months as was the spotting.

column2: not happy at all, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I really wish that I would have never had this put in.  My hands and feet are always tingly and swollen.  I have never had oily skin before, and now it is awful!  I also feel the strings sometimes which is extremely uncomfortable.  My fiance has also felt them too!  I am calling to have this removed ASAP.  I have only had it in for 3 months!  I miss my birth control pills.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of three, a doctor, and a runner so I have a busy life.  Since having the Mirena IUD placed I have gradually developed a lack of energy to run which is disappointing because it is my stress relief.  Three months after having it placed I now am experiencing insomnia.  I now also have frequent headaches that I never experienced before.  Last but not least, my sex drive is gone.    I have read other complaints and while this is a great choice for many, it does not work for some.  I plan for removal today and hopefully I will be back to myself in the very near future.

column2: lb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Well here it goes... I had mirena for almost five yrs. After I lost my baby weight almost I got it put in, then gained more than i weighed when i was pregnate. I am a very happy go lucky person.... realized not with mirena. I just got mirena removed because I wanted to see for myself it was mirena that was making me fat, miserable, and not to meantion nooo sex drive which was driving me into the ground with my husband because I didnt want to be touched. I got mirena removed and it's been 2 wks. Since then I have lost 7pds and have energy!!! I will mention the mirena crash im still not over which makes you still moody BUT im not as moody as i was with it in so i cant wait for it to be out of my system for good. I will say the upside to mirena is that I didnt have a period for 3 yrs and when i had it removed the red demon came with avengence from not being here for 3 yrs. I feel like a new person. Im happier getting skinnier and love life more and more each day. I do recommend if you think mirena may have affects on you to see about having it removed because for some ppl it works great but for me and couple of my friends it did not. Im ready for my life to be back on track and I am on a pill birth control and dont even notice I take it because it doesnt have side effects like mirena. But like i said it works for some and not for others so dont listen to the the doctor if they say the side effects are not from mirena like i heard for 3 yrs because they were VERY wrong. I hope this helps!! Also the removal was nothing like the insertion!!! I did have a little pain because they had to scrap some of my cervix to find it which was pain but nothing like insertion or the pain ive been through with mirena in.

column2: tmac2325, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted in March 2008 after I had my first child. I opted for this form of birth control for the convenience and the plus for me, from what the doctor said, there would be "little to no periods". I must say the convenience of the IUD is great; however, til this day I have had consistent problems. My cycle is very light, in which I only need to use pantie liners which is not half as bad. Now the negatives...a few months after having the Mirena myself and my boyfriend noticed a foul odor coming from my vagina. Come to find out I had a bacteria infection (never had one before). Took medicine and that cleared up...a few months later I have been discharging none stop, mind you it is now 2011 and it hasn't stopped. The discharge has an odor to it and it comes all times of the day in which I have to wear pantie liners daily because I never know when to expect it plus it soils my underwear. During intercourse you can really smell it which is quite embarrassing. My boyfriend says it doesn't bother him as much but it bothers me. The odor is horrendous. Another negative is I am extremely tired (this has been ongoing for 3 years as well). Not sure if it is my eating habits or just the IUD but I was full of energy prior to the insertion. Finally I have had enough, had an appointment with the doctor today to get it removed and to my surprise..they couldn't find the IUD. She tried and tried but nope, the strings are not visible. I had to get an ultrasound to see if it was even in there and it is just too far in my cervix for them to reach. Now I am currently waiting to see what options and expenses I will incur to get this thing out of me. I am not trying to deter anybody from getting the IUD but I definitely would not recommend it to anyone. Maybe I am just the unlucky one because my sisters and friends say they have not experienced the problems I have. This was definitely a lesson learned and I will never have anything inserted inside of me again.

column2: redrock, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for nearly three years; however, since becoming involved in a long-term relationship in the last year with frequent intercourse, I have experienced bacterial vaginosis regularly (twice a month).  This is not only a nuisance, but is beginning to be a real damper on intimacy.  Note: I'm in my mid-40s, was on the pill for years, and have maybe experienced a bacterial infection a few times in my entire life. While I am thrilled not to have had a period in most of the time I've had it in place, I'm having it removed next week.  I just hate the bacterial infections!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Worked great.  Didn't notice any hormonal changes at all.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Yvette, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I first posted about Mirena on 12-8-10 with symptoms of weight gain and severe depression.  I am normally a very happy upbeat person and couldn't understand why I was so depressed I just didn't want to get out of bed.  After reading these other helpful postings, I decided to get it removed (before I tried going to a Dr. for depressi0on medication).  BEST decision I've made.  Within 3 days the depression started lifting, within 3 weeks I was back to my normal happy self.  Now that a month and a half passed of not being hngry all the time, I'm starting to lose the weight I gained.  I can't believe my doctor said she'd never heard of any of the side effects I was describing.  Mirena may work for some, but it is disaterous for others.  So glad the effects were reversed so quickly!  Whew!   Life is good again!!!!

column2: futuremrscollins, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Me and my fiancee have been together for about two years. We are waiting on getting married because of college this also means that we are waiting on children. I found out about Mirena in the summer of last year (2010). I had been on the pill and found out that it was causing a lab misread with my thyroid tests. Since I want to effectively keep check on my thyroid I needed another option. My nurse at the health department told me about Mirena. It was a simple appointment which I was instructed to take a medicine that would dilate my cervix (since I have not had children). I am not going to lie it did hurt. I did not get out of bed for three days after the procedure. I have had one period since August 2010. I am happy with the drug and I would never get it removed but from time to time I have serious lower back pain along with abdomen pain. I know that it is due to the Mirena. I would recommend this method for any couple that did not want children right away. Me and my fiancee are very happy with the results that we have received with this method.

column2: mom 1 1/2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had it put in right after my daughter was born. When it was first put it i got an infection, but it cleared up within a week. Since then I've had no problems. Until I had it taken out I did not have a period. After I have this baby I will be having it put back in.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got mirena put in 7 weeks after i had my second son. Ever since then I've had horrible migranes, pain during sex , and little, if any sex drive. It's been one year, and I've been talking to my OB/GYN about all of my problems and we related it to post pregnancy symptoms. It wasn't until yesterday that i talked to my MD about my symptoms and he informed me that Mirena is probably causing them all. The other two symptoms I can deal with, but the migranes which I get about once a week for 3 days are debilitating. I hope and pray that getting Mireana taken out, which i am doing ASAP will stop all of these things. If you've had problems with this try what i'm trying next. ParaGard is a hormone free IUD that still lets you have a period. I'll update.

column2: Christina88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena in may of 08 after my son was born.. I took Ibprofen as my doc suggested before I got it in.. It hurt really bad I couldnt walk I only lived a mile so I forced myself to drive home.. sat in the tub and took a percocet still didnt help. After that passed I spotted for almost 3 months. I had a ton of side effect coming from a person who has never had side effects from medication before. I got really bad acne (which I had also never had) vaginal discharge with a nasty smell. I gained an extra 30 pounds after having lost all my extra baby wieght before insertion. I got really moody and the number One reason for NEVER reccomending this is I am no longer able to take anything hormonal.. I have alopecia areta its a kind of hair loss you can look up on here it is an autoimmune disease. It went away not too long after I got the Iud removed and the proper medication. but if I take any sort of horomones my hair will fall out again I have about 1/3 of the hair I had originally.

column2: Glove, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since I have had the device inserted I have discharge like I'm on my cycle. Not to mention when I'm on my cycle it lasts for 2 weeks. I've been told by my doctors nurse to give it a while longer but I'm getting tired of it fast.

column2: Daffodil, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted in April 2010.  It was inserted in a 20 minute doctor visit, and I had a few cramps and a couple of days of spotting, and since then, I never even knew it was there.  I have been pregnant three times previously, and was VERY fertile.  I haven't gotten pregnant in the time, and have had no serious side effects.  I LOVE this product.

column2: jenn424, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena in 6 weeks after having my 3rd child.In november 2010 because of the side effects that my gyno told me couldn't be from the iud...but it was...i had depression,migraines,blurried vision, rash on my leggs,anxiety, panic attacks,nervousiness,stomach pain,upset stomach,counldnt eat or fuction, no energy,bleed everyday,i am a very sexual person...me and my husband have been together for 10 years and we are very intimate...and had no sex drive...so i got it taken out and with in 24 hours i swear to you all my symtoms were gone....please dont think your crazy if you have these symtoms..listen to your body...i thank god everyday that i ididn't listen to my gyno that had little knowledge on the side effects. i called the company and made a report....i am on the pill and back to normal...i hope this helps you...

column2: Chicky, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted in 08/2009. The insertion was painless. I experienced slight cramping the first 5 days. I was spotting everyday for about 9 months so I called my doctor. I requested to have it taken out and to get on a different form of birth control. My doctor preferred that I kept the mirena in and also get the depo shot(it was given to me in my stomach) to see if that would help stop the everyday spotting that I was experiencing. That was in 05/2010. In 08/2010 I began experiencing nausea everyday. I went to the emergency room that month to have everything checked out and they said that it was in place and sent me home with nausea pills. As of last month I began experiencing severe abdominal pain, dark/heavy bleeding, and still the nausea. I went to get checked out once again. They cannot find my string. Its no longer attached to the mirena. Because of that I now have to have it surgically removed. With my own personal experience I advise women to not use this as a contraceptive.

column2: MELBELL, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena placed about six months ago. The inseration was practicly painless and very very quick. I had some cramping and spotting for the first two days but the cramps were very light. I didn't need any meds!! My side effects include no period mood swings and light depression. Nothing I can't deal with on my own. Truth is ladies everyone takes the same thing diffrently!!No two women are the same. I do suggest that you do your research and weigh the pros and cons.I do miss my period but i'm hoping it will return.Good luck everyone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
MomX2, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena in for almost 4 years and I have no complaints at all. It has been wonderful...very little pain after it was initially put in. My periods (even the cramps) became lighter and lighter until finally (after about a year) I only spotted a couple days a month and had/have no cramps at all!  I didn't gain weight and since I got the IUD my skin has actually became more clear than ever. From the other reviews I have read not everyone has had a good experience, but to each is their own. You never know until you try.

column2: Jena Rose, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put in 07/2008.  Insertion was not as painful as I thought it was going to be.  I gain 15 pounds right a way,nausea and acne.  But that was to be expected. I couple of months later 02/2009 I started to get sluggish,fatiqued,feelings of depression, lots of interest in sex etc.  So I went to the Doctor to get on depression meds to help with the symptoms of depression. Then I didn't think it was the IUD.I started to get inflamation of vagina and vula. This last time lasted a week.  Then I started researching and found all my symptoms all relate back to the IUD Mirena.  Next week I have an appt to have it removed.  If I wasnt having the inflamation, I probably keep the mirena since I am being treated for the depression.

column2: lindalou, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena placed a week ago and I have had no problems or issues at all. Insertion was easy and was out of the office quickly. Very little cramping that night and the next day and no other side effects. Don't let the other reviews scare you, insertion is not bad at all and I was surprised when it was done because I went in to the office terrified after reading others experiences. I am so happy to have a birth control that I do not have to think about.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had this IUD placed in 2008.  I love not having periods (I've only had one in almost 3 years).  I love not having to worry about birth control.  I hate my hair falling out, breaking out all the time, cysts (no prior history), pain on my right side for most of the month.  As soon as I get health insurance again, it's coming out and I'm going back on the pill.  At least 5 of my friends had it in and I've lasted the longest.  They've all had it taken out within six months.  Not having periods has really made me put up with a lot, and I've finally snapped! I wanted this to work so bad.

column2: Mommyof3, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena put in after I had twins.  I wanted my tubes tied but i was not old enough so the iud seemed perfect. A couple months after i had it i started gaining weight and my mood swings were terrible i was depressed and everything else. I went to the doctor and explained my issues and told them I was still having my period every month and they were more painful than ever. I was went on 3 diff depression meds at diff times, nothing helped. I read reviews about the mirena and saw I wasn't alone.  I got an appt with the obgyn and had the mirena removed.  I am still having some mood swings and other problems but not like before.  I have lost 20 pounds in a little over a month since having that removed.  The doctor told me when he removed it that it was sliding out and had probably started a couple months after I got it, the same time I started having problems. He said that from where it was coming out it was releasing the hormones too fast I was having more hormones from that then when I was pregnant with twins! and this had went on for a year and a half.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Had Mirena inserted Mar.2010 for heavy periods not bc. I am 45 years and no children. Soon afterward got severe pain - bacterial infection and ovarian cyst. My periods did get light, but spotting lasted 7-10 days. Developed headaches, oily skin and hair, all of which I never had. Also hair loss/no sex drive. Gained over 10 pounds and cannot lose it. I feel bloated and get cramps all of the time. My doctor does not think any of this is related to Mirena, but I had her remove it anyway. May be great for a younger woman, but I'd rather deal with the heavy periods.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am on my 4th year with mirena, On Jan 1st 2010 I found out that I was pregnant (Yes with the Mirena still in place.) I found out that its an eptopic pregnancy. Needless to say, I miscarried on my own and I have had two Doctors try to remove Mirena and ist lodged in my Uterus. I need to have surgery to have it removed. When the Mirena was placed intitially my fiance could feel the mirena. It was much discomfort to him and myself. Choose wisely, I know some medication is for some and not for all. just some words for the wise.

column2: Trish, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been so happy with the Mirena.  Other than the discomfort of having it put in, no side effects.  I have gone 4 years with no periods, just light spotting once every three months.  Love it and will be getting it replaced in a few months.

column2: Lisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Please do your research before choosing this form of birth control. I have had the mirena for 3 years and have had nothing but horrible side effects. The pain and swelling in my abdomin is starting to become unbearable. I went to my ob/gyn last week, and she checked for an infection and found none. I am moody, chubby and in constant pain. I also have a vaginal odor that I try to mask with femine spray daily. I told my ob/gyn this and she told me to douche with plain water...??? Don't choose this!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted 3-2-2010. I have menstrual migraines so cannot most other forms of bc because it will increase chances of stroke. Insertation was quick & somewhat painful, but doable. My periods have gone from 5 days to 8 which suck. The 1st 4 months, though they were lasting 2-4 weeks. I am still on the fence about this product for me. I think I am also more "blue" feeling & a lot more emotional. I was hoping my periods would stop & therefore my migraines would go away, but not yet. I will give it a few more months to see if things even out, if not, I will have it removed. I think the important thing to remember is that with every product, some work great for people & others it's not so good. I think that not all of the side effects have been disclosed by the company, & that's not good. I was excited to get & not have my period anymore & hopefully no more migraines! I usually do not experience side effects to meds or have allergies so there was no reason to believe that this would not work out great for me. Best advice I can give is just to really educated yourself & not by the Mirena website, but by users.  If you get it, keep a diary of when u get your periods, how long they last, & anything & everything that you're feeling or experiencing.

column2: sofia, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
angel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had it put in in Feb 09 and have been tired, very moody, and no sex drive at all. I bleed for 2-3 weeks out of a month on and off through out the month. They are heavier then before. Sex is painful now and it wasn't before. I lose clumps of hair at a time. I have complained to my Dr and he dismissed it. I have a appt tomorrow with a different Dr to have it removed. Hopefully things get better.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the the Mirena placed in Oct 2010 because I am breastfeeding which limited my choices.  After having four children I thought the procedure was easy. The following day the cramps started and have continued on and off for three months.  It is sometimes uncomfortable to have sex and my husband can feel it in some positions.  I feel like I have my period everyday because I have mood swings and food cravings.  Besides the ten pounds I have gained, I feel bloated and my pants hurt me.  I have bleeding on and off also which is bearable.  After I wean my baby, I will be setting up an appointment to have it removed.  And the good: I'm not pregnant again and it is easy to use.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I selected this birth control as I am a bit forgetful when it comes to taking pills. I was also told that it helps with heavy and abnormal periods. I actually have had no change in my abnormal periods. In fact, I think that my periods have gotten heavier since using this. I bleed heavy for 4-5 days soaking a large pad about every 2 hours. The only downside is this problem otherwise I love the IUD.

column2: Mbear, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Insertion was a bit more painful than I thought but nothing more than a pinch. A bit of spotting occured the first week or so after insertion. It's been 3 years now since I've had Mirena in and I've had maybe 3-one day periods throughout. Aside from the bit of weight gain I've endured from it, I believe it has surved it's purpose well. I am extremely satisfied with the product. The only problem I'm dealing with now is the added hormone. I didn't think that it could cause other problems during normal menstrual cycles. Talk about getting a double dose of hormones! I've had pains in breasts for 4-5 days now during ovulation period. Going to doctor to see if Mirena is causing this painful swelling. If so, could this lead to other side effects?

column2: tinkerbell, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena IUD for four years now. I have had severe side effects but have had normal pap tests and labs for all those years. I have had severe pain on my right side & back for 2 & 1/2 years. Have had several visits to er & numerous tests. I just found out out I have a severe infection in my abdomin which was caused by my IUD breaking off @ the arm, ripping thru my uterus and lodging into my cervex. I have to have surgery to remove it & bc of the severity of the infection, possible hystorectomy. I have three children and did not plan on having any more, but that was my choice. If I have to have a hysto done, then my choice is gone. I trusted my physician, trusted the IUD and look where it got me. I am in such severe pain I cannot get outta bed to take care of my children or function. Before anyone decides to get this, PLEASE, PLEASE do your homework!!! Go online & research the problems not being disclosed by the maker. You'd be supprised by the amount of women whom have had innumeral problems with this device. There are several class action lawsuits being brought against this maker.

column2: DIDN'T WORK FOR ME, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: 45 year old mother of 3 who was experiencing heavy bleeding and horrible cramping, I opted for the Mirena in lieu of surgical procedures.  The device did solve the problem of bleeding and maybe one or two partial cycles and nothing since for over two years.  Upon 1st annual pelvic check up the strings to the device could no longer be located.  We then had to do an ultrasound to check for possible expulsion and learned it was still in proper place.  Thus leaving me to pay in full for the ultrasound cost which was deemed not medically necessary.  Now I have been advised I am menopausal and the device needs to be surgically removed in the operating room.  Possibly deductibles and other expenses I never took into consideration upon getting this device.  Seems that strings retraction is a common occurence, maybe this should be mentioned prior to placement so costs could be considered in the event of this happening.  After reading some symptoms others have written I feel I have been symptomatic for many of the mentioned and also wish I had done more research prior to listening to my doctor who I really trust.  Look forward to getting this out as early as possible in 2011 and hopefully not experiencing some of the unwanted symptoms.  BEWARE of hidden costs and ask your physician if this is a common complaint with others.  Never hurts to ask, even though when I reported my dissatisfaction to the manufacturer they mentioned they cannot comment on incidence due to HIPPA privacy policies.  Not a happy camper right now and would NOT recommend this product to anyone more or less friends or family.

column2: TLleigh7767, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Birth control could not be any simpler, and the side effects (for me) weren't bad at all. Insertion was painless and I can't even tell that it's there.

column2: B. Original, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After reading these reviews...I wish I would have read them earlier...I had my Mirena inserted almost 5 years exactly, having it removed in 2 wks. I just wanted to share my experience with the newbies. Insertion was fine, a quick prick and it was over. A few cramps and that was it. Disadvantages: WEIGHT GAIN!!! I am not a pig, I once asked a doctor if it made you gain weight, she said no, but I thought it was weird that I had it inserted 3 mths after my babies were born, which at that time I was back down to almost regular weight, but after the Mirena, I picked back up every pregnant pound! Didn't know depression was a side effect, but after reading these reviews, I concur! First, I thought all my side effects were regular things for new moms, but it happened too quick and had no other cause; however, I will say...it did what it was supposed to do...My children are 5 and they have no little brothers or sisters, so I'm satisfied with that...but the weight gain SUCKS!!!! And now, that I think about it...decrese in libido. But after my removal, I'll let you know if any of these things change.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: what about ovarian cyst?

column2: Kayla, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: mirena overall is great, but when i first had it put in it was worse the labor pains!!! but after a few hours i was fine. had a lil bit of spotting then i didnt have a period or cramps for about 6 months!!! it was great!!! now i rarely have a period just spot every now and again. but overall great i would recommend this to anyone who is forgtfull. but if your good at takein the pill every day i would recommend you stay with that.

column2: Audrey Hulsey, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: There is a reason the Mirena is great for birth control:  it kills your sex drive.  I've had the Mirena for 4 months.  It's coming out next month.  I can't stand it.

column2: chrissysue6, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 43 I have had 2 children but husband is fixed so no use for birth control. I got the Mirena because of heavy bleeding and clots, I also have fibroid tumors, and my OBGYN thought this would be a prevenative measure to a Hystorectomy. Not, I have had it a yr, gained 40lbs, cramps like when I was 15 and no motovation and my sex drive is worse than ever, almost completely gone. The insertion was painful but I survived, cause the first piece it the procedure broke and mind you I clearly feel this is my luck so the doc had to start all over. It did cause my to have heavy bleeding for about a week and it has stopped my clotting periods. I have had the acne, cramping pain during sex,swollen ankles worse than my granma and break throu bleedin constantly and back pain that is very irregular for me with head aches often. It will be removed after christmas. I have many ppl that like and dislike the same. I just clearly feel that I am not a candidate for the product and so just do your research before the procedure.

column2: starlilly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Overall I have been very satsfied with my experience using Mirena. i think its really important to keep in mind two things regarding side effects with this product: 1 - things like acne, irregular bleeding, long periods, weight gain, ect...are all very common with the pill as well! I used birth control pills for over five years before getting mirena and experienced a fair amount of issues including cystic acne, cramps and headaches, and irregular bleeding. 2. Also, many people who get mirena do so within months of having a baby. Symptoms after pregnancy and giving birth naturally occur, like hair loss, and hormone fluctuations after childbirth also contribute to weight gain and other side effects. Im not saying these things cant occur from Mirena, but such things are just a fact of life with birth control and life events with women. as far as the insertion procedure, i would compare it to a pap smear. certainly uncomfortable and sometimes mildly painful, but quick and bearable. for me the entire insertion took maybe 3 minutes tops and was nowhere near as bad as i was expecting. I had mild to moderate cramping that day and day after. my normal period came when it was expected, however I have been spotting irregularly for about three weeks now. To me though, for FIVE YEARS of effortless protection against pregnancy, I will gladly deal with some light spotting for a few weeks! also have not experienced any discomfort since the initial insertion, and no pain durring sex. Overall I would definetly recommend this to anyone, we simply just have to keep in mind that all things have pros and cons, and with the IUD i beleive the pros greatly outweight the potental side effects

column2: Queen B, 19-24 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I decided to use the mirena because I didnt think I would be able to remember to take a pill everyday and I thought it would be the easier option. I dont have any complaints with the insertion of the mirena, it went smooth. I was on my cycle when I got it inserted and I bled for about 3 weeks, which was very annoying. I have been using it for 4 months now and have gotten my period one and it has helped my period not be so heavy. It has caused my hair to fall out more, and recently I felt a mass in my pelvic area which was painful and caused cramps. It also has made my sex drive lower, as well as my boyfriend saying it he can feel it while we are having intercourse. I am considering the removal because I do not want to go bald and I dont want any cyst forming. I have never had any problems and always have had normal paps. I recently had a baby 6 months ago and had a normal pregnancy. I just wanted to share my side effects.

column2: yvette, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of two kids and I wish I had read the patient reviews before I decided to get Mirena. Even if I had, I, like many of you probably would have discounted them.  The insertion process was exceptionally difficult-- with my doctor becoming very stressed and frustrated and having to insert some contraption to stabilize my uterus. It was very painful.  It took about an hour, and my doctor said she was thankful I was on my period, otherwise she could not have inserted Mirena at all.   The next three weeks were also problematic.  After the first week and a half of extreme pain I finally went to the ER thinking that the lining of my uterus had been perforated (punctured).  After all the tests, I was surprised to find that everything was okay with the IUD.  I am not a wimp about pain.  I have degenerative spine disease so I am in pain every day and often in extreme pain.  The pain from this IUD was bad enough that I went to the ER.  The second problem is the resulting depression and weight gain.  I am normally a very happy upbeat person, but have been consistently depressed since I got Mirena, and now it is so bad that I was considering going to get depression medication(!)  The ironic thing is that there hasnt been any change to my life, and there is absolutely no reason for me to be depressed.  In addition, I have been hungry ALL the time.  It used to be that I would have a crazy appetite for a few days before my period, but now, that is the norm.  Ive only gained about 8 lbs, but that is by fighting it all the time.  Im thankful for all your reviews, because otherwise I would not have been so sure it was the Mirena.  For those of you who are blaming the victim in your reviews, be thankful you have not been adversely affected, but never assume that their (our) symptoms are not real.  I will have the Mirena IUD removed in the next few weeks and I will report back.

column2: yvette, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of two kids and I wish I had read the patient reviews before I decided to get Mirena. Even if I had, I, like many of you probably would have discounted them.  The insertion process was exceptionally difficult-- with my doctor becoming very stressed and frustrated and having to insert some contraption to stabilize my uterus. It was very painful. column2: i'mjustme, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I agree the insertion was VERY painfull ( I almost passed out) but overall I loved it! I still had a light spotting for 3-4 days every month but very tollerable compared to what I  was dealing with before. After 2 years I had it removed ( not bad at all, similar to the contraption the use for PAP smear removal) I had it removed November 10th, today is December 6th, I've expirenced very sensitive breasts both last month and again now (last month I grew an entire cup size) I'm not sure if its from stress or from d/c the Mirena, and I have taken 3 tests since and am not pregnant (so far). I definatly would get another in the future, price per year its well worth it!!! My will-be-husband is quite large and said he never "felt" the strings during intercourse, I had no worries about forgetting to take it, and when I would spot, it became like clock work every month same day start. Saved money on feminine hygene products ( bought 1 box of reg. tampons lasted 3  months vs. 1 month... I was a heavy bleeder) I would reccomond this for any woman to at least try, If you're expierencing constant pain CALL YOUR DOC!!! The Mirena could've shifted and is puncturing your uterus.

column2: Dr. Y, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Too many side effects: too much bleeding, rash, fatigue, nausea, PAIN!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I hate the bleeding in between periods. well actually i dont even have much of a period, but i get alil bleeding once a month for 3 days on and off though. Not really heavy, spotty.
