Other than that its great. I'm not sure if this affects weight but it's been hard as hell losing the last few pounds of baby fat.

column2: sweetliz, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I felt like I was gonna die after I had this inserted, but I didn't bleed at all though which was good. 7 months later I bleed during sex, horrible cramping and cysts. There's just times that I really cramp really bad! Oh and I spot at times too. And I'm now goin through a divorce so having this a plus!

column2: recept2010, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got mirena because I hated taking the pill! I like it because I don't even have to think about it! However I have spotted for about 3 months now. I've had a few days without anything, but mostly very light spotting and horrible cramping. Not to mention the nausea! I have gained about 15 pounds and look bloated all of the time. I'm sluggish and fatigued! I would not recommend this product to anyone!

column2: babydee71401, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
swarebear, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a baby in sept2010. She was 8wks early and spent over the first month of life in the nicu. because of this i didnt get my iud til nov. It hurt getting it put in but wasnt unbearable(id recommend taking ibeprofen or tylenol befor hand!) and i started spotting for the first few days it was in. Then the spotting turned into full blown gushing and hasnt eased up any. Im breastfeeding, wich had stop my bleeding til i had the iud put in. not only does my bleeding seem heavier each day, I have horrible mood swings. And i get migrains every few days. I constantly feel like vomitting and always tired. my breasts hurt and my milk supply seems to be lowering. And the hormone gets passed thru my milk which my dr didnt tell me. Plus Im having trouble breathing and my heart randomly flutters which makes me dizzy. Luckily i havent experinced the weight gain or acne yet. Im giving it a few more weeks to see if it works the kinks out but if not im having it removed. O and my hair has started to fall out. It is a really excellent form of bc because you cant get pregnant if you dont have sex, which isnt possible for my fiance and i while i have this in. NOT HAPPY AT ALL!

column2: Stacey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was very happy with Mirena for the first year or so, but now that I am going on my 3rd, I am ready to have it removed.  I have been experiencing unbelievable weight gain, cyst-like acne on my chin, and haven't had any sex drive.  I wish I never would have gotten it.

column2: Bellabree26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena on July 2009, so far it has been ok... I've gained about 20 lbs though and it's ben hard to lose it... And I get my period at times very light for 3-4 days and sometimes for about a week (and yes after a year I still get my pd) It's a great method of birth control because u don't have to worry about taking in/out or taking it a specific time!

column2: ImKatherine, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Mirena definately has done its job with me to keep me from getting pregnant. However, I have experienced so many side effects from Mirena! Some months my period could last 3 days and be extremely light and others my period will be so heavy and last for a week. I have constant headaches, cramping, fatigue, nausea, and definately mood swings!!!!Mirena serves its purpose but unfortunately it is at a cost.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I received my implant August 2006 after my second child. I do cramp a little with no periods at all. My experience has been great and wiil get another one next year!

column2: jay, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted 10/21/10 and although it's only been nearly a month I'm afraid I'm experiencing some of the side effects previously mentioned. For the last week I've been spotting and I've gained almost 10 pounds. I feel very, very sluggish/moody and my abdomen has expanded considerably. I was so excited about getting the mirena because my husband and I have a 4 yr old son and since we're in our early 40's we've deciced not to have anymore children. I know I have to give it more time to really decide whether it's the right bc for me but so far, I am not a fan. :(

column2: mamak, 35-44 Female
column9: I had mirena put in in March of 2010 and have been bleeding/spotting continually for 8 months.  I expected this to last up to 6 months, but this is ridiculous.  I can't even tell when I am actually having my period.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had this put in 6 days ago... It hurt a little upon insertion, I bled for a few days then it stopped. For the past 3 days, I've had what feels like a urinary track infection. I called the doctor, and he called in med's to help and he said it's common for this to happen, if it worsens then we'll take a look on monday.. I called him on a Saturday with the problem, he called back within an hour.. I'm not pleased with the product so far, but I'm not against it either.. Remember ladies, anytime anything foreign is put into your body, there are risk factors. I expected to have some problems, a UTI is minor if this b.c does the job for 5 years.

column2: oneandonly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My experience with marina iud has been great I have had it for 3 months I have had a period every month since which doesn't bother me. (That is ur bodys way of self cleansing but this month right after my period ended I started having an odor and slight discharge I am in a monogamous relationship with the father of my child so I dunno what's going on. But other then that best of luck to all other users. Also if anything changes I will repost another review stating what happened.

column2: belly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: i had my iud done in april 2010 the first month it was very light for about 2weeks the second month it lasted a FULL month and thats how it been going seen it is ridiculous and it is not light anymore

column2: lilmomma86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put in on my 6 week check up after having my daughter and the insertion wasn't painful itself, but the fact that my OB/GYN gave me a shot for pain in the cervix that itself hurt like heck. and than it's been a month and I haven't stopped bleeding. I feel like I'm a victim of this crap IUD. The pro to it is I'm not pregnant, but than again I haven't been sexually active and really no desire to be! Also I'm breastfeeding and since I had the Mirena put in my milk supply has gone down noticeably. I don't like it so far but maybe it's too soon. I'm going to give it till next month and if I'm still bleeding I'm switching to the patch or something because this ish is ridiculous!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Mirena is hands down the best birth control I've ever used.  I have had mine for five years and plan on getting another one inserted when I have this one removed.  The insertion is a little uncomfortable, but I don't think I'd go as far as "painful" - I didn't think it was any worse than a regular gynecological appt/pap test.  I haven't had any periods or even spotting since I started using Mirena (no periods for 5+ years!!!!) which is a huge benefit in my book.  No PMS symptoms either.  And of course I haven't gotten pregnant.  I didn't experience lots of headaches, weight gain, no blood clots, no cramping or nausea, etc.  And you don't have to remember to take a pill every day or put on a new patch or ring every week - forget about it for years.  I would HIGHLY recommend Mirena to anyone looking for very reliable (it's been proven to be more effective than getting your tubes tied!) and hassle-free birth control.

column2: Nychole, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have yhad the Mirena for just over two years now and I love it. I love not having to take the pills anymore. I also like the fact that my cycle consist of a few spots every other month. I definitely recommend this drug to a women. Everyone's experince is different, but mine so far has been GREAT!!! Now Im looking to remove it next year on my third year to have my last baby and then have another mirena put right back in..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It's easy.  The first few weeks aren't great, with very heavy spotting, but overall worth it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena since October 2006. It is supposed to be effective for five years. At first, I missed my periods, but now I started bleed in June for two weeks straight and spotted thereafter until I got an appointment with my doctor. He gave some patches to use for a couple of weeks, he said that would stop the bleeding which did for some time. Now I made another appointment for today because I think I might be pregnant. I had an over the counter pregnancy test that came negative, but I feel movement on my belly. This product is supposed to be effective for five years, but I do not think that is the case, nor I think it is as they say over 99% effective. I can tell you this is not a good feeling at all. If not pregnant, hopefully I can get it remove. I do not think it is worth the trouble I am going through.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had mirena put in because I was loosing my medical insurance.  Having it inserted was very painful because I have not had children.  My doctor had me take a pill to dialate my cervix so she could get the mirena to fit properly.  I experienced a few days of painful cramping after the insertion.  Having not to take a pill every day was nice but the side effects weren't so great.  I had a major loss of sex drive, pain during sex, cramping (not on my period), and vaginal dryness.  However, mirena did help my acne and kept my period fairly short and light.  So you take your pick of side effects.

column2: angbek, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had my Mirena IUD for over 2 years now, and I still love it. I had horrible cramping for the first day or two, but I haven't had a period since! I've had occasional spotting and mild cramps, but nothing like before the IUD. Unlike other reviews, I've had no change in my sex drive, my weight, or my acne. I love my IUD and will get a new one put in after we have our first child (planning for 2012).

column2: Duch56, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IUD inserted six weeks ago for abnormally heavy periods.  My periods lasted two weeks out of four and the bleeding was so heavy, I became anemic.  Insertion was a breeze--I had no pain at all.  There may have been a little cramping here and there after the first day, but not enough to be notable.  Since I have had the device, I have had a period for five of the six weeks which I'm not thrilled about, but the bleeding has ranged from light spotting to a light flow.  As for side effects, I do have them, but they are all positive:  I have an increased sex drive and my sleep has improved.  I have not gained weight or experienced moodiness. I'm hoping that the spotting curtails in the next few weeks. My 24-year old daughter has used the device for birth control for 2 years and she loves it.  No periods at all and nothing to remember.  As for side effects, perhaps she has a little acne, but that's a small price to pay.

column2: MinnieMe, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in after my first pregnancy scare after my son was born. My gyno said it wouldnt hurt HOWEVER we discovered that my uterus was tilted and he had to physically hold my cervix opne with his hand and insert which was going thru the WHOLE PROCESS OF LABOR AGAIN!!!!.I literally sa in my car and cried because i went through that pain the second time with no baby coming out. Since then i have gained alot of weight and my acne does get a little bad. My periods are months apart and i only spot for a day. There are extreme benefits and negatives to put up with but its a peace of mind, but in my case when its up I may just be ready for my second child!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena put in back in 2006. Since then I have had nothing but trouble. I've had server pelvic pain and went threw my fallopian tube and caused an abscess on my fallopian tube and ovary. I had to have surgery to have them removed. My mirena was found by x-ray and CT scan in my abdomen close to my rib cage. I am going to have to have another surgery to have the mirena removed because my doctor claims he didn't see it on my CT scan.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am very bad a taking pills so this was the perfect birth control for me...well i thought so. When I had Mirena put in, it was very painful for me. I had bleeding and pains for almost 3 weeks after. Finally when the pain is stop i was fine for about a week. The first time having sex with mirena in was painful, I had pains up by my belly button which i thought ok that normal maybe next time would be better. Next time my boyfriend and I had sex there was no pain we were excited that was on a Friday nite. Come Sunday morning I went to the bathroom and felt something when i reached down to see what it was, it was my mirena! So the next day I called my doctors and they couldnt believe it. I was seen on Thrusday by my doctor who laughted in my face in told me "You must have pulled it out, becuase they just dont fall out". As she checked me I told her when you go on Mirena wedsite that many woman have had the Mirena fall out. She contuied to be  really rude to me we tried to talk about other methods of birth control i could try. Because i did not want to go though the pain of having another Mirena put in. So i would Never recomend Mirena to any one...But like they say Everyone is different! Forgot to Mention that I had Mirena in for less than a month!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When I had my Mirena IUD inserted I was spotting and cramping for the first six months, after that the cramps stopped. After the first year so did my period. I love not having my period but there is always a CON to just about anything. I have had terrible headaches, mood swings, deppresion, vertigo, weight gain, hair loss, pain during sex, loss of sex drive on top of other symptoms. It has been great to not have a period or worry about getting pregnant but it has affected my family and I in other ways that I dont think its worth it. Having mine taken out asap so I can have my life back.

column2: LadyMcLean, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had my second Mirena inserted in September 2010 with no issues.  My dr. always does insertion in the middle of the menstrual cycle when the cervix is 'soft' so the pain was minimal.  I felt cramps, pressure, cramps, then it was over in about 5 minutes.  Make sure your dr. does the insertion before the end of your menstrual cycle.  I did experience some acne issues while waiting for insurance to approve my Mirena.  My dermatologist prescribed a few things and told me within weeks of the Mirena being put back in I would see a miraculous improvement in my skin condition and she was absolutely right.  The 10lbs I gained was gone within two weeks.  With my first Mirena, I did get the ovarian cysts (painful enough for me to end up in the E.R. and being prescribed Vicoden).  That was the worst of my experience with it.

column2: cici, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have just had my mirena removed (few weeks ago), and am now having constant gushing bleeding.  It's is horrible!! I had 4 months of bleeding when it was put in. Horrible side effects and I still kept it on because they said it would stop eventually.  Well some of the side effects did get better. But now I am going through this bleeding thing all over again and it is horrible!

column2: Happy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After reading all the horrible reviews of this IUD I was a bit nervous about getting it but in my circumstances I had little choice.  My blood pressure is estrogen linked so all regular BC pills had to be done away with and the 2 years of progesterone only pills and shots were horrid.  Due to the blood pressure, getting pregnant for me is too much of a risk for a massive stroke so this is what we decided on.It hurt being put in and it took nearly 20 minutes to get it right, even with the local they gave me, but it was explained to me that my cervix and uterus are about 1/3 the size of most women!  Yeah, didn't know that going into this but it was just pain.  It passed after a few days.  I only had spotting for 3 days and have not had a period or spotting since it was inserted 3 months ago.  The occasional cramp yes but nothing else.  My sex drive is very much increased compared to 15 years of various pills and shots.  I don't have this dryness issue everyone is complaining about. I've started loosing the 30 pounds added by the Depo shots, the whole body acne from the shots is going away.  I feel better.  My blood pressure has stabilized.My only complaint is the bacterial vaginosis infection that comes and goes but I'm ok with that one side effect.  It's easy to treat at home once you know what it is.If you are considering this IUD, don't get scared off my all the negative reviews and by all means don't blame every little thing on it either.  Every hormone change causes a few issues until your body adjusts.  Talk with your GYN and consider all the pros and cons before deciding.

column2: candtrip, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have to say I was warned by a couple people not to get it inserted. I figured everyone is different and I have a high tolerance for pain. It was so painful getting it put in and the bleeding seemed to last forever. It was okay for a little after that. Then BAM!!! Migraines every other month, really bad cramps, mood swings,pains all the time and NO SEX DRIVE! At first I thought it was because my body was getting back to normal after having A child. I thought it was just my body getting back to normal after having my second child. No the symptoms are getting worse. I started fainting happened a couple times this week. I'm getting it taken out on Monday. DO NOT even think about getting Mirena. Its not worth all the side effects

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Like others I experienced minor pain at insertion in October of 2009. Afterward my pelvic area hurt when I walked something terrible. That eventually wore off but I still experience painful cramps even when its not time for my period. I have horrible mood swings. No problem with acne though. They say it doesn't cause weight gain and that is not the truth. It does. I like that I don't have to remember to take pills or take out that Nuvaring on a certain day/time but is it worth it? No. I plan to have it removed next month. Yes the flows are much lighter but I find my cycle is lasting twice as long as usual. My husband absolutely hates it! I think I'm heading back to the Nuvaring. \

column2: Happy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on Mirena for nearly five months.  Insertion was so painful I nearly passed out but it only lasted a minute.  For the first two months I had some very painful cramping.  I would suggest people get a perscription for strong Naproxen (Aleve) because once I got that it was bareable.  After two months things got much better.  Now I have a light period every 6-8 weeks with minimal cramping.  There is some spotting which is a bit of a pain but I just wear a panty-liner during those times.  At this point I'm very happy with Mirena but am glad the first two months are behind me.

column2: hopeless, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I put the Mirena in June of 2008.  August of 2008 I started to have acne breakouts 1 by 1 which was not so bad.  2009 it got worst it started turning into big cystic pimples all on my chin.  Also at the start of the Mirena I weighed 105 lbs size 1 & 3. 2009 to now I am 132 lbs, have really bad acne on my face, neck, some on my chest and back, I have really bad hot flashes, cysts on my ovaries, and now I can't find the string!  I now have severe depression because of the side effects!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted at my 6 week post partum check and didn't feel a thing. However, the side effects have been awful. I've had acne problems that I never had before, mood swings, depression and NO SEX DRIVE. I had it removed today which was less painful than having a pap smear and I am so glad to be rid of that stupid thing!

column2: linzo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ive only had it for 6 weeks now so far so good. sure the insertion hurt but i was warned and only had severe cramping for 45 minutes afterwards. i had it put in at my 6 week post pardum check. i had been bleeding since i gave birth and a couple days after the insertion it was gone i havent had any bleeding or spotting since but im still breatfeeding so i think that has something to do with it. since i just had a child my insurance max out of pocket had been meet so i had to pay nothing for the mirena which for 5 year birth control thats great. i also had a very heavy period before with severe cramping so any little side affects that might come are worth it to me.

column2: 5pinkfairies, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IUD put in because I didn't have very good luck with the depo shot. Days after getting Mirena I got my period and I have had it ever since, that was three weeks ago. I have been bleeding very heavily and have had very large blood clots. I went back into see my doctor and was given a shot that I was told would help stop the bleeding. The blood clots stopped but the bleeding is still very heavy. Now for the last two days I've had a pinching feeling where Mirena was placed. This has been miserable. Between the Depo and Mirena I've had my period for 9 weeks.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I chose Mirena over pills or shots because I have high blood pressure and didn't like the risks associated with other birth control methods.  I had Mirena inserted in Feb 2008, about 4 months after the birth of my son.  The insertion process was no more painful that a pap, but I would recommend taking a few Tylenol just to be sure.  I did have some cramping and very light bleeding for a couple days. I also experienced some fatigue, joint pain and body aches.  It felt like the early stages of pregnancy again and I thought it was the drug taking effect.  After about 6 months I was feeling fine and was period free.  After about a year I was still feeling good and started getting a period again.  It was very light and lasted for about 4 days.  I just had Mirena removed yesterday because I will be getting married and want another baby.  The removal was simple and pain free.  I didn't even know it was out until my doctor showed it to me.  I did have mild cramping yesterday, but today feel comepletely fine.  When the time comes I will have another Mirena inserted.  I was very happy with this product.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: its been very good for me,but ive put some unwanted weight on,but other  than that its great,ive had it for almost ayear now.

column2: baf, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I just thought Id like to give the point of view from a person who has had her IUD for 4 ½ years:I feel like I'm the only person who has LESS acne and FEWER migraines since the Mirena was implanted. Both my acne and migraines were based on fluctuating hormones and the Mirena helps smooth it out. I noticed these benefits within the first year of implantation.  I do plan to get a new one when the time is up!   The only downside is that I think it may have slightly impacted my libido (and I mean slightly). Its so subtle, its hard to tell if its the Mirena, or if its just in my head. Note: for me, the frequent spotting became less and less after the first few months, but I was still getting very occasional spotting up until a year after implantation. Same with the cramps. After the first year, Id get random spotting (but only like one drop) maybe only once every few weeks. Now I never spot at all. The cramps still come around, but again, its only once every few weeks, they are very light, and they only last for about 5 minutes. Really not a problem and ten million times better than the bad cramps and periods I used to have before this! It is strange (but wonderful) thing to not have had a period in such a long time!

column2: Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This has worked for me so far because there is just no guarantee. However when having intercourse there are times that you can feel it which are an ext ream disadvantage. It honestly feels like you are being stabbed and pinched.  An it does the same for him as well. Just something that should be seriously considered.

column2: bonbon, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this in for almost 2 years and have had absolutly NO SEX DRIVE!!! It's great not having a period but it is really putting stree on our marriage. Having it removed on Monday!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Absolutely love Mirena, yes the insertion was a bit rough, which my provider told me ahead of time.  No more periods or cramping at all, do not need to worry about taking a pill everyday either.  Can not feel it at all.  I did have one child before, it suggests not to get it unless you have had one.  I wish this would have been out years ago.  Thanks!!

column2: gisele00, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had been on Depo-Provera for 7 years prior to getting Mirena, but the bone loss was becoming an issue. Yes, the day I had it put in was pretty rough - the procedure itself was very painful, but only lasted about 3 seconds when they measured my uterus and 12 more seconds when they put the Mirena in. My GYN said it was the easiest insertion she's ever done in someone who'd never given birth. I got dizzy and nearly passed out in the elevator on my way out because "my uterus had never been manipulated before." The cramping afterward was severe enough to keep me in bed all day. The next day was a little uncomforable, but much better. Insurance covered it 100% because it's an "implant" and not a presciption, which was an excellent bonus. Free birth control, no periods, no babies... for 5 years!! I highly recommend it if you can get through the insertion (take something to bite down on, and have someone drive you).

column2: mdhr, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 35 and do not have children. I do not want children and so I got Mirena. It took two tries to get it implanted. I hurt horribly for about two weeks. My doctor told me to give it at least six months to take. I am on my sixth month and honestly don't think I can take any more. My mood swings are absolutely intolerable. I have the worst acne on my face and back that I have ever had in my entire life. My skin is oily and out of control. My hair is oily as well and stinks. I have never had these symptoms before I had this inserted. My husband was excited for the 'no more periods' that was promised. Yeah right. My PMS is the WORST it has ever been, not to mention my breast tenderness/swelling is so bad that I have been putting a heating pad on them. I have NEVER had to do that before. My doctor and her nurse made this form of birth control seem easy and carefree. That is not the case!

column2: jackieee, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i DO NOT advise anyone to use Mirena! i have had nothign but problems since i have had it inserted. Unfortunately about 7 months ago i had an abortion, i was on birth control & i happend to get pregnant! A kid just didnt work with my full time busy work schedule! I had the Mirena IUD put in the same day as my abortion & i have had non stop problems! the first day my cervics was dilating due to the mirena being in place! i couldnt move because of the pain! Now many months later i am having stomach problems, lets just say diarrhea for a week randomly is not my fortay? i got checked for any other sort of problem & the doctor came up with no solution... i did NOT have any bowel problems before this! now i have ABSOLUTELY no desire to have sex.. my boyfriends not taking that too well.. i have Mood swings like you couldnt imagine! my breasts always hurt, abdominal pain to the extreme i can even feel the pain in my hips & back at points, i dont have a period which i love! but the headaches, decreased libido, bowel problems, eye problems, abdominal pain, extreme tiredness & weakness is NOT WHAT I HAD PLANNED! i have an appointment monday to have this removed & boy can i NOT wait!!! I think taking the pill or another route is the best thing possible right now cause i cant handle all this trauma... let alone all the time i have had to take off work thinking something else was wrong with me?? BYE BYE mirena!

column2: Female
column9: Well, at first I loved it.  I had some mildly painful insertion (mainly the measuring) and cramps for 2-3 days afterwards.  The cramps continued for about 2 months on and off, especially after sex.  Then the periods were gone (and all spotting) after about 2.5 months.  Then rolled in the side effects.  It's gross, the oily skin, which was never an issue for me.  The back acne is also horrifically disgusting.  The low sex drive and the moodiness is also terrible.  I feel like I've had PMS for over a month.  I have also gained a good 7 pounds out of nowhere and they won't come off.  I'm really going to have a serious conversation with my husband about removing it.  I think this thing is really strange with all the delayed side effects.  At least Proactive is working to control the outward skin symptoms for now.

column2: RNmom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena placed by my physician in January 2008 and immediately experienced a negative change in my mood - within just a couple of weeks did a complete 180 change.  I am still having mood swings - although not as severe, horrible acne (I NEVER had acne prior to insertion - my husband teases me that I am just reaching puberty), anxiety, have zero sex drive and intercourse is painful, loose at least a handful of hair daily (comparable to hair loss after childbirth), have gained roughly 40 lbs since insertion even with eating healthy and daily exercise, and have had issues with abdominal and pelvic pain/bloating.  I have had ultrasounds done to check for ovarian cysts and other underlying conditions that could be related to the abdominal/pelvic pain - physicians have found nothing.  On the upside, I have not had a period since January 2008 - zero spotting and no need for pantyliners or tampons, can't feel the strings or intrauterine device, and am not pregnant (but you have to have sex to get pregnant - I have ZERO desire...very frustrating - I am married and luckily have a wonderful, understanding husband).  As far as insertion is concerned - it took maybe 15 min total office time, some cramping and bleeding, but overall not bad - what I had expected it to be considering the physician was inserting a foreign object into my uterus.  I am an RN and had heard wonderful results from colleagues and friends, but unfortuately, the negative symptoms are more of a burden to my life.  I have made an appointment to have my Mirena removed in a few weeks and hopefully will see a marked improvement in both my mental and physical state.  I urge anyone considering Mirena to weight the benefits vs risks that fit into your lifestyle and discuss your options in detail with your physician - each woman will have different side effects based on her bodies ability to adjust to the hormonal changes induced by Mirena.

column2: luv4tankian, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: While a reliabale source of birth control and a blessing for heavy periods this device has made my life miserable. I have had it for nine months and have spotted nearly every day, with incessant cramps since day one. I'm sick of living on Aleve and having to use period protection every day. I will have it removed soon.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I THINK THE ONLY REASON I LIKE THE MIRENA IS BECAUSE YOU DON'T HAVE TO TAKE PILL EVERYDAY BUT ON THE FLIP SIDE I'M HAVING THESE MOOD SWINGS ON THE REGULAR , MY  SEX DRIVE IS SLACK ,SOMETIMES EMOTIONAL,MY LOWER BACK IS SOMETIMES HURTING,I'M DEPRESSED SOME DAYS , MY HAIR IS SHEDDING DAILY MORE THAN THE NORMAL ,I'M GOING TO HAVE  THIS THING REMOVED AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.......

column2: Deb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been reading horror stories about some people's experiences with Mirena, and I have to say I have not experienced any of these problems.  Insertion was a dream - no pain, no discomfort, no cramping, no use of ibuprofen... and the nurse had warned me.  I had Mirena inserted about a month ago.  I have had light to moderate spotting the last couple of weeks, slightly heavier this week since this is the week of my period.  So far, this is WAY better than the extremely heavy periods I was having.  But, its also early in my experience.  Time will tell, but so far so good.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT!!! I will admit I am one to not go write reviews but I have to on this prodcut. I had the mirena inserted a month ago after the birth of my second child. I went for the one month follow up and doctor could not find it or see it in ultrasound. Was sent for xray and it is in my abdomen. I have to have surgery!!! I can't believe it!!! This product should be taken off the market. I was told about side effects but never told that this could happen.

column2: Jaime, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Mirena has been a wonderful choice for me. I couldn't take birth control anymore due to my age and my blood pressure. I had heavy periods as well. Mirena was not comfortable to have placed, but after three months, the cramping stopped, my periods stopped and I had no side effects. My sex drive is better than ever and I have had no pregnancies. I would highly recommend Mirena. I am not looking forward to having it removed, as the strings did move up into my uterus but the doctor said he will just have to use a tool to extract when I want it removed. So if you are thinking of trying it, I think you should!! Don't listen to all the side effects of others, it is good to know because I researched it long and hard before deciding but everyone's body is different.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had this placed after the birth of my 2nd child. Skin is disgusting, libido is ZERO, mood is very "off". Going to have removed this week. Very easy form of birth control, but the side effects are not outweighing the benefits at this point.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD inserted in June 2008, after the birth of my twins. At first, I liked it. The cramps weren't that bad. The spotting ended a couple of months after it was inserted. I didn't have a problem. However, I did notice some changed in my body and myself shortly there after. I have no sex drive, I am constantly exhausted, I have daily pain in my right hip, acne, severe mood swings (they are bad enough that my husband has told that either the Mirena goes or he goes), depression, on the rare occasions of sex my husband can feel it, and I have had more headaches than when I was in high school and needing glasses. It was been aweful! The weight gain has been horrible. I was 191lbs when I delivered my boys and I started out at 123lbs. Let's just say only 11lbs of that baby weight has gone and I am active and I eat right. It's not going anywhere! My best friend had one after she had her daughter and she gained ALOT of weight. After she had removed, she's lost so much weight. I am having it removed ASAP! It's not worth it anymore!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I went on Mirena because of my heavy periods and also because i was sick of taking the pill everyday at the same time. Now i had it removed 2 months ago and i would like to have another bab how long will I have to wait before i get pregnant?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had this inserted when my second child was 9 months old. It wasn't painful at all. It was an uncomfortable feeling much like what one feels when having a pap smear. The whole process took 5 minutes. I had some spotting, but this has been much better than the side effects I experienced while taking "the pill."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: im reaching the end of my 5 years with my implant. i have absolutely no complaints about it whatso ever. once a month i would get some cramps while at times they were very severe but not to the point where i would consider having it removed.. my only issue now is trying to figure out how to pay for  my next one. Great product overall!!

column2: BNM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Absolutely delighted with this. Used it for 5 full years, had maybe 3 periods, no side effects, i guess i am part of the lucky 10%! ready for another 5 years, although not thrilled about the insertion but after 2 birth, this is a piece of cake!Totally recommend it!!

column2: Mslisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I had Mirena inserted in April 2008. I have one child and I had been on the pill for 20 yrs. My Doctor suggested it and I was totally not interested. I researched it and was confident enough to try it. The procedure was uncomfortable to say the least, there was some pain but not severe and it was over in 5 minutes. I considered having it removed after about 4 months. I was having severe cramps that brought me to my knees, they were brief but hurt like hell. They stopped me in my tracks, I stuck it out and the cramps (contractions) stopped over the next month or so. I have not had a period since. I still experience spotting once a month and some cramps. Today I experienced the severe cramping again this is usually when I get my period. It was bad and lasted 10 minutes I took some tylenol and I had to lie down. I plan to address this with my Dr. But over all it has been good for me. I still have PMS, but no side effects at all and no regrets..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had terrible cramping for the 5 months that I had the Mirena. I have never been pregnant and partly got the IUD to avoid the pain of labor, but the cramps were way worse than normal menstrual cramps. I've been told by mother that they sound very similar to contractions, and I was having them more than weekly. I was living in fear of aggravating my IUD for 5 months. Certain sex positions, vigorous workouts or even sitting slouched guaranteed cramping later. The extra % the IUD provides as contraception was not worth it for me and I am sooo glad I had it removed. The doctor that removed the IUD told me that either my symptoms were rare or were not related to the IUD, but I am a nurse and I know my body. I doubt I will ever try any IUD again, especially since 3 Doctors (the one that put it in, the one that took it out and my primary doctor) were less than honest or upfront with me.

column2: Annabelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted after having a miscarriage.  I the insertion procedure was not painful it was the cramping that followed that was horrible! It was so painful that I passed out and vomited.  I have had it in for 2 years now and have not had a period for the last year and a half.  I have had considerable weight gain even with exercise. I am an avid runner, running everyday and my diet has not changed but I continue to get bigger. I feel like I am constantly pregnant.  My breasts have increased in size.  I get intense side pain/cramping which my OB/GYN assures me that it is just ovarian cysts that is common with an IUD.  Which how can ovarian cysts be common?? I am seriously contiplating having it removed because the symptoms are not going away.

column2: ebw, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i have had my mirena for about 4 years and so far every thing has been great, but in the past 2 or 3 months things have changed. if i didnt know better i would tell you i was pregnant. i have gained weight, i have cramping and i have also been having some break outs on my face (which i have never had). im concidering having it removed..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had this inserted after the birth of my son and was initially very pleased.  However, I ended up with an ectopic pregnancy that resulted in surgery. Now, I would need another surgery in order to have another child.  This definitely did not work for me.

column2: Tamma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Got it inserted in August of 2006, and haven't had a period since November of that year. I guess everybody's different. no mood swings, no side effects at all, other than no period. Love it!

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am considering an IUD. I have researched about every page you can think of.  I am either considering mirena or essure.  I haven't heard too many good things about mirena.  I can't find any reviews on essure. Does anyone know anyone that's had it done?  I have two kids and not looking to have anymore.  I know essure if permanent.  I want something permanent without surgery.  If anyone could help me out I would appreciate it.

column2: girlsx2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena inserted in Jan 2009. It was not painful at all. But I had just had my swcond child in Nov 2008. I had one period in Feb 2009 but that has been it. No weight gain. I actually lost about 30 pounds. But the only thing I have problems with is yeast infections. I seem to be getting them on a monthly basis since January 2010. I'd rather have a period. LOL! But everyones' body is different so you don't know how yours will react until you try it. And everyone has a different pain threshold. It is definitely the easiest birth control I have ever tried. Like one reviewer said "give it a year" and if you don't like it, then have it removed.

column2: sbeth74, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this IUD for about 1 1/2 yrs. The mood swings, fatigue, abdominal pain, head aches, vaginal odor, cramping, no libido and tremendous amount of weight gain is almost too much. I am going to my doctor to find out about having it removed. After seeing what I am going through, my husband is now very willing to have a vasectomy.

column2: Winnerie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Due to prolonged heavy periods (heavy flow for 5-8 days) I became extremely anemic.  I had the Mirena IUD inserted in December 2008.  For the first year, I had irregular periods, but they were very light.  I also experienced hair loss, which has since stopped, and weight gain (almost 40 pounds!).  The biggest complaint I have is with the icky brown discharge that just won't let up.  And now, I'm suddenly having a slightly heavier period every 2 weeks.  When I'm not experiencing a "period" I'm going through brown discharge.  Needless to say, I'm dealing with a lack of sex life.  No fun for me or my hubby.  I'm tired of the discharge and the constant need for a light/regular tampon or liner.  I'm going to the doc tomorrow to see if there's something that can be done.  I went through a 2-week course of estrogen last winter that helped for awhile, but that has since stopped.  While the Mirena IUD has been great for slowing down the bleeding, it has caused enough side effects that I'd consider taking it out tomorrow if I could.  My husband has had a vascectomy so birth control is not an issue.  I've had 3 kids, which is probably why the insertion did not hurt at all--no worse than a pelvic exam.  In fact, I don't remember much about that.

column2: angela, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Hair loss, anxiety, ovarian cyst, horrible mood swings, lump on left breast and no insurance to check or get removed, blood clots, shaking, weak all the time, never had any health issues s before mirena. Not recommended for anybody!!

column2: shezbabe11, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: worked great, no worries about having to take a pill every day, no bleeding, but then came the mood swings, the weight gain, stomach cramps and when i say cramps i mean you cannot physically move the pain is so bad. Swollen ankles, huge breasts that feel tender and like lead balloons, mood swings, uncontrollable itching all over my body, dizziness, palpitations, and headaches every day. I look pregnant and feel horrible and ugly, i was a UK size 12 prior to having this fitted 5 years ago, and was for most of my life except when i was pregnant. I am now a size 18 and eat healthy and i just cannot seem to lose any weight. I am now going to have this Mirena coil removed....my advice, if you are thinking about having one fitted......don't!!!

column2: Bridgette, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I wrote here a few months ago and I just want to say that my problems have not gone away and I am seriously considering removing it. I'm 19, child-less, and have had the IUD for almost 2 years now. i did not have problems until summer started. My mood swings and libido are horrible. I'm so disappointed because I love not having to worry about blood. But this is ridiculous!

column2: mirenauser, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for 2 weeks now. I would advise u to take a pain reliever before the procedure. There was spotting for 2 days after. Also spotting after a day off from intercourse.  Some slight cramp-like feeling sporadically. Contrary to info on the internet, my lover did not even feel the string/thread nor did it interfere with intimacy. Love it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Placement was extremely painful and I had cramping for about 2 weeks.  Then slowly the cramping and lower abdomin pain got worse and worse.  I ended up missing 2-3 days of work a month.  I found out I have Ovarian cysts caused by the IUD.  The only relief I have been able to get is with accupuncture, however I'll have to continue with 3 to 4 treatments a month, or have the IUD removed.  The IUD was inserting in September of 2009 and I have tried it for the last year.  The string has also caused sores on my husband's penis during sex.  The longer the IUD is in, the more painful sex is becoming for me.

column2: kthomas1890@yahoo.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Mirena almost a year now, the placement was easy and didn't hurt at all. I had a little discomfort afterwards but nothing compared to after birth. Since having Mirena, i am tired alot and my husband can fell it during intercourse. I bled for about 6-7 months stright after having it put in, then went to regular periods without the cramping, which was nice. Now my periods are shorter but still regular. i haven't experienced crazy side effects, but sex is half the time uncomfortable and i have no sex-drive at all, except spirts of horniness. If someone asked me if I thought they should get it, I would say it depends on what your willing to put up with. It's not for everyone and the reaction to it differs with every woman. Before going to your OB/GYN's office make a list of ALL the questions you have because you are sure to forget when you get there.

column2: CjNJo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have tried the pill for a while and after forgetting to take it once I got pregnant with my first child. Although I do love her with all my heart I was only 17. Well after her my doctor put me on the pill again, insisting would be my reminder to take it because he "was against Mirena". Well, I got pregnant but unfortunately lost the baby. This time I went to another doctor and she agreed that with my busy schedule working full time, raising a child and trying to go to school, Mirena was just what I needed. And guess what no more babies. I have had none of the negative side effects other that slight weight gain but I just increased my workout. Oh and if someone gets nervous about the first doctor, don't worry he just doesn't get commission off Mirena. So he gave me something not for me....

column2: jaklemann, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for just over a year.  Insertion - obviously uncomfortable, but manageable.  I had bizarre side effects at first - hip pain of all things, as well as cramping and bleeding.  My boobs bacame non-existent (which I didn't mind - they've always been a C - down to a B).  It has now been over a year and within the last 10 days, I have put on 7 pounds, my boobs are HUGE - and so sore - I need to wear 3 sports bras to bed so they don't move, and I have been bloated and cramping the entire time.  I swore I must be pregnant!! Test was negative.  I made an appointment to get it OUT!!!

column2: Kimberly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got my IUD put in December of 2005.  Although it wasn't horrible going in, I had lots of bleeding for the next 6 months.  Then my periods became an on and off thing (I'd go 6 months without one and then get one).  I have had regular pelvic exams and each time they said it was still in there right.  I had an ultrasound today and they couldn't find it.  When they finally found it on the ultrasound it was way too low in my uterus and they don't think it was giving me protection at all, so they took it out.  OH MY!  The pain was HORRIBLE with it coming out.  I still feel like garbage 3 hours later.  I will never get an IUD again, I'll stick to the pills.  The pain of it coming out definitely wasn't worth the almost 5 years I had it.  To me, it felt like giving birth again, which wasn't a great feeling..

column2: Erica, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i was so nervous about getting the IUD after reading all of the horrible reviews... but i have had it now for about a month and i cannot be happier w it. The insertion was HORRIBLE and very painful. I cramped and bleed for 1 day after. then no pain or spotting for a few weeks. I went to the dr and he checked everything and said it was perfect. i have been spotting now off and on but no pain or cramping at all. I'd say my only complaint is not knowing when you are going to spot. Overall, i am completly satisfied.

column2: sarah87, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD inserted 3 1/2 years ago and have loved it ever since. Insertion was easy, no more uncomfortable than a pap, and only had light spotting each month for 2 years, now no periods at all!!! However, after reading some of the other reviews, I am wondering if some things I have been experiencing are because of the mirena. I have had no sex drive at all since I had my daughter and got the IUD. I am exhausted all the time, everyday which says can be a side effect too. I am also wondering how it will effect my ability to get pregnant at the end of the 5 years. Has anybody ever stayed on it for that long who can tell me if it caused difficulty getting pregnant or not?

column2: dlwnov, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena Aug. 2005, Shortly after I had my 3rd daughter. The only 2 problems I had was the first time my husband and I tried to have intercourse, he felt the "the string" he described it as a bee sting. and shortly after i could feel what I thought was the end of the IUD. I went to see the doctor he said everything looked ok. I have not had any problems at all. I very rarely had periods when I did they were short maybe a day or two and very light flow. Now after 5 years I have had a regular monthly period for the last 3 months my doctor said its because there is probably no hormone left and all the crappy symptoms that come along with having a period have returned. I would recommend it to any one. I will be having mine removed in Sept 2010. I am sad because I no longer have insurance on myself and it will cost $1200 to have another. So I guess it's back to the pill again:(

column2: daisygirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I agree with everyone about the cramping after the insertion as with other peoplle i too could not drive for about a half hour i needed more time but was anxious to get home and lay down ive had the mirena in for about 4 months spotting occasionally no cramping some mild bloating im only 128lbs so its noticable anyway i like the worry free no hassle pill takin  drama what ive noticed is im tired alot slept to 11 00 in the morning the other day that is unheard of i cant say that i constantly feel tired but alot more since the insertion  ladies looking to get mirena  i strongly suggest you get a ride or take a cab  you feel like total crap after its done however throughout the afternoon post mirena the cramps totally subsided and i felt alot better all in all  i do like this im 35 with 2 kids  but my question to anyone who would like to comment :are you feeling extremely tired too i take prenatel vitamins and iron it doesnt seem to help i also walk 2miles a couple of times a week.anybody have some input please??

column2: ac, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena for 3mos,,,,the worst 3 mos I can remember!  I am 48 and have endured long painful periods last couple years and decided to give this a try before ablasion surgery.   Within first month I gained 7lbs!!  I excercise like crazy and get nothing from it because of the mirena.   In last 3mos, maybe only a few days where I have not had spotting.   I have been PMS'ing for 3mos, and after reviewing my last 3mos, I see I am one of the less than 5% that has had about every side effect.   I would rather have my old life back and deal with the periods than all the side effects from last 3mos of "hell".  I am having it taken out this week, would have actually done it myself with the mood swings, but I overcame that!I now know why I sleep so much including needing an afternoon nap or a grande expresso everyday, have had acne breakouts, weight gain (my watch is tight on my wrist!!) and been so depressed.I wish everyone better luck than me with your Mirena....guess just not for me.

column2: Natashia86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just received the Mirena on yesterday. My doctor gave me to pills one to relax me and one to open up my cervix. It was extremely painful. I am 24 years old with no kids. I bled afterwards and was in so much pain when I got home. I took two 800 mg ibprophens which helped a little. After I showered I have not bled at all. It may take some time for my body to get use to it. I am still experiencing mild cramps but other than that I am ok. Every womens body is different and no two people will experience the same thing. So if you wanting to try it, you will have to take the risk of trying it on your own and see how it affects you.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
bethm1310, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was put on Mirena shortly after I had my son at my first OB/Gyn check up. It was pretty painful for the insertion of the IUD. Afterward i was dizzy and had the sweats. Almost three weeks later I began to have really painful cramps and checked my strings that came out of my cervix and I could feel the plastic tubing also. I called the OB and they told me to take it out, that it had come out of place and needed to be reinserted. When removing the IUD I felt nothing. this was scary to me becuase it is used for birth control and if you cannot feel it comming out besides cramps how would I have known? I went back on the pill immidiately after the removal and will NEVER get the IUD again. I know someone who has had it grow into their uteran lining and had to have it surgically removed. For those who are seeking this IUD for birth control I do not recommend it.

column2: Mirena Newbie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only had the IUD in for 1 day. When my ob/gyn said most people take tylenol before the procedure, I thought maybe that was just for period-like cramps. I regret not taking a 24-hour advil or a vicodin before. Right after the procedure I had severe cramping. I couldn't drive so I pulled over, got a drink from a gas station and waited until the advil kicked in. After 45 minutes, the cold sweats and cramps subsided. Because I had a miscarriage and not a full delivery I was given a pill that dialates the uterus which helped with insertion. I can feel the strings as soon as I enter my finger into the vaginal canal. I have a romantic evening scheduled with my sweetie next week. Hope all is well by then, but I'm concerned about the strings interfering with intercourse. I will keep you posted.

column2: LIL_ONE, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVE THREE CHILDREN I DECIDED TO GO FOR THIS IUD TO HELP WITH MY ENDOMETROSIS I GOT IT MAY 11 2010 HAD ONE PERIOD IN APRIL AFTER THAT IT COMPLETLY STOPED . I WENT TO MY DOC THEY SAID IT WAS NORMAL I SAW HIM FOR BOWEL ISSUES AND ADOMINAL PAIN FOR TWO MONTHS. I WAS SENT TO XRAY CT SCANS TO EVENTULLY FIND OUT I WAS THREE MONTHS PREGNANT AND THE IUD IS MISSING IN ACTION MY DOC THINKS IT CAME OUT BUT I AM STILL HAVING BOWEL ISSUS AND LEFT SIDE PAIN THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE IT PENATRATED THROUGH THE WALL AND IS IN MY ABDOMINAL CAVITY THEY CANT HELP ME UNTILL THE BABY COMES OUT I AM TOLD I PERSONALLY DO NOT LIKE THIS IUD VERY MUCH

column2: Emily, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted after my first child in  Jan. 2006. I had a heavy period the month after and have not had a period since. I just got it removed in July 2010 and am completely happy. I never had a period or heavy cramping, nothing to complain about. I am 27 now and we are trying for another...wish us luck!

column2: Trish760, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 23 and have a 2 1/2 year old son, I had Mirena inserted 29 April 2010. I am horrible when it comes to taking pills on a daily basis. I tried Depo (whew the weight gain!!), I had the patch, and the ring. I was so excited when I first saw the commercials!! I hesitated on getting it right away, I knew two people who had it inserted and were not happy! Finally I decided I really wanted it! I have had it approx. 4 months now, I was told that these syptoms are not part of mirena, but I am not conviced. The insertion was painful, but to me worth it! I only blead for 2 days. My periods are so light, about 3-5 days. I was constipated for over a week after having it inserted! I was told it couldn't be from Merina(I was completely normal before). When I went in for my two week check up I told my doctor I could not feel the string, he said it's fine that when it's time to remove it they will not have a problem. Well, the last 3 weeks or so I have an my pregnancy symptoms! I have ONLY had heartburn when pregnant!! I will be taking a test, but can't figure out how???? That is really my only thing, that now I have those symptoms. My partner & I can not feel it. It only hurt the day of insertion and cramps the day after. It has been the easiest thing since minute rice! But maybe too good to be true????

column2: No more babies 11, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My daughter is the greatest thing that has ever happened to me, but I got pregnant on the pill and often birth control effects my mood and energy. I did not want anymore more children. Of course there is a little cramping when it is first put in, but other than that I have barely there spotting maybe once every 2 months and a some breast tenderness. It has been wonderful!!! 5 years without worrying about a pill or a period is fantastic!

column2: Anonymous, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After switching birth-control pills three different times, I decided to give the Mirena a shot after talking to my OB/GYN. Since I have not given birth, extra steps were taken to make sure that the insertion went smoothly and painlessly. However I experienced severe cramping afterward, but this is normal considering I haven't had kids.I still have light periods, and have broken out a few times. I still have cramps every so often, but considering the hormonal drama that is birth control pills, I'd rather deal with the pain. What is great is the fact that my libido jumped with in a few weeks of being on the Mirena and there isn't any stress about being spur of the moment.The only thing that would make this perfect is if I didn't cramp any more. But for the most part, I am glad I have the Mirena. However, it is NOT for everyone.

column2: chicdriver240sx@yahoo.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the IUD for about 3years now. It has been great for me up until now. I never had a period, cramps, or any problems with it. Now... I have started having horrible cramps, tiredness, very hungry all the time now, I feel like I am depressed now, crying all the time for no reason. I have also started having spotting. I am going to try to get this thing out as soon as possible!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The placement of this IUD has been the hardest part about it thus far.  I was not prepared for the horrible cramps I experienced; having my labor induced was much easier!  I've only had it for six weeks and so far this is my only complaint.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got this in August of 2008. At first I had occassional spotting, but it was better than my period. Now after almost 2 years and reading the reviews, I realize that I have memory loss, constant crying, cramping in my calves (like a charlie horse), acne out of this world (never had acne problems before), breast tenderness, and my boyfriend can feel it/is irritated by it, etc. Recently I have started to develop weekly UTIs(never had before) and/or bacteria vaginosis, followed by a yeast infection from the meds. Going to the Dr today and hopefully this thing is coming out.

column2: ahlewis85, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena IUD 8/2008 after I had my second child. Before receiving the birth control I was normal I had a regular period and I was not over weight. Within 6 months of the birth control my body just begin to act so different. I was very moody, just all around upset. I didn't want to have sex I was just a complete mess. So I went to my doctor and he talked me into just keeping it. So I did and it is now two years later and nothing has changed. I have seen a great weight gain I went from 120 to 180 pounds. I work out and eat right. I am just so upset with this product. I strongly don't believe that this is for every women out there. I wish I would have really researched this products before I allowed it to be inserted into my body. Another thing when you have the Mirena inserted it actually grows into your body it becomes apart of you so when you take it out it does hurt. I would not suggest this to ANYONE. :-(

column2: swopes1218, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have broken out in a rash this is my second mirena im not sure if they have changed something about it in the last five years but i seem to be having a reaction to it this time.

column2: mercrombie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD placed at my 6 week check up after my 2nd was born. I just had it removed less than a week ago. The positives: no pill to remember, my husband and I did not even notice it, it prevented pregnancy, no change in sex drive, no period, no weight gain. The negatives: there was a change in my body odor, no period(just felt wrong), felt bloated all the time, and finally(the deal breaker for me) no weight loss. After hiring a personal trainer and changing my eating habits, I only lost 5 pounds in 3 months.  Also, after having it removed, I have felt very sluggish, no energy what so ever, and my period has returned. I hope this review helps someone out there.

column2: sandra, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Marina for about 8 month.  Few days ago I got it remove. In the end of second day, I started to bleed with big blood clots. I was about to go to ER.  I got Marina  to prevent heavy periods,  but  while having it,  I experienced  very painful  breast  (enlarged  two sizes up) , gain 10 pounds in first two month , hair loss and  constipation, that I end up having a colonoscopy ,which it did not show anything that would cause   such constipation. Also, after five month a mammogram and ultrasound showed that I have a lump in my right breast. It did not show any lumps a year ago in a mammogram. I'll have another ultrasound after six month.

column2: Breanna, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got it when my daughter was 2 months old (9/06). I had light periods that lasted about 3 days up until December. Then they were non-existent. I had minor weight gain, no acne, but my sex drive didn't really increase or decrease. At least not until I had it for over 2 years. After I hit that mark it seemed my libido soared. Right before my 3 year mark in May I had really bad cramps to the point that I couldn't even stand up straight. It July I had to have it taken out due to interference with work and life. Even though I had problems after almost 3 years I started having problems, It was worth having and not worrying about a pill or patch. All I can say is that you decide and choose what works for you.

column2: Brenda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Placement was a breeze....I don't know why so many say how painful it is.  Its not, so don't let that scare you into not trying it.  I just got mine put in today and it is painless.  I will check in after some time goes by to let you know how its working for me.  But so far I am impressed and excited not to have to remember to take a pill everyday.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was previously on ortho tri cyclen for over 10 years prior to trying this method. On the pill, I was having longer and longer menstrual bleeds every month and a complete lack of interest in intimacy. I had Mirena placed about 2 months ago. The placement was painful, but mercifully quick. For the month following it's placement, I had very light spotting on a daily basis (only a pantiliner needed) and pretty significant cramping, especially when I did anything physical. The cramps immediatley stopped the day I started my period, which was lighter than in the past. During this second month, I have been experiencing more spotting on most days, although I have had a few days here and there without any bleeding. Little or not cramping most days this month. I have had a return in desire for intimacy and my partner did not feel anything when we had intercourse. Intercourse was a little odd for me, but I think that it was more psychological than anything. I have not experienced any weight gain (I've actually lost 4 pounds since it was placed), no emotional outbursts, or acne. My doctor explained to me that there is an initial adjustment period of 3-6 months with this device and once that time is up, the spotting should cease and my periods will be very light or nonexistant. I have also never had a child. Overall very happy so far, despite some initial discomforts, but figure it will be well worth it to go through 3-6 months of minor issues to hopefully have 4.5 + years of easy, good birth control that will allow the return of my sex drive and lessen or eliminate the 8, 9, 10 or more day periods.

column2: Kandi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Insertion was extremely painful & only a week later I'm back @ dr getting placement checked b/c thread is barely outside of cervix & hurting my husband when we have intercourse.  Very painful for me as well- sharp/dull pain on rt side of low pelvic region. Doc is about to do ultrasound to double check.  We'll see what happens; trying to stay positive, but it's hard when a device that I meant for birth control is preventing me from even doing anything that might get me pregnant:-(

column2: klmrcx, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So I a thiry-one year old mother of one who has just had a kidney transplant and was told that having a child on my meds would most likely result in major birth defects for the baby and possible death for me. My daughter is my miracle due to a high risk pregnancy so I went to my OB and asked for a tubal. I was told that Mirena would be a better and safer choice, so I agreed to have it placed. Immediately I began having severe abdominal pain that felt like someone was kicking me. My doc said to relax and lay down for as long as I needed until I felt better. After trying several times to get up only to realize that the pain was much more severe and that my leg had gone numb, I started having nausea and feeling like I was going to pass out. For two and a half hours I layed in excrutiating pain until finally my doc asked if I wanted it out. I said yes and immediatly I had relief. The pain and nausea was gone and I had the feeling back in my leg. My doc said that I was the first person she ever saw that had the serious and someimes rare side effects. I am now scheduled for the tubal.

column2: sheshe29, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: OK so almost over 50 percent of the females n my age group hv had the same symp. but no one has writin how/what they or their doc. has done to fix any of the side effects. After the first six months I've hv no sex drive what so ever n the acne is out ragious to the point were proactive doesnt even help. After spending over an hr reading these comm I will b making calling my Dr. ASAP, and hopfully she will hv a solution for aleast1 of my issues(sex drive#1) cause this is the best B/C ever! Outside of my lack of sexuall motivation.

column2: bridgette, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm 19 and childless. I've had my mirena for a year and 7 months now. I was fine until last month, when my mood swings got severe and I lost my libido completely. I've been dating the same guy for 3 years now, and he's noticed these changes too. I'm going to try to wait it out and take care of myself in the meantime, but if things don't go back to normal, I may have it removed. I almost thought I was depressed again but I'm pretty sure it's just PMS. I've never had bad PMS before, so I'm very disheartened. I also have strange under-the-skin acne, unwanted black hairs, and ovarian cysts. Even my skin seems different. I think I tan easier and repel mosquitoes better because of the hormones. I could be completely wrong about that. I will say that I was once completely enamored with mirena because I never had to worry about anything menstrual. I still appreciate the benefits. I don't have to buy tampons anymore! It alleviates a lot of stress. But my recent experiences are making me reevaluate my decision. I'll write back later.

column2: MrsLC, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had this placed for 2 1/2 years now. In the begining it seemed okay, other than the continuous cysts on my ovaries. Then developed horrible cramping, constant spotting, and mood swings. I have lower abdominal pain often and feels like pressure, I went to the doctor and they said everything was okay. I'm just gonna wait it out and see how the next 2 1/2 years go, if I can last that long.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Ortho Tri-cyclen Lo for several years.  There were times when I would forget a pill and have to catch up which always lead to panic attacks come the time when I expected my period.  So I finally decided to try Mirena after seeing the commercials.  I do not have children.  I do not want children, so this is a good option for me since I'm not so positive about not wanting kids to get my tubes tied.  Anyways, the insertion was painful.  No doubt about it, but it is quick and the pain subsided quickly after the procedure.  I did have some minor cramping in the days following along with spotting during the first 2 months.  It was hard getting used to not knowing exactly when my period would arrive the way I did on the pill.  However, my body seems to have fully adjusted now and I am getting a period each month for about 3-4 days, very light.  I do not get cramps.  I have no discomfort during sex, nor does my fiance.  Thus far I am completely happy with my decision to use Mirena as my birth control.  It has been effective and easy.  I never have to think about it other than to check for the strings every couple weeks, though I check more often just out of paranoia.  I would recommend.

column2: isaacsMama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Well, I had worte on here before that I wasnt happy with this IUD, due the the weight gain, headaches, dizziness, nausea, fatigue, mood swings...and the list goes on... Just and update. I went to the doctor to have it removed ( after insisting and arguing with the dr) and come to find out that the IUD is MIA. Yup, my dr. couldnt find it. After doing an ultrasound, looks as though it is imbedded in my uterus and I will have to have surgery to have it removed. IF all goes well, I might be able to have another baby, however that depends on the amount of scarring my uterus will now have from this method of birth control. I really regret ever getting this inserted.

column2: tdpurpl3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on the Mirena for almost 2yrs. The first 6mths is great but after that its down hill...I thought it was just me being a wuss after having a baby but after reading all these reviews my symptoms are EXACTLY the same!!! NO PERIOD - but I have IBS symptoms, low back pain, abdominal pain, cervical pain, feel the IUD moving causing pain,  weight gain, teen-age acne, dizziness/light-headed if I bend over, cramping, PMS, mood swings, severe hunger around that time of the month which is whenever it chooses to come(that is all the symptoms w/o the bleeding), fatigue, leg cramps,soreness all over, MIGRAINES ~ THE WORKS!!!! These are symptoms outside of the normal "that time of the month" BEWARE OF THIS IUD. These are all things I never had before. Think this all the way through before you get this one ladies; the after affects may not be worth it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 21 years old, never had a child, and had Mirena placed about a month ago. I did a ton of researched, and its important to know that talking with your gyno is the best way to go about deciding if its right for you. The first week or so I barely spotted, and had a few mild cramps that went away with a few asprin... So far I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS.. i was worried i couldnt feel my strings, but after searching, and a return doctors visit i was reassured that everything was fine! The insertion was easy, my doctor walked me through it. and well ive had no negitive side effects besides small cramps. I reccommend Mirena to almost all my friends!

column2: isaacsMama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After having my son last year, I decided to have the Mirena IUD. After reading up on it and talking with my doctor it seemed like the best thing for me. However, shortly after getting it, i noticed that I started having headaches and migraines like Ive never had before, I also started to get dizzy at the most random of times and with that came nausea and sometimes vomiting.My husband even thought for a short time that I was pregnant yet again but i wasnt. My doctor brushed it off as "my body readjusting after having a baby". I also noticed that I began to gain wait and had a very hard time losing little if any weight at all. (during the 6weeks after i had my son, i lost 23lbs. all of which I gained back within 3 months of having the Mirena IUD). It has now been a year since I've had the Mirena inserted and I am still struggling to lose the weight, having headaches and mood swings. I will be going to the doctor soon to have mirena removed.

column2: SelenaSaberWind, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 26yrs old, no pregnancies, going on my 1yr mark with my Mirena, and I have to admit, I LOVE IT!!! No more periods, no yucky weight gain, no decrease in sex drive (all side effects I had with pill and Depo shot).
