Insertion was a breeze b/c my doc took multiple precautions to make sure it was as painless as possible (numbing shot, numbing spray, Motrin, and a cervical dilating pill). Few days of general tenderness afterwards, and after a few months of "settling in" where I was cramp-y on occasion, things are great and have been since. I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a super easy, super effective birth control!

column2: purplegirl31548, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had it in for about 4 years now, and it's been great for me. I love it!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had mirena placed in jan 2010.  it was extremely painful!!! i almost passed out after the dr. was done.  i made it to my truck and could barely drive back to work. the dr. did tell me to take 800mg of ibuprofen before my appt. but i didnt so that is my fault.  the whole drive back to work felt like i was in labor!!! i took 800 mg of ibuprofen and fell asleep for an hour and went back to work.  i was uncomfortable but finished my work day.  i was in pain for 2 weeks then went back to the dr.  she did an exam and an ultrasound. the ultrasound showed the mirena placed right.  the next day the pain was gone.  i have acne now and major mood swings.  i feel bloated alot and find it hard to lose 5 lbs.  i havent had a period but get cramps and back pain once in awhile.  just last night after intercourse i was in so much pain i almost went to the emergency room.  the pain lasted about 45 min.  i dont know if it has anything to do with the mirena but i am going to my dr. next week.  if i have to i will get it removed!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have a five year old son and after a couple a years of not being on birth control (just being "careful") I decided to try Mirena to ease my mind. It seemed like the best thing out there because it's simple.. no extra time or thought put in. Well.. I started having lower back pain (which Ive only experienced while in labor), bloating, 10 lb weight gain, mood swings, my husband and I could feel it during intercourse.. & nothing pleasant! I realize everyone is different but to me the benefits do not outweigh the side effects/risks. Also, I have a friend that had an IUD and after being in severe pain found out that she had Pelvic Inflammatory Disease.. so needless to say had it removed. She has two girls (4 & 6) and since having the IUD removed has had two miscarriages. Her first two pregnancies happened first try.. now two miscarriages?? IUDs are not worth the risk!!

column2: Guest, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Here is my experience so far. To have it put in was not to bad. 3 large cramps but my Dr. gave me valium before the procedure. Its been a month and I have not stopped bleeding or passing clots. I get waves of cramps that make me sweat and dizzy along with lower back and pelvic pain. I feel like Im in a constant state of PMS. Im moody and sooooo very drained. Im sleeping up to 13 hours a night and always want to nap. I have IBS/Colitis and I "think" its causing a flare. Im hoping in time I will even out and start to feel better?

column2: mosschrupp, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: I have it placed 10 months ago and it's been nothing but wonderful to me.  A couple episodes of spotting, nothing major.  No period, no hormonal side effects, it's great!! I've actually found my libido again with it as well.

column2: Mehgan_thornton@yahoo.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This  IUD is the worse birth control I have used to date. I ahve never had issues with a Birth Control and i have had 95% of the side effects including the serious contact your doctor side effect with this IUD. Many of my friends have had issues as well from lumps in the breast to cysts on their ovaries. I'm worried that this is were it is leading but i can't get it taken out because no doctor takes my medicaid and it cost several hundred dollars. I would NOT recommend this IUD to anyone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 21 years old, and have a 11 month old daughter. I have only had Mirena for 10 days now, but so far so good. The insertion wasn't bad at all. Actually, after talking to my doctor before insertion, I was very nervous about it. My doctor told me to take IBUprofen before the procedure, and that helped. My doctor warned me about all of the possible side effects, and frankly I think it is primarily your responsibility to ask questions and find out important details of anything that is going to be inserted into your body. I do not think that you should get mirena without asking all the questions and doing a little research to determine if it will be right for you. The insertion wasn't bad - just felt uncomfortable and crampy - and only took about 10-15 min all together. I am still bleeding, but am hoping it will stop soon, as my doctor said it was just my uterus cleansing, and should stop in a few days. I will update again after a while, and I hope to still have positive things to say. Good luck to all of you!

column2: ilovemykiddies, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: First of all it was easy insertion, no pain at all! It was great the first couple of months. The first year had real light periods that lasted like 1 day and was every 6 months.Now going into year 2 havent had a period for a year now. I keep headaches, vaginal discharge with odor, pain in my uterus off and on every once in awhile, when I am supposed to be having a period my breast are extremely sore. I cannot sleep at night, I am always tired and moody. There are times that I am crying and I have no reason to be feeling like that. I get diareah every now and then. I stay depressed. I vomit sometimes. I swore I was pregnant once. But yea I hate it and as soon as I can I am getting it removed!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena for a little over a year and a half.  I loved it at first, but than i begin to experiance its side affects.  I got a UTI for the first time. Than I started having severe abdominal pain. I found out that it was from a ovarian cyst that i had developed on my left ovary, now i'm constantly in pain, my hair is thinning, i have oily skin, and i'm bloated all the time. i excerise all the time but i cant lose any weight and i was a size 5 when i got it. i'm always tired but i cant seem to sleep. i'm starting to experience mood swings and memory lost, my boyfriend feels it during sex and i experiance pain after intercourse. i have an appt to have it removed and i can't wait!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD inserted in Jan 2010.I have had bleeding/spotting almost every day since then. I get about a 5 day break per month and then right back at it. I am experiencing bad side effects. Very bad fatigue, extremely bad mood swings, Acne like never before in my life, and cannot lose weight for nothing. I am very active. 5-6 days per week for about an hour a day. I run, I cardio train and watch what I eat and cannot shed a pound. I will be calling my DR. in the morning to see about having this thing removed. Works for Some but not for everyone.

column2: steph, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have just got the mirena inserted 2day didnt think it was sore just relax and you will be fine also take 2 paraceomol before, its more the embaressment took 10mins if that and that was doctor setting up aswell. i have had period pain in my lower back and belly nothing major. i am scared about the weight gain although my doctor has assured me that wont happen. at the end of the day eveyone is different and you find people talk about the bad alot more than the good. it can be taken out wenever you want so i supose its trial and error. also its suposed 2 have the same hormone as microgynon (pill) so if ur ok if uv had that u should be ok with.reason i got mirenais my mum has had it twice and always been a tiny size 8 and has actually put on weight after having it outgood luck everyone!!!

column2: nicg23, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After reading many and I mean many reviews, I was extremely nervous about having mirena placed. That was 2 yrs ago and I am now so glad I made the decision to have it placed. Many of the reviews are terrible and downright scary. The insertion was very painful as I have never had children. I had light bleeding for about 2 weeks after insertion, then spotting for 8 months after. I have not had a period since(love)! I have some minor cramping at the end of each month, when I should be getting my period. I have had some side effects but nothing I won't or can't deal with. Mild acne and some facial hair growth. I have my acne under control with the right skin care. I was worried about the decrease in sex drive many had reported. This was the problem I encountered with many of the pills, this is not the case at least for me with mirena. I now have an increased sex drive for once in my life! I use this for very heavy periods and birth control and could not be happier with it's effectiveness. Everyones bodies are different but this has been great for me!

column2: emmasunshine1, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my iud for a year and a half.  It was very painful getting it put in after my daughter was born.  Then i had an xray and was told my iud was sideways but it was still "ok" had cramping very badly.  Now after a year and a half I went in for cramping and found out that it is now in my pelvis!  I am told i now need surgry to have it removed!  I do not want it again!  Very painful

column2: ethansmom, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted 6 weeks after having my son and had it removed after 2 years of having it. Insertion was a breeze as was removal and not having to think about taking anything or getting shots was great. However, I hate the fact that almost every doctor says there are no side effects from removal and not really any when the Mirena is in. There are obviously many people who experience symptoms and I think doctors should tell women this from the get go. They make a lot of money off the product which always leads to negative information being omitted. My story: I didn't have a period on Mirena (after some slight spotting the first few months), no big change in sex drive or moods. However, from the time I got it put in I had severe cramps that would come and go, often so bad I thought I would pass out and couldn't move, felt like having my son all over again. Went to the doctors multiple times and all said it couldn't be my IUD, it was probably IBS that just happened to start the day I got my IUD. Over the two years the episodes got further apart but still happened a couple times a week. After getting it removed I have not had any of the cramps except right after removal which weren't bad. I have had terrible headaches since getting it removed however. Hoping they will go away since it's only been out about a week now. Many people experience a crash after getting it out but usually fades by two months, usually sooner. I am bothered that my doctor told me there were no side effects with getting it removed when there clearly are for many women.

column2: snbmomma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I, like most was nervous about trying mirena. I finally did after our last child was born almost 4 years ago. It was uncomfortable during insertion, but no more than a period cramp. I have not really had a period, just occasional spotting. My sex drive is gone..as in in non-existent. This drives my husband crazy. Then a few days ago I made an ER trip due to kidney stones. During my trip they did a CAT Scan of my pelvic/stomach area. The next day the ER doctors called me back to tell me that my IUD had dislodged itself and was growing into the side of my uterus. I was then informed to see my doctor immediately. I have my appt tomorrow, and am scared to death about what is going on in my body. So now am looking at the possibility of having my uterus removed! No more kids for me...period! Hoping and praying this does not happen. I am 30 years old and have never had a surgery in my life!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

I continued to breastfeed, and lost around 25 pounds, within three weeks after I stopped breastfeeding (while excersing, eating right, and actively working) I gained 15 pounds. My acne tripled. These symptoms have not gone away. I still cannot lose the weight although I haven't gained anymore weight. I am constantly depressed and it gets worse at times. I am constantly tired no matter if I sleep all day, and some nights I cannot sleep at all. I feel discomfort during intercourse, if I feel up to intercourse at all. column2: Bad Experience, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was 44 years old and my doctor recommended Mirena to control heavy menstrual bleeding. At one month follow up appointment, my doctor discovered the device had shifted out of position so she removed it and re-insert a new one, which meant I had to endure the pain and discomfort of the procedure again. Less then three months later, I had a very painful and uncomfortable menstrual cycle and the device came out on its own.  My doctor said this has never happened to any other patients she had.  I am very disappointed with this entire experience.  I will not recommend Mirena to any one.

column2: robyn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in for just over 2.5 years, it was great for the the first year and half.  Rarely had periods.  Slowly over the last year things have gone bad.  Over the last year I have been much more PMS-y, increasing all the time.  For 2 to 3 weeks I am either bloated, constantly hungry and eating, fatigued, sleepy, mood swings, depressed, anxiety and thinking I am crazy.  Then it will go away and i will get a light period for 2 weeks followed by spotting.  I get irregular spotting all the time.  I get bad lower bad fatigue and cramps that run through my quads.  I am very active and extremely healthy so this is not normal.  I have lost sex drive over the last few months.  I have had many yeast infections over the last year.  Sometimes the mirena gets bumped during sex which is very painful and leads to further abdominal pain.  After reading other reviews I am hoping my symptoms are due to Mirena as well.  Will be getting it out in a couple weeks and I am hoping things will change after that.  Insertion was awful, I almost threw up and did faint.  Hoping the removal will be better.  Mirena has been 100% effective as a birth control though.

column2: GA92, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted after the birth of my 2nd child 4 yrs ago. I love it. I only have cramping the day I am spotting and that's it. It has worked fantastic for me. Ladies give it at least a year then decide if you like it or not.

column2: ALM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted in Oct 2009. It did resolve my issues with heavy periods however, after several months of spotting, I have been left with a discharge. In Feb 2010 I had a really heavy period in which I lost a lot of clots. This prompted a visit to my GYN. An ultrasound in March 2010 found that I had now developed cysts in my right ovary, my fibroids had grown and my uterus went from being 8x8 in Sept 09 to 12x8. My 2month follow-up in May 2010 found that the cysts have almost doubled in size, the fibroids have grown more and my uterus is now 16x8. Based on blood tests, I have no sign of cancer. My visit to the GYN Oncologist today ended with the decision to remove my right ovary and uterus. The doctors have NOT said that these problems are related to the Mirena however, I did not suffer from problems of this magnitude before the Mirena. I discovered my fibroids in 1996. 14 years and 2 children later, they remained slow growing and unproblematic with the exception of the heavy periods. The rapid growth occurring in my body at this time comes without definitive  explanation however, I find it questionable that these problems began shortly after the device was inserted. I think that Mirena could be a great fix for most women with heavy periods. Unfortunately it just wasn't for me.

column2: Mercedes Lopez, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been very pleased with my experience using this drug ....

column9: loves it

column9: i just made a review like a week or so ago, but now i have even more side affects! Or i am finally put two and two together. Because i didnt have any of these things wrong with me just 3 months ago.. My back hurts a lot. My legs ache, and its not just the muscles, its like my bones are hurting. I get explosivly angry for no reason. I cant remember some stuff. I have loss of sleep, but yet cant fall asleep sometimes. I get dizzy, and feel way bloated. Like my body just swelled up, not just a weight gain feeling.

column2: kelli_1714, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Not bad to insert, cramping for first 2 months with spotting. First 6-8 months normal periods with medium cramping. Next 6-8 months heavenly (no periods)! Year 2- irregular bleeding often, bleeding after intercourse and excersize. I pushed it off as being similar to first 6-8 months. I read some reviews, could still feel the strings, etc. My Husband could feel the IUD during intercouse since day 1, sometimes it hurt me during sex, like it was being pushed. Mood swings and general loss of patience, acne like I'm back in high school or worse, slight loss of sexual desire, paranoid I would bleed everytime we had sex. Not fun. Tiredness, fatigue, loss of appetite. The last 2 months were hell. I bled for 3 weeks, stopped for one, and then bled for 1 month. I finally went to the DR and at first glace everything looked fine, upon further investigation she found it was slightly dislodged and the wiry strings were in a huge knot. She said her notes said she cut the strings 4cm long and they were more like 6-7cm. She recommended that I take a break from the IUD and we decided to try out the Nuva Ring. So far so good, I have lots of friends and family on the Mirena and Paraguard IUD's and they love it- I just wish it would have worked for me! Just make sure you pay attention to your body, if you think it may be off a little or side affects change, get it checked :) Good luck!

column2: JWilliams865, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Its been a year this month since I had Mirena put in. I was told this was the best thing ever by my doctor. When he put it in it hurt so badly. I cramped and bled for about a week. Since then I have tried several diets,etc. none have worked..I keep gaining. Im ALWAYS starving when that is not normal for me, I have facial hair, CONSTANT yeast infections and terrible back and abdominal pain. I have developAnd they caused large cysts 5-8mm. Ive had to go to the hospital on several occasions for the random pain in my abdomen. They never find anything but the cysts. I have spent alot of time reading reviews and i have come to the conclusion that I need to get this thing removed. My psycho mood swings have gotten worse and worse. I have NO patience. Im snappy and angry all the time. I dont even know who i am half the time anymore. Im fatigued and depressed. I have no reasons to feel this way but i consistantly feel this way since i started on this. i think a year is a fair amount of time to make a choice and I have decided that this is NOT for everyone. And I think ill go back to Nuvaring. Less side effects and still pretty easy to use.

column2: myndles, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the first time i used the Mirena was Sept 2008. within 6 months i got pregnant on it. i dont remember any symptoms, so i went ahead and tried it again because of the easy use. I have had it for 2 months now. I have already gained 10 lbs. Worst acne ever, headaches, cramps, nausea, facial hair, increased appetite, bloating. IDK if the benifits of the easy use outweigh the side effects. I think I am getting it removed real soon!

column2: KG, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena since Oct. 07.  I thought it was a miracle form of birth control.  I was wrong.  I am a very avid exerciser - avg. 6-8 hours a week of circuit training, tennis, yoga, etc.  I eat very healthy also.  I gained 10 lbs. over the past two years, yet despite dieting and being incredibly active, I could not get my weight to budge.  I also suffer terrible memory loss, aka "brain fog", can't remember anything.  I have awful mood swings.  I have no patience for my kids and husband who are amazingly easy-going.  I don't sleep at night and I'm always tired.  After meeting with a nutrition counselor regarding the weight loss portion of my problem, I started looking into hormonal changes in 40 year old women (my age), which led me to looking into my Mirena.   WELL, the blogs I read ASTOUNDED me.  So many women experiencing the exact same symptoms!  I could not believe that I never put everything together.  I had always assumed each issue had its own cause.  I lot of it I just attributed to turning 40!  I'm getting my Mirena removed in two weeks and am praying that this is the answer.

column2: sweetie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this for almost 2 years.  For the first year I had a period at least 2 weeks a month.  I got horrible acne (never had EVER in my life), extreme hair growth on my face, loss of hair,  vaginal dryness with infections and discharge.. My doctor wanted me to wait it out b/c it would get better but the cons are out weighing the pros.. I plan on having it removed asap.

column2: Buttercup1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have to say the insertion wasn't to bad I didn't start cramping for about 3 hours then holy mother of God it hurt.(I have high pain tolerance delivered both children natural) For 1 day cramping then came the vomiting and dizziness, did I mention severe hot flashes that lasted first week. Now nothing I have had Mirena for one year and I LOVE it now!! Give body time to adjust and I hope you love it as much as I do!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena IUD since April 2009. The insertion was the hardest part about the whole process. And even then it wasn't THAT bad. I've had 2 children and it took about 6 minutes. I did have cramping and it did hurt. But compared to child birth it was nothin.I would compare it to bad period cramps. Today I have a light period and 1 day of cramping.Other than that I can't tell I have one. My advise: GET ONE. You can always have it removed later.

column2: abarr, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
hendo4, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted after the birth of my 2nd child. I thought it was perfect. No periods, basically no cramping and worry free. I kept the IUD in for 2 yrs and then decided to have it removed because of 20 lbs of weight gain (over the 2 yrs- this can be done normally as well by  a lazy person like me), facial hair ( I got 1 chin hair and I was shocked- I'm 26 yrs old- it's too early!), my sex drive is decreased a lot and the worse part- my acne. I have never had as much acne as I have with the Mirena. It's been 1 and a half wks since I had it taken out and my acne is literally gone. My face is so clear. I have lost about 1 and a half to 2 lbs in that short time and I and my sex drive came back quickly as well. I'm happy without it. I chose to go back to the pill but I am taking a long break from everything except condoms for at least a few months.

column2: 25-34 Female
column9: I opted to have Mirena inserted because I have endometriosis, and since suffering a blood clot in 08, I am no longer able to use any of the more practical methods of treatment (like the pill or the nuva ring).It hurt like HELL...so much, in fact, that I could not go through with the entire procedure. I only made it through the 1st measurement and had to stop my doctor. I could not stand the cramping and burning pressure in my cervix and abdomen. I have no children, and I've heard that it's far more painful when you haven't had any, but he never warned me that it would be so painful.I will not get mirena now, knowing how difficult and painful the insertion is. I wrote this review for others to know--It is not a gentle procedure as it is described. Be advised, it can be very VERY painful!

column2: Fifi1976, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in for a little over four months. Getting it put in was painful....and I have had two kids. The positives: Very effective birth control as I have not gotten pregnant and short, light, almost obsolete periods.The negatives: I still have severe cramps, not daily but often. I think I have noticed a little facial hair beginning to appear. My hair is slightly thinning, and I have gained 20 pounds. At this point, I am not sure if the positives outweigh the negatives. They say give it a good six months to let your body adjust to a foreign object inserted inside you, so that is my plan. I will keep Mirena at least two more months to see if my body will adjust....otherwise back to the pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication is super easy to be on, cuz you don't have to think about it. Placing the device was slightly painful, but my doc recommended that i take pain killers 30 min prior... so that helped. I've had no period since I got it, which is nice. The only side effect I got is monthly infections. I got both yeast & bacterial at the same time. I was hopping that my body would adjust and get better, but after reading other reveiws and just knowing my body, I'm going to go have it removed. I say its worth trying, because it does work great... but trust your body and if it doesn't feel right or if there are side effect, get it out :)

column2: paige, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: You have to give it at least 5 months to get your body used to it, but trust me it will regulate with your body. Cramps are gone, no PMS symptoms, no bloating and I feel great. But remember it is a foreign object you are inserting into your uterus, you body needs time for it to adjust.

column2: Happy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena insterted about a month ago. Although a little uncomfortable to have it put in, as I have never had a child, it was definatley tolerable. I had cramping for a day or two but was still able to do everything. I have had ZERO side affects and love it. You must trust your Doctor for insertion. I would reccomend this to anyone. No one from my Doctors office has had any issues either. :0)

column2: AshleyB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Not having periods or having to remember to take a pill was great.  But then I gained over 20 lbs over 3 months, got acne, and started growing facial hair.  Soon after that, I developed recurrent/chronic vaginal itchiness/abnormal discharge.  I had the Mirena removed after just over 2 years because I couldn't tolerate the side effects.  I think the convenience factor makes it worth a try if you're willing to risk the sometimes embarassing side effects.

column2: kittymerkat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Depo for about 8 years, went off of it so I could have a baby (took about a year to get pregnant) and then had the Mirena inserted 6 weeks after my son was born at my normal post-partum check with my OB.  I had no pain with the insertion (likely because I had just given birth 6 weeks before), have had only occasional light spotting since then, and other than a vague sense that something is there from time to time in my uterus (not really cramping, just a weird 'is something in there?' kind of feeling) it has been worry-free and 100% effective. I don't know how long it might take to get pregnant after I have it removed for our attempt at a second child, but my provider has said that once it's out, it's out, there's no "tail" period.  If you can tolerate Depo, have had a child recently and want worry-free birth control, I highly recommend it.

column2: KM826, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had the Mirena put in today so I really don't know how effective it is but according to the research I did it seems to be the most effective form of birth control out there. While doing my research I read quite a few reviews about how much it hurt. It didn't hurt, there was mild discomfort during the procedure, and afterwards I felt some mild cramps for a short while. The procedure lasted no more than a few minutes- some people have said that it lasted as long as 15 minutes. Before I had the Mirena put in I was really afraid that it would hurt and was anxious about it but the procedure really wasn't that bad. I think the major factor as to whether or not the procedure goes well for women is their doctor. Fortunately for me, I have a good doctor who knows his way around in there (those are his words) so things such as IUD procedures and pap-smears are quick and painless. There was a OBGYN I had before him who wasn't as quick and painless and I bet that if she had put in my Mirena it would of hurt alot.

column2: juliab9680, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have a good experience overall a few things that I have noticed like acne, depression, and vaginal discharge & odor.

column2: Kim K., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: am on day 21 of using Mirena.  I am 27 years old and married.  Let me start by saying that getting it put in was the most painful thing I have experienced.  There were two MAJOR cramps.  The first was when she measured me, the second when she put it in.  I went in expecting a cramp, but nothing like how it actually felt.  I couldn't help gripping the table, squirming, and probably moaning or making some noise.  I can't quite remember.  I also had a very bad few minutes after it was put in.  I think it was a combination of the pain and the surprise about the pain.  I felt very dizzy and nauseous.  They let me lay down, gave me some water, and I was better about 20 minutes later.  I had a few cramps the following days and some bleeding.  I had a black gritty discharge that my doctor said was old blood from previous periods coming out.Now that I've been using it I've had a few cramps every few days and spotting.  I freaked out at first because I couldn't feel the strings.  I trimmed my nails and then had no problem.  I thought I had my period about a week ago, but now am having more heavy bleeding and cramping, so this might be it.  I had my follow up appointment with my doctor and she said everything looked good. The cramping and bleeding is normal at first and should taper off.  So, I'm fairly satisfied.Hopefully, the spotting will go away and I'll have some pretty short, light periods.  If so, this is the way to go, even with the major pain of getting it put in.

column2: jjones422, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: was very easy to put in, and once in, hardly noticeable. extremely light and short periods or no period at all.has been effective for two years so far as a birth control method.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena since May 2009.Almost 1 year now. I had long,heavy periods and very bad cramps. Yoday I have a very light 4 day period with maybe 1/2 day of cramping. It did not make my period disapear but helped dramatically. I really only need the regular sized tampons anymore. I recommend this very highly. I wanted no period but am very happy with the outcome.

column2: Keryne, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of two and I had the mirena device inserted 2 months after I delivered my son.  The insertion was easy because I was on my period.  I was given a Motrin about an hour before the procedure but had no discomfort or pain.  Initially I had some light bleeding and cramping.  Then nothing.  I like this product because I do not have to think about it.  After reading some of the reviewer's comments, I think a lot of their problems are due to the fact that they have not had children.  Pregnancy and childbirth do not allow our uterus and cervix to return to their original state.  I believe this is why the product is recommended for mothers.  For my needs it is highly effective, painless, and I have not experienced the other side effects that are common with birth control- weight gain, mood swings, loss of sex drive, or hair loss.  I highly recomend it for the mom who might want other children some day.

column2: terl86, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena but then started spotting everyday. I called Dr and he said it would go away...but it didn't!!!  I spotted for 9 months!! Argh! So I had it removed after the 9 months. 2 days later I had my regular period, bled for about 6 days, and now no more spotting!  But I did like the progestrone it released because it increased my sex drive. So now the Dr put me on Camila.  Hope it works!

column2: mw, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: less menstrual bleeding but zero sex drive

column2: raychel, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The placement was extremely painful, however, I have not had a child. I was not given any medication before the implant I wish I would have that is for sure. I had severe cramping for almost a week followed my random cramping for the next month.  Light bleeding also occurred during that time.  My period is much lighter however I seem to cramp more now.  Overall after I forget how painful insertion was I love my mirena!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Ive had the IUD in place since February of 2009. For 4 months i had severe cramping and bleeding. After that had no problems, had the occasional cramping every now and then. Now every time I have sex i bleed lighty for a few days. Not so sure about that, but I will be talking to my doctor about it soon. The insertion wasn't any more painful then a regular pap smear check, and I've had 2 kids. I would recommend it if you really don't plan on having kids for awhile. Id rather have light cramping, and light spotting, then taking a pill everyday and possibly forgetting, and still continue to have a period.

column2: rj71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I first had Mirena inserted while on my period 2/4/10. Because I've never had children, the insertion was quite painful and I was given 800mg Motrin & Lortabs for the pain. After a couple of weeks I started to experienced mild depression, increased appetite, acne, loss of sex drive, and fatigue. I felt like I had lost my "mojo" and spotted the entire time I was on it. The doctor said to keep it in for 6-8 wks before giving up on it so I did. I had it removed last week and 2 days after that began to bleed very heavily passing clots the size of saucers! The nurse told me to expect bleeding for the next 2 months. I do however feel better since having it removed. I have a friend that has the Mirena and she loves it. Unfortunately I haven't had much luck with this particular method of birth control. I think I'll stick with the pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: The switch from th copper iud to this one really hurt

column2: SHNOBI09, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ok i am 27 yrs old and this is the second time I have gotten it the first time I had it for three years. Then I decided to take it out, got pregnant right away. So in that experiance I loved it no problems...THEN after my baby went back to get it again and have had it in for 2 weeks now and started having terrible pain, went to the doctor to get it checked and they couln't find it sent me for a sono and it tore through my uterus and is some how in my right ovary.I am having surgery 2mrw to remove it and see what other damage it may have done. NOT WORTH THE RISK...

column2: Randy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for 5 months now. I stopped having periods 2 months after having it inserted. I have had no side effects, no spotting, and no cramping.

column2: Lou, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had Mirena inserted June 2008.  I love it.  I stopped having periods 6 months after insertion.  I have a tiny bit of spotting only twice since then. Frequency of migraines has significantly improved. I have had no bad side effects - I am not gaining weight, no mood swings, no greasy hair.  I am just "me".  I can feel the strings to see if it's there, and my husband says he doesn't notice them.  So no problems there.  I

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I love the Mirena IUD because it has totally eliminated my migraines, cramps, bleeding, mood swings.  My only problems have been greasy hair and skin, but it seems like a reasonable trade-off.  no weight loss or gain for me.  I read some of the other reviews which discussed facial hair growth and I might have to agree with that, but not sure if it is related or not.  Overall, I highly recommend this method if you are done having kids and do not want to think about birth control every day, or even every month.

column2: griffithmellie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've used this drug for the past year now. It has worked so far for birth control. However I'm not sure if it's worth it. I've had continuing cramping,weight gain, mood swings, etc. I am planning on removing Mereina Soon! I do not recomend, especially if you've had past history of ovarian cyst.

column2: pinklollipop187, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this product in place for 3 years and i absolutely LOVE IT! I have recommended it to all my friends who are pregnant or have had a child. It has even almost completely eliminated my periods.

column2: momof4101, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena for 1.5 years. I always thought the side effects were in my head. Had it removed and within 24 hours, was feeling back to normal.Had excessive bloating towards the end, moody, uncomfortable sex (even with strings cut short). I never could feel the strings, which made me parinoid that it wasn't there. Had an ultrasound 5 months ago and it was still there....$250 later and many pregnancy tests, I decided to have it removed. Now, I am looking for another option but am afraid to have the essure put in. I would really not recommend this to anyone.

column2: do ur homework first!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had a bounty of side effects to this medicine... my hair has fallen out, severe depression, extremly moody and it has caused me to have constant re-occuring bacterial infections... i have been having sex with the same partner since i got it and he has thought i was loosing my mind. I also strongly believe that is has caused an onset of joint pains and I have been in and out of hospitals with strong abdominal pains only for the doctors to find nothing wrong! And i haven't stopped lactating since i've been on it. I am having this removed IMMEDIATELYY!!! it more trouble than its worth!

column2: Engel, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Mirena for 4 years now. In fact I have to get it changed out in about 8 months. After being on Depo for 8 years and not having any periods I felt this was the best option for me.  I do not have children and actually found the insertion procedure quite pain-free.  I did find they could cut the springs short enough not to bother my husband (you need to have this conversation with your OB-GYN up front to make sure you are on the same page).  I haven't had any bleeding except some spotting this last year.  It can be a little annoying but it only lasts 1-2 days.  I haven't had any weight gain or cramping (but I do take Topamax so that can effect the weight gain or lack there of).   I have noticed tenderness in my breasts and also mood swings especially as it gets closer to the 5 year mark.  Actually my husband noticed them.  It seemed as it got closer to the 5 year mark my mood swings almost resembled those close to severe PMS (irritability, moodiness, etc).  Those mood swings were not present in the first 3 years.  I will be asking my Ob-GYN on my next visit if this is a normal side effect as it gets closer to the 5 year mark for some of these things to return because it took my and my husband by surprise (it was a pretty marked change in behavior).  I would recommend this form of birth control to anyone not looking to start a family that is in a stable relationship, but I caution you to get all the information first and def. talk to your partner and doctor.  The mood swings were very surprising to both myself and my husband and were not present until much later.

column2: Mommy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I thought Mirena sounded great.  It was new on the market when I decided to get it.  Right away, there were things I did not like about it.  My husband could feel the strings during intercourse.  I also could feel it moving during intercourse.  I have had greasy hair and some extra hair growth on my chin since I got it.  I am not positive that this caused it, but I had it removed today in case it is contributing.  I also have had tons of spotting or skipped periods the entire time.  Always a mixture, never predictable.  I Mirena in for 20 months thinking things would get better.  Today I went to have it removed and they could not find the strings.  The DR. had to fish for them.  The hook got caught on the IUD and the doctor could not get it off.  It felt a little like labor pains.  Hey, at least this knocked it loose as it had started to adhere to my uterus.  The doctor finally got the hook out and informed me that I would probably need it have surgery to remove it.  I mentioned that I really was not happy about that so he asked if I wanted him to try one more time.  Because it had gotten knocked loose from the stuck hook he was able to finally get it out.  I feel so much better!  The doctor said some women love it, but most have it taken out before the 5 years is up.

column2: stephdmtz1377, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on this Mirena for about a year, and it has done nothing but cause trouble. I have been bleeding probably 8 out of the 9 months that I have been with Mirena. It makes my hair fall out. And it makes me very moody! Sometimes I feel like I am so hateful and others I would rather just be by myself.

column2: akellyk, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am no longer able to be on the pill and I've had no children. I'm 30 now, but I was 29 when this all happened. This was presented as one of the "highly" recommended options. Here were the side effects I experienced:1. Severe moodiness ( My fiance thought I had some kind of mental health issue)2. Spotting (it felt like constant for 10 mos.)3. Smell (The blood from the spotting was horrible. I was mortified.)4.  Acne5.  Hand numbness (severe) I was told multiple times by my m.d. that there was NO WAY the two were connected.  I teach and don't use my hands for tedious tasks all day. Something in me told me my constant and severe hand issue was due to Mirena.I felt like I had to beg and plead to get this thing out of me.  The day I got removed was literally one of the best days of my life.Three days later, no hand pain.I now use condoms- no more acne, normal periods, no stink, happiness, and best of all hands that work.  I never knew how great I had it.I have a new m.d. now too, one that listens.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I feel like this has caused me to not be able to lose weight. I need more time on this.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It has been exactly one week since i've had Mirena inserted. The overall experience of having Mirena inserted was not pleasent, I would definitely NOT say it was painful. Some of these reviews just prove to me they have an inexperienced doctor or a very very low pain threshold! I am 23 years old and have never had children and chose Mirena for that reason, i'm no where near ready for children! So far I have experienced minor cramping and spotting, the cramping is the only uncomfortable part because before Mirena I rarely experienced cramping! Some IBProfen and a heat pad decreases the cramping. I look forward to using Mirena and staying clear from "the pill" or "the patch", i'm a crazy emotional woman on both forms of birth control which is another reason i have chosen Mirena. I'm also hoping it increases my sex drive unlike other forms of birth control. :) Good Luck to you all!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I absolutely love it. I have had it since August and my period now lasts one day at the most. I can't feel it at all and neither can my boyfriend. It is the easiest form of birth control I have ever used. I don't have to remember to take a pill or change a patch or get a shot. The only bad thing was when they placed it in I had really bad cramps for about an hour but since then I can't think of anything bad.

column2: Wendi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started using this form of BC about 7 months ago. So far so good. I had come previously off the DEPOshot, so I enjoy still not having my periods, and I don't feel hungry 24/7 anymore. My husband and I are waiting to have our 3rd child for about another year but he's already begging me to take it out cause he hates hitting the string when we are having sex. I guess if your partner isn't that long, he probably won't notice the string at all but it's been 7 months here and my husband hates this!!!!! He says it sucks and can't even enjoy sex the way he'd like to sometimes because it's annoying to have the string there. Overall, I am happy with the results so far with this product. And it's a short term solution till permanent sterilization.

column2: Female  (Patient)
column9: I had mine painlessly put in Sept.08. I loved it! My periods stopped completely and I had no side effects from it. I recently had it removed so I get try for another baby.

column2: krisb78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I absolutely love Mirena!! I decided on Mirena after the birth of my child.  My husband and I do not want another child, however we don't want to do anything permanant yet.  I love not having to worry about taking a pill everyday. I have had mine in for 3 years now.  I did suffer cramps after the insertion, but it was just like having a bad period.  After 4 months I stopped having a period at all.  I actually have less mood swings than when I was on the pill. Some months I still have minor PMS symtoms.  I have also never had any problems during intercourse with Mirena.  I would recommend Mirena to anyone.

column2: NMN118, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: As a method of birth control it's been great. However, having it put in was easily the worst pain I've ever been through and the doctor didn't even give me a heads up on how painful it would be. It was probably about 3 or 4 days later when the cramps finally eased up. Now my periods are fairly light and my awful period pains have calmed down too. I've been having odd side effects though. At least I think they're side effects. My breasts randomly swell and get very tender, I've been incredibly moody, exhausted, and recently about 4 months after having it in have noticed my sex drive decrease. I've only been married for 2 months now, it's too early for my sex drive to die. Now I have gained 10 pounds that I can't seem to shake, but I don't know if I can blame myself or the IUD. I'm only 5'1'' I've never been big, so 10 pounds means a lot to me.

column2: KatieBear, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The insertion was extremely painful for me, however I have friends who have had it placed with no pain.It has greatly lightened my periods, which is why I had it placed.  However, the side effects are annoying.  I continue to have spotting between periods, mild acne, tender breasts, mood swings, less sex drive and less intense orgasms.My husband says he can feel the string but it does not hurt or distract him.

column2: Lilly, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got Mirena insterted over 4 yrs ago, the insertion was painful and I wasn't even warned about how painful it would be. I bled profusely for 2 months and have had 14-21 day periods for the last 4 years. I was never told to check the strings, now they aren't even there. I had cramps stronger than contractions that would paralyze my legs from the pain. All of a sudden, I missed my period and have gained weight, I'm fatigued, I have a constant headache, and sore breasts and found lumps 3 days ago. I got Mirena to stop having irregular periods but it didn't work now they're just long, I've never had a pregnancy scare-until now. My doctor has already warned me that removal without strings will be painful since they will have to "blind-probe" because sometimes the ultrasound can't help guide them. If you are considering Mirena please think about it thoroughly especially if you are breastfeeding because the hormones do go into your breastmilk and can affect your child. Something my previous doctor also failed to mention. Mirena is definitely not for everybody so really consider your own body/situation before being caught up by what could be a great option for some.

column2: ajl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in August of 2009. It was very uncomfortable to have put in and felt dizzy afterward. Since I have gain 30 pound and can't seem to loose any of it. I have also been loosing hair,  getting headaches and bad mood swings. I will be having it taken out next week.

column2: Mad in Kentucky, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I kept spotting, and finally decided to take a pregnancy test. I am 6 months pregnant. This is my third child, and I did not want any kids. I am very upset, and I'm demanding a refund.

column2: muffins, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started using Mirena about a year ago. When I got it put in I weighed 130. One year later I'm at 170 and despite a full workout plan and strict diet, I can't lose a single pound. My skin has also become really acne prone, not just on my face, but my back, chest and arms, which I've NEVER had a problem with. All, in all, I had higher expectations from this product, and needless to say, I'm making an appointment to have it taken out.

column2: Angel2, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I just had my Mirena removed, (to start a family) after having it in for 3 years. It was VERY painful to have the Mirena put in! Just about unbearable. And I was nervous to have it taken out, but that turned out to be painless. Other than a loss of sex drive, I had no other side effects. The only other complaint was that my partner would hit it sometimes during sex, and that was painful. All in all, I was pleased with it. And will probably use it again after we are through having kids.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Its been almost five years since I started using Mirena and I so far have not had any problems.I do suffer from anxiety sometimes but chalk it up to family stress not the Mirena but who knows? I have gained weight but do not blame it on Mirena,its my eating habits.I have Mirena because my periods were getting heavier and really messy. It has worked wonders for that. At first I had bleeding,sometimes spotting for two weeks but after about six months that tapered off. I have had no periods or bleeding in almost 4 years or more.Only time I bleed is after my exam with OBGYN. I am having this removed in about four months and will have to wait and see what happens they can,t tell if I,m in menopause yet because of the Mirena. I had no cramping with the insertion and am hoping I do not have a problem with the removal of it.I am a little concerened because I have cysts and I hope there is no problem removing it.

column2: 2boys , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i wanted to say that i have just had it put in...i love it...so far so good.  i bleed for a little while but just spotting for now...off and on.  this is one farm of birth control that is safe for breastfeeding mothers that is why i am on it..did not want to be having sex while breastfeeding b/c you can get pg with that.  i will write back in a few months to tell you more..so far i love it

column2: knowledge, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I wanted to have the choice, to have another child in the future and not think about birth control every day, I already have two children. I had a mirena put in about 2 years ago, it was a very painful procedure, and I wish my doctor had told me to take something for pain before going to his office. I am pretty healthy, I only had suffered with migraines but that was about it. I decided to have a physical, because I was losing a lot of hair and it really freak me out.I'm now having a number of test to find out what is causing this problem. In addition, I have suffered with fatigue, appetite increase, constipation, weight gain, pelvic pain, these feel like side effects, I'm thinking about having it removed.

column2: lilone387, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got it taken out TODAY (2/10/10) and I'm already feeling better!!!!I had my baby in Oct 09 and got Mirena put in on Dec 09. I had the worst side effects.. migranes, weight gain, breast pain, cramping, no intrest in sex, bleeding ALL the time, it sucked and I literally HATED it. It wasn't until about a month after I had it that I went online and checked the reviews. I realized I wasn't the only one and it wasn't just in my head. I'm so happy I got it out now. It's crazy but it seems like as soon as my doc pulled it out.. I felt better instantly! My cousin had it and said she loved it though... I guess it's not for everyone, definately not for me. I also heard if you're breastfeeding traces of steriods will be found in your baby..that made me want to get it out so fast, you don't know what kind of long term effects that could have on your child.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted Sep 1st 2009 and had it taken out Oct 14th 2009. I am writing this because I feel that I was not fully informed, my concerns were pushed to the side, and that I suffered numerous side effects (nausea, insomnia, sore breasts, anxiety etc). The mirena has been one of the MOST taumatic experiences I have ever had and I am STILL recovering from it. I was in a lot of pain and bleed constantly from day one! 1 week after insertion I suddenly wanted to bawl my eyes out for no reason, and the mood swings (eg anger/dispair) steadily got worse! I didn't want to be around my own self, in my own body - like who the HECK is this person!!!  This experience nearly destroyed my family, I had to quit work, and ended up under community psych care (which I am no longer under). The hormones in the mirena caused MY hormones to go totally out of balance. Ever heard of PMDD? I hadn't but in a nutshell it's 10 TIMES WORSE THAN A REAL BAD PERIOD!!! Everyone is different so if you are considering the mirena ASK LOTS OF QUESTIONS AND KEEP ASKING! The pamplet said the mirena may not be suitable for treating abnormally long and/or heavy periods. If that is you then think TWICE! If you do not handle hormonal treatments well once again think TWICE! Quite frankly DON"T DO IT! As for the rest of you I really do wish all goes well as the mirena CERTAINLY is a blessing for some women. In regards to weight gain GET OVER IT. There are things A WHOLE LOT WORSE!!! I certainly KNOW AND UNDERSTAND why some women CHOOSE NOT TO have the mirena. Best of luck

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put n after I had my son in 2007..I was on it for about 2 years..I had heavy bleeding for 2 monthes straight after haveing it put in,finely it stoped and I only had a 2or 3 day long period.. After about 6 monthes I stoped haveing a period at all and thats when I started haveing really bad mood swings and braking out really bad...They couldnt cut the strings short enough so my husband couldnt  feel them, witch he didnt like...It killed my sex drive bc I was afarid of the pain that came with haveing the strings hit durning sex...haveing it removed was easy and didnt hurt at all...Now Im on the pill and unhappy with it also...Im thinking about useing the copper IUD, with no hormones...

column2: hlstylist, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had my mirena inserted about a month ago. Insertion was very uncomfortable, but tolerable. Bled for about 4 days after and then it stopped. Now am having some light spotting. I was on depo for about 5 years with no period, so Im hoping that the bleeding stops. Will review Mirena on here again later and see if anything has changed. Sex drive has increased since getting off depo and I just generally feel better. Will be perfect birth control so long as the bleeding stops!!

column2: Amazedatno3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted March 09 shortly after the birth of my second child. I wanted a birth control that would be affective and last for a while. Less than a year later, I found out that I'm pregnant with Mirena still in place.

column2: k_mama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Although this birth control is very effective I will not be using it again due to the complications with removal.  I went in last week to have it removed and the strings had fallen off and they could not get it out.  I returned yesterday to have another procedure done with an ultra sound.  They probed pretty much blindly in my uterus until they were afraid they my perforate my uterus.  It was extremely painful and I have been bleeding and cramping since.  Because they still cannot get it out I now have to have surgery and be put under anesthetic.  I'm really scared to get put under all to get out this birth control devise.  On top of the fact that my doctor said this is happening all the time.  I'm trying to find out it this is a malfunction of the device or what.  If any one knows please post info.  Thanks and good luck with removal.

column2: Hunter's Momma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got my Mirena back in Aug 08.  The inserting of the IUD wasn't bad at all for me, just uncomfortable.  Until Dec 09 I had absolutly No probs, no periods, no break thru bleeding NOTHING.  In Dec 09 I started having painful intercourse, lower abdominal pain as well as lower back pain.  I tried diff thgs for 2 mths & nothing helped so I got it removed yesterday & had the IMPLANON inserted in my arm, so we will see what happens next.  I know it's not for everyone but I thought I would share my experience.

column2: dodos92278, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had no issues with this birth control. I have been very please I have had not period and i am not to sure how I feel about thet but I am told that that happens sometimes I have been on the Medication for around three years.

column2: HaMiEtZa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: OMG...they say "discomfort" upon insertation. Terrible, wrenching PAIN is more like it. I had light-headedness afterwards, along with nausea. That subsided in a fairly short amount of time but the pain on the left side of my body did not. It continued the day afterwards, shooting down my left leg. Day 2 was pain-free & the bleeding stopped. Day 5 now...no pain...no blood! I'm VERY happy with Mirena!

column2: jepea, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had high expectations for Mirena, but have been very disappointed....First of all, it was extremely painful.  I felt severe cramping, nausea, and a weird cold-sweat as it was put in place, then felt pretty miserable for the rest of the day.   Two of my friends also use Mirena:  one had it inserted 7 weeks after giving birth, and she said it felt like mild menstrual cramps.  For my other friend, it was so horrible she actually was crying in the doctor's office during the procedure.  I've now had the IUD for 5 months, and am seriously considering having it removed for the following reasons:1. my sex drive is now basically non-existant (it was great until shortly after the Mirena).2.  sex is now painful. 3. I feel moody, bloated, headachy, and vaguely "PMSy" almost all the time 4.  I'm a little worried that the hormones may be bad for my baby (whom I  breastfeed), since they do pass through to the milk, and adequate long-term studies have yet to be performed in the US. These are all brand new symptoms in my life, that didn't start until after I got the IUD.   I read all the official literature before choosing Mirena, but had no idea how very common my symptoms are until a coworker mentioned that her libido had dropped after going on Mirena.  Then we began comparing symptoms, and I started looking into it and started to realize that all of these symptoms (which came out of the blue, and I'd attributed to new motherhood), might just be side effects of Mirena.  I'm cautiously optimistic that, once the IUD is removed, I'll go back to normal!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a Mirena inserted 6 weeks ago and have been happy with my experience thus far. I am 25 y.o. and have not had any kids. Was previously on Yaz & wanted to get off b/c of wild mood swings. Insertion was pretty painful but it was quick and afterwards the Dr. gave me 600 mg of Motrin for the cramping. I had pretty bad cramps for the first week & I had almost constant spotting/bleeding for the first 4 wks, which Dr. said is normal. As far as side effects - I actually lost weight on Mirena which I attribute to getting off the pill. I have also had some mild skin breakouts which I also think is a result of getting off the pill not b/c of the Mirena.  I do have cramps with my period but nothing that can't be fixed with aspirin. For the first month my sex drive decreased but after my body adjusted to the new hormones, I am back to normal.  Mood swings are non-existent.  I can't feel the Mirena & my husband has never noticed the strings during sex. It is so great to not have to take the pill! If inserted properly by an experienced Dr., I think it is a really great option for birth control. It's basically idiot-proof - I just check for the strings once a month, otherwise I never think about it.

column2: Kila300, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena for one year.(never got a period with mirena)  I started immediately with the headaches, cramps, and after a few months, began to have noticable water retention.  I went to my family doctor to find out that I had high blood pressure. She put me immediately on medication.   The dr. did all the tests, which all came back normal...so I decided to have the mirena removed (after debating with the ob/gyn).  I have a lot of the symptoms others have reported.  I have been on a strict diet..haven't lost any weight.  Luckily I haven't gained any weight either, but I do have to keep my calories down to 1800/day.  and I'm 5'10"!  I'm looking forward to getting my health back!  Doctor says it will take three months to get my cycle back.

column2: Sammy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about four months now. When I first had it inserted I bled for about three weeks and I haven't had a period, cramping, or any other side effects since. I absolutely love the mirena.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: 6-8 weeks after getting the Mirena, I experienced pelvic pain and pressure. Eventually that subsided.  I had the Mirena for about 9 months.  About 3 months into it I started feeling more tired than usual.  Eventually I was dealing with full blown fatigue.  I am a physically fit person and had diffulty getting through the day.  I was having severe mood swings.  I started feeling very depressed.  Then, I noticed my hair falling out. I had very thick hair, so it took awhile for me to become alarmed.  However, handfuls of hair were coming out and my scalp was starting to show.  I now have a difficult time styling my hair so that the thin spots don't show.   I had the mirena removed 3 weeks ago.  Had blood tests completed. Went to a dermatologist who ran tests and determined the hair loss was from something internal and he thought it was from the Mirena! He gave me a cortisone shot to stop the hair loss and start new growth. He said my hair will grow back, but my body has to work all this stuff out of my system.  I have to go back in 5 weeks for another cortisone shot.    I would NOT reccommend the Mirena for anyone.  Too many side effects.  It is easy to use, but not worth it.

column2: crhwil, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Mirena for just over a year now and I can't seem to lose weight. I am working out at least 5 days a week and eating healthier. My doctor says the Mirena has nothing to do with weight gain, but I think she's wrong. Anyone else have the same issue? I am very moody and have no sex drive whatsoever.....frustrated..it does great on the birth control side of it, but the side effects are frustrating me.

column2: galacuts@yahoo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was treated with the mirena 9 months ago for perimanopausal heavy bleeding.  I no longer have heavy bleeding but do have a bloody discharge 3 weeks out of the month. Periods are still regular but light.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena in for about 1 month now. I have never had kids, and thought this to be the right choice because i dont want kids for a long time. The insertion was painful, you should take some pain killers before hand, but it was very short, took only a few seconds for it to go in. I had bad cramping the first and second day, and was VERY VERY bloated the day after insertion, but it subsided after that and now i dont have that problem. I spotted for 3 weeks and it just recently stopped. once in a while i'll get a small cramp, but nothing terribly uncomfortable. so far i am liking it very much. I havent had it in for very long, so i'm not sure if this applies, but i have not had any weight gain or those other weird side effects. i got a little acne on my forehead, but it's a small price to pay not to worry about it. i havent had a period yet, so we will see how that goes. everyones body is different, so good luck!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena IUD for a little over a year.  I had been on birth control pills for many years and was considering having my tubes tied.  My wonderful doctor suggested that due to my age (32 at the time) that maybe I should consider Mirena.  After careful consideration and reading a lot of reviews, I decided to give it a try.  My doctor told me to take some ibuprofen prior to coming into her office for the insertion.  She carefully explained the insertion process as she was showing me the IUD and as she was inserting it.  The insertion was some what painful, but no worse than a contraction.  I went home, laid down on my couch, and continued to take ibuprofen throughout the afternoon/night.  I did have some spotting and some cramping that day.  The next day I continued to have milder cramping, but by the 2nd day after insertion I was fine.  At my doctor's direction, I continued taking my birth control pill for a month after wards to ensure full effectiveness had been reached.  Since then I have not had any side affects and have experienced very mild to no period.  I would highly recommend Mirena to anyone.  It is so nice not having to worry about forgetting to take the pill or pack it when going out of town.

column2: akalucerne, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i had the mirena placed in may of 09 it is now january 10 and i think im finally to the point that i am getting this thing out first it was terribly painful during insertion for three days i was in pain finally went to doctor and had goten a infection due to the insertion of the iud...ive had nothing but problems since then.. such as sex ix painful i get a terrible cramp in my side at least once a week im tired all the time my body is just completly differnt (abnormal). it changed everything from my mood to my discharge is even differnt.. im getting it out the fisrt..hopefully i can go back on the depo i loved the depo.

column2: JMMC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I'm hoping the cramping will go away with time, but until it does I'm still skeptical about the birth control.

column2: mrslidia, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I used Mirena for about 3 months then had it removed after I kept getting yeast infections. While putting it back in the doctor had a lot of trouble putting it in and had to call for backup, then, after putting it back in I wouldn't stop bleeding, so instead of enjoying my honeymoon I bled the whole time. Now five years later I can't have any babies at all no thanks to Mirena it messed up my body!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
LIZ, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Girls: Go for it!I am 34, two children. I was on pills but affected my liver and weight. Then I moved to a non-hormonal IUD which was good, but the insertion was painfull (be sure you are on your heavier day of period for the insertion because this womb padding helps decrease the pain), I had heavy bleeding the first 6 months and cramps.  After a few years I discussed with my GP (partners count, but you take the decision!) and decided to go for Mirena.  Since I was afraid of the insertion my GP arranged an appointment at hospital for the insertion under anaesthesia: Brilliant! I have been with Mirena for a year and it is fantastic. I have no pain whatsoever, light bleeding, no weight changes; it has also improved my skin.  The only side effect I have noticed is a mild hiper-sensibility.  For example, around my ovulation days I become VERY sexual; some days I am incredibly happy, but others I can be slightly depressed.  Nothing to be worried about, though (just mind the ovulating days!).   I highly recommend Mirena as a conraception method. I don't even remember it is there.

column2: Angel, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had mine inserted 10/17/07 after having my daughter. Everything was fine at first, now it seems like I am having side effects. I have anxiety, which I have never had in my life. I get really flush in the face, and I have high blood pressure on and off. I have started to have a lot of abdominal pain, back pain, and pain shooting down my legs. I also have been having really bad acne, which I have never had before. I am 28, I should not be having acne like this. I am also having a low sex drive. I am thinking about having it removed.

column2: Jackie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: I got the Mirena about 2 years ago.  If you haven't had any kids this will be very painful for you.  After you get over the first few months its good.  Very easy, don't have to worry about pills or anything.  Slowly I started having frequent mood swings and anxiety.  It has been getting worse and worse. I have no reason to be depressed.  I thought there was somthing wrong with me, after seeing my doctor we stongly felt is was the Mirena causing everything. column2: Terrified, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Updated from 1/18/10:  The first night I had terrible pain in my lower back that meant I couldn't find a way to sleep comfortably. column2: Terrified, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I posted a review on how terrified I was to get this done on 1-16-10.  UPDATE:  I got Mirena this morning and so far so good.  I took a pill the night before to soften my cervix and diazapam (Valium) about an hour before - have someone else drive!!  Anyway, my doctor told me every step and then talked about what he was doing the whole time.  I had local sedation and the two shots were definitely felt but not as bad as the first time we tried to do the insertion without local (OWWWWW!!).  Once the two pokes were done (a bit of burning as the local was injected) I felt next to nothing.  Insertion took less than 30 seconds and afterwards I stayed on the table for a few minutes and then headed out.  My husband drove me home and I took a nap.  Three hours later I'm fine!  I'm a little sore now that the local has worn off and I have had a bit of spotting that is to be expected but really just a lot of terror for nothing.  My doctor took a lot of care that I was comfortable and that helped a great deal.  I'll update again in a few days!

column2: jmo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 28 and have never given birth or used birth control other than the Mirena IUD.  I used to get really heavy periods for 8 days with a lot of cramping on the first day. I had Mirena inserted 4 months ago and it was the best thing ever.  The insertion was very quick- took a minute or so to actually insert.   I had one very small cramp during insertion.  During the remainder of the day I had on and off cramping- but nothing major.  Took motrin and I was fine.  The following 2-3 weeks I had spotting (on and off bleeding).  The bleeding got lighter and lighter each day.  Since then I've totally stopped bleeding.  On occasion I get a very minor (isolated) cramp- this happens around the time I would normally get my period.  I've also had spotting on two separate days- but very minor.  I am completely satisfied, I had no mood swings, no weight gain, no side.

column2: Terrified, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
