column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I agree with most comments- painful insertion, but besides that works like a charm! You don't even notice it. I've had it since April 09. I do not have kids but liked the effective %, and I've heard its very easy to get pregnant once its out. I had bad cramping one afternoon about 6 weeks after insertion, and the doc told me it was just my uterus contracting. highly recommended for those who want kids in the future but don't know exactly when.

column2: brandywine, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 28 and have a family history of female issues.  All the women in my family have had to get their "stuff" taken out by the time they were my age.  I had a non stop period for 4 months so my doc. suggested this birth control.  I have experianced nothing but back pain, cramping, and discomfert since it has been put in.  I am still bleeding heavly and I have no answers as to why.  I have only had this IUD for about a month but I thought I would see some results by now.  I only have on child and my husband and I want to have another one.  I am scared that I will not be able to have another child.  I have read the reviews and data on the Mirena but so far it is doing more harm than good.  Some days my cramps are so bad I cant even stand up and my bleeding is so heavy it drips on the floor of my bathroom.  I am just at my wits end and not sure if this IUD is helping or causing more problems.  I know the cramping and back pain is normal but I never thought it would be this bad.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Punkydriver, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got my Mirena inserted just over 2 weeks ago. I had been on Yasmin/Ocella for 7 years and suffered a blood clot on my lung and ended up in the hospital for 6 days (I am 24, no children). After this, I didn't have many options for birth control. I was nervous after reading many of these reviews and going to a new male gyno. The procedure took maybe 15 minutes from pregnancy test to the doctor walking out after insertion. There was a lot of discomfort during the insertion, but nothing worse than a bad period cramp. I was dizzy and hot when it was over, but it only lasted about 5 minutes. I drove home, had some light bleeding and cramping, and hung out in my recliner. I was fine after a few hours. I am finishing my 1st period since getting Mirena. I have had a lot of bad cramping, but the bleeding was really light. The cramping seems to be only on one side though. Nothing Pamprin and I couldn't handle! So far I am very satisfied! I like the ease of not having to take a pill everyday and not having the "uh oh" feeling when I miss a dose or take it later in the day. Sex feels no different to me and it is more of a mental thing for my partner knowing something is there, though he says he doesn't feel anything. So far I am very satisfied and just waiting for the cramping to subside. I would recommend this to other women. I think that reading a lot of these reviews scare many women, but you are more likely to speak up when unsatisfied. Not all birth controls work for everyone. After my experience, I would never recommend the pill, but not everyone ends up in the hospital! If you decide on Mirena, just be prepared on what to expect and relax. I think my broken toe was much worse on the pain scale! lol. I also like that my insurance paid for this and I simply paid the $20 copay. Yasmin was $15 a month, so there is significant savings. Good luck!

column2: Cyrena, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i'm a 22 yr old mother if 2. i've had mirena for about a year an a half now, and i just recently started feeling really bad aches and pains kin my lower back, and am noticing a bit of a pouch in my stomach.ust this morning, i ran to the restroom, not knowing whether to poop or throw up (while soaking wet and sweating). up until this point, mirena has worked just fine for me, but i'm just hoping that i'm not that .1% that mirena is not successful with! wish me luck, goin to see my ob tomorrow (luck as in NO BABY #3!).

column2: Addie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got the insertion on May 2007, at 22 years, after having my third baby via C-section, I went to the doctor's office without having my period, because I was breastfeeding, I got some pain,not as much as the papsmear, that's the worst for me, just took a deep breath, and everything was fine, 20 minutes after a left the doc's office and went home driving about 20 miles, after an hour got some pain similar to cramps, nothing that advil couldn't handle, I started bleeding for like a month, doctor told me that was cleaning the uterus, since June of 2007 I had never a spot of blood, that's great for me, no more pads, lol, side effects to mention: some hair loss, similar to pregnancy, some acne, similar to the ones that appears in periods, ovary cyst, which dissapear by them self, no pain, gain some weight, which is good because I was really skinny and with out hips, now I am curvy and my husband loves it, I don't get any period at all, just like a girl, no discharge, my desire increased a lot, sex got 10 times better, no pain after having intercourse, some depression, but I am sure that without it, I still have it.  For me is perfect, I go to the gynecologist twice a year and always looks fine, maybe not everyone is the same, but just try it, give it a chance. Good luck.

column2: djtobin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena in for 2 years now.  My doctor told me I could bleed or spot for up to about 6 months...mine lasted 8 months!  Eight months, never a break.  This is the method I chose after my 4th child. Should have gotten fixed!  Well, my hair began falling out about 3 months into it, never lost my weight after chldbirth - still 20 pounds overweight, have suffered with severe depression, fatigue, insomnia,NO sex drive at all, mood swings, and more! Needless to say, I have not been my normal self for the past two years of my life.  I contributed it in the beginning to post-partum but realizing two years have gone by and nothing has changed, my marriage has suffered because of my state of mind (although I must say my husband has been patient & forgiving)Got off my anti-depressants because I do not like medication...it had side effects too.  had blood work done to see if it could be something else...thyroid, anemia,etc.  Nothing...in good health says doc.  To make a long story short, afer reading up on this and seeing others have gone thru same things, I've made an appt for next week to have it removed.  Praying this is the cause of it all and I can get back to normal. I would not recommend this to anyone.  As far as periods go,  nothing regular, usually hardly anything at all, but on occasion I'll spot and cramp for 6 weeks, like right now. That's why I started researching and decided it has got to go!

column2: fatcatmari, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted on May/2009 and it has been excellent compared to the Depoprovera injection I was on before this.  My doctor extremely cautioned me on the dangers of the continued use of the Depo; 9 years total! I decided to have the IUD inserted and will never go back to shots or pills. I was relieved that I decided to take the full day off for this procedure because it is very painful. My doctor is very good, he told me step by step what he was doing and cautioned on the pain I would feel as he went through the procedure. For those of you thinking of getting it; this is what to expect. You are on stirrups, they take your IUD and after inserting a speculum in you, they insert this IUD with a long, thin instrument. The passing of the vaginal canal is simple, but once this instrument reaches your cervix it is a sharp and hot pain that starts about a level 5-6 and gradually goes up to a level 8-9. Afterwards, you cramp and spot and even your legs feel weak and debilitated. Definitely take someone with you, because you walk out trembling and kind of out of it. It is also a good idea to have someone there at your home for the next 4 hours. You need to eat and drink but you will definitely not feel like getting out of bed for a while after this procedure. It is worth it ladies. I have not had a period in over 6 months now and I don't have to worry about remembering to take my pills. I have had some nipple pain but other than that I feel this freedom and calmness, knowing that I have one child and I have 5 full years (or less, because this birth control gives you that option)to think if I want another one. Don't allow the pain to discourage you. Once that IUD is in there, 5 hours later you will be back to your normal self knowing that you have taken control of your life in that aspect.

column2: Jen, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of a 12 year old. I suffer endometriosis and have tried nearly everything there is before having a hystorectomy as a resort.I have had the Mirena inserted for approx 12 months. At one stage alongside the Implanon implant which was removed last October.I would have to say that for the reasons that I use the Mirena, it has been highly effective. Whilst i still have bleeding, it is nowhere near bad enough to use anything more than a panty liner or two for the day. Much better than a full period!I would have to say that insertion was almost as painful as giving birth, and if I was given the option, I would rather have had it inserted under anesthetic! But this could be due to the amount of scar tissue i have. So i cant completely blame the Mirena for that bit.As for a contaceptive - time will tell as i have only just tested it for this purpose. Fingers crossed it works well for this also, as I dont wish to be restarting after 12 years!I would highly recomment the Mirena for sufferers of endometriosis, but make sure it is done with AT LEAST a local anesthetic!

I have been using Mirena since Febuary 2009 and I have not had any problems whatsoever. It is safe, reliable, and you don't have to worry about taking a pill every day or inserting a ring every week. I highly recommend it to other women.

column2: A student, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: DO NOT use Mirena is you are prone to anxiety or panic attacks! I am a 20 year old female with no children and have had the device for about 6 months. I'm not unsatisfied due to the pain during insertion. The doctor warns you ahead of time that the process will leave you crumpled over for awhile (and he is not lying.) What I AM unsatisfied about is my anxiety level! My mood stability is lost to this device! I not only have terrible cramps and unstoppable spotting, but I now have VERY frequent panic attacks due to it! Now, yes, I understand that me being 20 and in the prime in college for developing panic attacks due to being a student could be argued... but, I'm a junior, a very level headed junior. I've been at this school business for awhile now and didn't start having such frequent, severe, sometime unmanageable attacks until I had Mirena inserted. It is 5:15AM where I am right now. Is it because I want to be awake at 5:15 on a Sunday? NO! I have had three different panic attacks just tonight due to my anxiety Mirena! I'm not sure if anxiety constitutes to "mood swings" like I've read about in previous reviews of this drug, but it is definitely an undeniable mood to consider! Without Mirena I would describe myself as an extremely  stable individual, but with Mirena? From someone who has experience what seems like the worst anxiety over the past six months, DO NOT GET THIS DEVICE! Stay on the pill! Believe me, taking a little pill once a day is nothing compared to the endless nights, like tonight, that you will go without sleeping due to attacks!

column2: abringl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Hi. I am a 23 year old mother of 2. I have had my mirena for almost 2 years. Overall, it has been a great birth control option-no periods, bleeding, or extra kids! While I have gained about 15-20 pounds, which does not make me happy, I do like the mirena. When I first got mine, I had the usual cramping and bleeding but it wasn't anything worse than having a usual month to month period. I did bleed for about 3 months afterwards but once that stopped, I have not had a period since. Besides the weight gain, overall the product is good. Does anyone know if the weight goes away once the mirena is removed?

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted today.  It was the worse 2 hours of my life.  The procedure was extremely painful and within 5 minutes I was in unbearable pain.  I became extremely hot and my skin was clammy.  I was even nauseous and felt as though I would faint on the table.  The pain increased with every minute.  My pressure and pulse dropped to alarming levels and the doctor had to be summoned back to the examination room.  He was briefed on my complaints and vitals and had to immediately remove the device which had been placed only 25 minutes earlier.  The pain continued along with feelings of nausea off and on for over an hour.  I should have read more of the comments before I tried it.  I will never recommend this product.

column2: Dana, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My Mirena hell started 3 years ago, and today, December 31, 2009 I decided that I would not go into another year living in Mirena pergatory!!! I told my doctor to take this thing out of me because I was sick and tired of the horrible mood swings, the weight gain, the pathetic sex drive, the back pain, extreme fatigue, blurred vision, numbness and tingling in my hands and feet, and feeling like I was going to vomit all of the time.  At first I thought it was all in my head, then after 6 months I had a physical, my internist told me that I was very healthy and she couldn't tell me that anything was physically wrong.  She wanted to prescribe psychiatric medication to control my mood swings and that's where I drew the line.  I called my OB and demanded an appointment and got that thing out of me Today! I feel better already! I can't wait until my children gets their old mother back and my husband gets his wife back!  Good luck to those of you who still have this device from the devil and for those of you contemplating getting it, my advice to you is DON'T!

column2: jamie07, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Anikka, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i had my first Mirena inserted Feb 06 i spotted continuously for 3 months. after my period was moderate to light it still last for 7 days but not as much pain. i had it removed in 7/08 and tried to have a bay , miscarried in 12/08 and was pergnant again 3/09. i had a healthy baby boy Nov this yr& went in for my six week postpartum and opted for the Mirena again. The first insertion came out after she released the device into the uteris. the second insertion was sucessful but more painful than the first. i emdiately had cramps, back pain and bloating. i dont know if it was a rush of the hormones released from the IUD or if its placed incorrectly. i came home took 800mg i b profen and napped for about 3 hours and felt better. now cramps are back & the bleeding is heavier. i hope this doesnt mean bad news. i'll keep you posted on my progress

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena for about a year and a half now and I love it. I completely stopped getting my period right away, which is awesome. I've even lost some weight, but that may not be from the Mirena itself; prior to getting the Mirena, I was on the pill for about 8 years, so stopping the pill may be what caused me to lose weight. Either way, the Mirena is great and I highly recommend it!BTW, I've never given birth; I think the only draw back with that is an increase in pain during insertion of the device, which is not a walk in the park but is quick, bearable, and totally worth it.

column2: jackie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have only had the Mirena for about 7 months. I have gained 25 lbs since i got it and I have also lost my sex drive. I also get a very light brown discharge every month, sometimes lasting about 2 weeks. I keep hoping that my side effects will go away, but after 7 months, I have still gained 25 lbs. Im afraid if I dont get it taken out soon, I will continue to gain.

column2: mommyof3, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am terriable at remembering to take bc pills so after my twins i decided to try the mirena at my doctors recomendation his wife had one so i figured must be ok. Well ive had it almost 2yrs now . it hurts a lil when put in and i bleed lightly for 6 weeks but other than that i love it no periods at all no cramping nothing as for the weight gain i think some peole are looking for something to blame it on because i lost 40 pounds now i was dieting but the mirena didnt make it any harder. I am very very satisfied and when i get this one out im having another put in.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I decided to have mirena inserted due to extremely heavy cycles.  My alternative was edometrial ablation since I did not want to use birth control pills due to negative effects.  I educated myself well and read both good and bad.   I also asked around and spoke to a few that had it done with great success.  However this is not for me.  I've had it for about three months and I have the following side effects: depression, weight gain, dropped sex drive and horrible migraines really the main reason I have to have it removed.  Yes it did help the heaviness of my cycle, but there are just too many side effects for me.  Please note that I get bad side effects from birth control pills too.  I was hoping to be able to keep this, but it's not worth it to me.  I would say if you are considering- just try it.  One great thing is it is totally temporary.  Best wishes.  Oh btw I am 42 and have three children.

column2: kaci, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 20yr old mother of a 2yr old. I've had the mirena for 2 years. Ive always had a period since ive had it placed...just light spotting lasting normally 1 wk sometimes up to 3. The past month i have been having cramping not only lower abdomin all over and very heavy period along with significant bloating. spasms almost feeling like a contraction or even a baby kick...which concerns me that i could be pregnant and im so bloated that my tummy is sticking out so i plan on taking a test tom..will post when i figure out. if anyone else is having the exact same problems please post... : ) thanks

column9: i got my iud on oct.27 2009 that was 2 mo. after my misscarrage i have a 2 1/2 year old and an 8 mo old i would recomend this iud to every one who don`t want kids right now it works great the hardest part is the incertation of it the pain feels like a slight contraction but it is over in a few min. i really like it and it works very well since i had it put in i have only had spotting for my period witch is nice and the best thing about it is you can have it removed at any time

column2: rach, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I thought this would be a good birth control option for me, but i have had over a 25lb weight gain from this. I work in a endocrinology office and i was dx with pcos. column2: kellic, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Had mirena put in May 2009.  Have 2 children, had my tubes tied when I was 30, but peri-menopause was making my periods unbearable, would be bleeding 15 days out of the month.  I love it, slight cramping after it was put in, but periods are basically non-existent, a little spotting here and there.  Best decision I ever made.

column2: sabrina, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got my mirena on 12-7-09 at 3pm. after reading so many horror stories about the pain it kinda freaked me out. it was VERY easy. im 18 and i suffer from endometriosis along with never being sexually active or having kids. insertion takes 2-3 minutes and i didnt need ANY kind of painkillers or numbing medicines.they first check the position of your utuerus, then they put in a spectulum,then they clamp your cervix(feels like a tight pinch) next they rub iodine over the cervix, measure your uterus(start having some cramping/feels like a period cramp) then put in mirena. that easy! had some slight bleeding and cramping after but the cramping and bleeding only lasted a couple of hours. very happy i got mirena. today i have finals and feeling amazing! my advise to other women considering mirena is to not read horror stories and to try it for yourself. everyones body reacts differently including pain tolerence and reactions.what might not work for them might work for you and vice versa.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got the mirena iud today 12-7-09 @ 12p.m. The procedure was very easy not painful at all. Now, im experiencing a little bleeding and some cramps here and there . I guess its normal because ive never had kids. Over all so far its not too bad. Since i never had kids the dr. gave me a pill to help it go in easier. It wasnt too bad like i said i'd suggest to for girls who never had kids and want a long term birth control. Im 18 by the way .

column2: sabrina, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got my mirena inserted today for endometriosis on 12-7-09 at 3pm and it was VERY easy. i also freaked myself out looking at reviews about insertion pain but it was nothing like the women said. Im 18 and never had a child or been sexually active and didnt need any type of numbing meds or pain pills. had some slight bleeding and cramping afterwards but nothing too bad. it took about 2-3 minutes. they first check the position of the uterus, put in a spectulum then rub iodine over the cervix, then they clamp the cervix(feels like a tight pinch), next they measure the uterus which you will then have slight cramping, after that mirena is inserted and your done. nothing bad at all. DONT FREAK YOURSELVES OUT READING HORROR STORIES. everyones body is different including pain tolerence and reactions. try it for yourself. its very worth it!

column2: y20scouple, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got my mirena in today 12/7/09 but I thought I would just let people know that I had a great experience with my procedure.  I read most of these reviews and was scared out of my mind.  The procedure took 3 min and didnt feel a thing.  I have 1 child and dont want anymore but they say that i am to young to get my tubes tied at this time so this was the best choice for me.  i am 12 hours into and havent had any problems or pain.  I had a little spotting for a couple hours after the procedure but that has been it.  So far I am really glad that I went ahead and got the mirena.  I will update in a few months if there any changes.

column2: Elucas5369, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am only writing to explain my fears and frustration with reviews. Of course the majority of the reviews are negative. That is because if you are satisfied that you are less likely to write and say that. I am 32 and have two children and I am at a point where i just don't want any more children right now. column2: Missann, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Ok well like I said before I am 27 with 4 kids had the mirena for a little over a year had it removed about 2weeks ago..have been spotting since i had it removed called the doc they said " oh spotting can last up to 6months after removal you may also have mild to severe cramping and body aches while your body recovers from no longer having the steady stream of hormones in it." ugh i feel like i was hit by a mac truck hopefully i feel better soon.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: Okay, I rated on my previous experience. I had mirena put in right after I had my son in 2006. I had it in for 2 years. I loved it, no side effects other than no period. (who would complain about that) the insertion didn't hurt at all. I had it removed to try for another baby. I had 3 miscarriages then decided I really didn't want to go through that again. I blame Mirena for those issues. I just got my second Mirena placed last week. The doctors refuse to do a tubal or essure, and I was sick of the pill. The insertion of this last one was horrible. It hurt and I went home and took another motrin. The pain was fine after 2 days. So far there really isn't any spotting. When I took out my first one I gained weight. I'm hoping that I lose weight while this one is in I gained so much weight while on the NuvaRing. My husband did complain once before that it poked him. I loved it before and I'm hoping I have a similar experience this time around. I have recommended it to everyone I know. But man oh man the insertion was painful.

column2: Hopeful, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well I just got Mirena today but I did want to give other women who are considering it what I have found. First off, it was very painful when they put it in. I am 24 years and have never had kids but I would guess the pain is about the same as giving birth expect it only lasted 5-10 mins. I have been reading ALOT of reviews today (I guess this is something I should have done before) but from what I have gathered the women that have not had kids had more pain when it was inserted but no side effects. So I am hoping the same goes for me. If you do decide to get I would recommend taking some pain meds before you go in.

I WOULD AND HAVE RECCOMENDED THE MIRENA TO PEOPLE.

column2: bbb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about 2 and a half years. While it is 100% on effectiveness, and I do love the convineince, i HATE the side effects I have expereinced. Acne (whole body!),migraines and WEIGHT GAIN.I am the heaviest I have ever been in my life. I have three children, 16yrs, 5yrs, and 2and a half, and I am done! I cant wait to get the mirena out and get the permanent 'fix'! I hate being this heavy. Also, i constantly feel like I am PMSing. ALWAYS bloated, crampy, hungry, and irritable...yet I never actually get a period. It has served its purpose but truthfully I cant wait to get it out.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 20 years old and I have not had children yet. I had the Mirena inserted about a year ago, Oct. '08. The insertion process was quite painful. I had some bleeding afterwards, and some serious cramping, but that ended within 2 days. For the first few months, my periods were regular, short, and light. After about 4 months, my periods stopped all together, with the exception of a few light spotting periods. Getting the Mirena has been one of the best decisions I've ever made. It is extremely easy to use, my fiance has never felt it during sex, and after the first few days I have not had any bad side effects from the IUD. I would stronly recommend the Mirena.

column2: Misann, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 27 years old and I have 4 children I got Mirena a little over a year ago because how easy it is to use. I did not feel much pain during insurtion just a sharp cramp, I spotted for about 3 weeks. I recently had it removed b/c of lower abdominal pain and bleeding(I hadn't had a period since the birth of my last child a little over a year ago) The worst part of having it in was constantly worrying if the threads were still there and any stomache pain i had the doc. jumped straight to either it's inbeded or perferated or an eptopic pregnancy all of which are scarey thoughts when you have a house full to take care of. It has only been out for a few days but my stomache pain is nearly gone and having it removed felt like getting a cat scratch along the insides of my guts and gave me some nasty cramps. Good Luck.

column2: Meluvshortppl@aol.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am the mother of a two year old daughter. I had Mirena inserted on Dec. 6, 2007. Since then, My periods have lasted anywhere from 2weeks to a month. Also, I do not have "cramps" I have what I like to call LABOR PAINS! I am constantly hurting in my lower abdomin. I have made several attempts to have the bc removed, But since the doctor who inserted it lost her practice, nobody will see me. I am friends with a girl who has a sister who developed uteran cancer due to mirena. She is 26 years old and has to have a complete histerectimy. This bc is clearly not for me! I hope you all have better expericence that i have.

column2: vkmccoy78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted almost 5 years ago.  I've loved it.  It hurt having it inserted and there are minor cramps for a few days.  I spot maybe 4 times a year.  I still have acne issues during that time, but all and all it has not been all that bad.  the only issue is that when my husband and I have intercourse the wire hits the tip of his penis.  that can be an issue for my husband.  If I could do it all over again I would still do the same thing.  It has helped out so much and I may get it done again, here in the near future.

column2: leah26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I actually just got the mirena inserted this morning so I know my ratings may not be fair. I have never had a child so the insertion was VERY painful for me. I got very light headed and nauseus during the insertion and my cramps are awful! As long as the cramping stops I am sure I will be very happy with it. My only reason for writing the review so soon is so women can know to expect some pain (my doctor didn't warn me of it) and take some ibuprofen or tylenol before going in to the office.They told me I would feel like going back to work as soon as it was over and that was not the case for me, I am very thankful I didnt have to go back.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this IUD for 2 years and two months. I didn't have it for BC, I have menorrhagia so this was like having my prayers answered. No period months at a time, when i do have one it is light spotting. Side effects was the hair loss, headaches, stomach aches, weight gain, and acne. For two weeks i have been spotting and had a headache upon reviewing this i will have it removed to see if this will make it better.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
honey09, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 18 years old, no kids...don't want any for a while now. I got it on October 16, 2009. I thought it would be the best form of bc for me. For insertion, the pain was unbearable almost. My doc said the pain would go away in a few days, but...it didn't. i started out on motrin and tylenol...that stopped working after a week. Started taking aleve...it stopped working a few days later...all the while i'm still bleeding or "spotting", very very lite. Had sex the one day i wasn't bleeding, and it was AMAZING and it was great not having to worry about using a condom. still was cramping pretty bad though. I went back and saw a dif doc since mine wasn't in and he made shyt even worse...i left in even worse pain than i was before and bleeding more than i was before...i had heavy bleeding for the next week and a half with heavy cramping still and i was taking the advil liquid gels which seemed to dull the pain just a bit. The day before my check up with my doc, the pain was still somewhat severe but the bleeding decreased some. My doc fixed things and i went back to spotting and my cramps almost dissapeared instantly. She gave me a script for a higher dosage of motrin for my occasional cramps. Its been a week since and i still have spotting, and my cramps are barely noticable (w/o of motrin)and hopefully i'll stop spotting soon so i can have sex with my man again. I've lost 10 lbs, had minor acne, severe mood swings, and minor headaches. I def recomend this bc for anyone not trying to get preg, you just may have to deal with a bit of pain for a while. BUT NOT EVERYONE DOES!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm 28 years old and have a 1 year old. I have been on Mirena for about a year. When I had it insereted there was really no pain,and I didn't bleed very much. I have had one period in the last year and it lasted about 2 days. That has to be the only good thing about Mirena.  I have NO sex drive. Before Mirena I had a pretty high sex drive, now it dosen't exsist.It has really put a damper on my relationship with my Husband. Before and when I was pregnant I didn't weigh very much. I only gained about 30 pounds when I was pregnant, and after my baby was born lost most of it. Now I weigh more then I have even in my life. We are going on Monday to have it removed!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 22 years old and never been pregnant. Mirena has been perfect for me. I had it inserted this past January (09). The procedure took about a minute and the only side effects were mild cramping and bleeding for about 3 days after it was inserted. I have had absolutely no side effects from this IUD other than the amazing feeling that comes from not having to worry about getting pregnant. This form of birth control is a safe, no hassle way to prevent pregnancy for women of all ages that are in a serious relationship and not at risk for contracting std's. The only reason that they say it isn't for women who have never had children is because the insertion procedure can be more difficult, however my doctor prescribed me a single dose of something that softened the cervix for the insertion and everything went well. If the IUD isn't expelled within the first 1 to 2 months then it is very unlikely for it to ever be expelled. Also since Mirena delivers a very low dose hormone to the uterine area only, there are absolutely no side effects at all unlike all other forms of birth control. I can't even explain in words how Mirena has changed my life for the better. The secure feeling that comes with not having to worry about getting pregnant or taking a pill everyday is beyond amazing. I highly recommend it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It is a wonderful BC, as well as helpful treatment for Poly-cystic Ovarian Syndrome. The first THREE months were painfully full of cramps.  I am 8 months into it now and so glad I stuck it out.

column2: mary, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: In January I had a baby.  By April I was losing the baby weight and fast!  Then I got the IUD in May, it is now November and I just made an appointment to have it removed.  I weigh more now than I did when I was 9 months pregnant.  Also, I have been using a prescription for acne that I have always used and has always worked, now I am breaking out like crazy.  I am even developing acne on my chest, back and arms!  My husband and I don't want to have more kids but he is with me on this and he is willing to have a vasectomy just so I don't have to be on birth control, that's love!  I will miss being period-free but it's just not worth it anymore.

column2: jkcooper89, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for 6 months now. The NEGATIVES:Insertion was painful, but bearable. Aleve worked to get rid of the bad pain.I've had abdominal pain and cramping since insertion.Periods are lighter, but I bled for 2 months non stop spotting, then a month off, and had 2 normal cycles, now I get possibly 1 week with no bleeding.I've gained 20 pounds and cannot lose it.I'm tired and have NO sex drive. I previously had a higher sex drive than my husband. It is now nonresistant. It just so happens that most of the time I just don't care anymore.When I do have sex and an orgasm, it is painful. I can feel the IUD and it hurts during orgasm. The POSITIVES:My PMDD/PMS has been cut in half. My heavy periods are gone. Now I just bleed almost all the time instead. As awful as it is, I'm going to keep going and give it a little more time to see if the bleeding levels out. I can deal with the abdominal pain much better than the horrid bleeding I had during periods. For the record, my PMDD/PMS and heavy periods INTERFERED with my life and work, and I had to do something. Therefore, this was a plausible choice for me, and has been affective in reducing missed days at work and my ability to deal with everyday life.

column2: kv, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted about 3 weeks ago and haven't had the terrible side effects that people have written about here. My doctor took me off the pill because I have high blood pressure so this is a good long-term option for me. I don't have any kids so insertion was painful but it was quick, maybe about 5-10 mins total. I did feel dizzy during the procedure but not afterward. The night of the procedure however I had some of the worst cramps I have ever experienced. Even advil, a muscle relaxer and a hot water bottle didn't help. The cramps continued for the next day and the day after but lessened each day. Same with the spotting and nausea. I had some bright red spotting that night and the next day and then it tapered off, getting darker in color, lasting for about 4 days. Oddly enough I felt bloated and gassy for a few days as well. I do get some random cramps here and there and have noticed my skin seems oilier but so far I feel fine. I think the side effects and mood swings from the pill are worse. The reviews on here definitely scared me and those that complained of weight gain and feeling moody should also factor in their lifestyle and stress level. You can't blame a medication for massive weight gain without looking at your eating habits and the amount you exercise. It also takes a little while for your body to adjust to a medication and I think some women were very quick to say they didn't like it. I am definitely giving mirena a chance, so far I am happy with it and if I do experience any side effects I'll update this review.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got my Mirena in Feb 2009. Some cramping when inserted but no big deal. About five months later my Acne was out of control. I usually get a bump here and there during my cycle, but now i get 3 or 4 at a time.  I dont consider myself to be vain, but I am 30 yrs old now and should not have to experience pumpils.   Also my mood swings are out of control and the headaches are brothersome as well. I have a 5 and @ yr old and I need patience. Since the Mirena I am easily irritate and very very moody.   On the flip side very little bleeding.  I did have it removed today and I will be going back to the BC pill.

column2: bugbri02, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i am a mother of two childern i got the IUD 6 weeks after my second daughter was born because i had tried a few other birth controls and they didnt work for me i have had it in a little over a year and so far no more babies but the side affects are outrageous i can deal with most of it but i hate the acne its horrible my face is the worst its ever been also the mood swings i typically dont get pms but in the last 5 months or so its been horrible i am currently waiting to get it out and i am anxious i love that it has stopped me from having more children but i cant deal with the side affects anymroe its getting the best of me god luck to any one who gets it i wouldnt reccomend it

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena put on on 11/03/09 I haven't had any kids so I was expecting it to hurt worse then any cramp I have ever had. It did hurt but I have had cramps that hurt a lot worse. I had in inserted at the end of my period since then I have had hardly any bleeding I don't even need a pad. I would suggest you have someone drive you home because I felt way sick afterwords. So far I love it and my husband says he can't feel the strings.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a Mirena IUD inserted in May 2009 because I was having heavy prolonged bleeding.  Insertion was a short but painful process.  I was told that I could experience abnormal bleeding and cramps for about 3 months (which I did).  Five months have passed and yes, my periods have become almost non-existent, however I now also have acne problems, weight gain, depression, a decreased sex drive, and mood swings.  Does it work? Yes--but the toll it has taken on my daily life is too great a price to pay. I am having it removed next week.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had mirena inserted yesterday but felt compelled to submit a review on my first day experience because of the very negative experiences from a lot of patients.I was in my doctor's office for a total of twenty minutes, five minutes total for the insertion.  There were three series of cramps that my doctor warned me about right before each one.  I must say that I was a wreck going in there and while I was there, but the experience was a lot less painful than what I expected.  The cramps were very bearable, as I have two children already.The rest of my day I had minimal cramping and very little bleeding, even so far today.So, so far so good.  I will update in the future for how this is working for me, but as for now I just wanted to ease the feeling for those of you that are apprehensive about the procedure.  It was short and very bearable.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Hello I am 27 years old and I got the mirena inserted 4 years ago after the birth of my son. At first I noticed no symptoms until a couples of months after having it I gained weight at least 40lbs my mood shifted, my skin tone darkened in certain spots and acne was horrible.I also experienced the worst cramps in like as if I was having contractions all over again. I know that ever women body is differnt but for me this was a horiffic experience. I recently got my mirena removed and I would not recomend this birth control to my worst enemie.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: In may i had the IUD incerted, besides the initial pain/cramping; i thought it was great...that is until over time the side effects started... i have always had a clear complextion, now, WOW!i cant clear my chin to save my life! My mood changes are horrible and the bleeding is so irregular i cant keep up. I have no sex drive anymore and i am 25! i am seeing my doctor today and hopefully getting it removed!

column2: Kittie1598, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted on the 19th of October. It was very painful for the first day and i was physically sick right after. The next day I was back to normal, just some light spotting off and on. So far there have been no problems, but we'll see. I like it because i'm not stressed out about remembering to take my pill at the same time everyday, and since I don't have to worry about getting pregnant I feel sexier.

column2: Twiztid_lett, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started my Mirena after my second child loving the simplicity of it. On top of the fact my doctor had me convinced it was a better form of bith control. I had mirena in almost a year,but there was a problem with this worry free version of bc the side effects. I know everything has them but WOW. I didn't realize all this time my bc could be the cause. I gained a tun of weight, my very normal complexion turned into a acne nighmare, of course the deprression came as well. Not to leave out the pain it caused I had a dull side pain that became "normal" to have and also times of extreme pain with sex that lasted about a month. My period never went away but it was irregular,so I always felt bloated, and irritable like PMS 24/7. Just got it removed today its not worth all that for sure!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in for 2 months now and I just love it!  It was super easy to have inserted no pain a few cramps nothing big.  I have had 2 kids (one was a C-section).  I was taking the pill for many years and got sick having to remember it.  I also was slowly gaining weight over that last few years and no matter what I did (workout queen 7 days a week) didn't help.  After stoping the pill and using Mirena I have lost 8 lbs!  I highly recommend this!

column2: Missa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am about to have my second Mirena inserted. Having just given my body a years rest from contraception. I am 36 and have never had children or been pregnant. Discomfort and faint is what i shall feel tomorrow, nothing compared to getting your 12 times a year! I can live with the quick pain of insertion and the couple of days of discomfort... i keep reminding myself of the 5 years of no drama and it's all worth it!

column2: lily, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 28 and have never had children and have no desire to, so I thought Mirena would be good for me.  It definitely works; I've not gotten pregnant.  But wow; holy side effects.  If I had it to do over, I would have just stuck with the pill.  The insertion process was momentarily surprisingly painful for me (the kind of pain that makes your spine sweat and your eyes cross) but I think this may be because I've never had children.  I had no side effects for about the first 4 months until my periods stopped.  Now it's exactly like physically my body is stuck in a permanent state of PMS.  My tummy stays bloated & fingers and face swollen & I experience some ridiculously painful cramps 3 or 4 times a week. I've developed some pretty severe acne (I suppose my penance for having clear skin growing up).  I always feel like a bottomless pit as far as my appetite goes.  I gained a good 25 pounds in 2 months after my periods stopped, and I just couldn't seem to get rid of it.  Quite frankly, I've resorted to severely restricting my food intake and though I've dropped about 15 pounds, I'm always - ALWAYS - hungry.  I miss my naturally fast metabolism; now I reeeally have to work hard to maintain my physique.  I also have mood swings, debilitating depression and irritability just like I used to the day before my period except that now it's pretty much all the time.  I've resorted to seeing a therapist to learn emotion regulation techniques, going on anti-depressants & weekly acupuncture treatments.  If it hadn't been such a b*tch to get in I would have looong since had it removed.  I do plan to get it taken out before the end of the year.  If you're thinking of getting it then go for it.  Just know that if you experience any crazy side effects, you're not losing your mind.

column2: Renea, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena since April 2005. I would recommend this to any women. Inserting the IUD was a bit uncomfortable and I cramped for about 2 hours. I spotted for about 4 days. After that I haven't had any issues. I have not had a period since then. I spot every few months for about a day. No cramps, no pads, no tampons, no Midol, no unexpected pregnancy! Couldn't be better. I may get another Mirena when this one is expired. The only other thing I experienced was that the string retracted inside of me. This was not an issue. I just get a ultrasound every year.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Hi. 29 yr old female. I had the mirena inserted 1 yr ago, 7 weeks after my first child was born. The procedure for me was painless, and I only had minor cramping and slight spotting. Everything was great for me for the first 4 months, then Wham!!! Horrible symptoms. Bleeding every other week, loss of sexual interest due to SEVERE pain during intercourse; VIOLENT MOOD SWINGS; horrible depression with suicidal thoughts; nightmares, fatigue... just plain miserable. I intend on having this IUD removed ASAP. I think this product works for some people, but definitely NOT for me. The side effects are way to unpredictable and difficult to manage. The mood swings have caused problems with my marraige, but thankfully I have a wonderful husband. To everyone who has the Mirena, watch out for the mood changes... If you don't feel like yourself, TALK TO YOUR DR!!! It's scary to feel like your going crazy from hormones. Hope this helps someone!

column2: lmeyer36, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for about 3 wks now. I have had no side effects except spotting. I love this device and not having to worry about when I have sex! Don't listen to all the negative reviews out there, they scared the crap out of me before I had this inserted, now I am glad I had it done!

column2: Tinkerbell, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My ratings are low since I just had this inserted this week as I have heavy periods.  This was the most painful experience.  My doctor told me I would have some cramping when it was being inserted.  I almost hit the roof it was so painful (and I had my baby without epidural or any other pain medication, so It's not that I have no tolerance for pain).  I've had cramps off and on since.  If it comes out, I will definitely not have it reinserted - I cannot get that pain out of my head.

column2: txchick, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got on this after having my first child. I was told there were no serious side effects. The inserting wasn't painful and I had very light periods with no cramping. The side effects are another thing. I gained 25 lbs, started losing my hair, was moody all the time, had no sex drive, was depressed, got migraines, and the list goes on. I thought something was wrong with me but after taking a test to check my thyroid and  a blood test, I found out nothing was wrong with me. I eat right, exercise, and was still gaining weight. I then started looking at the side effects and realized it was Mirena. I am getting it taken out ASAP. I definitely DO NOT recommend it.

column2: dolphinschick, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in July 2009 and I have been very happy with it. I used to have horrible periods with bad cramping and I only had 1 period after having the IUD inserted. My periods went away and so far I have no trouble with it other than my partner says he can feel it every once in a while. I have had a child and I have read that it works better if you have had a child. I hope I don't run into any horrible side effects like I have been reading. The only thing I have experienced is mild acne and some weight gain.

column2: Morgan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had my mirena for a month now.  I had it inserted during my last period and haven't bled since at all.  No cramps after leaving the doctor's office that day.  My mood has been so much better.  I have been on anti-depressants and anti-anxiety meds for 9 years.  I have had a little bloating, but no more than usual with pms.  Maybe I am a poster child for Mirena.  I was terrified after reading some of the comments out there on the web, but I talked to my doctor, and my experience so far has been wonderful.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have a retroverted uterus and had the Mirena put in 2 wks ago.  Upon insertion I had terrible sharp pains that still have not gone away.  I can't walk, sit, or sleep.  Dr put me on antibiotics and had an ultrasound yesterday.  I am having it removed asap.

column2: lizzie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this is thw worst form of contraception i have ever had i am married with two kids and for six months i have been on to my doctor to get it withdrawn. i have put on over three stone despit starving myselt and constant dieting and excercising. i am constantly depressed and moody all the time. i  would not recommend this to any one ever

column2: alesia, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD for two years before it got removed I was having heart related problems due to the estrogen I gained over 50 pounds with it. I had cramps all the time. My body ached. I would not recommend this for anyone!!!!!!!!!!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had my iud inserted five months ago.  Im 23, never been pregnant, I bled almost everyday for the first three months which is what my gyn told me to expect my periods are still a little irregular, but it has helped a lot with pms and mood swings, periods are also a lot lighter. insertion was very uncomfortable WARNING TO WOMEN WHO DONT HAVE KIDS ask ur gyn for a local! overall Im happpy with this product and I havent experienced any adverse effects except for some bad cramping which is commmon for women who've never been pregnant

column2: Denise, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my IUD in now for nearly 3 years.  I hate it and am having it removed on Monday.  Sure, you don't have to think about birth control, but it has not been worth feeling depressed and moody, my loss of interest in sex, and acne like I've never experienced that has left scars all over my face.  I had no idea that it had these side effects until I recently read about them.  Now it all makes sense as these symptoms have only shown themselves since having the IUD put in.  NOT WORTH IT PEOPLE!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this iud for 4 1/2 years now. I HATE IT. I have had so many problems ranging from cramps to infections to reacuring uti. Now I have PID and may have to have a hysterectomy. It was not worth getting.

column2: MsMonica08, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted about 3 weeks ago (9/28/2009), I also never had a child, or been pregnant. Not even 30min after, I started cramping really bad. My doctor told me that might happen so I should get motrin to ease the cramps. I took the mortin, and after a week I found myself taking the motrin everyday just to make it through the day. Once the motrin wasn't enough, I started taking aleve, extra strength excedrin, and now extended relief midol. Yesterday (10/14/2009), I stared cramping beyond measure for about 3 hours straight and could not move at all. I also felt poking in my "pocket book" so I checked it and felt the strings coming outside of my "pocket book". Today I'm going to get it checked because I belive the IUD is coming out or just not adjusting to my body at all.

column2: Jennyfer, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i had mirena inserted today, and i'm not sure if it's the mirena or what, but i've been Very tired, and when i awoke from a nap i didn't know i was even taking, i was very confused, and didn't know where the baby was that i had laid in his crib right before laying down... is this normal? or should i be worried?

column2: LauraLove, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for 1 yr and 5 months. It has been great until about 5 months ago...At first I had some spotting, bleeding, but I do with any bc. About 5 months ago, I started having deep cystic acne, which I didnt know existed until this. At 33, my complexion rivals a teens and they are deep and leave scars. I have little lumps or cysts in my neck and even around my ears. I had a pain in my side that came and went alot over the past 5 months but no one knew what it was. I have been tired more lately, and for the 5 months I have had increasingly more headaches or migraines than usual. ( I am prone to migraines, but maybe 3 a month) but I started getting them more and more like 3 times a week. and for 3 weeks now I have had a headache every day but 4 days headache free. I feel like something is wrong with me....and couldnt shake it being the IUD after hearing so many similar stories. So this morning after arising with another headache.. or the same one...I washed and scrubbed my hands for 2 mins..and took out my IUD. I belive it will be the answer I have been avoiding, because of how much I wanted effective BC. But nothing is worth a month long headache with 4 kids to care for. It was easy. I grasped the strings and pulled gently, it took 5 mins and wasnt painful or even uncomfortable for me. (I have had 4 kids though like I said) I feel a little teeny bit crampy....but I am sp happy its gone and will never use hormonal bc again. Im going to go with the Essure Route I think...

column2: Stacie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 23 years old married woman with one child I knew I didn't want anymore kids so I got the mirena out in 2 weeks ago. The in office experience was fine it's just like a papsmear, some women say you get a shot in oyur cervix, not me. My OBGYN used a antiseptic gel to rub on my cervix with a cotton swab I didn't feel a thing. Yes its alittle uncomfortable but who thinks paps are? Anyways you do get a lot of cramping afterwards, I felt a little dizzy aftwerwards but the dizzyness went away. I am however still cramping, especially after I have sex with my husband. I go on this tuesday to make sure it has been placed in the right place by my doctor, so far I am pleased no negative feedback so far, in due time we will see

column2: Liza0315, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had the Mirena IUD placed today 10/08/2009.  I decided to get the mirena because I have one child already and I'm definately not ready to have another one.  I'm not very good at remembering little things like taking a pill everyday, so this option was very ideal for me.  The Dr. told me to take some kind of over the counter pain meds at least an hour before the procedure, but I didn't. I suggest that you listen to that advise. The procedure didn't last very long maybe 5-10 mins but it was uncomfortable.  I did experience pressure and quick, sharp pains a couple of times. There was pain, but definately bearable. After it was over, I felt cramping (as if it were about to get my period) radiating from my back to my left knee and a litttle unbalanced. I had some spotting but it stopped. I suggest you have someone drive you home afterwards.  It's been about 8 hours since and I still have some discomfort like menstral cramping and lower back pain. I've taken advil and motrin, it's helped somewhat. Again this is my first day, I'm not 100% on how my body will react to it but I'm hopeful. I was reading in other posts that some women had the mirena placed but they don't have children.  I was told you can't have it placed unless you have at least one? I did not read any of these reviews before I had the procedure. I think it's worth a try.  Everyone's body reacts different and it might not be for everyone.  Heck, it might not even be for me! Really talk to your Dr. about side effects if your uneasy about it or have a low tolerance for pain. If you've already had a child, this is a walk in the park.

column2: glowwings, 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have now had Mirena in place for 2 weeks. The only side effect that I have had is a small amount of cramping...usually the day after sex. Other than that...it is going very well!!!

column2: Turtle86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 23 years old and had the Mirena inserted in February 2009. The reason I chose it was because I couldn't take birth control pills for other medical reasons. It seemed like the best choice since I am in a monogamous long-term relationship, plus the convenience and effectiveness. I'm not ready to have a child and will not be for a while.When I had it inserted, I was very nervous. It was an unusual strange but severe pressure initially as they inserted it. But once it was in, the pressure was gone. I had cramping for about a day and I bled very little, it wasn't even from the IUD but from the clamp they used to prop my cervix open. I since have had my period only twice where it was a full regular period and that was in the first 3 months but it was always extremely light. Periodically, I will spot very lightly for a few hours and very rarely do I get cramps any more. I love that I do not have to worry about my birth control and that I do not even have to think about it. My boyfriend and I can be spontaneous whenever we want. Only occasionally has sex been uncomfortable but it has never actually hurt. Certain positions just add a little pressure, but nothing severe. I think the IUD tends to have a bad reputation but I am proof that it can work out! It may not work for everyone but that doesn't mean it won't work for some people.

column2: athensgamom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It was more painful than I expected to have it inserted but the pain was gone in a few hours.  My biggest problem is recurring nightmares.  Two weeks of the month I have nightmares so bad that I don't want to sleep.  To me it's still worth it not to have to worry about becoming pregnant at 40.

column2: milz211, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I decided to use mirena because my son was unexpected and i'm too young to have another baby before i'm ready. My friends and family all said good things about it and i thought it was the best choice. It was placed in march2009. I didn't have much cramping at first. It is now over 6 months later and i haven't stopped bleeding. I've seen my Dr. 3 times because of the constant bleeding and she's just keeps telling me to be patient. I want it out. I have terrible cramps and i just want to stop bleeding.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a Mirena IUD place after our second child.  The result was horrifying.  I got pregnant IN MY OVARY.  Sure the Mirena worked cause the pregnancy didn't go into my uterus but I sure wish it would have.  I had to have emergency surgery and lost my ovary and falopian tube.  I will NEVER recommend this IUD to other woman---friends or strangers.  After my experience my DR. told me that she's seen this a little more often than the warnings indicate.  Usually in the falopian tube but nonetheless a pregnancy that shouldn't have happened and certainly in a place it was never intended to occur.  PLEASE TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR ABOUT THIS COMPLICATION BEFORE HAVING THE MIRENA INSERTED.  A healty UNPLANNED pregnancy beats living with the fact that your choice of birth control caused you to lose a baby and part of your reproductive system.

column2: Jessicabartz, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena in August of 2008. It is now October 2009. Over a year sonce I got it. It was a little painful when they put it in, and a little cramping and pressure, but I never had any bleeding. I had my regular period there for a little while, but since May of 09 I havnt had my period at all. What I WANT TO KNOW is what about when I decide to have children again? How long after I take it out will I be fertile again? Will there be birth defects? Please let me know. . .jessica_bartz_1987@yahoo.com

column2: apinkcharm, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted 09/30/09. I have never been pregnant. I had the worst cramping of my life. I couldnt move the first day and am still having very intense cramping that has now moved to my lower back as well. No over the counter pain medication has made a dent in the pain. I started this BC due to the side effects I was experiencing with the NuvaRing. I have heard good things about Mirena and hopefully the side effects will subside.

column2: tmh, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had mirena put in Sept.11,2009. It was not really painful. Just felt alot of pressure, but I did pass out when I started to get up. Had minor cramping for a couple of days.Started bleeding on 9/16/09 and am still bleeding. Very heavy bleeding and large blood clots. Todays date 10/01/09. Went into the doctors yesterday, and was given premarin to take for ten days to stop the bleeding. So far, still bleeding. Will update how long it takes for it to stop. Doctor told me that 10% of women will never adjust to mirena. If bleeding continues, I will have mirena removed. Going to wait 3 to 6 mons. to allow my body to adjust.

column2: misha8000, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mine put in on 9/29/09. The insertion process was very painful for me. I was given a local in my cervix, and that was the most painful part, I could feel the insertion, but with the local that wasn't painful. I had severe cramping and pain the first day, and the cramping has continued but not as severe. I spoke with my doctor. She said the cramping was normal, and to switch from taking Aleve to Advil, which is really working out well. I feel confident about this, escpecially knowing my doctor has a Mirena IUD herself. From reading other reviews and talking with my doctor, it sounds as if I just need to be patient and in a couple of months I'll be very happy about it. I get my period every 20-21 days without fail, lasting for 6 to 8 days. I am tired of my period getting in the way of everything else I like to do. I also do not want children, and get anxiety if my period is one day late. I definetly think the benefits will outweigh the negatives! As for hair loss, I have suffered this before with a thyroid problem I was treated for. I took a hair vitamin for years that helped a LOT. In fact, I stopped taking it because my hair was growing too fast. I started taking it again after reading the reviews and I know it will help. I would highly suggest to anyone to get a good hair vitamin which contains MSM. MSM tightens your hair follicles which prevents hair loss. (I take Optim 3 Hair and Nail Formula from Hi-Health.) Back to the IUD, I need to be very honest. I felt very uneasy and had a lot of fears. I thought "What if the IUD string gets stuck on a tampon and tears out", "What if I get toxic shock", "Oh my, what have done to myself?!"but my doctor put my mind at ease. The insertion process felt very invasive to me, so I realized I was a bit emotional for that reason. Not to sound judgemental, but many women in the reviews that have had it removed so quickly may be reacting to that emotion, which is natural. If you feel that, just be aware and it will pass!

column2: Portland, Oregon, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD Mirena placed in my uterus on 11/13/2008, eight weeks after I gave birth to my daughter. I thought things were going fine until two months ago when I started having a heavy menstrual cycle every two weeks and increasing right sided pelvic cramping. I went to my doctor for a check of my symptoms and my annual pap exam. During my exam the doctor could not feel the string, she then performed a vaginal ultrasound and found my uterus to be empty. I then went on to have a abdominal x-ray to confirm my IUD had fallen out. But as of yesterday I have learned that I have to have Laproscopic Surgery to have my IUD removed from my body because it had purferated through my uterus and is now stuck in my right pelvis bone by my spine. The doctor will not know if any damage has been done to my bowels or any other organs until I have my surgery on 10/13/2009. I thought this was going to be a easy no nonsense birth control option for me but it has turned out to be a very scary nightmare.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have noticed some behavioral changes in my mood; slight depression, anxiety, nervousness, and just down right edgy and moody. This usually occurs a few weeks before my mentrual period. Mentrual cycles are weak, lasts for about a weeks time with slight bleeding, which will occur off and on. Acne break outs are common for me now. Cramping, along with sharp pains are a normal occurance for me.

column2: jenniferph24, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IUD put in about 18 months ago. The insertion was not that bad. I had one very bad cramp and a small amount of the "brownish red goop" almost like a dark red period for a day or two. I got a light period for about three months then I no longer got it. I tried Depo-Prevera before that and you aren't supposed to get your period on that but I got mine EVERYDAY (no exaggerating) that I was on the shot. My doctor and I did not talk a lot about the side effect of the IUD. After about a three month I started to get a very sharp pain in my pelvic area and I had the IUD checked a second time for proper placement. It was in place. I had an ultrasound done to check for any cysts or perforations that could have been caused during insertion. Nothing. A few months later I realized my hair was  shedding a little bit more then I used to. And I didn't even realize how moody I became until I looked back at the last few months. I also have not had a child. I did have the Mirena IUD taken out last week because of cronic pelvic pain, I got Bacterial Vaginitis four times (never had it before IUD was put in), and I had lower back pain. (I have to lift a minimum of 50lb required at work.) I no longer have the BV and my lower back pain has subsided. the hair loss has lowered, my sex drive has come back, and my mood swings are gone. Although not having my period in 18 month was nice. I got the IUD taken out and I got my period as normal. ALL BIRTH CONTROL WORKS DIFFERENT FOR DIFFERENT PEOPLE. IT IS A TRIAL AND ERROR ON SIDE EFFECTS. TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR IF THEY GET TO BE UNBEARADLE. IT COULD MEAN SOMETHING IS VERY WRONG.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Immediately after the doctor inserted the IUD I started experiencing severe abdominal pain. Fainted in the office as a reaction to the pain. At home the first day I was taking Vicodin every 4 hours without any effect on the pain (and I never take more than one Vicodin for anything!). Doctor sent me to the ER to make sure the IUD was placed correctly and it was. They gave me Dilaudid injection (morphine) and the pain stopped for 24 hours. Returned the following day with same intensity - I could not walk, had to scoot on my butt to get myself to the bathroom. After two more days of this, I had the Mirena removed at the ER and it's been two days now and the pain is much better, only minor irritation persists. The doctor said that this was a fairly unusual reaction, but I guess it can happen. Horrible experience and I really needed this thing to work because my endocrinologist needed me off the Depo-Provera which I had been using for the past 11 years without a problem.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena in for 1 week now. Had some mild cramping for a couple of days...no bleeding. So far only side effect has been mild nausea..lasted 2 days. And occaisional headaches.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The Update on this Post:(I have never had any children or been pregnant. I have complications with all birth controls. Either they make me EVIL, Nuvo ring gave me the worst yeast infection in my life, Etc. I decided to get the Merina put in. After reading everyones comments, and replaying them through my head I almost walked out of the doctors office. I had taken 3 Ibuprofen and a very small dose of flexeral an hour before my appointment. I had also just got off my period the day before. It took about 5 minutes to put it in. There was about 3 bad cramps during insertion. I wouldnt say it didnt hurt at all, but YES it was somewhat painful. Although I dont think it was untolerable pain. I have had some steady cramping, and little spotting since yesterday. It has now been 36 hours since I had the Merina inserted! I am still having some bleeding, but no cramps or side effects at this time. I have not tried to have sex yet, but I will keep you all updated! It has been 3 days now, and I have no side effects other than some bleeding. I had sex last night and he did not even notice, and I had no pain from it. It took me a while to find the string but I finally found it. It's kind of like a wire almost, so if it did poke your man I could see it bothering him. Other than that all is great!)UPDATE: It has now been a week. I am still having a period, slight cramping(like period cramps), and a little lower back pain. This is all completely normal. I was informed of these regualar side effects before I got it! I was told these symptoms will end between 3-6 months. I am still more than happy with my choice!

column2: Teena, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I didn't read these reviews before I got Mirena placed (May 09) and thankfully I didn't! Mirena was suggested to me as an alternative aid for my PCOS. Since having Mirena, my cysts have decreased dramatically, and my periods are non-existant. I will admit, the insertion was quite painful (had to go back a 2nd time b/c my cervix wouldn't accept it) but I have had no children. The first month I spotted a ton, and honestly had second thoughts about the product. I am now in my 6th month with Mirena, and really loving the experience. My boyfriend and I have spontaneity, and security that we are protected. I do check every 3 weeks or so for the strings, which is recommended. The price was hefty (insurance didn't cover it) but well worth it because I will be saving roughly $3600 for the five years ($75/month for BC). I have learned from reading these forums that not every medicine works for everyone, but if you suffered from heavy periods, cramping, or even PCOS, or just aren't good at taking pills on time, I'd recommend Mirena for at least a try. 6 months later I have NO periods, occasional spotting, and NO loss of sex drive. I haven't noticed hair loss, or severe pain. The two things I have noticed were increased acne (still not bad) which could be attributed to the fact the medicine is released right into your uterus and isn't getting absorbed throughout the body like BC. Also, I have experienced a weight gain, but I do not lead an excessively healthy lifestyle, so that may be due to my own accord. In summary, I say give it a shot. Talk to your DR first and keep an open mind. These forums are scary, and I wanted to go up for bat for the good that Mirena has done. I'm planning on getting another!

column2: momof3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Had Mirena inserted after my 3rd child at age 40.  LOVE IT!  No periods or just spotting occasionally.  No weight gain. During my 4th year on it, however, started to get light periods every two weeks and progressing to spotting or streaking almost every day.  Dr. & I chaled it up to peri-menopause.  Also experiencing all the other peri-menopausal sympotoms.  God's cruel joke!...Here we go!  Just had Mirena switched out for another one three days ago.  Today cramping and heavy bleeding which is normal, I think.  Hope to get my hormones in check again without having to go on estrogen.

column2: truly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have never had any children or been pregnant. I have complications with all birth controls. Either they make me EVIL, Nuvo ring gave me the worst yeast infection in my life, Etc. I decided to get the Merina put in. After reading everyones comments, and replaying them through my head I almost walked out of the doctors office. I had taken 3 Ibuprofen and a very small dose of flexeral an hour before my appointment. I had also just got off my period the day before. It took about 5 minutes to put it in. There was about 3 bad cramps during insertion. I wouldnt say it didnt hurt at all, but YES it was somewhat painful. Although I dont think it was untolerable pain. I have had some steady cramping, and little spotting since yesterday. It has now been 36 hours since I had the Merina inserted! I am still having some bleeding, but no cramps or side effects at this time. I have not tried to have sex yet, but I will keep you all updated!It has been 3 days now, and I have no side effects other than some bleeding. I had sex last night and he did not even notice, and I had no pain from it. It took me a while to find the string but I finally found it. It's kind of like a wire almost, so if it did poke your man I could see it bothering him. Other than that all is great!

column2: glowwings, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had the Mirena inserted yesterday. I do not know how it will go from here. But I thought I would write about the insertion. Yes, it was painful...it felt like someone sticking a hot poker into my cervix. But it went away fairly quickly. I have had some cramping overnight and this morning. No bleeding so far. They insert Mirena while you are on your period..because the cervix is open at that time and it reduces the pain. I will give it a few weeks and write about any side effects that I have.

column2: boysx3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is my 2nd IUD. I had the 1st for 3 yrs with little side effects. I've had this one in for 3 yrs and am getting it out. I'm moody, gaining weight, migraines, chest pains, dizzy, etc. I had my doctor check everything else before it dawned on me to check the side effects of the IUD...they are ALL effects of Mirena! It will be out tomorrow and we will use condoms!

column2: Jackie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
