column9: I had my tubes tied and started heavy periods. This was recommended because I would either have a lite period or none at all. I thought I would die when the first one was placed. The Dr. had no idea what she was doing and had to keep reading the directions. It fell out 4 weeks later. 2nd one put in a year ago. Not too bad at first but my periods went from heavy for 4 days to lite for 10. It got worse and worse. A lot of pain and periods would last between 20 & 25 days. I became very weak and could barely go to work. I had it removed 13 days ago and still bleeding. My Dr. said it is my body trying to regulate itself. The first 2 days I could not leave the house it was so bad! This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. I would never recommend this to anyone.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Although the convenience of the Mirena is great!! It is very low maintenance, however I am having a lot of trouble sleeping at night. This is starting to take it toll on me. Also, I have bad cramping two weeks before my cycle and bad headaches 2 days before my cycle. Other than that it is a Great birth control method!

column2: Mrs.Escobar, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The first year and half I suffered prolonged bleeding during menstration, which made me feel week and anemic.As I got used to it,I had debilitating cramps in my lower back, as if I had a muscle spasm in my lower back during PMS. Periods are lighter and shorter but still exist. I don't mind having periods however because it is a normal and necessary process. At 2 yrs later, I don't have all the same side effects, and I'm just now feeling somewhat normal.

column2: kate, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 23 and it hurt me badly when they put it in but they said it was because I've never had children. Other than that I have cramps all the time no period at all now the first month I had it I had a period for a month straight. I also went from 110lbs to 150lbs sense I have been on this which has been a year.  I do plan on taking it out this week and finding something else that works for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well I wont lie, it really hurt getting it put in. BUT. I had a c-section with my daughter. Also, I had displasia last year and i had a leep done, so my cervix had alot of scar tissue. Otherwise, I don't think i would have been in so much pain. I had cramping for the first 2 days, nothing worse then period cramps though. I had some bleeding the first week, but it was really just spotting here and there. there was maybe 1 day it went like a light period, but the rest was spotting. Otherwise, I don't notice it and it hasn't made me feel weird or anything.

column2: BBinez, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'm in my early fifties and probably going through menopause, or right before menopause. So, my hormones are already out of wack, and the Mirena releases a synthetic progesterone. I became emotionally unstable, had migraines frequently, and had two periods a month for two years. My doctor kept telling me it wasn't the Mirena, so I went to another gynecologist. He suggested I take it out, and he found a cyst on my ovary when using the ultrasound to see where the Mirena was so he could remove it safely. I did not have a pleasant experience with it, and I don't think everybody has the same experience. My thoughts are that it shouldn't be used on women over age 45 and either pre-menpausal, or in menopause. I felt like a different person on it, and am beginning to feel like me again.

column2: JaylaBell, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for a year now. When I had the Mirena put in, I was totally shocked at how painless it really was. I have had very light spotting, no real periods. I haven't gained any weight. I am not sure though if a side effect can happen a year later, but I have very thick hair, and lose quite a bit of it every day, but in the last couple weeks the amount of hair I am losing is starting to scare me. I've read about 10 or so reviews and I haven't seen anyone having hair loss yet. But it is a side effect, and Mirena is the only drug that I am on so....I am kind of worried!

column2: michelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Did not get pregnant.  Lost sex drive.  Had no period.  Depression.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm sure that this may have been a decent birth control, but 2 weeks after use, I noticed an itchy rash develop on my breast, along with significant breast tenderness.  Pregnancy test was negative. These symptoms lasted 2 weeks whereby it then spread to other areas of my torso, inner knees and elbows.  At the 5 week point of Mirena being inserted, I couldn't stand the rash/itching any longer.  Nothing else in my life had changed, and although providers were leaning towards an allergan, I thought it had to be this Mirena.  So I had it removed.  It has now been a week and I am still itching and waiting for a derm appt.  I would appreciate hearing more testimonials of those who have had the itching. If it is just dermatitis, then this is a real coincidence I feel.  I also recall having leg itching with the birth control pill, so am wondering if I am having a reaction to hormones, even low grade. I hope that my problems subside with in the next few days.  I would love to hear more from those with these problems instead, rather than the insertion cramps...mine of which only lasted 1 minute.I just may have wasted a lot of money getting it removed. Hope I did the right thing.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Insertion was painless for me. Periods weren't any worse than normal, and lessened to spotting every three to four months. However, It has been five months and I haven't had a period (got tested by the doctor, not pregnant), and a year ago my sex drive completely died. I did not know this was a side effect. However I had the IUC in for 3 years before this came to be. I am not sure removing it is the best option and will discussing my options and pros and cons with my doctor.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Im happy im just lossing my hair.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in 6 weeks after I gave birth to my first baby. I was actually surprised when I had it put in because I thought it would hurt a lot more than it did, but really it was like a mild cramp for me. I had a little cramping for the rest of the day, but not after that. The only thing that upsets me about Mirena is the fact that I have had my period for the past month now and that my husband can feel the string. Otherwise I'm pretty satisfied with this product.

column2: gagirl125, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried every birth control before i tried Mirena. I would be sick for 2 to 3 weeks out off the month so my MD thought i should try Mirena. Putting it in was very painful and they ended up giving me a low dose of pain medicine after they inserted the IUD.About 2 weeks after I had it in place I became very ill. I had a VERY hard time breathing and it was extermely painful. I had a rash on my back and legs and ended up missing 2 weeks of school. I went to the doctor and told them i thought i was having an allergic reaction and they sent me home saying i had a severe chest cold.I later went to the ER and they told me the same thing. When i went to my MD the following day she told me that I WAS having a reaction to it and promptly removed it. Taking it out hurt but wasn't as bad.I'm not trying to scare anyone with my post but I just want people to be aware of what can happen. 5 years sounds great, just make sure you do your research before you try this method. I wish I would have!

column2: mom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My Dr. gave me a mirena because I had thyroid cancer and needed to stop my heavy bleeding from my periods.  It did hurt at insertion and I have so many side effects.  At first I bled for 6 months straight.  One day I got out of my car and had blood running down my leg and clots like a miscarrage.  She was not concerned and told me my body was "adapting". Over the years I have had terrible acne, my hair falls out in the shower every day, and I am moodier, have sweats, and have gained weight.  I never knew the extent of the problem until I read these reviews.  Now, it is time to remove it am I am finding nothing to replace it.  Ablation is an option but then you still need birth control.  When will these manufactures get this right?  Why are the women the guinea pigs.  I don't think I would choose this option especially since I didn't choose it the first time around.

column2: Boysmama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted 6 months ago and four months after the birth of my second child. I'm only 30 and still not sure if I want to have more children. The insertion was very painful for me, which suprised me because I was not expecting this at all. After it was inserted and I stood up to get dressed, I almost passed out. After about 10 minutes and apple juice, the feeling subsided. I really think it's a good idea to bring someone with you in case this may happen. Since the insertion, I have very light spotting. I have to wear a pantyliner all the time. I also noticed a slight crampy feeling that seems to never go away. I'm not sure if this has anything to do with the IUD or if it's just the fact that I'm highly sensitive to any discomfort in my gyn. area. Overall, I am happy with the Mirena - other than the constant bleeding factor. I haven't noticed any weight gain (but I breastfeed), no acne, no moodiness, and my sex drive is fine. Yay for the mirena!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I read all kinds of reviews right before I got my Mirena, and I was terrified! I just wanted to let people know that, for me, the insertion was easy! A little crampy, but I've had worse period cramps. I went right back to work and was a little crampy the rest of the day, but I took a couple Tylenol and was fine. So far I've had a couple of days very light spotting, but again, no big deal. I'm head over heels for this product!! I have had no issues and would recommend it to anyone looking for easy BC.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I got my mirena to help with my heavy periods and endometriosis.  I love it!  After the first few months of spotting off and on my period disappeared.  I love not having a cycle.  It has really changed my life!

column2: Emily, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena IUD for a year and 4 months and had it taken out because I had horrible side effects. I thought something was seriously wrong with me because I was sick all the time, I had cold sweats, shivers, acne, headaches, dizziness, vomiting, anxiety,diarrhea, moodiness and junk food cravings all the time. I thought I was just crazy until I read other reviews on many sites. I thought I was pregnant all the time because of the nausea and breast tenderness and breakouts and no periods. It's just too dangerous and not worth it.

column2: lucygreen64, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I havent gotten pregnant, but I have had really bad headaches, no period in two months, tried all the time, achey, moody, and weight gain is horrible, along with the possibility of a false negative.

column2: sexymilf, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First of all, Anyone considering Mirena should take in the consideration that the majority of reviews up here are going to be negative and that is not how all Mirena users feel; I am 5'11, 130 pounds and  I was scared to get Mirena but it did not hurt during insertion BUT everybody is different, i had a baby 8 months ago with no pain medicine so.... I knew i could handle it. But back to the Review, i had no cramping after insertion, i did not even feel it in there, I am still having a brownish discharge but so far so good.To the women complaining of Weight Gain: How long did it take you to realize that you were gaining weight? I check my weight once a week and if i notice a 5 pound weight gain the IUD is coming out!!! I asked my doc about that and she told me some people just cant keep food out of her mouth :) but so far so good for me

column2: me_me64151, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had my first child in April 2009. My doctor and I decided to go with Mirena because I dislike having to remember to take a pill everyday. I got Mirena inserted in the end of June. My doctor gave me a pill to take 5-6 hours before going into my appointment that thinned out my cervix and made insertion unpainful. I was talking to my doctor and the nurse and my doctor stood up and said it was inserted. I didn't even feel it go in due to that pill she had me take. It was on a Friday that I had my appointment and that evening I went camping for the weekend. Went boat riding, fishing and swimming. Did not have any problems. It has been almost 3 months now and the only thing I'm not liking is my body getting used to it so the period goes away. I bleed for 2 weeks then stop for a week then bleed for 2 weeks. Everything I have read tells me that once I get past the 6th month it should go almost away. I would recommend this to anyone that doesn't want to take the pill everyday but make sure to ask for the pill to thin your cervix.

column2: rgrolivia@verizon.net, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena since the birth of my second child. I had it inserted 12/08. And I do love it. My periods have gotten lighter, and I don't have cramps anymore. I have noticed that my weight has gone up, up, up. I've gained close to 30-35lbs. I called my doc that inserted it, and said that weight gain is not a side effect. Well...IT IS!! 90% of the reviews that I have read people complain of weight gain. I hope I can keep this in, because I love barely getting a period. But we are totally done with having children, so I'm weighing out my options.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena placed after the birth of my 2nd baby.  About a year and a half later I was going to get the Essure.  When the OB/GYN went to remove the Mirena he said it wasn't there and it may have fallen out but they were goin to do an x-ray to see if it was in my abdomen.  It was.  It had gone through my uterus and into my abdomen.  i had to have surgery to remove it and it was very costly and Mirena would not cover any of my expenses.  Would NOT recommend!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on the Mirena Device for 4 years now. Although I love the effectiveness and the stop of my period on this IUD, the pluses are now being out weighed by the minuses of this product.In the 4 years I've been on it I immediately started getting side effects that I did not think at the time were Mirena related. I had bleeding / heavy discharge for 4 to 6 months after installation, rash & flush on my face that I thought were symptoms of menopause (even though I was only early 40's), I've had joint pain for the past 3 years and now I'm just about at 50% hairloss. My hair falls out in clumps and is so thin I almost look bald in the bright sunlight. Now I've finally decided to have it removed while I still have some hair left.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena for 3 years now.  It was a little ache bring inserted but nothing compared to childbirth.  No side effects, just my usual once monthly outbreak of acne.  I would recommend it to eveybody.  I now have 4 girlfriends that have the Mirena as well.  Sometimes I go 5 months without a period and when I do have a period, it is so light that I wear a pantyliner (or tampon, just for comfort of not wearing a pantyliner.)

column2: KelCut, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm 37 yr old mom of a 19 yr old. Got Mirena Feb 09 due to bp and dr. thought it was because of pill, had extreme cramping to the point of Good Lord what did I do? Was that because of c-section and not vaginal birth? I've gained approx 20lbs, have itching sometimes, oily skin, tired alot but may be because of bp meds. Really hate the weight gain and bloating. Seems to all be in the stomach area and look awful. I am researching other methods of bc because I hate this. Weight seems to be going no where except up, despite decrease of calories and increase of exercise. No period is nice but who wants to go to the pool/beach when you're bloated/pudgy like this?

column2: Wendy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in now for a month.  I read the reviews and they all scared me.  Let me say up front:  It hurts getting it put in.  If you go in knowing that it will still hurt - but it won't seem so bad.  Think, labor pains.  The first day really sucked... cramping and just a general discomfort.  But by day 2 things started getting better.  I had no bleeding the entire first week, then BAM! Bled for 2 weeks straight then it stopped.  I am a migrane sufferer and have not noticed any increase in headaches.  No changes in my mood or appatite.  I went back for my 4 week follow up and everything looks good.  I am very excited about not having to deal with Birth Control for the next 5 years.  Although I still some nights wake with a start that I didn't take my pill then think, "oh yeah!"  My best advice to anyone thinking about this is just to go into it knowing its going to hurt.  Don't believe anyone who tells you "its just unpleasent".  Um, no - it is painful!  But the procedure only last maybe 3 minutes.  If you have had a child, you will remember the pain, it really does feel like labor, but its over quick.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love not having a period.  But, I'm now experiencing side effects over a year after having it put in!  I'm getting really bad acne and my hair is falling out by the fistful (but I have a ton of hair to spare).  I'm seriously debating getting it taken out, but this is seriously how much I hate my period.  I'm just confused how side effects will just show up a year later...Just make sure you do your research and ask your doc a lot of questions, they'll tell you everything you need to know.  A lot of these reviews sound like they didn't do any research.

column2: nrapp19, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a person who gets every side effect from birth control.  I seemingly had none until about 6 months ago.  I have roseaca & the past 6 months my skin has become uncontrollable.  No medication or light treatment is working & my flare ups are ever present.  I am trying to find out if my birth control has anything to do with it.  I also am getting bruises on my legs out of nowhere!  My life style hasn't changed, nor my eating habits.  Otherwise it's been a great birth control, and if it's not the cause of my flare ups...it's the perfect birth control.

column2: tt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: When I first got Mirena just over a year ago I bled like crazy, I mean GUSHING for a month straight. I almost had it removed, then it stopped. My periods progressively got lighter and shorter and now I haven't had a period for the last 2 months. I had really heavy periods prior to Mirena so it's been nice. It hurt pretty bad getting it inserted, almost like labor pains but much much shorter. I have worried that I might be pregnant just because I haven't had my period, but I'm not. It's nice not to have to take a pill everyday and I can't feel it at all. I still have other monthly symptoms like water weight gain and sore breasts, I guess that was my period. I personally am really glad I got it. I'm happy I stuck it out that first month, as miserable as that was...it was worth it!

column2: marcy1630, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well I just got the Mirena put in about 2 1/2 Months ago. For some reason though I feel like it makes me really dizzy, and sometimes I see bugs that are not there... I know you all prob think that I am crazy but I am serious!Has this happened to anyone else? Also it is hard to describe but all in all my body just feels weird?

column2: Concerned/Relieved Dad,  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: My daughter suddenly became an emotional wreck and feeling stressed. Oddly, she couldn't really articulate what she was causing her to feel stressed out. Then, she began experiencing involuntary muscle movements, first in one arm, then one leg and then all 4 extremeities. Her hands would clench and she reported feeling pain when it ocurred. The involuntary movements intensified over a 3 or 4 month period. Doctors and specialist tested her for Hutchison's disease, lupus and other conditions. She was placed on medication to prevent siezures. They even thought she had onset of epilepsy.  The siezures became more frequent and lasted longer over time. She went on disability from her job and was unable to drive for fear of an episode with her children in the car. She finally decided to have the device removed and miracle of all miracles...every single one of her problems stopped! Her neurologist to this day cannot offer an explanation as to what happened to her.  A reasonable person can only conclude the chemicals or hormones emitted by that device severely impacted her well being and ability to carry on everyday activities. It's been several months since removing the device and she STILL has not had a single episode of involuntary muscle movements and emotionally she is back to being herself.  I am posting this because I think others should know. I have urged her to report her experience to FDA.  Good luck to those of you that are using this device. I hope your experience is better than my daughters.

column2: eryberry6mile@aol.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: gaining a good bit of weight, not too happy ab that!!!!

column2: LAL23, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It's been over a month since I've had the Mirena and I do love the fact that I don't have to worry about getting pregnant! yay! I already had one unplanned pregnancy and we are definitely not ready for another little one. My list of pros vs. cons-No pill to take every day-No weight gain-No hormonal changes -No changes to my libido-No worries! Cons-was spotting/bleeding for 3 weeks straight after getting it put in.-My boyfriend could feel the strings sometimes. He says it hurts his sensitive area. lol-I'm tired more often (well i do have a six month old now...so that might contribute)-I have more minor headaches than normal.-Minor backaches (But i also was in an minor accident 9 days after I gave birth to my son.  My back has been aching since then so having the iud probably haven't changed that at all.Well all in all, probably the best decision we've made for birth control.

column2: Leslie, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i had many problems with other birth controls this one has been the best i recomend it to any one.

column2: DON'T DO IT!!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: On 7/20/09 a dr placed the Mirena IUD in me. Almost immediately my stomach started cramping. I could barely stand straight up to walk. I've been bleeding every day since. Somedays my stomach hurts and other days my legs hurt. My feet tingle and yesterday I noticed 2 acne bumps on my face. I was in good health before I got this IUD. I went to the dr on 7/31/09 to let him know that I was in pain. He told me to take Aleve & that pain was normal for the 1st couple of weeks. I'm having the IUD taken out on 8/31/09. I know everybody's body is different but nothing is worth torture. Just think about it. What woman wants to be on her cycle for months at a time?THE ANSWER IS NOBODY!!!

column2: Dee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I love it, been on it for three years. Just a little fearful, when I get my next one because of the cramping I had during the first one (only a few days) but well worth it; no periods, copays for pill, pads, tampoons, etc....see you again mirena in two years.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Although Mirena has been an excellent birth control method I have lost interest in sex and started taking anti-depressants.  I have had the Mirena for almost 2 years and I haven't had a period since its insertion.

column2: jenna6, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 41 years old, a mom of a teenager (who was delivered via c-section), have this IUD for 17 months and absolutely love it! I haven't had a period since! Over 2 years without taking a hormone pill or using a tampon (or pad) is AWESOME!! I used to get terrible headaches, breast tenderness, and acne on the pill - NO MORE!!!  My only regret is not getting the Mirena sooner!

column2: SarahJones, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm guessing side effects are different for everyone.  I've been on Mirena for 7 months.  I swear I've had every side effect possible!  I've gotten acne...and can't get it under control.  I've gained weight...went from 125 to 135...maybe not a lot to most people, but I can't stand it.  It did hurt when they put it in, but I got over it.  I had spotting for about the first 4 months.  I keep getting vaginosis...that nasty fish smell.  Going through a urinary tract infection as I'm writing this.  My body feels out of my control right now.  If Mirena wasn't so expensive, I'd have it taken out and get my husband snipped!  Trust me...I'm almost at that point!  Hope others have better luck than me.

column2: Confused, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had Mirena for a year and a half and did so at the advice of a friend. Like most of you, I wasn't aware of all of the side affects. The benefits are that I have slight bleeding each month, but so far, haven't gotten pregnant. However, I have gained 10 pounds, have slight acne, mood swings, and occasional cramping. I didn't know this had anything to do with Mirena until I read the reviews. I might also consider removing it, but I love not having to buy condoms. My husband could feel it at first, but hasn't mentioned anything so far. My sex drive is the same as normal (high). But I would LOVE to try to lose the weight. Unfortunately, I haven't even after dieting and exercising.

column2: nola, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The first 2-3 months with Mirena were fine.I got it a month after having my daughter who is now 10 months. I had no problems at first. Then, I completely stopped my period, got acne that I cannot get to go away, and gained 20 pounds. I work on my feet all day, took a boot camp, and still cannot get the weight off. I called my doctor today to get it removed. It is very convenient, but its just not worth it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had my IUD for about 3 months now.  I am 23 and have never had a baby to the dr wasn't sure it would work for me.  Since i've never had a baby, the pain of insertion was terrible.  It felt like the worst cramps of my life and felt like i would faint.  If you can bring a driver to take you home after that may be smart.  I was in terrible pain the first day and couldn't really sit, stand, or lay down with out pain. I took pain medication and was fianlly able to fall asleep.  After that first day everything was fine.  I had mild cramps and spotting for a week.  Everything is fine now and it was worth the pain in the end.

column2: BABYDOLL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have tried several different birth control pills and when i found out about this method i was a little worried because it seemed so fool proof and too perfect. My girlfriend had hers inserted about 2 years ago and she absolutely loved it and had no periods. I on the other hand had got mine insereted october of last year. yes at first there was a little cramping but nothing tylenol could not help out with. and for the first few months i had a period of about 2 to 4 days now i am lucky if it lasts 1 day. this was the best decision i have ever made. i dont have to stress anymore trying to figure out if i took my pill in the morning before work anymore because now i can just forget about it. some people may say its not worth it but i have never had mood swings while on it and i have actually lost weight. there was no change in acne and my boyfriend actually loved it because we had sex more days out of the month. it was a win win situation for both of us and the pros and cons actually benefited in our favor.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Here's my story.. all were so helpful and it's easy to see every women is different.  I was so worried!!  Cancelled my appt. for 10mths straight.. finally did it and it didn't hurt at all, I've had just light bleeding and spotting.  Normally I have a heavy period.. this is fantastic!  I also have fibroids which my doc. said would help keep them small as well as prevent pregnancy.  I'm so happy I went with this form of bc and I was in and out of the doc's ofc. in just a few minutes!  I wished it worked for every woman like it does me..  good luck to everyone that trys it!

column2: LuMac, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The side effects have been minimal, i don't have to worry about getting pregnant. I LOVE IT!!!!!

column2: mamafitzy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted 8/08 a few months after having my 2nd child. My dr had me come in during my period to have the Mirena inserted because the cervix is more open so it is not as uncomfortable. I did feel some cramping. I bled for a couple weeks after, but it was a lighter flow.  I went back after a couple of weeks and had the strings trimmed - my other half was being poked by them. Since then my periods went to just using a liner for a day or two and now nonexistient. That makes me nervous, paranoid i might still get pregnant. I have had weight gain, but close to 10 lbs.  I have no issues with my sex drive, it is high. Also no acne issues. I guess my biggest issue is the total lack of period making me think i might be pregnant. Other than that, I think its' great!  Total carefree birth control.

column2: heather, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have had CONSTANT bleeding since the day i had it put in, back on May 7, 2009.  One of the greatest perks for getting it was no period, man did i get a lemon! My acne is horrible. EXTREME mood swings. Husband hates it. NO sex drive. I seem depressed and constantly stressed. I have no hide left on the insides of my legs because of pads. Tampons hurt horribly. If you are contemplating it, I suggested not doing it. I agree that just because we don't want anymore children, that we shouldn't kill ourselves in the process. If you don't want to get pregnant, get this and you won't even have sex.  I have 2 wonderful children and if God sees fit for me to have more, then it is truly meant to be. I will be having it removed next week and my husband has been fixed. (Which i do completely suggest;)

column2: jordan's girl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have had all kinds of problems since i got my iud at first i didn't think it was caused by my iud but as time goes on i really do feel that maybe it is my iud

column2: tavia, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Don't get me wrong, this birth control provides excellent protection against pregnancy. However, for me personally,the side effects suck royally. I have never had problems with vaginal infections until I got mirena.I've had it for four years and have had yeast and bv infections the entire four years. My sex drive went out the door, and since my periods were very irregular, I often felt extremely bloated, fatigued and depressed.I appear to look three months pregnant due to the lack of my menstral flow. As I said before, the birth control is excellent,but if your a woman who has adverse reactions to hormones,consider getting a paraguard iud, which is free of hormones and just as effective. Also, if something doesn't feel right to you but your doctor says otherwise, go with your own instinct.My doctor swore up and down for years that the iud was not the cause of my incessant infections until they realized all the medications were not helping.Trust your own instincts.Doctors make human error in judgement just like the rest of us.I neverimagined in my wildest dreams that I would go through so much trouble tonot get pregnant. Although the side effects are saidto be minimal,you never know how it will effect you personally.

column2: ASballgal, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on the Mirena since Feb 09 and have hated every step of the journey. I have had problems with other birth control pill/ring because of the hormone dosage. My doctor recommended this and it sounded great.  I have had irregular bleeding, COMPLETE loss of sex drive, hair loss, constant cramping, weight gain. I have real bad acne on my jawline that won't go away and I have tried every cleansing product to get rid of it. This may work well for some and not for some. This has been the worst birth control that I have been on. Personally I liked the Nuvaring better. I can't wait to get this thing removed in a couple of weeks.

column2: Tara, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just recently had my IUD placed in June 2009. I am 38 years old and did not want to go through with a tubal ligation. So far besides the placement being uncomfortable, it has been great. I have noticed some side effects from reading the other reviews that I really did not know about. I hope that I will be able to keep it for the next four years. The worst of the side effects now is the bleeding. My last menustral cycle lasted almost three weeks. Bleeding on and off daily. Hopefully this will subside. But so far no major problems.

column2: Bree4459, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'v had Mirena for 4 years now.  I have two small kids and I just turned 30.  After my second child was born my OB suggested Mirena (she also has it).  It was uncomfortable having it put in (I wont lie) but overall its a great birth control.  I haven't had any bad effects. My husband does say he can feel it.  My doctor told me that she can shorten the "string" and this should make it more comfortable during intercourse.  I however, feel great.  I do have some spotting throughout the month so somtimes i'll wear a tampon if i have white pants on (just in case) otherthan that i can't think of any reasons that are negative.  I was supprised to read everyone elses experiences with the birthcontrol.  I have several friends and family that use Mirena and they all LOVE it.  Hope This Review Helps!! (ps i'll be replacing my old with a new in the next 10 months)

column2: littlemamma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD put in in March of 08.  I just had it removed because of blot clots, headaches and increased acne. It has also caused several ovarian cysts.   The acne was the worst I have ever had.  When having it removed, it was extremely painful. Worse than a contraction when you are in labor. I would not recomend this unless you plan on using it for the five full years.

column2: delainegirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i had a mirena for a year and a half and didnt realise all the symptoms i had related to it or i would have had it out sooner. I gained 10 kilos had severe acne, depression, severe mood swings, no sex drive, constant nausea, bloating in the abdomen that led people to ask if i was three months pregnant, painful breats and cramping the symptoms got worse as my periods became lighter and lighter when i had it removed i bled as if id just had a baby but suddenly all these symptoms just stopped this was two weeks ago and im already losing weight before i would go to the gym four times a week and not shift a gram! beware girls mirena is not for everyone and although i didnt get pregnant on it it made my life a living hell and reduced my self esteem to zilch.

column2: kim, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i got mine 03/2006. dont recall any pain, periods basically stopped. i lost interest in sex, but i thought it was the stress of being a new mom. i had no idea all these symptoms i've been experiencing for so long could be related to my iud. my dr recommended it because i'm not good at taking pills, i was already overweight so he didn't want me to get the depo shot. but since then i've had almost no interest in sex, i've gained approx. 30 lbs, my face has become severely red, i get headaches & migraines several times/ wk, trouble sleeping, moody, anxiety, the list goes on. i had no idea all these things could be side affects from my birth control, my dr said the only symptoms were cramping & irregular periods. i have a physical with a new dr in 3 weeks, i am definitely going to talk to him about removing it.

column2: jenl168, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my Mirena in for 2 years now and am getting it removed on Tuesday because I am TTc #2. I was nervous about the removal so I decided to google and found out about all the side effects (That I had NO idea about). This explains A LOT about what is going on with me. I LOVE that I don't get a period! After insertion I had mild cramping and spotting and have not had a period since. (Inserted 6 wks post partum.)  In the two years that I have had it in I have taken 6 pregnancy tests-I constantly experience pregnancy symptoms.I also had my thyroid tested and tons of bloodwork done. Prior to getting it I was breastfeeding and shedding the baby weight. Right after I stopped the weight loss completely and gained about 30 pounds. I am constantly on a diet and exercise plan and get little results. I am constantly tired, get severe migraines, my skin itches, I have horrible acne, NO sex drive at ALL, mood swings and depression,tender breasts, my uterus always feels like I am three months preggo. I could go on. I lived with all these things simply because I hate taking the pill, refuse to get the shot and I like not getting a period. Hopefully it comes out ok and I wont be going back to it.

column2: Jenny, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Love that it is easy, effortless, love that my periods are no longer present, not worried about getting pregnant anymore because my sex drive in gonzo!!  My husband got poked and he hates it because I don't want to have sex ever!!  I didn't know that this was happening to other women.  I really thought something was wrong with me.  I know it doesn't affect all women this way, but for some it does.  If you are contemplating it, go for it.  It is very expensive even with insurance.  That reason alone makes me not want to get it removed.  It's like throwing $500.00 down the toilet.  But, my relationship is suffering and nothing is worth that!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: mirena is been working just fine for me, but im actually worried bc i barely get my period and i dont know if thats safe n also i get a lot of yeast infections. i think i might get it removed. still thinking about it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ive had this in for 2 months. I am 25, never had children but have history of stroke so cannot use normal bc methods. So far the only side effects ive noticed are the acne, But Im now on Retin-A and that has worked very well. I have no cramps, no period and just some spotting. Overall I am happy and dont experience any cramping, no loss of sex drive and im not getting pregant!!!

column2: loganrea, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: cramping heartburn stomache pains headaches mood swings ovary pain loose stools hot flashes hair loss need I say more

column2: kl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I did not believe the horror stories. Each of us is different but the side effects CAN happen. Try it out, it works great for some people. Just know that you can get it out any time.For 4 months I have had significant hair loss, weight gain and now have PMS after 19yrs of having a period. I get headaches and cramping all within the last 4 months. I am normally a healthy 33 yr old, have had 2 healthy pregnancies and run 2 miles a day. I'd rather take the time to use a condom and retain my sanity and normal way of life. Could it be a coincidence? Maybe......but I am not going to wait it out any longer. Don't want to mess with my body chemistry any more, who knows how it will affect me 15 yrs from now.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I was on a birth control pill before this.  This has been the best thing ever.  No pain, no cramps, no bleeding.... No pill every month!!!!

column2: Suzy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I haven't had kids so it did hurt to have put in.  Some irregular bleeding at first but fine now.  Slightly more cramping for the first 6 months then normal but almost no period now.  I am getting worse acne then normal though lately.

column2: duvalzdiva143@yahoo.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I OFTEN HAVE BLEEDING OUT OF NO WHERE. IS THAT NORMAL? My husband tells me he can feel it and it makes him irritated everytime we have relations. What should I do?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: DO NOT BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS.. They will just freek you out. I read all the reviews before I ever got my mirena. I was still going through with it, regardless, I was just trying to figure out what to expect. IT IS THE MOST AMAZING BIRTH CONTROL. I have had my mirena for over a month now. Yes the day of I had some cramping for a few hours afterwords. Its going to happen, they have just inserted a foreign object. I had very light cramping the next day, no worse than a period. I have not had ANY bleeding, any cramping, or any unusual problems. I feel amazing. Sex is not any different. My partner has not been able to feel it, either. It is amazing. I love it. Love it Love it. I wish I never read any of those bad reviews all it did was stress me out for no reason. They set you down in the room measure your cervix, show you the mirena itself, puts it in a tube like structure to measure how long it should be when inserted, and its a quick pinch and its done. Literally five seconds. My ob handed me the end of the strings to feel to know what they feel like (fishing line).Gave me an antibiotic and i was done. Its not bad at all. And its amazing. Everyone should have Mirena as a birth control.

column2: beccabloom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Inserted 3 months post partum. No pain during insertion. Love the fact this works for five years. However, I cannot loose any weight while on Mirena no matter my efforts. I will most likely get it removed solely for this reason. I have also lost my sex drive completly. So if you want to be huge with no sex this this is the perfect thing for you. Mine is coming out in a couple of weeks and I can't wait. I understand It's not that way for everyone. Everybody is different. This is just me. I will update once it has come out.

column2: AnnieCat, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena inserted 6 weeks postpartum, (it was relatively painless).  It's been in about a year and a half.  I have yet to have my period - which is a concern.  I had the spotting for over a year.  My husband got poked by the strings in the beginning, but it's better now.  But the strings are so short I fear they may have trouble removing it.  I am concerned about not having my period, I think it's a good thing; to have the body cleanse itself of toxins once a month.  As a yogi and a person who considers herself very body aware; i feel like my uterus is getting tougher - thick - bulky.And I am starting to have lower abdominal pain which could be any number of things according to the precautions and side effects of this drug.  And after reading the reviews I too have been having my hair come out in mass amounts.  And I had a horrible unexplained rash/hives like occurance for two days that I found listed in the side effects.  AND I was told this drug only affects the uterus and the hormone is not stored in the cells, but now I find that the hormone could've been passed to my baby when I was breastfeeding - so obviously it travels around the body.This thing in my body concerns me.

column2: Jula, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had the mirena for five months now and so far so good.  I haven't gotten pregnant, which is a huge plus since that's the point right.  As for the side effects...well since the mirena was put in my acne has gotten worse.  I only get acne when I'm pregnant and I have very little of it while I'm nursing since hormones are still crazy then.  Anyway, my last daughter 9months when I got it and I was in the process of weaning her.  Everything went fine with her milk since I was already starting to dry up.  I only had a period for the first two months after I got it and they were light.  I've only had very light spotting one or two days once a month since then.  Around the time that I spot I feel a little cramping but nothing major requiring any medicine.  My main concern is the acne.  IDK whether it will eventually go away once I've had the mirena in for a while or if this side effect will stay as long as I have the mirena in.  Oh and I have had a problem with losing weight and I'm always hungry.  That's not a good thing.  Anyway, I've decided to give it another few months, hopefully at least a year to see how things pan out.  If I still have this acne and cant lose weight then I may get it removed.

column2: pfcpremosgirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I can tell you I have stopped having a period, and any spotting I have is light enough for a pantyliner. I LOVE Mirena! I've had it for over a year now, and it is perfect for me and my husband! I cannot recommend it highly enough!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: In the beginning Mirena was awesome. I stopped having my period after a month. The side effects I experienced were cramping on my right side, weight loss, and decreased sexual drive. I once read "It works great as birth control because you have absolutely NO sex drive", I now completely agree with this statement. After using it for a year, I had it removed.

column2: hlane, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I experienced a complete stop to my post-birth weight loss & even gained despite rigorous exercise, headaches that got worse each month, high bloodpressure (I have always had low before Mirena) and it was as if I was always on edge, stressed, anxiety, lost my sex drive and all in all almost lost my relationship... 2 days after the Mirena was removed, all symptoms are gone and I feel better than I have since 9 months ago when I had it inserted...

column2: Alisha, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena now for about 8 months nows and i have been pretty pleased with it. I don;t have to remeber to take a pill everyday which is nice so i guess i just have learned to deal with the side effects of it.. I spot bleed alot and it seems my stomach always hurts.. so i guess its all on what u want for yourself.. I know i don't want no more kids but fearful to get fixed.

column2: Lovely, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had mirena in for over a year and still bleeding,sometimes for over 2wks at a time. I have had acne in the past, but since mirena, the acne has come back and gotten worse. Also, I feel like like I have lost weight,but not a lot  since being on mirena. Oh, did i forget to mention the cramping before my period. I don't know about you, but for me, the weight lost, the acne, and lond periods is enough for me. Making an appt on Monday to have it taken out.

column2: forevermama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Mirena was inserted 6 weeks ago when I was about 2 months post partum.  The insertion was extremely painful for me.  I had a normal vaginal delivery, so it was supposed to be a piece of cake, but no.  Of course I spotted and clotted for a month continuously, had a week of relief and then started a twisted version of a period.  I know all of these things were possible, but was not supposed to be was weight gain.  Today, I stepped on the scale to reveal I had gained 9 lbs!  I lost it!  On the day of insertion, I only had 4 lbs to go until my pre-pregnancy weight.  I am active and watch what I eat, so I was shocked.  The doctor was very upfront, letting me know that if my body had reacted this way so soon, I would likely continue to gain weight.  My Mirena is now sitting in the bottom of a bio-hazard box.  Yes, I could have tried to wait a little longer to see if things would level out, but I was not going to take the chance of gaining another 20 lbs.  I worked too hard to keep from gaining too much weight while I pregnant and to lose it when my son was born.  Everyone reacts differently, most women do not gain weight, just keep an eye on it if you chose Mirena.

column2: Karine, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in about a month ago or more. I have previously been on the shot and that made me bleed for a year straight. After reading comments on here I was worried it would happen again. I bled for a week immediatly after getting it put in, then stopped for a week and now I've been bleeding for 2 weeks. I want to try to stick it out the 3-6 months but I don't want to keep waitng to stop bleeding and go through another year of this. I don't know what to do. Also to the people that just got it put in today please quit writing comments because you are not helping because you really don't know anything about the side effects of the product. Please and thank you!

column2: ABC, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had it inserted a year ago.  I bled lightly for about a month, then I just spotted lightly 2 days a  month, then 8 months after insertion I stopped having any spotting at all.  I've LOST over 15 pounds and feel better than I have in years.  The Mirena did not make me lose weight, diet and exercise did. "Marital relations" are great with no worries. Went for yearly check up last week and doctor says I have a mild bacterial infection - I have no symptoms and feel fine - for which she prescribed Vandazole gel.  Will go for a follow up in 2 weeks.  My only nagging fear is that this bacterial infection is somehow going to adversely affect the Mirena.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena in for almost 5 years and I love it. I stopped having periods completely after the first year. I have had none of the bad side effects other reviewers listed. I have tried most forms of B/C and they all made me nauseous, weight gain, mood swings and headaches. The mirena pinched a little bit going in and I recall being crampy for a few days but since then I don't even know it is there. I will definitely be getting a new one this year.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was surprised by how painful insertion was.  The side effects I experienced included fatigue, severe cramping (to the extent it would wake me up in the middle of the night), and constant spotting.  I developed ovarian cysts for the first time in my life approximately one month after having the IUD inserted.  While I have been unable to find the medical correlation, it is my belief the IUD caused this condition.  I made the decision to have the device removed after three and a half months.  Fortunately, removal was not as painful as insertion.  All symptoms have now ceased.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Mirena for the full 5 yrs and i just love it. I already talked to my doctor about a new one.

column2: nt, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My IUD(mirena)was inserted before my 30th birthday.  I've had it three years...I love the fact I don't have to worry about it but I have gained thirty pounds, really bad back cramps, I can't sleep.  The doctors tried to tell me this isn't a side effect.  Ladies we know our bodies.  I'm having mind removed.  Oh did I mention swelling and itchy skin.  I wouldn't recommed it.

column2: Happy2beMe, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It was not fun having it inserted and did have the cramping and spotting for about a week, but since then, I have been very happy with it. My periods are pretty infrequent and very light compared to what they were before, incapacitating and couldn't leave the fetal position the first 3 days. After the 5 years is over, or after baby #2, what ever comes first, I will definetly do it again, the pain was worth it.

column2: I hate Mirena, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 38 and was advised to go on Mirena almost 2 years ago due to my extremely heavy and painful periods and uterine fibroids.  At first my body went through several months of adjustment (spotting, gross discharge), then finally leveled off with no more periods.  I thought all was going to go well from then on until about a year into it.. I slowly started to get side effects that have just increased as time has gone on (edema/water retention, fat gain on the hips and waist, headaches, low back pain, dizziness, foggy-headed, sleepiness, no energy, greasy acne/huge festering pimples that won't go away, rage/severe mood swings, depression, chills, sweats, worse allergies than normal, extra clumsiness/poor motor skills, insomnia, confusion, poor memory, lack of concentration, muscle mass loss - even though I still exercise, dry brittle hair and hair loss, and anxiety/panic attacks).  As I said, these continue to get worse and worse, and I've had the Mirena for 1 year and 8 months now.  I have an appointment to have it removed in two weeks.  I know I will go back to having extremely bad periods and painful uterine fibroids, but I'd rather have them than this.

column2: transcriber87, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well, I had mine inserted about 2 months ago and at first, I just spotted here and there.  After about a week, I started bleeding and I HAVE NOT STOPPED BLEEDING SINCE! It is a real pain to bleed all these months!  AND I am getting acne, not just on my face but on my back too!  The plus for me is that I have had no cramping with this just the non-stop bleeding and acne.  I decided on this method of BC because I was using the ring before and I wanted to use it again...doc put one in and told me that it could diminish my milk supply (I am BF'ing) well within 12 hours, my milk supply was cut in half almost so I opted for this...I am having second thoughts now, I really don't know what I will do now!

column2: Olivia, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had this inserted in April, and have had hell with it. I have had continuous back pain, stomach cramps which I have been taking paracetamol, codiene and diclofinac for. I have had a one month long period, where it was extremely heavy bleeding, resulting in me having an extremely low iron levels. Today I had to have an urgent ultra sound as my doctor was going to remove it, and couldn't find the strings. The Mirena is still in me, yet the sonographer wouldn't say where. I am now going to have a surgical procedure done to have this removed. I am 15 years old, and had this put in to help with heavy menstruation under a general anaesthetic.

column2: nomoremirena, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had four children--this is the WORST pain ever to have it inserted. The doctor took 2 shots at putting it in--that's after I had the paragard removed at a previous appoint. I had natural childbirth with a high pain tolerance--the insertion of this was horrible. They had to keep me also due to my blood pressure bottoming out (I kept breathing just like instructed). Why in the world does the manufacturer not include a quick dose of numbing med with the package? Many medical procedures do that now, we don't even treat animals without meds. Now that it's been in a month, lots of nausea at weird times, constant feeling "hot" like I have a fever, some bloating (I'm pretty skinny so it's more noticeable). Don't know that I would recommend this for others. My best friend also had one--she'd also had the paragard and she said she would never recommend it, and if when it's time to replace in a few years, she'll have to think long and hard before having another one put in. ditto for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had Mirena for 6 months and I've had cramping and bloating the majority of the time. Also I've gained over 10 pounds since it was put in. It's great not to have to worry about birth control, but the side effects are terrible.

column2: JessicaJJ, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Getting it put in sucks and don't let the doctor tell yah any different..... a little pinch....yeah right!! I am satisfied with it though not pills to remember to take, no menstration to deal with. Occassionally there is some discomfort in my abdomen that usually subsides shortly after.

column2: Niecey, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So i did a post 5/19/2009 and now im back for a update.  Went to my 1st check up 6/5/09 (5/8/09 i had it put in). The dr couldnt find the strings so i had to do the ultrasound and thankfully it was located and "perfectly" in place.  I was told she could redo it or leave it, it will just be harder to take it out later.  Im not going to go though the pain again if its in a good place.  The everyday cramping, back, and leg pain has subsided and the spotting/light flow is pretty much gone unless i have sex.  then i bleed for about a week.  And i have notice some cramping during sex but it does subside.  I still have periods w/ cramps, not as heavy but for a longer time.  and for the 1st month my boobs were so sore i could barely wear a bra.  Never had that happen before.  I went from 3 heavy days before the iud to 5 light flow days after it.  I have started to notice some acne but not a lot and some moodiness.  Cant say anything about the weight gain or the spotty skin being african american, but i will keep an eye out for those.  I really am getting less to complain about im just ready to have sex more often w/out the bleeding, hell  im ready for the bleeding to stop altogether!  I will check back in few months with a update.

column2: Stefanie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is the second Mirena IU I have had, the first one {had for 2 years} fell out after a bladder procedure so I just got a new one yesterday, for me it is extremely painful to have inserted and both times I almost passed out because of the drop in your heart rate whenever your cervix is messed with like that. The insertion is the worst part for me! I have had extremely good results with this product and would highly recommend it, but we are all different and not everyone will have the same results, it took about 3 months after the first one was inserted for my periods to become regular and the spotting to go away but after that my periods were so light, regular and very mild cramps, no problems with weight gain or anxiety but about the same PMS as without the IUD. Overall very satisfied as my periods without an IUD are pretty unbearable, (heavy bleeding, horrible cramps).

column2: gee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well, i could write all day on the side effects that came along with my mirena. It was inserted 1 month ago and since then I have been bleeding and clotting non stop, i am dizzy and moody everyday! My bp has increased, I have palpitations , my sex drive is gone , I have high anxiety...and the list goes on and ! I am having it removed today! I would'nt recommend this to my worst enemy! I am even considering changing my gyn for not informing me of the side effects and making the mirena sound so grand.

column2: NONAME, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I SPOTTED FOR 4 MONTHS AND HAVE GAINED OVER 10 POUNDS BECAUSE OF MIRENA. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND EVEN THOUGH IT IS EFFECTIVE AND EASY TO USE.

column2: kyla, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Mirena was inserted in me last wednesday.  As soon as the doctor inserted it I started having very strong cramps and they got stronger and stronger.  I went into the doctor 5 days later and the could not find the tails, they sent me for a ultra sound and found it in my uterous.  Now I am going in surgery to have it removed, and may cause me far worse problems than that.  Ialways read review and think what are the odds, but it happened to me, I reccomend not risking it.  DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for two years now.  I'm kind of dissatisfied with the results.  I have bad period cramps coupled with lower back pain.  Acne has not been a problem but lately I noticed that I have facial skin discoloration.  Frequently, I experience abdominal pain during sex.  In addition to the painful sex, I have almost NO sex drive.  I'm only 25 years old, I should want to have sex more than I do.  I never experienced weight gain but I do feel like I am moodier than before having the IUD.  The IUD is very easy to use and effective but I am beginning to think the side effects are out weighing the good.

column2: Kat, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am planning on getting IUD. I hate the pill and side effects, mostly I didn't have any sex dive. Did that happen to anyone on IUD?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena since 2/09....up until last night(6/09) i have had nothing but good to say...i love that i do not have to be bothered with bc pills and i don't even feel it in my body...its so care free! but last night i was removing my tampon and after removal i noticed that the strings from my mirena were hangin out....i was scared and nervous and didn't know what to do! i called my doctor and the nurse told me that my strings were probalbly just needing to be cut a little shorter and that my doctor would not be able to see me until Monday (today is Fri)...i asked if it was a problem or emergency that i had to go to the emergency room and have it removed...she said it was a common thing and i could even leave them like so if it didn't bother me...which really shocked me! the weird thing is i have not experienced any pain from this! i plan on going to the doctor Monday to find out if my strings need to be cut shorter or if there is another problem! Has anyone experienced this problem? if so please let me know what your result was!!!

column2: Michelle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena placed around January 08, so it has been over a year now and it is working great.  No pregnancies nor complications.  There was very minor cramping upon placement and throughout that day.  I am very happy with the Mirena and would recommend it for anyone.

column2: hugshelpalways, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in for 2 months. The first week I got really bad cramps I mean I thought I was in labor. I went into the doctor and had an ultra sound, everything was in place correctly. My doctor encouraged me to keep with it and stick it out. He prescribed 800mg motrin which I took right away. and made me feel much better. For the next week I was taking the surgical stegth motrin regularly. then I just didnt need them any more. although I have been spotting daily the pain is not so bad. My doctor says after about 3-4 months the spotting and cramping normaly go away. I love and trust my doctor. and thank him for suggesting mirena.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena in April 2007 after I had my son and I just had it removed today. I felt instant relief when it was removed! I got off to a bad start with the IUD, I bled for 2 months after I had it put in! Then I have had severe--I couldn't move they were so bad-- pains in my abdomen. I went to the ER several times and they found nothing wrong with me and my Mirena was in place. I have basically been in pain for the past 2 years with this IUD.It did prevent pregnancy,it was easy to use (you don't have to do anything) and had no weight gain side effects but the pain (for me) was not worth it anymore! Mirena gets mixed reviews, I'm sure it works awesome for some women, just not this woman =)

column2: Dragonslave7, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD put in last Monday (6/15/09). My doctor did tell me most of the side effects. But I am still cramping and having severe pelvic pain which makes me take 800mg of Motrin every 6hrs to help with it. I am still bleeding heavliy. I have tried the pill before and got pregnant with it, and the shot (Depo) makes me have my period for months at a time, which I can't have because I am already severly anemic. I think my system is just screwed up.

column2: jan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The IUD came out of place after 6 months in. I was having bad lower abdominal pain and did not know what it was. I started suspecting the IUD. I went for a checkup, and they couldn't find it. So, now I have to go for an ultrasound to see where it is. If it is easy to reach, they might take out with forceps, or it could require surgery! I am extremely worried about surgery and fearful that it may have damaged any of my internal organs (hence the horrible pain I  am having). This is absolutely not worth the risk. There are many other good birth control methods out there without this huge risk. I then found out that exactly the same thing happened to my co-worker and heard about more people that I know having complications. So, I think the statistics for this device are not accurate. It seems that it comes out more than is claimed. By the way, I have been an extremly healthy young woman and I have never had any health problems.

column2: Kim, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Im going on 5 years with the Mirena and love it!  I dont know its there. I have not had any problems, no weight gain. Im very happy and would recommend it to everyone. Getting my new one next month.

column2: allymarie1019, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got Mirena put in yesterday and now after reading these comments im scared to death. I feel dizzy and am having cramps and not sure if i should give it more time or not because i have weight issues already and some hair loss recently. If I would have read these comments before i got it I wouldnt have gone through with it.

column2: myblondeprotege2002, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Well i had mirena after my first kid and barelly any problems other then spotting.  I just had my second kid on 2/19/09 and got it in in 06/09.  I'm in week like two and I have had horrible head aches and some cramping and today 06/21/09 severe cramping.  I don't remember it being so bad, ever.  Like stop you in your tracks i got it at the gym, gettign out of the car, and a sec ago just sitting here.  I'm allergic to BC pills and will not be happy if my body is rejecting this b/c I think its whats happening!!!

column2: teffyH, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i had it in for about 9months and i have been nursing my baby girl the whole time and just now i have noticed that my milk supply is going down ((a lot)) i want sure why if i have had it this long why would be be doing this and well it just dose your body is changing again my DR said and well i have been trying to pump as much as i can but hey i am a full time college student and well that is hard to come by time to do that and nursing my baby girl.. i have had to change her over to whole milk this early and well other then that i would tell anyone who wants to get the miena well its done great for me

column2: ADRIANA, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I hate mirena i got really bad acne and i've gained 20 pounds!! DO NOT USE IT!! I will be getting it removed next week!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena placed about 6 weeks ago.  Yes there was some cramping during the placement,but overall the pain was minimal.  I have lost weight and have had no problems with acne. I absolutely love Mirena and would recommend it to anyone!

column2: angelface, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It is coming up on my five year anniversary with the Mirena and my experience has been very smooth the whole time.  I had some pain at insertion, some cramping initially (first day or two), then couldn't even tell that it was there.  My periods stopped almost immediately, which was nice. To make myself feel more at ease, I'd take a preg. test every other month or so- always came back neg. One thing that I have noticed lately though (remember, its been almost the full 5 years now) is that my blood pressure has been higher than usual.  I already have high blood pressure, and control it with meds, but lately, its still high and I'm wondering if it has anything to do with the Mirena.  I have an appointment with ob/gyn next week and will have to make the choice whether to insert a new one or not.  I'd like to do this again, but am holding my breath to see if dr. recommends it w/high blood pressure issues.  Everyone's body is diff and reactions to meds are diff too, but for me, Mirena was truly a God send.

column2: bbromley06, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i got the mirena inserted on june 5-09it was so not painful at all..i acutally was expecting the worse but honestly i dont think anything can be worse than being in labor for 15hrs!!anywho.i havent had it for very long but i love the idea of hassle free bc the only thing i dislike is the feeling of anxiety and always afraid im pregnant.that is a bit alarming.. but other than that i'm good :)  i would def recommend it to anyone :)

column2: yikes91, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is only a review about the insertion of the Mirena. I had mine put in yesterday, 6/15/09. Yes, it was uncomfortable, but bearable. I have a tilted uterus so the doc had use a clamp on my cervix. This is why it is so painful to some. The clamp allows the doc to tug on the cervix to straighten the uterus while she measures, then inserts the Mirena. The clamp has very pointed ends and pinches when clamped on. Think of how it initially hurts to get an IV.  The tugging feels like a cramp/mild contraction. I relaxed the best I could and went to my "happy place". Don't be afraid of the pain. I took an Aleve when I got home and barely felt uncomfortable the rest of the day. The other bonus is that I only spotted for 6-8 hours. No cramping today and I was even able to do a spin class this morning. Everyone is different, but just felt I should balance out all the negative reviews. So far so good for me. Hoping it will lighten/remove my period next!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've had mirena 9months and I've had a lot of itching and pain.Yeast and bacteria infections.I've also had uti's.(never had before IUD)All these infections have taken multiple antibiotics and have lasted months.Over 12.After I get rid of one I get another one.I suffer from depression so low hormones was a good option for me.We weren't 100% on not having more kids so I opted for this instead of a tubal.The cramping and bleeding did get better after 3 months.I would almost rather have more kids then deal w/ the itching and infections.

column2: MISSLADY, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I TOOK THIS FREAKING IUD AND IM MISERABLE THE GREAT THING ABOUT IT I HAVEN'T HAD A PERIOD IN ALMOST 2 YRS THE WORST THINGS ABOUT IS I VE GAINED 25 POUNDS IM ABOUT TO GO NUTS BUT IM GETTING IT REMOVED ON THE 30TH AS A AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN IT HAS DARK CIRCLES AROUND MY CHEEK BONES I LOOK LIKE A MONSTER BUT THANKS TO BLEACHING CREAMS IM GETTING MY FACE BACK TO ITS COLOR DONT TAKE THIS IM GETTING MY TUBES TIED

column2: manda, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: well it's nice not to take a pill everyday or a shot but i have changed so much (moody) my husband can barely stand me when i first had it put in i had my period for 5 months straight, no light spotting either normal or heavy, then i get 1 every month which is a normal one i had it put in december of 2008, i have gained like 10lbs, don't ever want to have sex,and my husband said it hurts him when we do,i get bad cramping, really bad in my lower back,i always think im pregnant im getting it takin out i can't stand it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had my 1st child 10/07 and i had the mirena inserted 1/08. Since i had recently given birth I didn't feel a thing when it was inserted, was surprised when the dr said "its in"! Had moderate cramping the first day, nothing major. In the past I have had horrible cramps each month and heavy periods, now just the occasional cramp, but very irregular spotting, if I have to wear a pad its only for one day, then panti-liners for the spotting. I do have frequent headaches, but can't be positive its due to the mirena..I didn't gain any weight either, same as before I got pregnant. It is very convenient, I was horrible about taking the pill! I do have frequent discharge, and did bleed for several weeks after insertion, and for about the first 6 months, frequent periods...i thought it would never stop! But it did, you have to be patient, no bc is perfect, but once you get past all the initial side effects its great. I am ready for another baby though, so removing it this month, maybe back after baby #2!Everyone has different tolerances for pain and shouldn't be too worried b/c some ppl say its terrible...its over quickly and you need to relax your muscles, just like with a pap! Tensing b/c you are nervous will make it worse I would think.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Doctor recommended it for endometriosis, since I have difficulty with other bc. Was EXTREMELY painful to put in (no kids), bled for 5 weeks straight after. Have not had one period since, and am a little worried about that since I want to have kids in the next 1-2 years. I have pain in my right side near my hip, and while I have cut my caloric intake dramatically I can't lose weight. I get migraines from the hormones, and am now on two other medications to prevent those. I am very scared of losing the mirena inside, or having an ectopic pregnancy, but don't want to get pregnant just yet. I would strongly encourage people to NOT take this.

column2: pc, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Inserted 3 months post partum.  No pain during insertion.  Love the fact this works for five years.  However, I cannot loose any weight while on Mirena no matter my efforts.  I will most likely get it removed solely for this reason.

column2: Kay, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I go Mirena in May 08 at first I bleed for about 3 weeks then I would have these pain but after the 3rd month I had no bledding and no pain. My only concern is since I have had the Mirena I have gained about 25 lbs I was wondering why i have been gaing but reading what others have said I think i know why. My doctor never informed me of this side effect and had I known i may have taken another route since I have has weight problems in the past. Other that the weight gain I would recommend it to others.

column2: mobo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Changed my life!  My heavy menstrual bleeding controlled every thing I did 3 days every month. I was using a super plus tampon every hour or less. I had to take iron pills. After getting the IUD my periods are so much better I can't even believe it.  I should have had this done years ago.  Don't wait for your doctor to suggest this - if you have heavy periods - make an appointment to talk about it with your doctor.

column2: kel1105, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted on 6/2/09.  It was extremely painful for about 1 minute.  I was very crampy for about 1-2 hours after. I wish I would have had someone drive me to my appt.  I was very uncomfortable driving home.  I have mild cramps here and there but nothing unbearable.  I do find myself having a hard tire sleeping at night.  Unsure if it is related to the mirena.  So far so good.

column2: Kimbertimbers, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
