column9: I has 3 months of terrible cramping, it was constant pain. But after that t is month 7 now and I don;t even know I have the IUD. I think if I knew how horrible the pain was I would have reconsidered. I have gotten acne but no weight gain. my period is lighter and happens less often, but I still get the bad cramps (flash-back) when I am going to get my period. Still it seems a better choice than taking hormonal pills everyday, and I have had a better time with the IUD than the pill as far as side effects go. I think a lot of people get "side-effects" because they are getting off the pill and going back to normal hormonal levels which makes for a long and uncomfortable adjustment. For example, I did not have acne before, but the pill helps subside acne. So no pill now and more acne now, it's makes sense to me anyway.

column2: ihateit, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My list of complaints with this form of bc would take up all 2000 characters on this form! I am having it removed tomorrow and would not recommend this product to anyone unless I really did not like them. Just to name a few of my favorite problems I have experienced horrible cramping, nausea, acne, weight gain, discharge, dizziness, anxiety, back pain and 3 week long periods. I have been to my regular doctor as well as a neurologist to determine the cause of some of my more alarming symptoms and they found no underlying cause. It never dawned on me until I recently web searched the Mirena that it was the most likely cause of all my discomforts. Furthermore, I agree with some of the other posts relating to the lack of a sex drive it causes, so in a way it is a great form of bc because you have to have sex to get pregnant and the Mirena makes it very undesirable to do so.

column2: mommyof3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: GET THE MIRENA IT WORKS!!!I had Mirena put in 07/2008 and its been FABULOUS! I had some moderate cramping after insertion, a little light spotting and its been PIE IN THE SKY ever since. I'm not depressed. My acne is non existant. My sex drive couldn't be better. My usual case of pain in the butt PMS is no more. My period has been no more than a day or two of very light spotting. Initially I had some hair shedding but I had that following the birth of all my children and can't  place the blame on the Mirena. When I had my Mirena placed I still needed to lose over 40 pounds of baby weight. I lost it all plus an extra 10 pounds that had been holding on since college that I hadn't been able to shake. I won't say it was easy because I had to really work at it but it is possible.  Don't let all the bad reviews scare you away from what could be a really great form of birth control. Had I read these reviews I would have never given the Mirena a second thought. But after expierencing it for myself I kick myself for not trying it earlier. My last birth control fiasco resulted in me having 2 sons in less than 18 months. I say try it if it works out well great if not just know not all birth conrol works the same for every case.

column2: Freedom1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Symptoms occur over time and become more severe. Finally when I went to go have the Mirena out - it is stuck inside - they can not remove it without surgery. THis is extrememly danagerous device and should not even be on the market

column2: sarasd@aol.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mirena put in for less then 24 hours.  When my Dr. put it in and I had instant pain he informed me that some pain is normal. Within the 24 hours I had it in I was in unbearable pain and had to go the a hospital for tests before my Dr. could take it out.  I am a healthy 29 year old with 2 children and no want for anymore soon.  I was the perfect candidate.  I didn't realize what horrible things could happen with an iud until I had one.  I hope that this will help more women make a educated decision and I don't mean what the drug companies want up to hear.  I would tell anyone and everyone don't get a iud it's not worth the side effects! !

column2: Dianne43, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IUD put in Nov 08. After the initial bleeding stopped...several weeks, as they said, I remain on a regular cycle. My only complaint is that my cycle is sometimes a little longer 7-9 days, but it is very light to spotting. Sometimes it is only a couple of days, so that is nice. I experience the normal PMS, but it is nothing that is unusual to the natural hormonal effects that I've ever had. Light cramping, moodiness, cravings etc...nothing that I haven't experienced since I was 12. I have struggled with the weight a bit, but only a few lbs. I figure the exercise that I do is worth the convenience. Maybe it's my age, I turned 43 this year. So, I plan to continue eating well, exercising well and staying on it. If I begin gaining rapidly or having longer periods...I'll talk to my doctor and go from there. Everyone is different... Good luck!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: In the first 6 months I had nothing but cramping and pinchy feelings and heavy spotting, I almost had it taken out but it resolved luckily. I love not taking an oral B.C and am enjoying the much lighter periods-hardly there at all! One thing I still don't like though is that it does not stop ovulation so the possibility of an egg being fertilized is still there but then it has no lining to implant in so essentially you miscarry. That still bothers me.

column2: missmk81, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have to say I love the Mirena. I got it 5/2008 and have had very few complications. I have no kids so the insertion was definitely uncomfortable, but after that I was fine. I had a light period off and on for about 4 weeks after it was inserted, but it was extremely light. I was the type who had severe bleeding to the point of having to go to the ER each time I had a cyle prior to Mirena. Now I never have a cycle. I have very mild cramps, some acne and bloating during the week I would usually have a cycle. I gained some weight, but nothing that was just unbearable.  My sex drive is FAR from lacking, if anything it's tripled. (smile) And I've had no hair loss whatsoever. Everyone is different, but to me the Positives FAR outweigh the Negatives in my experience!

column2: srjames, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena in Dec 08 after my second child was born. The pain was about like having a pap smear done while being inserted. I beld off and on a lot for the first 3-4 months. I have noticed me being bloated and have not lost any baby weight. i get asked all of the time when my baby is due. I also have really bad mood swings and it breaks my heart to know that my children are suffering from this too. I did not know that any of this was related to the mirena until reading the comments. I am going to the doctor today to make sure that it is the mirena causing the problems but I feel confident that it is now. I love not having to take birth control and it is a hard decision to make but I can not deal with the mood swings and bloating. These are the only problems I have with it now. Any suggestions? I don't want any more kids right now but my youngest is only 7 months so I don't want to rule it out completely. HELP!!!!

column2: smartmama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 30 with 1 child and pretty sure I'm done having children but not ready to make it permanent. I have had it in for six months now and hate it. I have bleeding up to the six months which is normal.My moodiness has been insane every 2 weeks I feel like I'm pms-ing and I mean extreme. I had a very high sex drive before and now none at all. Cramps they cripple me just went to doc and found out I have a BV infection-a side effect of the iud. Once the results come back I will know if it developed into PID. I'm getting it removed I'm done I would rather bleed every month and get a dif bc then ever go thru this every other 2 weeks.

column2: gbell1983, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAD THE MIRENA IUD PLACED IN FEBUARY. I TOOK A PAIN PILL BEFORE HAVING IT DONE, AND HAD NO PAIN AT ALL. MY ONLY COMPLAINT WITH MIRENA IS THAT MY PERIOD LASTED ABOUT 12 DAYS THE FIRST MONTH AFTER HAVING IT INSERTED BUT I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE. IT IS VERY EFFECTIVE AND VERY CARE FREE.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: mistyleemoo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena put in march 09...i have had every side effect of this product...if i would have known about all the side effects that they don't tell you at the doctors i wouldn't have gotten it...the 2 weeks of periods,loss of sexual feelings, the weight gain, the pain in my legs and back,headaches, peroid pains, and my anxeity is rrelly bad...i am going to get this product taken out...but i don't want anymore children, i am 30 with 3 kids.

column2: neecee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: stumbop, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Like I have read everyone is different, Little painful on insertion, but only lasted a few seconds, head aches first couple of weeks, but now 1 month out, havine first period, and it is just heavy spotting, no terrible cramps like before. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my baby in Sept 2008 and got the Mirena in Nov. 2008.  I lost all of the weight from the baby immediately and was down to 130.  Since being on the Mirena I have exercised, started eating better and even trained and walked in a 10k BUT I have gained over 15lbs!  I have read some other comments that other people have gained on it too.  I also feel bloated and my belly is so big.  I have never had trouble losing weight but the weight has not budged and I blame the Mirena.  I am going to get it taken out as soon as possible!

column2: misfitgrl78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have never posted a review before in my life, but after reading all the negative reviews and knowing how nervous I was, I decided to add my two cents. I have had my Mirena for almost 5 years. I have to say it has been the most amazing birth control EVER! The insertion was more painful than I expected, (it is a little more than 'slight discomfort' ALMOST as bad as a contraction) but it is over quickly. I had slight cramping for a couple of days, and during my first couple of periods following insertion my cramps were worse than normal. However before insertion, I always had HORRENDOUS cramps and excessive bleeding (sometimes 2-3 WEEKS at a time) and  after getting Mirena they immediately became shorter. In fact, after about 6 months I would only have slight spotting for 1-2 days per month, and NO MORE CRAMPS!! My sex drive increased remarkably, and has remained high. Now that I am nearing the 5 year mark, I am starting to have longer periods and slight cramps again which I assume is because the hormones are running out. I have had no negative side effects, and will definitely have it replaced!

column2: MommyMB, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After having my 1st child in Nov of 09 Mirena was the so called best birth control choice of all of the doctors at my OB/GYN office and they made it seem so safe and pretty much 100% effective, but they don't warn you about the threads that can make "bedroom time" painful! Lets just say the husband was being poked where he didn't want to be and it hurt for me as well. Also I had gotten it put in 6 weeks after delievering my child and I was still losing my baby weight till the week I got it put in and i've been gaining ever since. I'm a pretty athletic person i'd say and I've gained 15 pounds in 4 months. I went for a check up 4 months after having it put in and they couldn't find it and scheduled me for a sonogram to see if they could find it. A few days after that I felt sick after I ate as if I was pregnant again. I went and read all the side effect of mirena and wow i wish I woulda have been warned about them all before I just agreed with it. So I take a pregnancy test tomorrow and if the Mirena is still inside of me lost somewhere, I will not be able to keep that baby which is such a horrible thing and something i'm very against. I just wish they woulda warned me about the side effects and not made it seem 100% safe and effective. I will stick with pills from now on for sure.

column2: krissn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a traditional IUD for 10 years and was very happy. I decided to try the Mirena on the advice of my GYN to control excessively heavy periods and cramping. At first it worked, my period was light the first month and gone the second. However, pain incresed to almost constantly. I ended up with cysts as a side effect. My new GYN said they were "impressive". While removing the cysys, she also removed my uterus, as I didn't need it anymore and it was the original problem. So, no more mirena and no more cysts since it was removed. I think it could be a great method of birth control, if you don't get the side effects!

column2: niecey, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena inserted in May '08. So far I have been pretty satisfied w/ it. I do have severe headaches quite often, however, I had a problem w/ headaches previously. They have now regulated a little more...just some light spotting in between. I was on the pill previously and was always nervous about getting pregnant, w/ this my mind is much more at ease.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena iud placed 4 1/2 months ago.  I took it to reduce bleeding and as a form of birth control.  I have two friends who have not bled a single day since it was placed.  The insertion was not too painful but I had severe cramping for about 2 hours after the procedure (take Advil before you go in).  I bled off and on for the first month, almost every day for the second months.  The third month I bled like I was having a period for a good two weeks (not too heavy but not light either).  The fourth month I would feel a bit of cramping for 20 minutes and would bleed for a while and then nothing for a day or two.  I actually went four days without bleeding last week.  I am encouraged that I will have little to no bleeding by 6 months.  It is cost effective if you use it for the entire 5 years and is a good form of birth control.  I just think you need to be prepared for a long duration of bleeding at the beginning.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted 9/06. I have 3 kids and am 35. The procedure itself hurt a little, but driving home I felt so dizzy and light-headed, I crawled into the house and crashed on the floor. After about an hour I was fine.  2 years and 9 mos. into it: I have no sex drive, problem with acne, no period (I feel like an idiot when asked when my last period was- I don't know!) this is fine with me, and twice now, even this minute I wonder if I'm pregnant. I have never before had bloating or other side effects. If I'm not pregnant, I would get it again when it's time.

column2: Amy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got this IUD inserted 7 months ago after the birth of my 4th child... I have gained a total of 40 lbs since then, and I cannot lose the weight no matter how much I diet or exercise.  I have had NO sex drive since the insertion, and my hair and skin have been so disgustingly greasy that I have to wash my face 3-4 times a day.  Awful.  I had a non-stop period for the first 2 months which I expected, and the only positive thing I can find about this IUD is that now I have no period at all.

column2: Kigak5, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am late 20's and have 5 children.  I got this put in in late Jan 2009.  It did hurt when it was put in and for the rest of that day, some cramping.  Went away, spotted for the rest of the week.  My period came in feb, no march, yes in april. Oh and I spotted for almost all of feb on and off, taken care of with thin panty liners (highly recommended). No more spotting, only slight clear-yellow discharge once in a while. Sex drive is good, I got some severe headaches the 1st month, but gone now. Don't be afraid to try it, everyones body reacts differently.  My husband and I said we would try it for 6 months and then decide to keep it or not. I really like it up till now. Will keep it in unless something better comes up...doubt it. The Mirena has been good to me.

column2: poppy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was not bleeding when it was inserted.  No bleeding for 2 weeks.  Then bled regularly for 2 weeks and now still bleeding lightly for 3 week after that.  So, bleeding for a total of 5 weeks now.  This is getting very, very OLD!

column2: screenname, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After having the mirena inserted I began to suffer from constant kidney stones, despite medication and diet changes. I had the Mirena taken out 8 months ago and I have not had one since.I made no other changes to my diet or medication. I never had a kidney stone prior to it's insertion. The longest time I went with out a kidney stone when I had the IUD in was two weeks.

column2: kateplus2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i had mirena for two months and had it removed 3 days ago. About a week after I had it inserted, i started having panic attacks, nausia, fatigue, weight gain, and SEVERE mood swings. I thought I was going insane. My doctor then tried to push more meds on me, but I know it was from the Mirena. I never had any symptoms like these before. I didn't get pregnant, but it is not worth my life being disrupted so severely. I don't feel like this is for everyone and your body will let you know!

column2: mmoss, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is a love-hate relationship for me....I love that it's there, I don't have to worry about it, I can check to make sure it's there (for my peace of mind), and that it's a no maintenance type of birth control. However, I have had SEVERE bloating about once a month for around 5 days at a time. Also, this is preceeded by two days of bad migraines. With the migraines I get naseau and sometimes light-headed. I rarely bleed but when I do, I can't leave my home because it's so bad. Also, I began lactating (which is a very rare side effect of this drug) last month. That was quite the shocking moment for me! I'm not sure the benefits out weigh the side effects I'm having at this point. It's been almost a year since I had it implanted and I'm thinking of removing it. I really have a hard time with the headaches but the hardest time comes with the week long bloating where I can't wear my normal clothes and weight 5-7 pounds more than normal....this takes a toll on my emotional health as well!

column2: Steph1017, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted on March 18 2009.  I went in on April 14 for my one month check up to be sure all was well.  Mirena strings were missing so they did an ultrasound to find the mirena in my pelvis.  Instead they found a fetus.  I'm 6 weeks and 6 days pregnant.  It's either faulty IUD or faulty physician office.  The dates don't add up, that means they inserted the device and I was already pregnant.  Ridiculous.  I'm very DISSATISFIED!! Now I'm stuck trying to decide what to do about the unexpected pregnancy.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I thought this would be a great solution to the bc pills. Well I was wrong I would never use this again even if someone paid me. I had it done in December 2008 that was 4moths ago and i am still in pain. Heave bleeding and cramps the whole entire time not one day of relief, nausea every day and not the mention the horrible headaches it has caused. I finally had it removed last week and I have never been happier in my entire life!

I got the mirena inserted about six weeks after i had my son in august of 07. I realy thought it was going to hurt but i didnt feel a thing. I still have my period but i only get it like every three months and it last for about three days. Its also very light. My sex life is higher than ever.I dont use condoms any more and still havnt gotten pregnant. This is the first birth control i have ever tried but its great.

column2: twinzmom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had twin girls in May 2008 and had the Mirena inserted when they were about 10 weeks old.  I went in expecting a lot of pain, but it was not bad at all.  She said "you'll feel a pinch"... and I felt something that was a little uncomfortable and I kept waiting for a pinch... and then she was done.  I had a couple of periods, but haven't had one in quite some time.  No complaints about that!!  And for my sex drive, it's possibly lower but HELLO, I have two little ones who have me grabbing every bit of sleep I can get... so no biggie for me... I'm sure if you asked my hubby, he wouldn't agree.  But it's all good.

column2: pattie , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about 2 years now. I love the person who invented this. Not only do i not get a period i don't have the worry of if i missed a pill.  I have a 6 year old son. As for my sex drive its still rockin.  The only side affect i have is the acne which comes and goes.  I can handle that for now.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had two miscarriages 5-8 weeks in, but no kids. I didn't have any pain, cramping or spotting after insertion. I actually stopped having a menstrual cycle all together. And I don't have a problem with this considering the fact the I bled like a river and pain killers couldn't help my cramps before getting the IUD. I had it inserted 8/08 and I love still love it now 4/09.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I wanted to tell about my experience with Mirena because I have read the reviews and really, everyone is going to be different. When I had the IUD placed, I will tell you, the pain was terrible. It hurt me so bad I literally fainted in the Dr's office. BUT, there are 2 reasons why: 1. I have never had children & 2. I have a tilted uterus and my Dr had to lift it to insert the device. After regaining consciousness, I went home and was in pain (bad period cramps) the rest of the day and for about 2 weeks. The cramping did get lighter and lighter but I thought I had made a terrible mistake in getting the IUD. It's now been about six months and I absolutely love it. I have tried other birth control methods and nothing has been so confortable. I haven't gain weight, I'm not moody, I have no period and I don't worry about getting pregnant. I have not lost my sex drive, infact...I am more driven then ever. I do get cramps maybe a coupld of times a month but only for a day or less. My only worry now is whether I will go through the same pain again when it is removed. And from what my Dr says, because of my uterus, I most likely will.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had it put in 6 weeks after having my son On Sep 14 2007. At first nothing changed as far as periods which would last atleast 8 days. Then it started to work and I didn't have anymore periods and if I had it was every 2 to 4 months. Now my complains have been fatigue, sleepless nights, not as high of a sex drive, when cramps come on it feels just as bad as labor pains. I also have to say I cannot seem to lose much weight after a certain point no matter how much diet and exercise. I would recommend this to women who have unsually long periods who have had children and really don't plan on having anymore for a long while. I am not getting divorced and have lost 20 pounds out of shear determination however, I get cramps atleast 3 times a month without bleeding and if i decided to have it removed it should be a couple times more painful to take out than it was putting it in. At the time my cervix was still soft but it's been almost 2 years so it wont be as great.

column2: mommyofboys1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Its very effective cause you completly lose your sex drive and guess what no sex means no baby... grrr. and i have been spotting off and on for 4 mo. now. I got it in dec. of 08.. Im having it removed and just taking pills or smoething cause this lack of sex is puting a strain on my marriage. and I mean seriously i just dont wanna be kissed, touched nothing and ive never been like this before

column2: misjan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: So as far as Effectiveness goes I have to give it 5 stars, not because it's good at preventing pregnancy but because I don't want to have sex. It's not that I don't have a sex drive but I'm constantly having cramping and pains in that area. My periods which I do say are lighter last 12-14 days at a time and come back after about 2 weeks. The cramps I have during that time are much worse then when I was just on the pill. It was a horrible experience being put in and assuming this doesn't subside I'm not looking forward to the removal. I've talked with my doctor and she's put me on an oral birth control for a month to see if that will help my symptoms. I'm not going to get my hopes up. My friend has ad it for over 2 years and has not had any symptoms. So I can't say I wouldn't recommend it but it really sucks if your body doesn't like it.

column2: katiep2000, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 19 with no children and I just had it put in yesterday and Ive never been in so much pain in my life! ive had many procedures done while I was awake and none of them hurt this bad. I almost passed out after it was over with too. After the feeling of passing out was over with I was fine! I just took some pain killers and took a nap...I havent had much cramping but I do have an upset stomach. This was my last option for birth control so I hope it works like the doctors said it would.

column2: Lana's Mom, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I love this thing. For those of you thinking about having an IUD, don't let negative reviews scare you away.  Like any medication, everyone reacts differently to it. It was easily inserted, I had minor cramps but nothing excruciating.  I just had a baby 5 months ago and my husband and I are not ready for another one, so I did some research and was almost scared away from the idea of an IUD by the negative reviews. I'm had a little spotting but nothing else.  Some women complain of pain during insertion but it may be the dr's fault.  Some are just more gentle than others. But you should really check it out. I love mine!!! Because I'm still nursing, I had to take Jovilette which you have to take within 3 hours of the same time everyday. With a busy infant, who has time for that. Mirena is so convenient!!! And I don't feel it at all!!!

column2: Kelli, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I Had the IUD inserted 2/06/09. I am 19 with no children. The insertion was very painful, and I had bad cramping the first 3 days. My period has been irregular, but since it is a new horomone in body that is expected. So far, I love it! I have had no major issues and love that I dont have to remember the pill everyday. I highly reccomend this form of BC!One reccomendation is to have someone drive you to your insertion appt. I was dizzy after insertion and was very glad to have my boyfriend drive me home.

column2: Lana, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena in 9/08. It is April 09 and I have very light periods but they last 2-3 weeks, then i have one week with no bleeding or spotting, then i'm back on again!! It is very annoying! No heavy bleeding. I can usually get by with a panty liner, but it is not stopping 7 months later!! Not much pain at insertion...moderate to severe cramping for two days or so, but after that better. I do have more severe cramping and VERY tender breasts a day or two before each period. But the worst has been the constant spotting. No decrease in sex drive like some others have had.

column2: hamy456, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 45 years old. so the reason i got this was to slow my bleeding down. It hurts quite a bit to put it in. After a month or so i cant feel its there anymore but i havent stopped bleeding yet!!!! I dont want sex anymore not interested at all! When i did have sex he could feel it and it scratched him. I do also have weird discharge sometimes. Also im not myself anymore, depressed i guess.I have not taken it out yet as it was expensive and the doctor told me to give it 3 months. All i wana do is cry. why did he do this to me? Also my friend said it is very painful to remove. one more thing i have been very dizzy and unable to work lately, i see that could be a side effect. now i have to go to my regular doctor he will know what to do. please dont do this to yourself before you are very sure of what you are doing.Oh yeah i have had it for 4 months.

column2: Banana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got mirena put in last Friday and it is totally tolerable. I have a 8 year old daughter and was currently on Neuva Ring.  Don't read the horror stories like I did, I went to the doctor a nervous reck. It is not that bad just a little cramping that last 30 seconds to a minute. I stoped bleeding 2 days later and now i am spoting in the mornings and that is it. Hopefully, that will stop soon. I went to work after the procedure and I cramped the rest of the day, but come Saturday all the cramping was gone and have not experience any since so far I am loving MIRENA!!!!!!!!

column2: Frustrated, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Constant bleeding; cramps; back pain; always tired.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am totally lovin this iud. I was on the depo for 5 years and decided that I want to try the mirena. I had major cramping the day of the insertion with light spotting. No more spotting since,no more cramps. No worries.

column2: jethoon, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Even though they say to get Mirena only if you've already had a child, I didn't know that and it had been recommended by two different friends.  Neither of them had given birth either and we're all around the same age, early 20's.  They were really excited about their IUDs and warned me of the pain.  Planned Parenthood was giving them out for free and 5 year protection sounded great.  It did hurt a lot, but was over very quickly.  I didn't have any bleeding afterward, but I did feel a little funny and was nauseous for about a day or two.  Overall, I highly recommend Mirena and have told friends to get it.Every once in while I get a little light spotting, but thats it!  It is great.My boyfriend really loves it too, but it gave him some problems at first.  The strings sometimes poked him during sex.  More than hurting, it caused some psycological problems.  I went in and had the strings shortened.  After that, we were fine and he wasn't scared anymore.  The IUD was put in a year ago and I'm so grateful to have 4 more worry-free years!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD inserted in Oct of 08. I had it placed at my 6 week check up after a c-section. I will be very honest. It was intensly painful. Like nothing i have ever felt before. I bled for two days after that, and then stopped for a few days. I then had three solid weeks of bleeding followed by two week periods for three months. Now, after six months i have only two day periods that are so light i really have to wear nothing as protection from my period. I would say to anyone that has just gotten it or is going to get it, to really give it a good four to six months before you have it removed. It is a super pain in the butt at first but well worth it now. I have no cramping, basically no period and my husband loves it now. It was definitly worth the hassle. Just be patient. It is so worth it now.

column2: Tigger, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had my son on 3/11/08 by c-section. He is my second child, my daughter is now 3 years old. At about 10 weeks out from my surgery I was told I could get the IUD. The procedure was more painful that I expected, it was like a mini labor but bearable. Afterwards there was the bleeding and discharge from the medication she put on my cervix (it bled from the spreading). I bled off and on for several months afterwards but it wasn't much of an annoyance. The part I don't like about this product is I am having a reaction to the medication (I believe). Each month before I have my menstral cycle I start getting yeast infection like discharge, inflamation, irritation, and iching. It is like my warning that I will be bleeding soon. Then I bleed for about 2-3 days (med to light) and after that is complete the yeast-infection-like symptoms go away and I am good to go till next month. It is really weird (and a bit annoying especially when I want to have sex because it is painful). However, the benefits of knowing I won't get pregnant and not having to take a pill (I am terrible at taking pills) outweigh the cost of irritation. :) I haven't heard anyone talk about discharge and irritation on a monthly basis so I thought I would share just in case someone can relate.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
NOT HAPPY WITH BC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I RECIEVED MY IUD A MONTH AGO AND MY PERIODS ARE LONGER MY CRAMPS ARE WORST AND I HAVE FREQUENT MIGRANES I HATE THIS IUD ITS MAKING ME MISERABLE. OH! MY SEX DRIVE IS TOTALLY GONE!!!

column2: fussballgirl29, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had Mirena for almost a month now, and I love it!  I've had very few side effects, and nothing that I wasn't informed about beforehand.  I recommend going to this website for a great source of information and both positive and negative experiences, instead of only negative experiences.  It helped me make my choice.  http://community.livejournal.com/iud_divas

column2: atsirhclove, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first appointment was not such a fun experience but now (only 1 month later) I think this is the greatest birth control I have ever had! I have basically tried everything but this is easy, comfortable, and I don't have to remember it!!! I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a long term birth control method!

column2: aryanas_mama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 30 year old female who has had the mirena implaced in november. To me this is great. The only thing that bothers me is lower back pains all the time. also my boyfriend has been cut up by the strings in which i had to go to the gyno to have the strings cut. overall i am happy with this devise.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I have had Mirena for almost five years and Love it. My doctor inserted it shortly after my second child. I have never had any issues with it and to be honest sometimes i forget its there. I have set an appointment to have it replaced with another one since my five years is coming up.

column2: BrinksFriend, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I feel that this prescription is a good way to not get pregnant for five years unless you decide to want kids eariler than you expected.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I really like this birth control. I dont have to worry about taking a pill, changing a patch or spending money on condoms.

column2: V-town MOM, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I recently had my third child and decided to take the easy route and get an IUD.  It is HORRIBLE!!! It has been 3 months...I have been bleeding for every week within those months, but one.  I am experiencing an alarming hair loss( and I have a lot of hair).  Also, I breakout with the most unusual rash all over my body:face,bikini area,legs.  I must explain this rash b/c it's that horrid.  First, you break out with red bumps( the size of an eraser). Then, they rapidly fill with puss;thus, becoming the size of a quarter. Next, the puss bubbles until leaking out...Finally, the quarter size markings turn a dark brown and harden.  Oh, and if you try and pop them, they only get bigger!!!  So, I have been on this birth control for 3 months;yet, cannot have sex becqause I have been bleeding for most of that time.  My OBGYN tell me, so women experience this for up to 6 months.  Also, I believe it's important and relevant to mention,I have had these horrible side-effects and I am only 29 years old.  Worst of all, I had to pay $500 out of pocket for it, as most do.

column2: brittanyarnold, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 19 years old, I have no children. Although I did have a miscarrige a couple weeks ago. The only pain I had was when my Dr. was inserting it. I've had no bleeding, or discharge, so far. I have  read a couple stories of women that have had the IUD and hated it, I have also read stories about women who hated it. I was on YAZ when I got pregnant, do you think my DR. gave it to me because I got pregnant on the pill?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i bled like a period for about 3 weeks and spotted for about 2 but since then I have had no bleeding! I have 3 kids so mirena is very convenient for me. I had it put in 6 weeks after my last daughter was born and it felt like i was having a 30 second contraction when it was being put in, but other than that it was definitely worth it!

column2: JD2004, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena inserted in early January 09. I'm 22 and mother of a 2 yr old which I delivered through C-Section. I wanted to switch from the patch only because I wanted something more reliable and long-term. Like most, I was worried about the bleeding and the pain that might follow. However, the insertion was very easy. Especially after reading all these posts, I was really expecting the worst. But it felt like nothing more than strong menstrual cramps.  However the bleeding has been a nuisance, but my doctor fully explained that it would be beforehand. I bled for two weeks after insertion, stopped for two weeks, bled for another week and a half, and stopped until early March 09. Today is the 19th and I have been either spotting or having sporadic heavy bleeding since the first week of March. But my fiancee is understanding. I know that if I just stick it out everything will work out. I would recommend this to any woman looking for a reliable, fool-proof form of birth control.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
JAS, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had a lot of cramping and spotting

column2: mckenzien18 , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for almost 2 months and the only problem I have is a light brown discharge along with bleeding off & on. It's really annoying. I don't understand why a doctor would allow somebody who has never had children to get the IUD inserted. I had mine put in 6 weeks after I gave birth to my daughter and I didnt feel anything when he put it in.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I love this form of birth control!  It has been such a convenient method for me.  I have been on it for over 3 years and have such a light period...I've heard others complain about heavy bleeding and cramping but I have had none of that.  It is such a great alternative for me being that I was mostly sure that I didn't want anymore children but wanted to reserve from getting a surgical procedure.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for 12 mths now and I still have extreme cramping for weeks at a time.  I don't have much of a monthly cycle anymore but the cramping and bloating is still there and doesn't seem to subside much.

column2: Ruth, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm on my 4th month.Hurt like a SOB on insertion and I bleed non stop for three months straight. And I have random sever cramping.My doctor suggested I give it time but I won't give it much more. I've had severe head aches and leg pain. I didn't consdier the leg pain could be due to this until I started reading these reviews. I can't say it's effective beacuse I only have sex now about once a month. I'm happy about not having to worry about pregnancy, but I'm not sure this is the method for me.

column2: Nicole J, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 20 years old. No children. I just got the Mirena yesterday, and like some people I didn't read reviews on it, which scared me a little. My boyfriend didn't like the idea of me getting it because of some of the contraindications and he heard (and me also) that you can become infertile from Mirena. I read the most 100 recent reviews, but there were only about 2 other women that i can compare myself to (age, no children, not married, etc.) so I thought i should give my input. when getting it inserted it did hurt, but it was bearable. i didnt faint, didnt feel dizzy, or feverish, just shaky (i was nervous). after reading some of these reviews i feel better about it. the dr suggested i come in when i was on my cycle to make it easier, so i did. i was given 800mg of ibuprofen, my Dr measured my uterus to see if i was the "right size" and put it in. it took less than 3 mins and i was able to get up, get dressed and that was it. i did have cramping after and took steady doses of 800mg ibuprofen, and that helped me. i was toward the end of my cycle, but i have more bleeding (which i expected). its more of a brown gouk, not heavy so i just wear a panty liner. I am scared about the weight gain and getting acne that i have heard about, but i believe this one is the best for me. i have tried close to 10 different kinds of bc and have yet to find the right one for me. i hope Mirena works. remember ladies that everyone is different!! so its not going to be the same for everyone! but if it seems right for you i suggest trying it. :)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I absolutely believe this is a terrific form of birth control! I do have to say, not having a child was quite difficult to have the mirena incerted. a couple days of cramps and some slight spotting and I was goldon from then on. I did have the first month a few ovarian cysts which hurt but went away after the first month

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had mine for 4 weeks.  I wanted a tubal but was told I'm too heavy for surgfery.  yikes  I just had 2 BABIES 10 MO APART  so I know I need to lose about 30 lbs.  My dr suggeated Mirena instead nd I thought I wouldtry it even though I had a copper iud back in the day and was nit happy,  With this I have constant bleeding, bloating and cramps like I just delivered my 4th baby.   I will be asking for a removal on tues at my appt and will schedule a tubal ligation.   I don't recommend this birth control at all and wish I had read comments from this website before I had it inserted   I don;t want to gain weight and I definetly don;t want to get prego which I've read has happened to a few who also posted comments

column2: MissMinWisconsin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted 12/31/08, and it is now March 5th.  It was just following my cycle, as my doctor recommended. The pinch as she held the cervix in place to insert it was no picnic, but was over quickly.  I've had 3 children by C-section, and dealt with all sorts of pain following those so it was definitely manageable though uncomfortable for sure.  They asked me how I felt afterward - I had no idea some people faint till they brought it up (I didn't).  I got up, got dressed and went back to work (office job) -- I recommend to bring a moderate flow pad to wear afterward or use the one they provide -- I changed mine to an ultrathin as soon as I could. No big deal!  I bled for 3 days and had first-day-of-period type cramps, and then had  a break for a few days and the bleeding started again.  I have now bled lightly to moderately off and on (mostly on) since then, but suddenly this past week it stopped (so far). The pieces of tissue & small clots I passed sometimes were gross & unexpected, but again tolerable.  I know it is keeping me from getting pregnant which is the desired effect, but I hope that it is not what is causing me this fatigue.  I was not happy to see fatigue on the list of symptoms.  I've been blaming it on all sorts of things, and really hope this isn't the actual cause.  I came on WebMD to research symptoms of being tired and a rash (circular shaped rashes in places where you sweat that flake over), and found that a rash (doesn't meet the same description as mine though) and tiredness came up for Toxic Shock Syndrome which is a potential result of using mirena so I ended up in this area checking other people's symptoms.  Again, hoping this isn't caused by the Mirena!  I am assuming my symptoms are from something else, and would still recommend Mirena so far!

column2: turtle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Okay let me say I had my mine for 4yrs & 9mo. I ? it and even 6mo ago planed on getting another June 09.  However it wasn't till 2 week ago I started haveing laber pain type cramps & I looked up side affects & then it hit me what I had been dealing with this whole time. No period right away which I am not complaneing about that but stomach stayed bloated all the time.  5mo after it was fitted panic attacks, anxity, mood swings no histery.  11mo into it 45lbs weight gain I was always a size 4 & all of a sudden I was a Size 13. then about 4yrs into it cronic back pain, stomach cramps,chills, drpression a feeling of being overwalmed of duties,breast milk discharge even though my son will be 5 in 2mo.  The ER said by CT Scan I had endometis due to this. GYN will not get me ultrasound for 1 1/2 week because I am not pregant & they don't consider it an emergancy.  I finally had mine removed yesterday I had to convince the GYN.  Because he still says nothing is wrong.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have now had them mirena in for a year an half. I'm 25 & have one child. I had it put in 6 weeks after having a c-section. When the doctor inserted it, it hurt very badly but only for a few mins of excruciating pain. (c'mon he's pinching & shoving something up your uterus) I had cramps the first couple of days, for about 3 months I had major hair loss, HORRIBLE headaches & was about to have it taken out. But after 3 months it got better. VERY light periods which is always nice. My advice wait about 3-4 months before you decide to take it out because most likely the side effects will decrease. Also, make sure the "string" (which to my husband says feels like a wire) is cut short enough so it doesn't poke your significant other during sex.

column2: txpeach, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: OMG...I've had this thing for a week and I'm about to rip it out myself.  I've cried from the pain, vomited at least 6-7 times in a week!  I hate this thing and wish I would've never done it.  I've taken motrin, even feldene to help with the pain. I haven't had sexual relations with my husband from the fear of more pain.   This sucks---BTW I'm 38 and 0 pregnancies

column2: sass, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: WELL.. a girlfriend of mine had the mirena put in and i asked her how it felt? She explianed it to be like during intercourse when it feels the guy is in too far, but lasts for about 30 seconds to a minute and half... i was like i can deal with that. NO i cried and screamed i felt like the biggest baby! i even made the nurse hold my hand. IM NEVER HAVING CHILDREN! She spent about 30 minutes trying... It wouldn't go in! i gave up a few times ~ finally when it was in i felt i was going to pass out from exhausting my body from tensing up. I didn't realize they would dialate your cervix!!! Wow! i mean if you can get it in easily great but i have a friend that works at a gyno and she said no matter if you have a kid or not... IT HURTS! i cramped for over 3 days and now 3 weeks later my boobs feel like tender rocks and occasional random cramps. hopefully 1 month of mess will make the next 5 years easy.

column2: blondambition813, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today I went in to have the mirena iud put in. I am 28, no children. I was given this birth control option because I now have high blood pressure at a young age. The doctor prepped me for the iud. I had to take 2 tablets to put in my cheek i believe to dilate me a little better an hour before the procedure. In the room, the doctor injected me with a "novocaine" type injection to numb the pain since i had never had kids before. The pain I felt following that while she attempted to put the mirena in was unbelievable. She wasnt able to get the mirena iud in after a few attempts and told me I had to find another birth control. My cervix opening was too small and she was unable to insert it properly. So pretty much I went thru all the pain of the procedure with no results. I am back to a new pill now. Not all women will experience the pain I went thru, however I would suggest if you have NOT given birth before and you are getting an iud inserted, save yourself the pain and try to see if you can have your doctor check that the iud will fit properly into your body. Best of luck to those of you who are able to successfully get it inserted!

column2: Laurie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 24 year old woman with a 2 year old.  I had mirena put in after my little girl was born and it was fine.  My doctor explained to me that my cervix had already been expanded for the birth of my child, so inserting the mirena wasn't a big deal.  I cannot believe that some doctors would even consider allowing women without having given birth get the mirena put in.  I can't imagine how painful it would have been if I hadn't given birth a few months beforehand.  My only complaint is the irregular, strange periods that make me paranoid about being pregnant.  I am terrified of getting pregnant. Although my boyfriend and I would gladly welcome another baby, the complications of getting pregnant with mirena scare me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 44, I have 2 kids ages 18 & 21 years. I got my Mirena about 1 month ago. The first week was irritating because the inflamation from the insertion was causing a little cramping. I spotted a tiny bit and then it stopped. I feel great! I wish I had done this years ago! I have had some intermittant spotting but nothing I can't handle. I have always had a pretty healthy sex drive and I have to say that now it is better than ever! My husband loves it too! It put spontanaity back in our lives.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena placed 6 weeks after my c section in may of 2008. I have not stopped bleeding since it was put in. I have no idea if i have gotten my period. I have tried everything, taking birth control pills to get my cycle on track, pain meds, and just waiting it out. I have had problems with mood swings, feeling depressed, tired all the time,wieght gain 15lbs, itchy skin, bloated, consitpation, cramps all the time. the worst head aches of my life. I wanted to wait it out but nothing gets better. More and more side effects come with every day.

column2: Deserae, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: 2 years ago I, like others on here, had Mirena put in 6 weeks after having my youngest. I have gained 50 lbs. I have had maybe 3 days at a time without bleeding, and bleeding old looking, clumpy blood. but for the most part my period is 24/7. not to netion that the most effective way this is keepingme from getting pregnant is that I have absolutly no libido. Also wanted to add the depression and mood swings. And to top it all of my cousin just found out shes gotten herself PREGNANT even thought she had mirena put in about a year and a half ago.

column2: hsaund06, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: i got mirena two weeks ago it was painful been bleeding every since i started having pain in my lower right side and back went to the doctor thought i had a kidney infection turned out negative just looked up mirena on webmd and started reading comments turns out several people have these symptons cant take the pain calling obgyn first thing in the morning. wish i would have researched mirena before i got it

column2: Casey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got the Mirena two day ago, but I already love it. I am nineteen with no children and no plans on children any time soon. I had cramping for the twenty-four hours following the insertion, but that has gone away now. I am looking forward to five years of not worrying about unwanted babies. Knocking on wood that no complications arise.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm 24yrs old and got Mirena July of 08. There was no pain and my dr. was done in 1min. I had VERY irregular bleeding for the first 5months, but now I have VERY light peroids that last 2days. I have some cramping every now and again, but that is the only side effect that I have now. I have not lost my sex drive and am very pleased with this form of birth control. The reason I probably didn't have any pain with it being inserted is because my dr said its easier when its put in on your cycle. Im a mother of 2. Hope this helps!

column2: 1isenough, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had a Mirena IUD for 5 years and never had any complications. There have been no problems and I would recommend it to anyone that meets the requirements.  It is painful to have inserted but it is a quick procedure,(only a couple of minutes) and the cramping lasts a few hours after. The protection is wonderful and I have no worries about it failing. I also just had it removed and replaced with a new one the same day. It also helps control my problem with ovarian cysts and endometriosis.  Ask your doctor about that.

column2: Gigi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 35yr old mother of 1 child which is 6yrs old. I got mirena in June of 08. The 1st day it was put in I started cramping and spotting. I took advils and motrins. I bled off and on for about 3mths then i started getting a regular cycle. I have no problems with sex. A few minor cramps a week before my cycle but nothing serious to complain about. I like mirena so far and Im just waiting for the no period stage. I have not gain or lost any weight. I have a very active life and it has not slowed me down. I had back pains before mirena so I dont incorporate that as coming from this birth control. Im very sexually active with my mate and he still doesnt know that I have mirena. Rigth now Im satisfied!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have had the mirena for about 2 years now. when i got it inserted i did have cramping and i was spotting on and off. after about 3 months that all went away. i do get one or two SEVERE crams before im about to start my period but those are few and far between. i LOVED it up until recently. i have absolutly no sex drive, no energy, and i feel bloated all the time. when i do have sex it is really uncomfortable to the point where i just want it to be over with already. im getting it removed next week and hopefully things get better....

column2: melissa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had mirena put in on september 15,2008 and have been in pain ever since. I have also not stopped bleeding. My doctor says it takes 6 months for your body to adjust. column2: runningirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 36 year-old woman who does not plan to have children. I have tried many reliable hormone-based birth control options under the sun and always had a hard time with them - mood swings, depression, significant weight gain shortly after starting using these methods. 14 months after getting Mirena I went up 2 pants sizes and it seemed to have all caught up with me in the past 2-3 months. I always don't think it's natural for a woman not to have a period at all (it happened to me after 2 months). I feel constantly exhausted and my breasts are always tender. I can't even run anymore. 2 size bras up as well. I originally wanted the copper IUD but my dr told me my periods would be even heavier and the risks were not worth it. I am hoping to have mine removed this week.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena going on 4 years now. I have 3 children.  I love the fact that I have not had a period for 3 1/2 yrs, at first bled for about a month then went to occasional spotting. It did hurt putting in it nothing like childbirth though. Sometimes I have some discomfort when having sex. I get cramps, but overall I think it's worth it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

My first couple of periods lasted about two weeks and now have cut down to about a week, but I get constant spotting and headaches and get major cramps like two weeks before my period.  and come to find out that 10 months down the road of having mirena IM PREGNANT!

column2: Worried, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got the Mirena IUD inserted on Monday, February 9, 2009.  So far I have experienced back pain on the first day after the insertion and mild cramping is still is present.  I'm wearing a pantyliner just in case I start bleeding or spotting, but I have not noticed any bleeding. I have one child and it still hurt.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 24 year old African American, Im married and have a 21 month old son.  I have had problems with Mirena from time I got it put in aug 07.  My first "cycle" was about two months after and was very light and "dead" looking and it lasted about two weeks.  So I figured I would give it some time for my body to adjust...needless to say now feb 09 I currently have a cyst on my right ovary, lower back pain, joint pain, mood swings, fatige, headaches, bloating, no sex drive and I cramp for about two weeks before my "cycle" comes on (its still very light and last about a week now). But I must also say that I have had bad reactions to all alternative birth control currently out.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got my Mirena right about a month ago. I hadn't actually read any reviews on it until I got home that afternoon. I just want to give some people some hope! There are certainly more negative's on this than positive's! I will say this...it only took a minute or so for the doctor to do the procedure. The worst part of it was the fact that he dilated me a bit before doing it. I was uncomfortable but it cerainly wasn't unbearable. I cramped up mainly. But, I also had my 1 year old daughter sitting on my stomach while he was doing it! =0) So maybe that had something to do with it! I got home and for about 4 1/2 days I did have cramping. I took Advil liqui-gels (800mg) in the morning and then I would take a couple more in the afternoon. I used a heating pad when I was sitting or laying down. It went away. I haven't had any problems since then! Intercourse hasn't been uncomfortable and there haven't been any after effects...my husband said he could feel it for a second but it didn't bother him! Remember ladies...every woman is different different different! Give it a try, if you don't like it...you can always go back! Best of luck to all of you! (Jen...25 yrs. old)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm writing this review to set the record straight. First of all, I'm a 20 year old college student who has never had a child before. My doctor and I made the decision to go with Mirena because of complications with the birth control pill OrthoTriCyclen Lo.   After reading many negative reviews about Mirena- I was very hesitant to go through with getting it. I was so nervous I delayed getting it for two months. It's important to take into account that many of the people who leave reviews are people who have had a NEGATIVE experience with a drug/product. With this in my mind- I decided to give Mirena a shot. I went to the doctors office with all of these horrible ideas in my head (many women said that it hurt so bad they passed out/cried out in pain) THIS WAS NOT THE CASE.Remember it's important to have a good relationship with your gynecologist, let them know what you're expecting and they'll do their best to prepare you for anything that will happen. The procedure took no longer than ONE minute (despite some women saying it took 10 to 20 minutes), it was very quick and someone uncomfortable during insertion. I was able to drive home, and the pain was tolerable after with a few ibuprofen and bed rest. Basically I'm writing this to help women my age with the negative comments about Mirena. Everyone is different and you should really give it a try! I had Mirena inserted yesterday and there is no more cramping/pain. And as for the women who say that there is "brown gook" discharge- it's the antiseptic that the doctor puts in prior to insertion...which should go away with showering.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've had this almost a year. I have absolutely no sex drive.  Constant headaches, lower back pain, leg pain and joint pain.  I had it inserted seven years after my son's birth.  I had tried the depo and almost every pill available.  It was not very painful having it inserted and have extremely light bleeding, when I get bleeding.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena inserted after my first child.  Very painful.  After having it for several month started having horrible leg pain and joint stiffness of the lower extremities.  Gained 15#.  I was irritable, and just didn't feel like myself.  I started reading the reviews. My doctor tried to tell me that my symptoms were not related to the mirena.  I had it removed and the next day my mood was better.  I have no leg pain now and i am still trying to get my weight off.  this BC method was not for me.

column2: HighLow, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm 43.  Got Mirena in June 2008.  Bled lightly for about 3 months, and now nothing.  No period for 3 months.  Fine with me!  Feel great, diet is working and I've lost 22 pounds, I can check for it myself about every 2 weeks and I can find the strings.  No complaints.

column2: MandyLynn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had to have Mirena due to hypothyrodism. Mirena was not any more painful than a period cramp being inserted, and was done very quickly. The one thing that I did not like was that I bled very lightly for about 2 months, but was told that was normal. Other than that I say that it is so worth it and the best birth control ever.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Mirena has been in for 3 weeks. There was intense pain upon insertion - I nearly passed out, turned completely white and started shaking. The doc recommended that I make the appointment for 8 days following my period, as my cervix would be wide open and thus insertion would be less painful - couldn't imagine what it would have felt like at any other time of the month.After eating/drinking in the doc's office for about 20 minutes, all pain had subsided. Now - I have no bleeding/spotting, very minor cramping, no mood swings (yet).I'd recommend it - but also recommend asking the doc for some pain meds beforehand to help with the insertion.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Michelle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I'm going to give it a little more time, hopefully my body will adjust.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 25 without any children.  I decided to get mirena, since my insurance would cover the entire cost and I was tired of taking a pill everyday.  (I took Yasmin and Yaz for 6 years). The worst side effects have been acne, mood swings, and insomnia.  Fortunately, the acne and mood swings are starting to go away, now that I've had mirena for 4 months.

column2: jewel, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: weight gain, my hormones are out of control. I feel like i have lost all patience with everyone.

column2: melissa.cherry, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena in for a month. I did my research and felt it would benefit me. My tubes are tied but I have issues with my period.I'd been on Yaz for 2 years & I was fine. My doctor recommended the Mirena as I am approaching my mid 30's. I've had bloating cramping feeling since day 1. Also gained 5lbs in 4 weeks.I bled for 3 weeks. I'm having alot of discomfort after intercourse and problems with constipation and gas. I've also noticed more acne.  I'll see my doctor in 2 days and I'm gonna ask for it to be removed as some women with the side effects I'm having have had perforation.I'm glad it has worked for some women just not for me. It would have been more helpful it the makers of Mirena had been more informative of side effects. I have been taking 800mg of advil twice a day for a month and it doesn't help. Intercourse has been very uncomfortable for me, like I can feel it in there. Not to mention the severe bloating after intercourse. I hope that my doctor doesn't give me any argument about having it removed.I understand that everyone is different and Mirena works well for some, but after reading other women's testimonials I feel better knowing that I'm not the only one feeling miserable on this medication.

column2: myopinionmatters, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had no idea mirena would be so painful. If I would have known I never would have went threw with it! When it was put in it hurt and when I got home I couldn't even get up. column2: anh3s, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 23 year old mother of two and just had my 6 week postpartum check up today. I was told that I would have to still be bleeding for them to insert mirena, and although I still have not started they went ahead and put it in.  I have to say after reading reviews on here yesterday I was scared that it was going to hurt.  But honestly the only thing that was uncomfortable was the clamp that they used to open the cervix. Overall so far I am quite pleased and hope that things continue to go well with Mirena!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Great birth control method, but within 3 months of having my Mirena put in after the bith of my daughter, I ended up having a cyst on my ovary the size of a golf ball. column2: maria, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I had Mirena inserted on December 18, 2008. The insertion was horrible. I felt I was going to die, and was not prepared for the pain at all. The cramps were more than cramps. The rest of the day I felt lots of discomfort, and although I had just gotten over my period, it started all over again. The following week was better, some spotting every day, but not so bad. Last week I had my period again, it lasted 7 days. It finally went back to spotting on Monday.(today is Thursday). Today I went to the doctor since he wanted to see me a month after insertion. I told my doctor that my boyfriend complained about poking and some pain. (That was the first time we were intimate. After that he has said he feels something but its not so bad). I wanted to ask my doctor to cut the strings shorter and how long it would take for them to get soft enough. He said that cutting them short will make it more difficult for my boyfriend and will really "poke" him, plus at the time of removal, it would be very difficult. With my body temperature, it has already adjusted to the way it should feel, the doctor also said that the strings are doing what they are supposed to do, which is to "bend back, wrap around, etc". He also said that the spotting is due to the fact that as the IUD releases its medicine, it makes the lining of the uterus thin out, therefore it comes out in the form of spotting. He said to give it a few more months to see any changes in the spotting. So far my boyfriend and I rather have this than being on the pill, or using condoms. I had not been on the pill for over two years and my boyfriend and I could never be spontaneous, we had to make sure we had condoms and we had to plan things every time. Now things are very different, at least for now, we dont worry about pregnancy, if we want to be intimate we can do it worry free! I could not be on the pill because it makes me gain weight, and condoms are very uncomfortable, so our alternative here is so much better. I also

column2: SD, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the IUD put in approx. 6 wks after having my second child in 2007.  I am considering having it removed because i have found that I am having frequent yeast infections (which follow my period) and never had this issue before using Mirena.  While it's worry free birth control, I'm not sure it's for me.  I still have a period; though light I hate the fact that the discharge is dark in color.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena put in about 8 wks after my daughter was born in Dec 2007. I love this thing. I felt a small cramp when they inserted it and I got my period right after and it only lasted for a few days, but very light. My cycles quit coming since Nov 2008 and the only problem I've had with Mirena, is I've gained close to 25 lbs with it. I excercise on a daily basis and I eat really really healthy. But if you're looking for an effective birth control and you don't want pills or any other kind...Mirena is right for you.

column2: youlittlesqueek, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 25 year old mother of one who got the iud in may of 2007 it is now jan 2009 and I am having it removed in 2 weeks. It is nice to not have to take a pill daily but about three months after insertion I started getting urinary tract infections which have continued every month after my period since.  I do have very light periods, a panty liner a day, however it took some time for them to regulate.  There were times in the first few months that I WOULD BLEED for weeks at a time.  The insertion is painful however I don't think it was worse than child birth.  The pain afterwards lasted about two weeks and advil worked the best. Better than vicondin.  My dr tells me that this is due to advil suppressing uteren contrations. I have to say if you have problems remembering the pill and issues with depo than I think giving mirena a try is worth it. It was very conviniate and if it works for you it would be great.  I did also have large cysts on my ovaries also but they went away on their own.  Women need to remember too that we are all different, just because this didn't necessarily work for me doesn't mean it won't work for you.

column2: navybratsmama5, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 32 with 5 children. I chose this over getting my tubes tied because I'm afraid that I might regret doing that. I absolutely love having this type of birth control. I don't have to worry that I forgot a day and I can go about my business like I'm not even on birth control. Okay, I do get a little bit of pimples on my face now and then... I don't really like that part but I can live with it. My periods have been extremely light... light like meaning I don't even need to wear a panty liner light. I don't mind that at all. I haven't had any cramps, aches, or pains. And, best of all, I haven't gotten pregnant on it!I have gotten pregnant (in the infinite wisdom of my teenage years) using the "pull out" method (all you little girls learn something from me... "pulling out" does not work), I got a little smarter by using condoms and got pregnant again, decided the pill was the way to go and, guess what, got pregnant again, I got the norplant after my 3rd child and that worked only because I bled for 18 months straight before having it removed. My 4th child was planned and that was really nice. And then I went on the patch, well, needless to say I have baby #5 sitting on my hip. Don't get me wrong I love all my babies but, you know, I would have loved to have planned them all. Yes, I have been called fertile myrtle many times and I think this time we finally chose the right way to go. I would and have recommended this to friends, especially those who are like me and not want to do any permanent damage. Having the choice to decide together if and when to have or not to have another child is awesome.So, overall I say this is definitely the best out there.

column2: AlyK, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had this put in shortly after my son was born. I had absolutly no pain, and only minor cramps after.
