column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in a little over a month ago.  I've never had a child, but the dr reccomended it because of my endometriosis.  The insertion was very painful, not gonna lie.  I yelped a little and had a few tears.  BUT she told me exactly what i would feel.. a pinch, poke, cramp etc...  It was in in under 3 minutes.  I was a little dizzy so i layed there for a few minutes.  She gave me a script for some pain meds.  by the time I left the Pharmacy 20 min. later all I felt was a little discomfort.  The rest of the day i relaxed and used a heat pad.  The next day I felt OK just a little tired.  After that all was fine.  Spotted for about 2 weeks, very light though.  And no period so far.  The only pain I've had since insertion is from a current cyst I had before insertion.  Great for me, I love it!

column2: Missdetroit08, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It felt like I was giving birth everyday, I was on 3 pain medications for 1 1/2 months! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone! I couldn't care for my newborn or even hold her because of the pain!

column2: messyjessy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 25 with a 6 year old, got pregnant on the pill was using ortho-patch for the past 5 years. Didn't have insurance paid like $500 for this to get put in which was very pratical considerin the patch was $50 a month. I enjoy not having to think about birth control. After insertion, I had severe pain and cramping, the Dr. told me it shouldn't hurt that bad, Yes he was a man! Duh! Anyway, I think the sorfter the cervex like on your period the easier for insertion and maybe less pain. about 2 -3 days later I was bac to normal.My boyfriend did say he could feel the strings, but no big deal. I used to have a 7-8 day cycle every 28-30 days, now I have a 3 day flow once a month. LOVE THAT!I have had an acne problem since I got pregnant 7 years ago, but have noticed a lil more than usual like on my back and shoulders, which I didn't have before.I don't think I had an excessive weight gain, I mean I got it in March 2007 and just noticed some weightgain due to the colder weather and the Holidays, so I can't say I think it's the device.Overall I like it, I am however, concerned about getting it taken out and what will happen then, 5 years is a long time.

column2: Rayn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm 23 with one child. When they put it in at my six week postpartum visit, if felt as though they were breaking my water all over again! After about an hour, though, the pain went away and I was pretty happy with it because I didn't have a period at all. If you are considering Mirena, be sure to not only read their website's warnings, but also read other peoples comments before deciding Mirena is for you. I'm having mine taken out because I recently sat down to think about my health over the past 11 months while I was on Mirena, and I have discovered that symptoms I have had over the last year that had unknown causes may be due to Mirena. I won't find out for sure until I get it removed and see how my body reacts, but these are a few symptoms I have experienced (though, not all at once): weight gain / bloating (looking six months pregnant), uncomfortable vaginal dryness, lack of sex drive, painful sex, headaches, mood changes / swings, memory loss / forgetfulness, and even an unexplainable thyroid cyst that had to be surgically removed. I am considering using ParaGard instead since it does not rely on hormones to prevent pregnancy. I'm hoping it will be a better choice than Mirena. While Mirena is effective and easy to use, personally, I am dissatisfied with it. The negative side effects outweigh the benifits, and I am opting to go without the hormones... I've always thought adding things to your body that aren't naturally there probably isn't a good idea, anyway. Good luck on your decision!

column2: jport, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had mirena put in about 8 months ago right before i got married, i had had problems with other birth controls so it seemed like a good choice, even though i hadn't had a baby. Insertion was so painful, i had terrible cramps for the next month, and lots of bleeding. Months later i have spotting all the time, no sex drive, acne, head aches, I don't feel like myself! I had it removed today and i am so excited to have me back! I told my doctor about the loss of libido and she said it shouldnt come from mirena, but sounds like on here it does. do your research!

column2: Betty1234, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

It works- because Im not pregnant but I feel a little bit dissapointed in the side effects. I also have bleeding during intercourse which is a huge nuisance. I am going to keep it in for a couple more months to see if it gets better but if not, I may have to weigh options!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IU inserted nearly 2 years ago after the birth of our second child.  The discomfort when it was inserted was minimal and I've not had any issues. column2: Hope, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am completely satisfied with Mirena! I had it inserted 18 months ago after the birth of my second child, because I want to wait a few years before even thinking about another child.  I had always used the pill, but Mirena is so much more convienent and worry-free(and, in the long run, much cheaper than the pill). The insertion was pretty uncomfortable, but it was in place within a few minutes.  I experienced some mild cramping for about a day or two(like period cramps), then after that I didn't feel anything at all.  And, best of all, I rarely get a period.  When I do, it's just spotting that lasts about a day.  I have never experienced any unpleasant side effects from this drug and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Wow...I've had so many out of wack things go on with me, and I NEVER thought it was due to this little evil device. I gave birth to my first child and got pregnant with twins 6weeks later. I made the decision to get off the pill and onto this since I refused to chance another pregnancy anytime in the near future and could be forgetful with the pill. GREAT idea right? I have fybromylgia and have had very low points with it...but it has been nothing compared to this. I am probably twice as fatigued than normal which was already all the time practically. I am losing so much hair. My normally "always ready to go" sex drive was gone and I didn't even realize it, because I was so irritated all the time. I've been called one of the most patient and "kind" people anyone has ever met until this thing took over my life. I've been absolutely irrational for the past several months and didn't know what changed all of a sudden to cause this. Then the other day I flashed back to reading my "warning" pamphlet when I got this evil thing and remembered the hormone being different from anything I've ever taken...and then the light bulb when off in my head. I'm used to getting bad migraines which I regularly have, but are aggrevated by most pills...so I asked the doc about it, never did I think to be concerned about all of this. I've had the IUD for about 7 months now, and I believe that I have spotted everyday. I have breast pains, as if I were needing to breastfeed. Nausea- sometimes to the point where I took a preg test. I'm 27, have never had a pimple and have had 2 zits in my life...now I break out with all of these little aliens (?). My back pain-horrible. Fibromylgia is NO fun, but I even learned to cope with it-with NO meds outside of a motrin here and there. This thing though???? I'm so glad I decided to check these reviews. I had NO idea...Calling the doc tomorrow as soon as I wake up!

column2: jjr, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for one year now.  I've had 4 ultrasounds this year, two confirmed ovarian cysts over 2 cm, which have since gone away.  I have constant aching in my low back, in front of my pelvic bone, sometimes it extends down my right leg and migrane headaches, which I take tylenol about 1-2x per week.  (I only take it if I have to.)  I have no sex drive at all and rarely orgasm any more.  I constantly have one big pimple or "boil" like I used to get when I was a preteen, I'm now 32.  As soon as my husband gets his vasectomy, I am getting it removed.  I've tried to get it removed, but my FNP resists, stating, "you are just going through a phase."  The good news is that I don't have a period, at all.  Yes, it is a reliable form of birth control, but I don't like it, I miss my old self!

column2: lushlygrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Have had Mirena for one year now.  Like others, I had it inserted before I read actual patient reviews, which had me quite scared.  I am pleased to say that I have not had any reactions.  I had major depression/ mood swings, weight gain, and acne while on DepoProvera and was scared to have the same reaction as the hormone released by Mirena is the same. I may have some weight gain, but I was overweight to begin with.  Insertion was a bit painful with cramping for a few days, but no cramping and no periods since.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Insertion was NOT FUN.  However I got through it and then read all the reviews on this site and was scared to death.  After a month I have not lost any hair, gained any weight or any of the other horrific side effects I read about.  The insertion was like a regular pap smear with severe menstrual cramps.  That lasted about five minutes.  If you have a high threshold for pain it won't even phase you.  My "period" this month is almost non-existent.  If you've ever taken any kind of birth control pill then you are already used to the possible side effects.  I would highly recommend it - and also recommend you stop reading the user reviews as they will scare you, possibly for no reason.

column2: suecee1020, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am the mother of 4 and my husband had a vasectomy so I wouldn't have to take the pill. I have a strong family history of breast cancer and heart disease. I went to the doc for heavy bleeding. I was bleeding through tampons and pads in 1/2 hour. I went for an ultra sound and biopsy. I was suppose to have a D&C and the doc said she couldn't get OR time. She had the mirena in her hand. She had already decided she was using it.  so without the test results she inserted the mirena. I was talked into it by the doc and nurse. She has one and it's great.  I never saw any info or side affects until it was in. My fault!! I asked and was told it was safe. There was not other word the nurse did most of the talking. It didn't bother me going in  but, I have leg pain back pain, headache, cramps, my breast and armpits  feel swollen, no sex drive and I have a wonderful husband. Why are these docs pushing this?? I called and wanted it removed. She wants me to go for another ultra sound to check location. I said I just want it out! Why would anyone put this into a woman 50yrs old who has a strong history of breast cancer and heart disease?? I can't wait next week it is coming out.  Ps Test were normal.  Do your research

column2: garysbabygirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i had this put in late 2007 after my youngest daughter was born.i am 21 and have 2 baby girls.they are 16 months apart& i decided i was finished having kidssince i couldnt afford to have my tubes tied and no1 would do it because of my age.mirena seemed like a little too good to be true.insertion was a little painful but nothin i couldnt handle.i mean come on girls we had kids for gods sake...and trust me it doesnt even compare.i do bleed a litle after sex but it doesnt bother my partner to any great extent and it doesnt make a mess or anything.my sex drive has probably increased if anything.i have read so many negative reviews here.Its not all bad.i do have some somache pain and the occasional downer days but nothing that really affects my life too bad.i do recomend going ahead and having the strings trimmed as soon as they put it in too many people say that their partners feel this.ihave had the strings trimmed and havent really had a problem since.i do also recommend having appointments wih your doctor on a regular basis just to keep things checked out and be safe.and about the feminine odor this can also be remedied with a good possibly prescription wash.i'm not pregnant and i only bleed after sex and i do need a little more rest than i used to need,and i have had a slight weight gain and i can eat more than i used to be able to but my man still loves me and thinks i am as sexy as i always was but overall I LOVE THIS THING!!!good luck and give it a try!~

column2: kee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: cycle stays on too long.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 27yrs old, 1 child, insertion 1yr ago. After much research on mirena I decided it was worth the possible side effects. Insertion was right after my period, and was quite painful but not unexpected nor was it debilitating for me.  It seems so long ago that Im not sure I remember original side effects except spotting and cramping.  After about the 1st/2nd month I no longer had a period but I still experience monthly PMS symptoms including cramps, breast tenderness and body ache. I have several medical concerns but did not relate them to Mirena until reading reviews. Side effects POSSIBLY related: weight gain (25lbs), depression, hip pain (joint), fatigue, loss of energy, acne, mood swings, random spotting with sex. I say possible because I have had several very big life changes during the past year, including a new climate. I did have to have the string trimmed as it was poking my partner making sex very painful & impossible for him.  Pros: no daily pill, no monthly RX cost, no pregnancy, no period, ability to have it removed if we want more children.  I am not considering early removal unless side effects worsen or when Im ready to try for more children. I have recommended this product to friends. I think the review complaints are very valid and anyone should consider all options before making this decision. Good luck and I hope this review is usefull.

column2: mirena, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i love it i haven't had a period in 5 months it is great    little worried about menopause

column2: doyourresearch, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Due to a small hole in my heart, I had to find a non-estrogen method of b.c. to limit the risk of blood clots and strokes. My new doctor suggested the Mirena. She has one and "loves it." Well, I do believe many women have the product and love it. However, I know from experience that doctors are not educated enough on the true percentages of side effects vs. what the company advertises, nor are they educated enough on who the "right candidate" is for this product. I had never given birth to a child, I am not married, so just with those two descriptions I do not fit the company's "ideal candidate". Regardless, I made a HUGE mistake of trusting my doctor without doing my own research and let her insert it at the same visit in which she suggested it. The insertion was horrible (I can handle pain, I've had many surgeries) and I nearly passed out. I had to stay at the doc office for 30 minutes before driving and was sick to my stomach for 2 days. I gained 20 lbs within the first 6 months (while working out and watching my nutrition!). I have experienced a whole different kind of acne - cysts - on my face. I also had depression/anxiety. I was constantly tired, no motivation, and loss of desire. Unfortunately for me, my work life was so stressful and since my doc didn't tell me about any of these potential side effects, I didn't know that the Mirena was likely the #1 cause of these new issues in my life! After seeing my family doc a few times, seeing my girl doc once, and doing my own research, I had it removed after just over 1 year of insertion. I immediately lost 7 lbs within the first month. Felt energized. No more random pains. Face is clearing up... In summary --- do your research on Mirena in more places than your doc office and than on their inaccurate website. Ask around. Read everything. Good luck.

column2: dissapointed, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put in Feb of 2008.  It has been 9 months of constant bleeding, foul odor, heavy bleeding after sex, no sex drive, headaches, insomnia along with fatigue, lots of pelvic and back pain, heaviness in the vaginal area, and now to top it off, tried to have it removed and the string was missing.  The IUD had embedded itself in to my uterus and I have to have surgery to remove it.  DON'T GET IT!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was really painful the first day. Lots of cramps but after that no pain. I bleed for about 3 weeks and haven't bleed since. I love it. Saves money on monthly prescription costs.

column2: mom of 2 boys, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well I had Mirena inserted just over 1 month ago. It has been great!!! I have had 1 period that lasted about 10 days, only had very light bleeding, hardly enough to wear a pad. Light enough to have sex whenever I wanted. My husband cant feel the string. The only side effect Iam having is feeling tired. When I read about other women complaining about this, I thought there is no way this could be a side effect of the birth control. I have worked in a pharmacy for 14 years and have never seen this as a birth control side effect. Would not have guessed I would have that side effect. I forget I have only had Mirena in for just over 1 month. It seems like it has been all I have every used. It has been great. I would recommend this type of birth control.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I got this about 8 weeks after I had my first baby (Jan. '07).  I have a low pain tolerence and all I felt when they inserted it was cramping and a little pain.  I spotted for about a day.  In October of '07 i was having a little pain in my side and i checked the string and they were not there so i called the dr and he ordered an ultrasound and come to find out it had slipped back some so i went to the dr and had that one taken out and another one inserted in the same visit and have had zero problems with it since.  Every month about two weeks before i start i get some cramping but nothing that i can't handle, other then that i have had zero side effects.  I would recommend this product to everyone but remember you can't go off of what other people's experiences are everyone has different pain tolerences and think different things hurt.  I would say try it and if you don't like it you can always have it removed.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 47 years old and got the mirena to help with my heavy periods. It was very painful to put in. Since I have had it in I have come down with an itchy skin rash, cramps, headaches and neausa I am looking to get it out soon.

column2: ALICIA B, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'M A MOM OF 3 AND IN MY MID 30'S. I GOTTEN THE MIRENA IU IN OCT. '08. IT WAS VERY UNCOMFORTABLE TO ME WHEN IT WAS BEING PLACE INTO ME. BUT ONCE IT WAS OVER I DIDNT FEEL ANY PAIN. THERE WERE SOME LIGHT BLEEDING AFTER IT WAS PLACE BUT SOON STOP THE NEXT DAY. ON OCT. 20 I STARTED MY PERIOD AND BEEN ON IT TIL NOW WHICH IS NOV. 20. I BEEN BLEEDING FOR AN MONTH NON STOP. I'M DIZZY, SLEEPY, SOME HEADACHES, NO ENERGY TO DO ANYTHING. I HAVE AN 9 MOS OLD TO CARE FOR AND SOMETIMES I CAN'T DEAL WITH HER CAUSE OF HOW I'M FEELING. I CALLED MY DOCTOR AND THEY TOLD ME ITS ALL NORMAL. WHAT I SHOULD'VE DONE WAS DID SOME RESEARCH ON THIS BC BEFORE I WENT AND GOT IT DONE. AS FOR INTERCOURSE I CAN FORGET ABOUT THAT FOR NOW. I HAVE TO WAIT TIL 3 MOS TO PAST BEFORE I CAN BECOME SEXUAL ACTIVE AGAIN. THE ONLY GOOD THING I LIKE ABOUT THIS BC THAT I DON'T HAVE TO WAKE UP AND TAKE A PILL AND HOW MANY YEARS IT LASTS. BUT GUESS I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS BC TO FRIENDS. IF ANY FEMALES WANT TO TRY THE MIRENA, ITS UP TO YOU. I HAVN'T HAD ANY CRAMPS YET BUT I HAD ALL THE OTHER SIGNS.

column2: kylie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had my mirena for about 6months i've only had 2 periods and they were very light. the insertion was uncomfortable but not painful about like cervical cancer screening only for an extended period of time. So far no problems i have a little acne which i have never had before but other than that it's been great!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I decided to get Mirena because I am in my 30s now and smoke and have very heavy painful menstral cycles.  If I had known how painful this was going to be I would have never done it.  I have a strong threshold too.  I have felt completely dysfunctional ever since insertion a month ago.  Some issues I thought unrelated but after reading reviews on here I am not so sure.  I have been dizzy and exhausted, the cramps I have EVERY DAY are worse than my normal cramps, I have severe lower back pain and even pain and cramping in my legs.  I just don't feel like myself at all and taking 800 mg Ibuprofen twice a day every day for pain is not my idea of fun.  Plus that only remedies one of the many problems I am experiencing.  I am having removed next week and cannot wait.  Like all things this is not what everyone will experience but just sharing mine.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena in for, as of next week, 5 years. I have loved it until recently. This month I have constant strong spotting, just non-stop. I thought maybe it was "wearing out", but none of the information suggests that is really possible. Then I started reading the web. I'm not a reactionary person - I wish someone had some basic research on whether these side effects are more common with Mirena. But I've had more than usual trouble with depression (a life-long issue, so I thought nothing of it), developed an anxiety disorder, have terrible acne (well, for me), back pain (which I feel sure is unrelated), and weight gain (which I figured was getting older). I have to get it out anyway, but after all I've read I don't think I'll get it again. My insertion, for what it is worth, was fine.

column2: Trell, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my Mirena inserted about 9 months ago now.  I talked to my doctor about having it inserted and he consigned the idea.  I have irregular, heavy periods lasting about 7 days with bad cramping.  I was given a many pamphlets and testimonials from women who all said it was the most wonderful thing.  I even read that it was painful getting it put in, but the results were worth it.  The doctor who did the procedure told me there would be mild discomfort and any symptoms would go away within three months.Therefore, I decided to have the Mirena inserted.  The insertion was very painful, but nothing I could not handle.  Fifteen minutes after it was over, I was doubled over in pain.  I had to call my finance to come and pick me up from the doctors office.Since I have had the Mirena, I have been having about 2 -3 periods a month lasting about 5 days.  They are certainly lighter than before, but they are extremely painful now.  I feel tired all the time, I feel like I want to throw up a lot.  I am very moody and worst of all my stomach cramps so bad, sometimes I just cry because the pain is so bad it sends shooting pain down my leg.  I also have bad acne beginning on my forehead and my jawline. I would not recommend this to anyone.

column2: Stacey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I experienced great pain upon insertion and the week following, after the pain subsided, I thought I had a great birth control, until my check up,  my doctor informed me that my iud was missing!! I had a ultrasound and a x-ray only to discover my iud did in fact perforate my uterus and entered my stomach! Tomorrow I will be in surgery to have it removed!  I actully consider myself lucky not to be pregnant, and this is why I rated the effectivenss the way I did!! If I had to do it again, I probably would, considering the facts, this only happens to a small precentage!!!

column2: fgh, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: not happy

column2: emmam, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been very happy with Mirena. After trying a million different types of birth control, I finally found Mirena and have been using it for 2 years. I have, however, been experiencing severe abdominal pain on and off for the past year. Doctors have not been able to say whether or not this pain is because of Mirena, but I did have it in for almost a year before my first pelvic pains began.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i love my iud, i got it after having my son via c-section in 2004, i felt light cramping at insertion. i did have to go back in to have the strings trimmed as my boyfriend could feel them during intercourse. i sometimes feel cramping during sex but nothing too serious just a little uncomfortable, i do not have a period and if i do i only spot lightly, i have had some weight gain approx 5-10 lbs but im also on lexapro which also may be the culprit. im due to have it replaced in jan 2009 and unless its god awful to have removed im am planning on getting it again. hope this helps ive read all the horror stories and wanted you to know not everyones experiance has been bad.

column2: alyssajane, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i've had the mirena for about 20 months now and have had problems the entire time. insertion was horribly painful!! it started out at shooting pains that would almomst drop me to the ground. lately, it has just been painful all together. it feels like it is poking me and makes my ovaries ache. i get my period 2-3 times a month and i am always in a lot of pain the day before it comes. i have had hormonal acne on my chin. the big under the skin lumps that are there for a month. i finally decided to have it removed and went to the doctor yesturday. she could not find the strings, so she went in with forceps and poked around in there (also VERY painful) still couldn't find them. so i have to go in for an ultrasound to make sure it even in there. if it is, the have to dialte my cervix and poke around in there again. if it isn't, they will have to remove it sergically. this thing has caused me so much pain!!! my advice: DO NOT TAKE THE CHANCE OF THIS HAPPENING TO YOU!! i seriously just want to cry thinking about what this thing has put me through

column2: the7thbaby, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well I have had the Mirena for 6 months now. Due to family history my most extreme side effects have been unbearable I have developed Alopecia Areta (my hair falling out in bald patches) which is genetic in my family and is set into motion by the hormones in the Mirena. Along with gaining 25 lbs that I lost after child birth. And acne that I have never had before, I have tried many things most of which had worked for me for years now and cannot even help a little that along with the hair falling out I will be talking to my doctor about removal ASAP I am undergoing treatment for the Alopecia and it hasen't helped yet I hope by removing the Mirena it will start to work. My family also has many other health problems that limit my birth control options to three: and IUD, depo and the mini pill I thought the IUD was the easiest option for me So just if you have ANY family history of Alopecia or any other Auto Immune Diseases I advise against the Mirena.Thanks so much I hope it turns out well for you!!

column2: jeweles, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena put in about 6 Mos. ago. It was recommended by a relative. The insertion was so painful. I could possibly compare to the first stage of labor. I had light bleeding for 24 hrs. The bleeding has stopped and I haven't had a period for 3 mos.. Which is Awesome. The bad thing is i was losing weight prior to Mirena and now i have put on 5lbs in 6 mos. (NOT GOOD). I also have headaches and never had headaches before Mirena so that's another side effect I don't like. My sex drive is low and I suffer from lower back pain. Overall i am somewhat satisfied.I will give it another 6 mos and see how it goes..more weight gain ..it coming OFFF!....

column2: kim2882, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was wondering if anyone had any problems with embollisms or small blood clots and smoking with this product. It has been great until my DR thought these red lumps on my feet were small blood clots.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena put in 9 mths ago and am getting it removed next week. I hate the thing, the side effects are horrible. Headaches which I have never had before, I have gained 30 pounds which I have always been thin my whole life, I have always had a really good sex drive but have no interest in sex since getting this inserted, mood swings, tired all the time even after sleeping 9 hours, i have a period two weeks out of the month every month, a strange odor down there especially after sex. Have to wear a pantyliner everyday because of spontanueos bleeding through out the month. I can not wait to get this thing removed.

column2: katskin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After an extremely painful insertion, I spent a month cramping and bleeding (lightly, but still bleeding) and had it removed.  I have never had breast tenderness or cramping with my periods and now, two months later, I am still having severe breast pain and cramping, plus I have broken out in severe acne and gained weight, and for the month I had the device, I had chapped lips which began to go away the very day I had it removed. I have never had so much pain and would have cramps that would cause me to double over. It may be for some, but not for me!  I wish I had read the reviews for this thing first, before I spent over $900 for the insertion and the removal and wasted a month of my time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am neither for or against this product. I'm going on my 10th month after insertion. I am 29 & have 3 kids. Pros: Painless insertion, no more heavy periods, and of course very effective as birth control. Cons: constant spotting, light bleeding everytime after sex, tiredness, weight gain, unusual vaginal odor, and frequent cramping. I will probably be removing this device after much consideration and will be seeking a more permanent birth control procedure. Since every person is different my side effects may not necessarily afflict anybody else. Good luck to all.

column2: mom of 2 boys, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After the birth of my second son, I needed a birth control that was semi-permenent, but was reversible. I choose Mirena, after researching other types of birthcontrol. It has been the perfect birthcontrol for me so far. I had it inserted on Thursday Oct. 23, 2008. I had a small amount of cramping during the procedure, but nothing too bad. I had just started my period the day before, so I was bleeding heavily. After the procedure my bleeding all but stopped. I did not have any cramping after the procedure. So far every thing as been wonderful. I am prone to get migrane headaches and so far no headaches, just some loss of appitate, but that is ok since I have not lost all the baby weight yet. I hope this review helps somebody. Everyone is different and reacts to medications differently.

column2: metacognition, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This IUD is great! It was put in two days ago. I am 22 and have never had kids. The insertion was very uncomfortable with serious cramping but not painful. The cramps remained for about a day, then a day of "tenderness" and now I almost feel nothing, plus my period has stopped. I can run, jump, lean over and bend without feeling it. And I've got 99.9% birth control protection! Take that, nature!I will have to wait six months to see if there are any side effects but the Mirena has been excellent so far! Ignore all of those negative rants on the internet - people blame anything on this little IUD and some birth control is not for everyone. If you experience major symptoms in the first six months you can always have it taken out. Also those horror stories about insertion seem to be rare or exaggerated - I was kind of nervous based on what I've read but everything worked out fine for me and I did not take ANYTHING beforehand or receive anything to numb the cervix. Give it a try and see what you think (especially if you get insurance coverage like me - I paid $40 for birth control a year LOL! I am ecstatic to have this IUD. I will update it in a few months if I get any side effects. Since I already have serious PMS that results in acne, depression, bloating, and half of the symptoms that 5% of Mirena users experience, I figure that this IUD could not actually make things much worse and might even improve them if it stops my period like in 20% of users. We'll have to wait and see!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 20 years old. Have no children and currently no desire to have any. My primary care dr and I discussed the risks of Mirena and I had been thinking about getting it for 6 months. I have a heart condition that is genetic and am scared to death of giving birth so I would really like to adopt when I am older. i have been on depo for 3 years and i'm currently not sexually active. Also my insurance is up at the end of Nov of this year so mirena seemed to be an excellent solution. So my gyno said he thought I had made a good choice and we scheduled it. I had it put in monday 10/20/08 it took 30 minutes. I nearly passed out during the procedure. had severe cramping, i wanted to die. the pain is now worse. i was taking 800mg ibuprofen every 6 hrs, i am now on lortab every 4. I am so swollen i cannot even check for the string. Pay attention when they say Mirena is NOT for everyone and make sure you are well informed before making the decision to get it. I am going in tomorrow to have it checked and most likely removed. I cannot even stand for five minutes without hunching over in pain. May be good for some, but not for me!

column2: yashira, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: i'm on my second iud. I got my first one removed in october (after 4 yrs and 11 months). I love the fact that my period are very light,i Don't like the headaches. The first time i had it inserted i was 16 or 17, my doc resisted told me to w/depo. She told me i was too young didn't have kids. I insisted on having it placed, the procedure took about 15 mins, i had light cramping and spotting. having it removed took about 5 mins no pain. In april i had it reinserted very different experience. I switched providers and the process took about 45 min she couldn't get it in, she stated that it was cuz i hadn't given birth. I explained that i had it before with out any problems. After it was inserted everything is okay.. Very pleased with results

column2: AC in Illinois, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 29yr old Mother of two (5yr&4mth old)I got the Mirena put in October 16,2008... I was on my cycle ....OH my the insertion of the Mirena  VERY PAINFUL..it takes about 10 to 15 min to get it in but it hurts I had cramping and discomforting pain only during the procedure but after I was fine, I felt gross due to being on my cycle as requested by my doctor. I took a 600mg ibprofen after but thats it.. I did have a little itching after and still now (nothing major)  my cycle lasted two days longer but everything is fine no cramping,back pain etc.. I actually feel better then before I have a burst of energy as if my hormones has changed(maybe its just me)but even my fiancee thinks my attitude has changed since Mirena and I really feel different like two days after I got it, so far I read all the reviews and the majority on here where negative but I made the decision to try it for myself each women is indeed different and I didnt have alot of the problems that some of these women had after insertion only time will tell but so far so good. I will keep you posted if anything changes I LIKE MY DECISION I feel like it was worth the pain

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena 6 wks after having my last baby. The insertion was uncomfortable and I cramped for the rest of the day but by the next morning the cramping was gone and I started light bleeding which lasted for 3 months. The bleeding was more of a nusance than a problem in any way. My husband could also feel the strings so my doctor cut the strings shorter. She said that she has  only had to do this for one other person.  I had it in for 3 years and I love the fact that the whole time I didn't have to worry about any birth control. I am not the best at remembering pills so this was great. And did I mention 3 years of no worries!!! When we decided to get pregnant again I went in to take it out and they weren't able to do it in the office and because of the strings being short. I ended up having to go to "surgery" just so they could put me out and look a little harder without me feeling any pain. (Don't worry. there wasn't any actual cutting or anything.) I would actually prefer we had gone straight to this method because it was completely painless and I got to take a little nap with it.  Although the insertion and removal were uncomfortable I will definitely do it again. The benefits way out number the negatives.

column2: kelley, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this happens to be the best birth control you stop having periods and you don't have to remember to take a pill or a shot it is there for the 5 years. it works excellent

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena removed yesterday.  I had it for a little over a year and am SO glad to have it out of me!  The insertion was a breeze but the side effects were a killer.  My husband could FEEL the string for the first 2 or 3 months, talk about a buzz kill.  He said it felt like barbed-wire.  My normal very high sex drive took a nose dive...had hardly no interest.  Then started the odor from "down below"....but only after sex.  Never in my life had I EVER had an "odor" issue.  It was horrible...after tests for infections and so on my Dr chalked it up to "hormonal" chages deep with in.  The only thing I could relate it to was the IUD.  Needless to say I cant wait for my body to retun to normal.  I've gained about 10 pounds on it and feel lucky to have any hair left!  It falls out constantly!  The great side of the IUD was no periods...I did have frequent spotting but no cramps or anything like that.  My husband and I will be TTC in the next few months and after that he's getting snipped so I will just go back to BC pills to help with my cycle.

column2: amhoult, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been using Mirena for 3 years, 5 months now and it has more positives for me than negatives.  I have two children and don't plan on having any more.  Periods have always been UNBEARABLE for me and often left me doubled over in pain.  No need to worry about forgetting to take a pill with Mirena, little to no periods and it's good for five years.  Can't get much better than that!  The biggest complaint I've had after being on it for three years is increased discharge or vaginal fluid/moisture, especially upon getting up in the morning.  Feels like I'm wetting my pants!  The only other (minor) complaint is that what little periods I have (actually for me periods=spotting) is unpredictable.  For the most part, periods have almost stopped completely since the second year of use.  All in all Mirena is my #1 choice and I HIGHLY recommend it for all women!!!

column2: mama08, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD put in 6wks after the birth of my 3rd child. It did not hurt. I had spotting for 3 months after. But since the bleeding stoped I had some cramps.After intcrose They became so bad I had to go the ER. The IUD had become upside down and side ways. It was painful to move.Once it was put back in place. All pain stoped. I love the bc methode. But I do not want to go throught that again!!

column2: me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 35 and the mother of a 5 yr. old.  After having my daughter, I started using the patch, since I was breastfeeding, I could not take the pill.  After finding out about all the problems associated with the patch, I went back on the pill within a year.  My doctor advised me at my last visit that since I am a smoker and have reached the age of 35, they will no longer give me the pill because it will increase my chances of having a stroke.  Mirena is what they suggested and after asking a million questions, the doctor convinced me this was the way to go.  When asked if there was any pain associated with the insertion, I was told I would feel some cramping.  Exactly 2 weeks ago, I had the Mirena inserted and 'some cramping' was putting it mildly!  I would have at least appreciated being told that the level of pain varies by person, I think I would've been more prepared.  The insertion went fine, only took about 10 minutes, but afterward, I felt faint and nauseous and had to wait a while before leaving the office.  It subsided after a couple of hours and was just normal cramping after that, for a few days.  I have been bleeding lightly since and it has been 2 weeks.  Just yesterday, I had a dizzy spell and felt very nauseous last night before bed.  I didn't think anything of it until I read most of these reviews, now I'm wondering if it's related to the Mirena.  I will see how things go in upcoming weeks, I am certainly not willing to deal with a 4 month long cycle or bleeding heavily after sex with my husband.  I never had a problem remembering to take my pill, so unfortunately for me, this was the only way to go unless I quit smoking.  I am not totally against it, to each his own, definitely give it a chance if you have a hard time remembering to take your pill, but be prepared and do your research.  I'm surprised I even tried this, the thought of anything foreign in my body creeps me out, I wouldn't be surprised if my body rejects it.

column2: mommy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: AWFUL PRODUCT.  IM AM BLEEDING SO HEAVILY AFTER HAVING IT PUT IN.  I AM BREASTFEEDING BY BABY EXCLUSIVLY THAT IS ONLY 9 WEEKS OLD AND HAVING BEEN BLEEDING FOR 3 WEEKS STRAIGHT AFTER THEY PUT IT IN.  I SHOULD NOT BE HAVING PERIODS LIKE THIS DUE TO BREASTFEEDING.  CAUSES HEADACHES AND CRAMPING.  I HATE THIS PRODUCT.  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT.

column2: j-bean, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was not prepared for the pain of having it inserted, yikes!  I was on the depo for 7 yrs, and needed to get off in case of bone density issues, none of which my doctor ever mentioned could even be a concern to me!!  Thanks for that, Doc!!  Side Effect-I have been getting very strange acne on my forhead, not zits but more like a semi-permenant acne rash, plus my head has been getting severe acne, which infects my hair follicles and scalp condition.  I havne't had my period for many years except for one miserable week switching bc methods.  My main concern and I read the entire blog to find out about this.  I have a problem worring about the IUD coming out.  My cervix moves around(in depth) and sometimes the "string" (really a sharp plastic pokey, that no one actually descibes)sticks out farther than at other times.  This constant checking and worrying makes me extremely paranoid.  I already have depression and am overwieght (my whole life) and had a decreased sex drive since the Depo 7 yrs earlier.  I hope the side effects will clear up in time, you DO have to get used to new meds,(I should know, I take Tons!)  It may be worth trying, I would recommed try, but be warned.

column2: deenaathena, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Mirena starts with a non-pleasent insertion and never ending cramps, ive had it for 6 months, constant bleeding, back pain, acne, weight gain, bleeding after sex, my partner can feel the string, positive pregnancy tests im gladly removing my mirena tomorrow, with hopes of non complication.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My experience with this was horrible. I had it only for a week and I bled all over the place. My doc was upset because it was a waste of money to him. I developed huge blood clots and no matter how many times i changed my pad or tampon 5 minutes later it was full. I passed out at work because i would so weak. I am very disappointed in this treatment. I would not recommend it to anybody.

column2: angelina6913, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for 2 years and i love it. I don't have a period anymore and I don't have to worry about taking a pill everyday or having anymore babies right now. My husband loves it, he says he doesn't feel anything.

column2: jsmith0621, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I became pregnant before my third child was even 1 yr. Then I miscarried. I didn't want to have to go through with that again since I was nearing my 40th birthday. After talking with my doctor about my options I had the Mirena inserted. It has been one of the best decisions that I have ever made. Yes, there was a little pinch when inserting but nothing more. And, no more periods. I will be having my doctor remove and reinsert a new one this month.

I'm 25, mother of one. I had the mirena inserted at my 6 wk check-up in May. My doc told me I'd feel 3 cramps.. felt 2 but nothing worse than a regular period style cramp. Spotting for a couple months on and off.. rarely needed a liner for it even. Have had 2 three day periods so far. My husband doesn't feel it or the strings and I don't feel it. I love not having to take any birth control. Sex drive is very high. Works wonders. I breastfed my little girl for the first 5 months. No cramping in many months.However.. I've had lightheadedness the past couple months. I've also gained a good 20 lbs. I moved after her birth and just seen a new doc about both of these factors. She knows I'm on mirena and never mentioned these could be related to that so it's interesting others mentioned these. I will ask her at my next appt in a couple weeks. She did different tests to check out what could cause those and all came back normal.. so very interesting to me now!

column2: littlemama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: When i first got Mirena put in it was a little uncomfortable but that goes away as soon as they are done and then you don't even feel it. i got it put in on my period so the cramping was normal nothing you cant handle after having a baby. But i did have a long period for about 2 months of light bleeding but after that was done not even as much as spotting. its been a little over a year now and still no periods and no side affects, and most important, no unplanned pregnancies. i love it and would recommend Mirena to every one out there that is wanting to wait for a while for more kids.

column2: runningrn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the second Mirena IUD I have had and I am 25. The first one I had taken out after two years due to unrelated problems.  This time I had it put in in April due to a period that went for 25 days.  The first insertion at 19 and no births, was awful and I cramped for 24 hours.  This time it was nothing.  My period is now gone, not even spotting.  The only problem this time is I am shedding a lot of hair.  I have thich hair, so I don't have bald spots.  This didn't happen the first time.  I would rather have thinner easier to fix hair.

column2: tomataan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for 3 years and it is amazing.  I actually have had no mensus since insertion and forget I even have it. My husband doesn't feel a thing and I can testify it is effective.  I have 2 more years and plan on another insertion of mirena which upon initial insertion really did not hurt. Thank you makers of Mirena.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I agree with others that have suggested to not take so much of the negative feedback on this site into consideration before you get Mirena.  I looked at some of the comments, got a little concerned but kept my appointment and I am certainly glad I did.  I am 43 and have no kids, didn't want estrogen and this was a great option for me.  It was a little uncomfortable to get but I kept thinking of how convenient it was and how much I was looking forward to less/lighter periods.  I did experience a little discomfort for a couple days - then a couple days of spotting but now 10 days after I am feeling great.  I highly recommend this if it is an option for you with your doctor - it is worth it for me so far!

column2: ttfn7381, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got the Mirena put in 9/10, doc told me I had to put it in during my period to ensure I wasn't pregnant. The procedure was ok to handle I had two kids w/o and drugs. I was still having boold clots at day 10, finally it subsided. But having intercourse with my husband or having a bowel movement aggravates it. I hope this will subside as my doc assures me. She highly reccommended it. I cramp occasionally, but it doesn't bother me. I've had two kids with no drugs! I got the Mirena cause of the risks other other forms of b/c and I can't remember the pill. I don't want my husband to get fixed, I'm still trying to convince him to have more kids. I'm anxious to find out the long term and hope this side effect dissappears and no others occur.

column2: aunt2b2003, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for 1 year and 1 month.  Starting out it was great.  Bled some, not terribly bad.  Insertion was a breeze and I really believed this was heaven sent. Now a year later I'm questioning the length of time this product has been tested and feel that Bayer has not tested the product for a sufficient length of time to report the effects to providers and patients for long term use (past the 3 to 6 months they stress abnormal bleeding).  Not only was there not enough information out there when I researched this form of birth control but now there seems to be more negative than positive and you really have to question that. I have to agree with alot of the women that the side effects are pretty tormenting. The side effects should really be looked into before making the decision to use Mirena.  If you do choose this form of birth control I wish you the best.

column2: SSHILL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I cannot say that this isn't the most convenient method of birth control out there but there can be, depending on the individual many side effects. I am one of those people! I am 28 and have two children. I have had my IUD for 9 months. For the first 3 months I bled everyday...from then on my periods have been eratic but light. I thought I wan losing my mind when I woke to a face and upper back full of acne- something I have never had before. I have totally lost my sex drive like many other women. FOr me insertion was not bad but I am looking forward to having this thing removed. I tis just not worth the side effects....

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had it put in Monday afternoon, it is now Saturday. It was extremely painful, I was told because I've never given birth. I had cramps for the first 3 days that were like a period, very little bleeding though. I have since experienced some abdominal pain the last 2 days. Going to give it some time but if it continues I will have it out and get my tubes tied instead. I did this so I could have more sex with my boyfriend, not less because I'm uncomfortable!

column2: imthatdamnshorty@yahoo.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have had my iud for a year now and i still bleed everytime i have sex and about every 2 weeks i have my full period. and getting the thing put in hurt so bad i cried out loud yelled and i felt sick to my stomach and dizzy for a long time but the only problem i have with it is the excessiive bleeding

column2: PcLvNHapines, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 22 year-old mother of one. I had Mirena put in about a week ago. There was hardly any pain in the procedure, but I did have some slight cramping and light spotting for 2 days afterward. I did not even need to take Tylenol. I feel great now, and my hubby and I have already had sex and he can't feel it in there at all, so that's a plus. I had tried Nuvaring before and had some bad side effects. I don't plan on having another child for a couple of years at least, and I can't remember to take a pill so this method is VERY easy to use!

column2: AllGood, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Severe depression, mood-swings for this patient with a previous dx of bipolar II. I'm getting it removed on Wed b/c even the small amount of hormone triggers mood-swings and suicidal depression (I attempted suicide and Mirena is but one contributing factor)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 26 and had this put in a month ago.  I exercise regurlary, count my calorie and carb intake.  Dont use sugar and salt to an excess.  My weight has not fluctuated since the birth of my second child, almost 4 years ago.  However, I have already gained 10 pounds, reducing my carbs and calorie intake would not be healthy (going under 1200 a day) and to work out daily for two hours is enough.   In addition, I have severe pain and swelling in my legs as if I was going to burst with pressure.  I have commented this to my doctor and he said first, Mirena doesnt have those side effects.  I was appalled, not only did he lie straight to my face, but his nurses advised the same.  I cannot believe this. MIRENA discloses this type of side effects on the pamphlets and internet site.  How disgusted I am to know medical practitioners mask pharmaceutical companies.  I never used any type of contraception since I dont like any type of medication or hormones.....Nevertheless, I hate this experience, the pain upon insertion, severe cramping, mood swings, headaches, weight gain that is not just water retention (is what doc and nurses concluded I was suffering from)  I WOULDNT RECOMMEND THIS AT ALL.  MEN YOU NEED TO GET a vasectomy done!!!!! we deal with enough JUNK!  THis is coming out next friday...i am NOT submitting my body to this junk.

column2: mommyof3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 27 yr old mother of 3.  I had this put in in dec 07 about 10 wks after last child.  It hurt but no more than cervidil i needed for all 3 labors.  I had cramping for 2 days.  My husband could feel the string at first but that resolved itself.  I stopped gettting my period in April.  Before that it lasted for about 10 days.  No increaded acne, I have lost 10 lbs, and i enjoy sex more because no risk of pregnancy.  The only thing I have noticed is i am tired but the 3 kids might have something to do with that.  If you have a child already it tends to be easier because your cervix has been stretched out already.  Also if you are predisposed to the side effects it causes it would be a good idea to stay away.  I am very happy with the Mirena and so is my husband.  I would recommend to try it but if it is not for you , you can always change your mind.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted about a week ago. I've been on various forms of birth control since I was 15 to control ovarian cysts and heavy menstruation and cramping. I started having migraines with vision changes with the combination pill and was told that I couldn't be on that anymore due to risk of stroke. After talking with my doctor we decided that the Mirena IUC would be the best option for me. If I had read these reviews beforehand I never would have gone. The pain was close to being the worst thing I have ever experienced. Like many here I was told it would be "uncomfortable" and that I should take some ibuprofen before having it done. As far as I can tell the ibprofen did absolutely nothing to help with the pain. I am 24 and have never had children but my doctor had assured me that it would be fine. I cried and moaned and did my best to keep from outright screaming during the procedure. Several times I almost had them stop and give up on the whole thing. It took nearly 20 minutes and she had to call a nurse in to help because she couldn't get my cervix open and then she couldn't get the IUC to go in. I ended up laying in the exam room for almost an hour afterward until the pain went away enough for me to move. I bled a lot (soaked through 2 maxi pads that afternoon) and had very severe cramping for 2 days. It has been a week now and I am still having mild cramping and steady spotting. I'm willing to give it more time because this is basically my last option, but so far I'm not terribly impressed, and I will probably not have another one put in again ever.

column2: nursechick 22, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The insertion was a little painful but quick. I had cramping for the first 2 days but now none at all. I had some light bleed for about 2 weeks but that has now subsided too. I am very happy with it. I also had my first period and it was very light normally it is very heavy so I was thrilled about that!

column2: crytsal_wolter, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The only things I so not like with this form of birth control are; I don't know if or when I will get my menstal cycle and the abdominal pain.  Having the IU has also caused me to have an ovarian cyst which is not serious at this time.  Otherwise, my husband and I have not had to worry about having another child until we are ready.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So far so good!  I had been on the pill forever, and after having two children, and at 44, I wanted something that I didn't have to think about all of the time.  I would forget to take my pill sometimes for 3 days in a row!  It is quite painful to get inserted, like a giant cramp or contraction and lots of pressure-but it was over relatively quickly.  My period was fine, but lasted about 3 days longer than usual.   My body seems to be happier with it-my sex drive has increased-things feel more sensitive now.  Go back in October for a check up.  My husband has not been bothered with the string, and actually thinks it's great because it has taken a worry off of our shoulders.  Hope it continues to be a positive experience!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: No one, not even my doctor, prepared me for how painful the insertion would be.  I literally cried out loud in pain.  It was a quick procedure but the strings got caught and my doctor accidentally removed it...so I had to do the whole entire procedure again.  But that wasn't anyone's fault I guess.  The pain so severe, however that I felt lightheaded for the next few hours and had to go home early from work.  Pain relievers did not work at all.It has been two weeks without any pain and now all of a sudden, I am having severe cramps and feeling light headed again.  I have a follow up appt with my doctor next week so we shall see.Besides the initial pain, it seems to be working well.  I am rather moody but I kind of expected that.

column2: k9dawg, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mine in for 3 1//2 years. I've enjoyed not having to take a pill everyday or worry about getting pregnant.  However, for the first 6 months, I bled everyday. After that, I've had very few periods at all.  I've become prone to get bacterial vaginosis (bacteria in vagina that causes that fishy smell) more often, especially after I have a period.  I'm also moodier than I was ever before.  So..this treatment has its ups and its downs.  For me, I've decided not to have anymore children, so when my 5 years is up, I will be looking for a more permanant fix.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is the second time that I've had the Mirena IU. The first time was after the birth of my first child (7 yrs ago), and the second after the birth of my second child (2 1/2 yrs ago). I had no problems getting pregnant again after the removal of the first one. Both times I experienced few problems, although I wish I had known that decreased libido was a possible side-effect. Not sure that that cannot be attributed to other causes (screaming baby at inopportune times for example). I would certainly recommend this product to friends, although if they experienced any of the nastier side effects I would definitely recommend that they try something different ASAP because it does seem like there is a significant portion of the population for whom this  product does more harm than good.

column2: csidak, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: after having the mirena inserted i experienced cramping and a period that lasted three months. i wanted to have it removed and my doctor decided to put me on estrogen pills to stop the bleeding, which caused tingling in my arms and legs,dizziness, and hot flashes. i have also been losing hair and can not drop weight from having my daughter. i would not recommend this birth control.

column2: am25, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: alot of weight gain and mood swings

column2: easybreezy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I looked to this website of ratings to get an idea of how people felt about Mirena.  I agree that the majority of the reviews are the negative. This teriffied me and I almost didn't go.  I started praying about the situtation and reminded myself that everyone is different.  So far, I have had not problems.  I had the procedure on 8/29.  I had mild cramping for a few days and that was it.  No other side effects. I will revisit my doctor in six weeks.  I will provide an update at that point. It is worth it to give it a try.  You can have it removed if you don't like it.  See you in six weeks :)

column2: aj, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: EVERY WOMAN IS DIFFERENT! It seems like the majority of postings on here are negative. If you are looking on here to try to help you decide whether or not to use Mirena, you may get scared away- I almost did! I decided to get the Mirena and am thrilled that I did! I was in and out of the doctors office in 10 minutes! It was quick and easy. I only had light bleeding/spotting for 2 days after insertion. Other than that, I've had no other side effects! The best part for me is that I don't have to remember to take the "pill" anymore!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I can't believe the side effects many reviewers are trying to pin on this IUD. Many, many Rx drugs cause hair loss, anti-depressants are one of the main ones. Adult acne in women of child-bearing age is extremely common, and is usually worse after childbirth. Weight gain can be attributed to so many other things, especially when caring for small children. I highly doubt all the side effects listed here are due to an IUD. I used the Mirena for all 5 years, never had a period, and it worked great. Many of these symptoms have come and gone over the years, but can easily be attributed to other conditions or medications. I had it removed just this week, and after hopefully having one more child I will have another put in. Removal was difficult due to the strings being cut way too short, but that was not the fault of the Mirena. Insertion was a breeze, but I have a high pain tolerance. I would recommend this to anyone who wants easy, reliable birth control.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
susan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this in since July 2006.  I had extremely heavy period that would last literally months at a time.  The only time my period ever gets like that is when I am on birth control.  Anyway, I have had bad headaches and never really put it together until i started doing some research on this thing.  Turns out that my sinus problems and chronic tiredness could be linked to the IUD.  While I was on the pill, at one point I felt like I was having a stroke.  I have been feeling the same kind of symptoms for the last year or so.  I still have a period every month.  I'm only 26 and in pretty good health.  I have had three children.  I have been fighting the urge to get this thing taken out for over a year, and everything on the web seems to solidify my theories.  I am going to get it taken out as soon as I can.

column2: worried in michigan!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 30 years old and I had the Mirena putin Aug. 25, 2008.  It was extremely painful!!  I have been suffering from excrutiating back pain ever since my doctor put this in.  I am also scared to death to have sex, I am afraid something bad will happen, after reading the pamphlet that the doctor gave me.  I am also scared that my husband will feel the string and not be aroused by sex with me anymore.

column2: Lydia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I may be on the brink of menopause anyway, but after I got my Mirena, my periods stopped completely which has been nice after many years of heavy bleeding.  I have had no other side-effects.  I previously had a Paragard for 13 years and was also very happy with it, except for the heavy periods.

column2: Marr7791, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 31 year old Mom of 2, ages 6 and 4.I had Mirena inserted in October 2007. I got my periods regularly until April 2008 and then they went away completely. I still experience a mild cramping when I would normally get my period, and also the mood swings. My doctor prepared me for up to 8 months of discharge and random bleeding, however there was a point that it concerned me so I got checked out. Other than that, I have loved this product. I am NOT a pill taker, and even the Nuva ring was difficult for me. I love having this, the minor cramping and discomfort felt for the first months do not surpass the freedom you get from this product. I have better sex with my man, and better yet, its not permanent birth control so we can have another baby when we are ready.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: bleed all the time with severe cramps

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had Mirena inserted 2 days ago.  I am 35 years old and have never been pregnant.  I had been on the pill since since I was 17 years old with no problems but wanted something with no upkeep (no pill to take daily, no refills).  I was on my period for the procedure and it was EXTREMELY painful.   Was not just slightly more uncomfortable than a pap as my doctor told me it it would be.  Measuring my uterus was the most painful part and had to be done twice.  Also, the instrument used to open my cervix nicked a blood vessel and it took almost 10 minutes of swabbing with a clotting agent to get the bleeding to stop.  This definately contributed to my pain for the rest of the day.  The day of the procedure I experienced intermitten strong cramping as well as the pain from my cervix.  The next day I had a constant cramping which also caused pretty severe back pain, but very little bleeding.   This is my third day and the cramping and back pain has decreased significantly but there is more bleeding.   I think reading the comments here helped me prepare mentally for the procedure because I was not surprised by any of it.  Time will tell if I end up having worse side effects, but so far it hasn't been too bad.  I suggest having it done on a Friday so that you have the weekend to rest and recover.  I have just been taking 800 mg of ibuprofen every 4 hours for the pain but definately would have liked something stronger the first 2 days.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After reading other reviews I am starting to wonder if my acne, fatigue, and increased depression are a result of this too?  I have had this in for about 6 months now.  It has been effective, and although painful the insertion was very quick for me.  Oh, and my sex drive has also declined though I should say that I am not sure if these side affects are from having just had a second child 9 months ago or what.  I don't want any more children so I may ask my husband to have a vasectomy and then have it removed to see.  Though I have always suffered with depression somewhat, for the first time in my life I am seriously considering antidepressants.  Oh, and I too am experiencing difficulty loosing weight

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: when i had the mirena put it the first time it was the worst pain ever. i was sick for 4 days and my doctor said i would be fine and after that is was. my periods was 2 days long and very light. but after 7 month my husband started feeling the string and i went in for a visit well to my surprise it had came out without me knowing. i had it replaced last month and i just had my period last wednesday and its been here ever since. i also have acne in my face, mood swings and lower adnomal pains. maybe this is the way its surpose to be and i will give it a few more months and if it don't get better i will have it removed

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have experienced cramping that varies from mild to intense, I have had a period once in the almost 3 months of having the Mirena. It was very light but very crampy. I do have mood swings but my sex drive is higher then ever!

column2: Whitney06, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 20 years old and i had the mirena put in 8 weeks after i had my son. my doctor talked very highly about it and i'm terrible at remembering to take the pill, so i thought i'd give the mirena a try. insertion was quick but uncomfortable.. i was pretty crampy afterwards but by the next day i couldn't even tell it was there. i got my period about a week afterwards and unfortunately it lasted 40 long days. its been 4 months since that and i haven't had  a period since. i haven't noticed any side effects inparticularly.. but after reading other reviews i'm beginning to wonder if my loss of sex drive is because of the mirena? i guess i won't know until i get it taken out.. and since i haven't had any major health problems i will most likely keep it in until i decide to have another child. i'd say overall my experience has been pretty good =)

column2: jodi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had Mirena for about a month now and have been bleeding pretty heavy ever since.(definately not just spotting) After intercourse I bleed even heavier for at least 5 days after and it makes me not want to have sex anymore. Usually the bleeding would increase shortly after, but last time it started gushing during and my husband got scared and stopped. It seems to be getting worse and worse. I haven't noticed any other side effects, but the bleeding is getting so old. I wanted to wait it out, but am not sure I can much longer unless it stops. I am so frustrated because I loved the idea of being off the pill. I've always had pretty heavy periods but this is far worse. I am so disappointed.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted 6 weeks ago and it came out today, I like many other women started having side effects which included: chest pain, numbeness in my arms and legs, tired all the time, can't sleep at night, nausea. I really hope I start to feel better soon now that is gone.

column2: TLM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the mirena for 2 weeks now. Did not like the procedure, doctor had a difficult time inserting it (I have children) it was very painful and should not have been (I had to be numbed). I have been bleeding since (not spotting), headaches, nauseated, moody and extremely tired since a couple days after it was inserted. I am trying to be patient, but...if the side effects continue- out it will come! Good luck to anyone considering it.

column2: FelixandSarah, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had it inserted June 30.  No problem.  No bleeding until July 25, and I thought it was a regular period.  But I'm still bleeding 3 weeks later.  HOWEVER I am not upset because reading their patient literature prepared me for bleeding for 3 - 6 months.  I'm giving it time.  That is the one and only side effect so far.  Skin is fine, I am LOSING weight because I am dieting and it's working, sex drive is in overdrive because we're just so releived that we're not going to get pregnant, can't feel it in me but I can locate the strings easily, no mood swings, regular headaches like I had before (nothing weird).  Everyone is different.  I am watching my body closely but I'm going to see if I can wait out this bleeding.  It's light to moderate and bright red. I am hoping for good results.  Everyone is different.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried this a few years ago when I was 36 and since I haven't had children it hurt very badly having it put in.  It seemed to make me cramp and bleed and hurt a little during sex.  I didn't have it long before I asked to have it removed.  Having it removed is painless.  I'm at a loss for what method to use now because I was on the pill for many years with no problems and then I hit 35 and the migraines and water retention and anger issues started.  That's why I went to this, but I didn't like it either.  Too much cramping.

column2: darkogirl610, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted 2 months ago and I really like it.  The initial insertion was painful because I have not had any children.   I also almost fainted in the doctor's office within 5 minutes of it being inserted (a little known potential side effect).  Other than that first day everything has been great! I have not had a period since I had it put in and my husband doesn't feel it at all.  I was previously on the ring which has estrogen and since being off of that my blood pressure has gone from 140/80 (borderline high) to 119/69.  When I asked my midwife about it, she said that some women react poorly to estrogen and that removing it is the reason for the blood pressure drop.  I would recommend this birth conrol!

column2: AngiP92@aol.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had this for 8 months after 2 months I began to have the headaches, joint pain/stiffness, bleeding EVERY TIME after intercourse (the only bleeding I had ever), mood swings, and a few more minor side effects. I had it removed less than 3 weeks ago and feel like I did before I had used the Mirena. I felt better within 2 days but it did take 4 visits to the OBGYN to get it removed. I had to call in very emotionally distraught and at wits end to get it done. The OB also doesn't feel that my complaints were from the Mirena even though I had done nothing differently to add the issues to my body. It did not hurt to have it inserted or removed, but I have also given birth 2 times. Good Luck to all!

column2: ready for a change, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about a year now, and i have had almost all the side affects that most people are complaining about (acne, unsteady weight gain and loss, mood swings, tiredness, hair thinning in certian spots, long periods, and cramping, depression, loss of sexual drive dry skin, and every time i have sex, i spot) and plus when i got it put in, i cramped really badly and blead for 2 months straight. Yes i agree that the side affects sucks, but the pill that i was using at the time (ortho-tri-cyclen) was doing the same thing to me, the pros of the pill was that i had less bleeding on my period, and the cons was i had to take a pill every day and i was a little more depressed. After thinking hard on what choice to make (get it taken out or keep it in) i felt as if it(Mirena) was doing its job.  Every one situation is not like mines, I did not want to have any more children bc i wanted to achieve my personal goals in life by graduating college first and get married before i had any more, plus Mirena was easier. I know the pros are limited to NO PREGNACY, compared to the cons of many different side affects. I felt as if i can handle that for a short period of time if the rewards are greater in the end. And plus i had to understand that ALL medication have some sort of sideaffects that could cause death.
