But when i do decide to take it out in december of 2009, i am gonna get me some proactive and clear my skin (even though my skin was not that bad) and hopefully i wll go back to normal for the other side affects. I would recommend Mirena to any one.... who is over 21, who is a high achiever, wants to have sex and dont want any more unexpected pregnacies.

column2: Mom of One, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had Mirena inserted 6 months ago.  I have no complaints about this form of b/c.  I always had trouble remembering to take the pill and as a mother of an 18 month old, neither my husband or I were ready for another.  This seemed like a logical choice, and not permanent.  There was some pain during insertion, just like a bad cramp.  It was over before i knew it.  I did have bleeding for about 3 weeks after insertion, but for the next 5 months my periods got lighter and lighter.  This month, only spotting.  I have no problems with cramps, irritability, weight gain, or loss of sex drive.  My husband does not even know it's there.  Mirena is very convienent and I would definetly recommend it to others!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: It has been an absolute nightmare!  I had it put in June 3, 2008 and it came out yesterday, August 5, 2008.  Severe pain, ovarian cist, back pain, nausea, dizziness, anxiety and two trips to the ER in one week because of pain and nasuea.  Every test came out fine. (X-ray, CT scan, blood work & urine).  Not ONE doctor suggested I remove the IUD knowing it was there.  It was finally my insittence to have it removed and the doctor finally agreed.  Wouldn't wish it on anyone!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had the implant done and had it taken out 1 month after the fact. I had very heavy, painful menstul cycles. Lasting up to 3 weeks. Severe headaches, and was contantly tires. This did not work for me at all. I hope others have better luck with this.

column2: Jessica_Valentine, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my mirena inserted September of 2007. I just had it removed today! I loved it for the most part. It was easy and something you dont have to remember and rarely had my period. The only down fall I had with it was bad depression, mood swings, and I lost my sex drive almost completly. Getting it inserted there was little cramping but nothing compared to child birth and getting it removed and quick and simple. I'd recommend it to friends. It just affects different people different ways.

column2: mom4life, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: The Mirena seems to be good but I only had it implanted 1 1/2 months ago.  I do have some cramping and bloating for sure, and it may just be my eating habits but I have gaineda little weight.  Also, my face, neck, and chest are a mess!  Acne has NEVER been a problem for me but it is now and it seems like it is ever since I had the Mirena implanted.  Has anyone else experienced any of these issues?

column2: Amy , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've had it in for 5 YEARS and I am getting it right back in. I love this little thing no bleeding, no cramps, no clots, just great! I have never had any of the side effects and my sex drive is just as high as before. I've recommended it to all my friend, some have even gotten it and had no problem either. Don't believe all you read everyone is differnet and it is worth a try.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just had this placed last Thursday.  So far, it has been excellent.  I haven't had any of the side effects that others have talked about.  I feel so much better knowing I am protected without having to use another form of birth control.  Having had twins 3 years ago, we are not wanting anymore for a while.  I am not ready for permanent birth control, so this is the option we chose.  I did have some cramping when it was being placed, but nothing I couldn't handle.  I drove myself home afterwards and had no issues except for a few minor cramps.  I did take Ibuprofen before the procedure and took some more after I got back home.  I hope I am still loving this a few years down the road.  So far so good!! I would recommend it to my friends!

column2: mrsnelson78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Horrible side effects that built up the longer I had it in.  Eczema, anxiety, frequent migraines, no libido, weight gain, acne, sinusitis, vertigo.  Was never warned of these effects despite all being listed in the physician's literature on Mirena.  Ask to see it- it's in black and white.  Post removal side effects or withdrawal are as bad or worse and there is no research on that so good luck getting treated.  I wouldn't wish Mirena on my worst enemy.

column2: N E, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Mirena isn't for everyone. I am experiencing way too many side effects that the pro's of it are no longer out weighing the cons. I'm getting it out next week!

column2: mimiliz, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Glad it worked for previous reviewers, but I had horrible side effects- skin changes, weight gain (despite working out 2 hours a day) mood swings, depression, insomnia, joint pain and many others.  If it works for you, great, but for those of us it doesn't, it's truly a nightmare, and not just problems I blamed on the IUD.  The side-effects (including the weight, thank heavens) went away after removal. To those who think it's great, a warning however, I know women whose side effects didn't show up until many months or years later, until then they thought it was great.  Once the problems start, your body's a mess.  Hope this doesn't happen to you, I wouldn't wish this on anyone, even the know-it-all who thinks thinks the side effects aren't real.

column2: twinmom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: OK - I read all this stuff before I had Mirena put in and an almost did not show for my appointment - I am 34 and have had 1 twin pregnancy (but never went into labor and my cervic never dialated)- for all of you who are seeking comfort read this --- I had the merina put in while I was on my period. Was it comfortable - no - was it the worst pain ever - not even by a long shot! I had a Kidney stone that mounted this easily - 2nd only to giving birth to twins by c-section. Any way- that was in April - GREAT news!! I have not had my period since! The first month I felt very PMS had some on and off cramping and I could have sworn i could feel it and I spotted on and off - but nothing a panty liner could not handle. But after that - have not had any issues - no mood changes, I cant feel it, no weight gain (in fact I lost 3 lbs) and my sex drive is the same... I would highly recommend this - if you are someone who is very sensative or gets wound up about stuff ( you know who you are) you could easily blame all the problems of the world on this tiny little device - if you're not stop reading these crazy sites and driving your self nuts!!!

column2: Cheri, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 22 years old and have no children, but am married.  I have had the Mirena a month and a half.  Insertion was very painful, but that is probably because I have never had any children, but my Dr. didn't have to dialate my cervix.  I was dizzy afterwards, but I am dizzy after any kind of procedure I have ever had done.  I cramped a little and spotted a little for the first week and had a very light period this month.  I have only had to use a pad, which before my bleeding was so heavy, I had to use a super-plus tampon plus a pad at all times throughout my entire period, which usually lasted about 7-10 days.  My period now has lasted 9 days and I am still bleeding lightly.  Hopefully I will be done tomorrow.  The only complaint I have with the Mirena is I have been constipated and the cramps that are associated with that are unbearable.  I have been doing what I can to help that problem and what I am doing is working.  I was told of this side effect.  I have had stomach problems in the past, so I don't think it is because of the IUD.  I just went in and had it checked and my Dr. said everything is fine.  My husband cannot feel the strings.  I have not noticed any difference in my moods or my sex drive, but I have only had it in for a month and a half.  My Dr. told me to expect side effects for the first 3 months.  I am going to wait it out and see how this works.  I really want this to work because my husband and I do not plan on having children for about 5 years anyway.  I have not experienced hair loss, weight gain, or acne.  I am happy with this birth control, but I will repost in another month and a half and let you know how I am feeling.  I love not having to take a pill or change a patch or ring.  I love the freedom.  I am going to be patient and hopeful that the side effects do not worsen.  I would recommend this birth control method, but do research first and do NOT read the reviews of other women before you have it put in because EVERY WOMAN IS DIFFERENT!

column2: CMLS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am 39 and mother of a 6 and 3 year old girls. I had the Mirena inseted a week ago. Am experiencing light bleeding.  The insertion was NOT BAD at all. It only lasted a total of 10 minutes, start to finish.  Just took Advil prior.  Had mild cramping and still have very little back pain that Advil takes away.  I am just waiting to see when this bleeding will stop.  So far so good but some of these comments do scare me. I hope this works for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'M A 29 YEAR OLD MARRIED WOMEN. I HAVE A 10 YEAR OLD SON .I GOT ON DEPO 2 WEEKS AFTER BIRTH AND MY LAST SHOT WAS IN MAY 07. MY DOC TALKED ME INTO THE MIRENA CAUSE SHE WAS WORRIED ABOUT BONE DENSITY. I WOULD'NT CONSIDER ANOTHER B/C BECAUSE DEPO WORKED AND NO PERIODS.SO RIGHT NOW I'M A GINNY PIG.I'M THE ONLY PATIENT AT MY DOC'S WHO'S BEEN ON DEPO FOR 10 YRS.MY DOC INSERTED THE IUD HALF WAY BETWEEN MY LAST SHOT AND THE NEXT ONE HOPING TO ELIMINATE THE PERIOD THING.I HAD NATURAL CHILD BIRTH AND THIS THING HURT OF COURSE MY CERVIX WAS COMPLETELY SEALED NO ACTIVITY FOR 10 YRS. I'V HAD THE MIRENA FOR 1 YR NOW. THE CRAMPING SUCKS NO BLEEDING YET MY HUSBAND CAN FEEL IT DURING SEX. I WANT A HYSTERECTOMY DONE BUT MY DOC SAYS TO YOUNG SHE TYE MY TUBS BUT I HAVE NO INSURANCE. ALL AROUND SO FAR ITS NOT TO BAD OTHER THAN THE CRAMPS. I'TS GREAT NOT HAVING TO WORRY FOR 5 YRS ABOUT GETTING A SHOT EVERY 90 DAYS. I HOPE THIS HELPS SOMEONE MAKE THEIR DECISION IT'S A BIG ONE BUT IF YOUR SERIOUS ABOUT NOT HAVING CHILDREN RIGHT NOW IT'S A GOOD CHOICE.BUT ALSO REMEBER EVERYBODY HAS DIFFERENT REACTIONS TO METHODS. I'V HAD DIZZY SPELLS, CRAMPING, NAUSEA, ANY B/C I'V TAKEN WEIGHT GAIN BUT NONE WITH MIRENA SO FAR. I'V HAD MENSTRUAL PROBLEMS SINCE I WAS 12 AND TRIED JUST ABOUT EVERY B/C OUT THERE. I HAVE GRAVES DISEASE AND TAKE 3 PILLS A DAY AND HAVE'NT HAD ANY COMPLICATIONS WITH THE MIRENA. ANYWAYS GOOD LUCK ON YOUR DECISION.

I gave the mirena a try on April 14th.  I was told since I've had a child the process would be the equivalent to a pap smear.  Needless to say, that was not the case.  A trip back, two valium, and two doctors later it was sucessfully inserted.  Apparently my cervix went back to prepregnancy form .. basically it's like I've never had a child.  Anyway, I immediately began to notice side effects.  I became extremely irritable, had abdominal pain, hair shedding (in handfuls), bloating, and zero sex drive.  The only good thing about the mirena is no menstrual cycle and spontaneous sex (no worries about condoms or pills).  On June 27th I had it removed and began to notice a difference right away.  Please do your research on this before deciding to use this as your method of birth control.  The side effects are just not worth it!

column2: Mom of 3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a mother of 3,and chose to get Mirena due to a surprise pregnancy with my third(while on the pill).I've been on it for 4 months.The insertion of it was fine,cramping(but labor was worse).I got it inserted 2 months after my son was born and bleed for 2 months after that.I have severe headaches now,acne;which I've never had in my life!My sex life with my husband has gone way,way down hill and I gained 10 lbs easy!Yeah its great because you don't have to take a pill everyday,but it takes a toll on your body!

column2: ursula, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was very hopeful about this method of b/c DESPITE some poor reviews.  Well, my hopes were dashed within first couple of weeks of insertion.  I managed to stick with this method just shy of 2 months. I spotted occassionaly for the first month; then no bleeding!  Which would be fantastic!  BUT, not worth the extreme breast sensitivity and horrible abdominal pressure I felt DAILY. I was examined for that discomfort and had developed ov cysts.  Treatment seem to fail, abdominal pressure persisted and weight gain ensued. The discomfort was something I could no longer live with...it was like having all symptoms (in a more extreme form) of mensturuation, without the bleeding.

column2: Debora, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena put it 14 months ago 6 weeks after my 1st daughter was born. I only felt a small pressure during the insertion. My period was normal during the first 3 months. After the 10th month, my period was coming less and less. I have not had my period for 3 months now. No weight gain or acne. The only side effect for me is some nausceousnes and it has brought my sex drive down alot. This is the only reason I plan on removing it. Other than that, it has been doing its job. I do not have to remember on taking a pill or have a hard time to get pregnant again when we want.

column2: cbledawg, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this little torture device for nearly two years.  Since inserted my hair has been falling out in handfuls, I've got bad acne, my migraines have flaired up (2 a week as opposed to 1 every few months before), I've had a 2 year long sinus infection (yes this is one of the relatively unheard of side effects), absolutely no libido, serious moodswings, vertigo, I bleed for 5 days every 2 weeks, horrible cramps and about 5 ovarian cysts (one of which ruptured on me).  This thing is coming out ASAFP!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm a 29 year old single mother of one. I was hessitant to use anything with hormones but after i had this placed i haven't had any moodswings, depression, or panic attacks. I love it! It was a bit painful but worth getting it. I suggest getting this.

column2: LillyMom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only had the IUD in place for just over a week.  The insert was a bit painful, although uncomfortable is a more accurate description.  I cramped considerably for 2 days.  I am still spotting lightly, which will make this a 2 weeks of bleeding, so far.  However, I am usually quite sensitive to hormones.  Yet, I don't feel cranky or nauseous as I have on the pill.  As of now, I am quite happy I chose Mirena.

column2: Lexysinger, 25-34 Female
column9: I am 29 years old and a mother of one.  After having my son I was concerned about which birth control to take seeing as I was breast feeding.  My doctor recommended Mirena to me said it was low hormonal and would not harm my son.  I couldn't wait to have it put in.  I even told my husband, "Don't touch me, till I have this put in." LOL.  During the insertion, there was a little discomfort but nothing worse than a bad cramp that lasted about 20 seconds.  Then I did cramp for the next day or two like I did during a normal period.  My period was like a normal period during the first 3 to 4 months but would come about twice in a month only lasting about 3 days.  The cramping would come and go during those few months even without any bleeding.  After the first 6 months my period went from every month to every other month and only lasting 2 days then becoming lighter and lighter.  I would still get cramps off and on every month without any bleeding but the cramps were not severe just annoying lasting only a day.  Now after 2 1/2 years with Mirena in I do have a period every month but it is only spotting lasting only about a day or two, which is GREAT!!!!!!  Oh, for the first 6 to 8 months my husband did feel the string but only occassionally, so I went back to the doctor and they snipped it another 1/2 inch.  After that he no longer could feel it. However, I was told by a different doctor that they snipped to much off and was hard to see curing a routine check up. I have not had any health problems that I recall. In fact, my face cleared up and I have had no problem losing any weight. I love mirena and when my 5 years is up if my husband and I aren't ready to have another child I will have another replacement.

column2: Nicole, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 29 year old married mother of three...I have had mirana for 8 months..I put on 30 pounds!!! besides that I feel sick and I have had serious moods swings..I am not sure if the mood swings are from this..but I do plan to have it removed soon and tie my tubes....

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Painful insertion, severe cramps for 24 hours.  Also, something not many people have written about, but several of my friends agree...your sexual partner does feel the wires/strings and get poked.  Can make intercourse uncomfortable.  However, it is cost effective. I'm not sure if I will go back to using this after I'm done having children or not.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Spotted for the first month. But overall it is great! I would definitely sugguest it.

column2: wabbett, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena for a year and a half....and have been through hell, i am 22 a single mother and have had acne, depression,sever panick attacks, stomach problems, nervesnous, just to name a few. I am getting it taken out finally thank god. But otherwise the insertion was painless and it is effective. I would say beware useing this, my life changed because of it!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: experiencing constant bleeding, dizziness, nerveousness.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 27, no children, and I got Mirena inserted today.  I was planning on getting Paragard, but my doctor said that with the copper IUD most women get heavier and longer periods that don't go away over time. I was nervous about hormones in my body never having been on the pill/patch/ring before (didn't want hormones hijacking my life), but since Mirena is localized and doesn't contain estrogen, I changed my mind.  Insertion was not pleasant (yeah, it hurt), since I've never given birth. Some cramping today, but I feel great! It's such a huge relief to have reliable birth control!  I did not know about the possible hair loss, weight gain and acne side effects; they worry me a bit. Im also concerned about my partner feeling the strings during intercourse. My doctor told me that he cut the strings long so they would curl and not poke my partner (here's hoping it works). If all of those side effects are mild, then I am going to keep this IUD in for at least three years. Also, I recommend NOT reading all of the negative reviews prior to insertion - they will only increase your anxiety. I was very nervous before the procedure - its a big decision!  I do recommend, of course, reading as much factual information as possible, so you can be informed and have questions for your doctor. Will post if I experience any problems. Good luck!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have one child. I had the device placed for abnormal bleeding and very heavy long periods. I've never been able to take birth control pills. I had fibroids removed about a year ago with a D&C. My doctor thought my bleeding would slow down but it never did. My doctor suggested this device. Severely painful insertion for about 10 minutes and I had mild cramps for about 2 days.  So far so good with the rest. I have had spotting but minimal. I am hopeful that this will work for me. I believe eveyone needs to give things a fair shot and remember all drugs are individualized and take time to work. My doctor said to give it 6 months, before making a real judgment. She believes that this is actually one of the best products out there. I also believe how it works depends on your age and what other medications that you are taking and have currently taken in the past. It's scary trying anything new and not knowing what to expect.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got the mirena about 2 weeks ago, after using a diaphragm for 3 years and getting tired of the upkeep and mess.  i have thrombophelia so hormonal bc is normally not an option for me, but the doctor told me the mirena's hormones do not get into the bloodstream and progesterone doesnt effect blood clotting like estrogen.  the insertion was very painful (no kids) but was quick and the severe cramps went away after about an hour.  i have slight cramps every once in awhile and so far the biggest issue i've had is the fact that the strings cause my partner discomfort(dr. said not much you can do about that).  hoping none of these other side effects that are reported pop up in the months ahead.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Got the mirena about 19 months ago and since have experienced acne- I'm 31 not liking it, also the worst part is Ive noticed my pores have gotten huge. Is it possible it could be aging my skin. My skin was not like this before I had it installed. Also my eyes have been bugging me and are often dry. These problems only started since I've had it put in.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i think that mirena is working great for me, i was spotting for about a week and a half afterwards. after just light spotting once a month for about 3 days. i love the fact that i don't have to worry about popping a pill everyday or having my husband use a condom. i absolutley recommend mirena for everyone but just know that everyone is different.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had mirena for about 2 and a half months. insertion was very painful!!! i have not had kids so maybe that is why. my only complanint is that i have been spotting off and on the entire time, which my dr says is normal so maybe that will go away soon. as far as weight gain goes, you control how much wight yu gain or loose, yeah you may have to change your eating habbits in order not to gain, but i havent had a problem with it. i think ppl like to blame thier weight gain on something besides themselves. so far happ with merina.

column2: Shaaaawarren, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: was great for awhile... not anymore having major cramps and gonna get it removed tomorrow:(

column2: Darko9905, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Sheer regret!! I absolutely wish I would've never considered Mirena as an option. It's been a year since insertion & I've gained about 40 lbs, developed acne (at 29 yrs old!), my menstrual cycle has completely stopped, and my desire to have sex is now non-existent. Definitely dizzy, decreased energy, and excessive sweating. Can't wait to have it removed!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had this thing in for about a month and a half.  I was very open minded about the ease of not having to take pills anymore however, I have not stopped bleeding, not just a little either.  It is mainly during and after intercource.  It has interrupted my fiance and I a number of times and he has noticed that I am not as interested in sex anymore (never a problem before).  I am having it removed asap.  It is very uncomfortable for him and I don't like being at work and suddenly feeling a wet spot on my clothes.  It is so unpredictable.  I do not recomend this to anyone.  I have also noticed a definate state of depresion.  WARNING!!!  The doctors are using us as test dummies.

column2: topdogmill, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is the best birth control ever!  I was on the pill for 10+ yrs, but after my son was born experienced high blood pressure, so I then switched to the copper IUD - no hormones - so no moodiness or weight gain, but the heavy bleeding was not fun.  After my second son was born, on the recommendation of my best friend, an OB-GYN nurse, I tried Mirena.  Insertion was a non-event, just relax and take a deep breath.  I spotted for about 6 weeks afterwards, and now have no periods.  I may spot once every 3-4 months, but that's it.  I actually have decided that if I do have another child, I will not have a tubal ligation (seems like a standard when you deliver by C-section), because I love Mirena and the fact that I don't have periods anymore, and it is more effective than a tubal according to my doctor.  I highly recommend it - the best birth control i've ever used, and the last one I'll try.  The other bonus - my insurance covered Mirena so with my copay/deductible it was about $100.  Then after the initial six weeks, I have saved a ton of money by not buying any monthly supplies and not paying for prescriptions every month.  Highly recommend it - go with Mirena.

column2: TammyGirl, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am sitting here wondering weather or not to use Mirena. I am a single mother, 37 years old and I have an appointment as soon as my next period comes. I am reading these expierences that everyone is having and I am getting a little nervous. I know it doesn't affect everyone the same, but I really want to try it but nervous at the same time. Well I guess I just have to wait and see. I will send an update. Wish me luck :)

column2: cbournheard, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Mirena for about a month now.  My Dr suggested it as a method to reduce periods which would eliminate the pain I have with Uterine Fibroids. Since insertion, I have experienced extreme weight gain and prolonged periods (very light though).

column2: tired, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I never had children and my doctor recommended this type of birth control.  I have had it for 1 year and 5 months.  I'm not fond of it either.  I have really bad cramps two weeks of the month and I have a period every month.  For the past 3 weeks I have been spotting every other day.  I didn't even have that bad of cramps when I wasn't using birth control.  I also have soreness in my breasts.  I would like to have it removed but I don't want to pay the cost.  I thought I was the only one with problems but I guess not.  What attracted me was the "no periods" after a few months but that is not the case.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've had my Mirena since 2002 and had it replaced in 2007. I've not had any complications other than cramps every once and a while and best of all for me, NO Menstral Cycle.. What we must remember is that all medicine works differntly for everyone.

column2: danis, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using Mirena for almost a year now and I really like it. I have no children but was still approved to use it as a form of birth control. The insertion was painful because I had to be slightly dilated (praise be to all of you women who have had children!) and I bled/spotted for about a month. However since then I have only experienced a few breakouts and a bit of weight gain. I love Mirena! No periods, no bloating, no  having to remember to take a pill!!! I highly recommend it!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my second review for Mirena. I have been on it for about a month now. I say it is worth it. I just had twins about 4 months ago and I am breastfeeding. The procedure to have it put in was uncomfortable and caused cramping and nausesa the first day or two. I had mild to heavy bleeding the first three weeks. I have not been bleeding for about 6 days now. As for the hair loss complaint I do not notice any more so than what was before I was on Mirena. Weight gain not a facotr. Sex drive...about the same. It took about a week and a half before I was interested though because of soreness it being put in. Before Mirena I was on quite a few birth control pills that cause weight gain and depression so I am so glad I tried this one.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ok, so i've had this product for about 2 months now and i did not know that there could be so many side affects i'm now reading about. sadly my ob/gyn is not very personable so we never actually had a lengthy conversation about the product.  i just knew that after 3 kids i did not want anymore but since i have such a wonderful husband i might reconsider some day. but since i've had this put in, i've gained about 10 lbs, i've experienced cramping all the time, headaches, i've had my period 3 times in 2 months and i don't mean just spotting, and i think i can feel it!  does anyone have any suggestions?!?

column2: hardc08, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I hate this Mirena. Calling my doctor Monday to get it out and if she tries talking me into keeping it in for a few more months, I am going somewhere else.  I have had Mirena for a little over 3 months. I have been "spotting", more then spotting, the entire time and get cramps like I have never experienced before. It is the worse pain and shoots right down to my legs. I cant even stand up from the pain.  And I know I have a high pain tolerance, so this is not me being a baby. And it feels worse for some reason when I exercise, so I am scared to exercise now.  I have also experienced very painful breast on a few occasions, bad acne (I never had acne before this. Maybe one small pimple a few days before I would get my period), my complextion just doesnt look right to me at all, I have had a headache for the past 2 weeks (not bothersome but annoying), and I have definately noticed mood changes.  I am sure this is an effective birth control method.  I wouldnt know because who wants to have sex when your bleeding? Not me anyway.  Not everything works for everyone and this is definately not working for me.  When I went for my 6 week check up, my doctor told me to give the Mirena 6-8 months.  I dont think I can handle this for another 3-5 months. Glad it works for some of you though.

column2: Kati, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I thought this form of birth control was perfect.  I had the mirena in for almost 3 years.  I felt a little discomfort when it was put in however the pain was gone before the doctor told me it was over. I never noticed it again.  I did have some weight gain but it wasn't more than 10 pounds and I needed that anyways.  The only issue I had with it was that the string cut my husbands penis on the tip.  I had regular periods the entire time I had it in.  I just had it removed this week so my husband and I could have another child.  It did not hurt at all coming out. I will use this form of birth control every time from now on!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have spent sometime today reading over the previous reviews so I figured I would throw in my 2 cents as well.  I had mirena inserted about a month ago.  I was very nervous and even cancelled my original appointment because of the uncertainty.  My biggest mistake was reading all the negative reviews of this birth control.  Somewhere along the line I forgot that not all drugs or birth control work the same on everyone.  I can say that the whole procedure took about 15 minutes, that includes the doctors set up.  There was a lot of discomfort.  A LOT!  Similiar to bad period cramps, however lasting for a few minutes.  I left the office feeling fine and went home to relax.  The next few days I was in slight pain, not as bad as my period, just uncomfortable.  I did bleed for about a week after.  Light bleeding, I used a panty liner.  So far it has been fantastic!  My sex drive has increased.  You wouldnt believe how freeing it is to not have to worry about forgetting your pills or pesky condoms.  (I should mention I am married with 2 kids, youngest is a year and a half)  So far I have not had any of the negative side effects others speak of.  No weight gain, no hair loss, no reduction in sex drive etc.  My suggestion if you are considering it is to do lots of research on it and ask LOTS of questions of your trusted doctor.  Dont be disappointed by the negative reviews. This is not going to work for everyone.  Good Luck!

column2: Mother Chaos, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: my doctor convinced me to get the iud. i was going to tie my tubes. I'm glad i din't. i am a mother of 3 beautiful boys and thought i was done but i decided after finding the love of my life i want more. but not just yet. the incertion was extreamly painful and i was in tears. i bleed for over a month and no period. the only good things that i didn't have my period and it was effective. i cramped serverly the whole years i had it and i cramped after intercourse. it wasn't worth the trouble. i'll just stick to condoms. now after a month and a half of not having my period i had it. it's the worst period ever. clotting and heavy bleeding sucks. i do not advise any woman to get this implant.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Wost pain I've ever experienced! Yeah I didn't get pregnant on it, but that could very well be because I could never have sex.  I went to the ER and everything for the pain.  I had it removed before the first month was up.  It was put it to help prevent endometriosis pain and it only caused more.

column2: mljewell_06, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had almost every side effect of this drug, without the cancer part. I bleed almost every day. There is maybe a week out of the month that I dont. I have discharge all the time(no infection tho). Headaches, cramps, stomach problems, depression, SEVERE drop in libido(sex makes me want to vomit right now), fatigue, weight gain, everything.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: gladerica@yahoo.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I am so tired of being in pain and taking all theese pills that don't work someone need to do something and quick.  If you have any suggestions feel free to contact me email me at gladerica@yahoo.com.

column2: iuder, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was aware of no side effects but I have had major hair loss but I wasn't aware of why, but it was a long bloody procedure to put it in. column2: miss_dee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 31 year old mom of two, a 6 yr old girl and a 1 year old boy. Had my Mirena inserted in Feb/08. No cramping, but feel a little nauseous and some hair thinning...Feel like I'm stuck between a rock and a hard place because I can't use anything else except condoms...and that's how I got my fist child. No real complaints so far but the jury is still out...will post back when the bleeding stops...

column2: Tamra, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had mine in since August of 2005. I got it about 6 months after my daughter was born. I bled for a few months and then finally the bleeding stopped and I stopped having periods altogether. The IUD has been great for preventing pregnancy and it's nice not having a period, but I too have lost a lot of my hair and it seems to be looking worse all the time. Also, after I had my daughter, I lost all of my pregnancy weight plus 5 pounds. Since having Mirena, I have gained it all back! I now weigh more than I did when I was 9 months pregnant!! I cannot seem to lose it either. I also have depression, acne and bad uterine cramps.I think this IUD is great for preventing pregnancy, but that's about it. I am getting mine out and I cannot wait to start feeling normal again. I honestly wish I'd never gotten it and I don't recommend it. It's not worth having to deal with the side effects.

column2: jjalvino78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: Satisfied with the ease and reliability.  However the mood swings, depression, cramping, acne and weight gain are too much. I have only had it for 6 months and I will be having it taken out next week.

column2: Tanya, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena in for about 1 1/2 yrs. No problems with having it put in or with spotting, but about half of my hair has fallen out. My husband will be scheduling an appt to have a vesectomy, so I will have it removed as soon as I can.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I am 38 and runing out of options.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena IUD in for over a year now.  No periods.....ever.  No cramping, bleeding, no pills to have to remember to take.  It's great!  The convenience and ease of use is amazing.  If I were to comment on any negatives, it would be that my complexion is not as clear.  Occasional breakouts occur; similar to "that time of the month".  But, I've had no bloating or weight gain.  My husband and I are happy.  I would highly recommend an IUD.

column2: momof2girls, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Inserted on 9/11/06 and thought yeah no more pills.  Bleed for 6 weeks, just like after the recent pregnancy.  Gained 30 lbs and had some bladder problems.  Removed on 4/29/2008 and loving it.  No more bladder leakage and lost 5 lbs with in the first week.  Everyone that I work with all have had the same complaints about the weight gain.  I was also constantly moody with no period.  Well I would rather be moody on a monthly basis than be an emotional rollercoaster all the time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got it inserted yesterday. It was painful, but bareable since it only took a few minutes. I had sharp cramps go up my left side. My doctor gave me some motrin. I felt slightly nauseas and a little dizzy on and off the rest of the day. This morning my back aches and i have slight cramping. Generally, how I would feel on the first day of my period. I had twins three months ago. I was not on birth control before because of adverse reactions to the hormones in multiple types of the pill. I thought I would try this because it didn't have estrogen in it just the synthetic progestrone. I am breastfeeding, and was worried because the label says to discuss it with your doctor, but she said its ok. I am willing to try it out to see if it is worth it. I was shocked as I read the reviews to see how many women who had not had children were given this BC when it says you should not have it unless you have had children. When they insert it the doc is dilating your cervix think about it, it is going to hurt somewhat. I only rated somewhat satisfied because it is so early on, but I do feel very relieved about knowing I will not have to worry about getting pregnant again soon. I have only had sex with my husband once since giving birth because the act itself is still painful for me because I had an episiotomy. I still have a sex drive right now so I will know if the mirena is a cause for a decrease in my libido.

column2: Butterfly Love, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Lady, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: thornz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Wow! I am so glad that I found this site.  I had mirena inserted 6 weeks postpartum in Nov. 07 and was not told of all of these side effects. My shower drain is constantly clogged with hair. I get really bad headaches and my weight has skyrocketed!  I only gained 25 pounds during both of my pregnancies and easily lost it after my first child.  At my 6 week postpartum check up after my second child was born in October 07 I had already lost about 20 pounds.  I now weigh more than I did when I gave birth!  I have been very moody which my husband and I have blamed on my low self esteem with my weight and just the strain of taking care of a 3 yr old and 7 month old.  After reading all of these reviews I finally feel hopeful that I can get back to my old self if I have this IUD removed.  I am calling my doctor in the morning and hope that she can schedule me soon! I will re-post in a couple of months after removal to update on side effects and hopefully they have all gone away.

column2: ANGELA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: For all the ladies who had problems with this product, I feel your pain. I had Mirena inserted in January 2008 and its now 3 mos later and I can't wait to get it removed! I can't stand the break through bleeding, leg cramping, mood swings, and constant migraines. I feel sluggish all the time, I feel bloated all the time, and Lord knows the sex is extinct due to all the bleeding [all the time]. Mirena is not for me! I have 2 teens and definitely do not want anymore children. I plan to get tubal ligation in the fall. I figure 3 mos is enough time to see how well it works with my body. Yes, it does its job as far birth control goes (probably because you don't have sex due to the bleeding) but the constant side effects are too unbearable. Ladies listen to your bodies, if you're having difficulties in the early stages Mirena will only cause more difficulties later. I will have Mirena removed 3 months to the day of insertion and can't wait. Good riddance Mirena! 04/16/08 angela

column2: ReneeC, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had first heard about it when I was 7 months pregnant. I had researched it and luckily my insurance paid for the whole thing. I have had it for about 5 months now. I absolutely love it! I remember on the way to my ob/gyn I was so scared that it was going to hurt. I didnt feel a thing. A couple of days after I had it put in I was sick and crampy and I bleed for almost 2 months but I dont have my period at all now. And I don't feel it in there. I couldnt be more happier with the decision to use it!

Plus that child birth syndrome of forgetting how bad that pain was.  I'll never forget how painful having this has been. At least with the child birth I ended up having a happy little 3 year old face smiling back at me.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: tll08, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had mine inserted about 4 months ago, I haven't been on bc in 7 years b/c I hated how it made me feel, so after 2 (planned) children I didn't want to take any chances so I opted for Mirena. Has any1 else had this exp. and when did it get somewhat predictable????

column2: Rachel, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: To Pauline, you were asking for some help or advice. This is really something that you will have to try for yourself. Yes, it wasn't the most pleasant experience to have the IUD inserted (mine was a little jarring because I have never had kids), but just take a few asprin or advil to get relaxed and make sure to get a good night's sleep afterwards. Make sure that you monitor your mental and physical self. Look for hair loss (I did have some, but its gone away) or acne (which did happen to me too, but it went away), but if you start thinking in a different way and you notice that "Wow, the thought I just had really isn't 'me' and I do mentally feel different, then take it out. I had the nuva ring for one month. I was moody, irritble and sucidial. Once I saw the connection, I took out the ring and never looked back. I felt better right away. Since you are the only one who gets to deal with you all the time, you will notice changes that no one else will. Monitor yourself and even though things may suck at the beginning, just give it atleast a month so your body and adjust. You will do just fine.

column2: pinkshoelaces, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD put in 4 days ago and they have been the worst 4 days of my life.  Insertion was so painful I passed out.  After I was correctly anesthesized and the procedure was continued, the friend I brought with me to drive me home passed out too from seeing the amount of blood that dripped of the table and onto the floor.  What should have taken 5 minutes took 30.  My doctor recomended it for my endometriosis, praising it, and even suggested I go to work later that day.  I have had heavy bleeding and intense cramps since and am having this taken out asap the minute I start losing hair or gaining weight.  Hopefully the cramps and bleeding will slow down.

column2: Elsa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

What really drive me insane is the horrible cramps and the lower back pains. I like the fact that i dont have to worry about getting pregnant but i don't know if is really worth it.

column2: Poozabug, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had the mirena for approx 2 years.  I have experienced terrible lower back pain on and off for 2 years.  It has just occurred to me that it might be the IUD.  Has anyone else experienced this???  I have a gyne appt. in 2 weeks, I might have it removed, but I don't want my periods back.  I haven't had any hair loss or weight gain, but the back pain is awful.

column2: BrandiJo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been having a problem with bleeding every time I have sex and it has become an issue. I have had the Mirena in for almost 5 yrs. column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had this in place since November 2007 and at first I was pleased and then a week or two went by! It was very painfull getting it inserted. I had my period for almost three months (light and then Heavy), I have gained about 35 pounds regardless I work out three times a week, I have serious abdominal pains including cramping, and My sex drive is almost gone. I am 24 years old and NO children. I am going to get it remove ASAP.

column2: mom2donny, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Do your research before getting this device! I had it removed after 3 mos. because of the side-effects(weight gain,depression,joint pain,insomnia,acne,irritability). If I had seen these reviews, i would've never gotten it. I told my doctor about mood problems with birth control pills and was told this would not have the same effects(not true). AND if you are still breast feeding and thinking about getting this IUD, it is NOT proven safe for your baby, the hormones are passed to the baby in the milk (i was told it was safe to use while breast feeding, also not true). I realize some people have no side effects and love it, but if you have ever had problems with any hormonal birth control in the past, this device is probably not for you. If you do decide to get it, be on the look out for adverse effects, most women don't realize until months later that the IUD is causing them. If you do have adverse effects,PLEASE, report them to the FDA. You can do it online and it only takes a few minutes.

column2: Edsa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first I loved it. Now that I has been in for about 3 months I am having nothing but problems, all the time. I get black an blue marks on my legs all the time. It looks like someone had beat me up. And I am VERY DEPRESSED! To the point I thinking about killing myself. I have to keep telling myself that is is the Mirena and that I will go away once it is removed. I have headaches every day and cramping all the time. When I bleed, I bleed so heavy It is like I am peeing blood. The other day I have to change my pad 4 times in a 6 hour time table. I can not wait to have it removed and get back to my old self.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I have broken out with acne like I did 20 years ago.  It is horrible.  I think it may have fallen out a little.  I can feel the strings without actually looking for them.  I can see them with a mirror.  I am going in to have it checked and hopefully removed.  I did have hair loss after about a month both times but I thouhgt it was just postpardum????  So I am kind of in the middle on this one.

column2: abbie0924, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted 2mos. after the birth of my daughter. I didn't even feel a thing! I had a few light cramps afterward and some spoting for 3 days that has stopped now. I am happy that it didn't hurt like the majority of people said it would.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have had bad cramps since I had it done, and have bled for the last eight weeks

column2: luvley76, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am not usually one to complain about a new drug. Being an RN, I try to really give things a go and let it have some time before judging it but I am making an exception with this! Immediatel after getting the mirena I started losing my hair, they blamed on me being post partum. However this did not happen for the 8 weeks I had nothing in post partum. I kept it in thinking I was over reacting. It just kept getting worse. Then I lost my sex drive. COMPLETELY! Forget the birth control, who needed it I stopped having sex at all. It also made me very moody, even my husband noticed a huge difference. This went on and on and finally at work, I work in various depts I started asking others that I knew had it in if they had the same symptoms. Sure enough, sex drive was number 1 and hair loss too. I couldnt believe it. I even asked a few patients on the sly about their symptoms and many reported similar things. Finally the last draw came when I got my first period after 13 weeks, it was horrible and it never ended. It lasted 4 weeks of straight bleeding. I was at my wits end and had it removed. Amazingly my hair has stopped falling out, and I may just want to have sex again now! I am feeling much better and want to caution anyone to read up on this drug. Just because it is the next new great thing, doesn't mean its without some major side effects. Good Luck

column2: kgirl21, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Ive had it for a little over a year. I do have a lot of pain when im about to start my period. so far i havent had any of the symptoms that were described in other reviews. just once and a while i have sharp pain. my sex drive is the same as it was before. but before mirena i was on the pill for a long time. the worst part was insertion it only took my doctor like 2 minutes so it wasnt that bad.

column2: pauline34, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Maggie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had this inserted a year ago after my second child was born and had no problems until now. I have all the symptons of being pregnant but a hpt says I am not. I feel tired to my very core, nauseous, colostrum leaking, even though I finished nursing 1 year ago and now I am getting headaches more frequently. I am having it removed asap...I do not think this is a safe contraceptive...and the FDA needs to pull this off the market.

column2: Roxanne, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: *** Insertion***This was EXTREMELY PAINFUL to have inserted. I've never had children before, perhaps that was a factor. The entire procedure lasted about 4 or 5 minutes and it was the single most painful experience of my life to date. I question whether or not I EVER want to have children. I was screaming on the table, broke out in sweats, almost start hyper ventilating, wanted to puke, feint and defecate myself all at the same time. It sort of felt like a Papsmear multiplied by 1000.  They didn't offer me any kind of numbing agent or local anesthetic. GET IT. Don't let them convince you otherwise! Get someone else to drive you to this. Brochure says "may have some discomfort or pain during insertion"... what a joke, it was torture.I had just a little bleeding and cramps/ backache afterwards, that lasted about 4 days.*** Results ***I've now had this for about a month and I am very satisfied. I did not gain weight, or break out in acne. I actually lost weight and other than the occasional mild abdominal pain I have had no other cramps/back-aches. Appetite is decreased and I no longer crave junk food like I used to.  I also suffered no spotting or bleeding.  I feel like my sex drive has increased, no pain or irritation during sex. I think I have my period. I'm not sure because the bleeding is VERY light, almost not panty liner worthy. If this is a sign of things to come I'll be very pleased!I recommend this device but PLEASE GET A LOCAL ANESTHETIC BEFORE THEY PUT IT IN! ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAVE NEVER HAD CHILDREN!

column2: queen_gemini143@yahoo.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Ever since the first day my doctor inserted it, I have had nothing but pain. I no longer have a sexdrive, even when I'm having intercourse with my husband. I haven't had a period in a little over a year(I've had mirena for about 3 years now). No one told me that overian cysts could occur, I believe I've had quite a few. Sex is very painful to me and my husband. He says it feels like a needle is poking him and I feel as if something is being jammed into my uterus only on one side though. I have all of the side effects to my period without actually having my period. And the bloating is rediculis. I've talked to 3 doctors about it and they all told me not to worry about it. Some doctors they are!!I'm getting this removed as soon as possible, I just can't take it anymore and I want my libido back, its ruining my marriage. I'm just afraid it's going to hurt worse than it did when it was put in. That was the worst day of my life.

column2: happy to get off, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: Mrs_Michael, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I've now added anxiety to the list. I hate this thing b/c it has affected my life in the worse way. Oh and I bruises just appear on my legs for no reason. column2: Cristina, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I thought mirena would be a safe form of birth control for me since I had really heavy and long periods before I had my son. I was hoping  it would lessen or stop my periods altogether. But it was not completely effective. I did not get pregnant, but it made my periods worse. They last for months now. Heavier than before. And I rarely cramped before, and now it rarely stops. It is a rare side effect, I suppose, and I never thought it would happen to me, but it did. It was easy to use in the sense that the doctor put it in and I don't have to really mess with it, but now it hurts me and my boyfriend to have sex. And I've had it trimmed as far as it can be trimmed. And the cramps make me double over in pain. I just wanna curl up in a ball. And I can't really do that with an active 17 month old in the house. I told myself that I would at least give it a year to see if it would get better. But it didn't. I'm getting it taken out in February of this year and will have used it for 16 months at that point. I hope someone will read this and realize that some side effects may be rare, but they do happen. At least to some people. I just want to maybe save someone else from going through the nightmare that I have gone through. I am personally not satisfied with this birth control because of the side effects, even though it has so far prevented me from getting pregnant.

column2: Maryann, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was nauseous, gained weight, depressed, had mood swings, and even had a bit of "dripping of urine" on this med. If you begin to feel ill after having this thing inserted, have it removed because you will not feel better later, but worst as time progresses. Having it removed was the best thing I did for myself.

i got the mirena almost 2 yrs ago now and it has worked, however ive had many side effects. i did not find getting the mirena painful at all, but this is probably due to the fact that i have two kids. during the first yr i had severe pms, especially moodiness and headaches. those side effects have disappeared now, however i have gained 35 pounds and have lost alot of hair in the past year. although it is nice not to worry about birth control i would not recommend it to anyone, especially anyone with weight problems or headaches. i am considering getting mine taken out.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had it placed in about 2 yrs ago and i love it. There is no monthly birth control bills or remembering to take you pill. It really works. My partner hated it for the first eight months. He said it was like a sharp needle stabbing him. It also made sex uncomfortable for me. Sometimes I cramped so bad i would have to stop having sex. Weight gain was another problem. I was a size 10/12 when I got the mirena, since then I am now a 16/18 and almost in a 20. I gained 40lbs in less than 2yrs. I am actually thinking about having it removed as soon as I am able to. I am kind of still outweighting the good and the bad. I can deal with the low sex drive and even the cramping one week out of the month but the weight gain is making me think twice.

My OBGYN says that there is no way it could be the IUD.  However, I've been to every other doctor and they believe it is the IUD.  So I had it taken out yesterday.  I have a slight headache today, I am hoping that it is just after effects.  Oh also I gained 40 pounds, which I am now trying to lose.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had the Mirena IUD inserted six years ago to reduce heavy irregular bleeding despite being on the pill.  It was painful for a few minutes on insertion but then no problems at all. Periods dropped to 1 light day every 8 weeks then stopped when I started having chemo for breast cancer 12 months later. I kept it in because the Tamoxifen I was put on can cause thickening of uterine wall and Mirena reduces this so they cancelled out. Saw a different gyno after 5 years to have it removed but he wanted to do it under general anaesthetic! GP suggested to wait till own Gyno was available; he took it out in office last week with barely a twinge (one good cough!)I have read lots of reviews and it seems some people are unlucky or very sensitive but I loved it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My doctor suggested this b/c of endometriosis, and my inability to remember to take the pill. I was tired of forgetting and worrying about getting pregnant. Putting it in was nothing.  I had already had 2 children and I guess my cervix was ok with it.  No pain whatsoever, no dizziness, no cramping.  I did have moderate cramping for a few days afterward. My periods have been irregular, I have head headaches (which are sometimes really severe) which I never had before, acne which I had never had before and cramping which I was already used to from the endo. Even with the acne and headaches I still LOVE my mirena.  It is SO worth it not to have to worry about getting pregnant.  My husband has never felt the strings and I check each month after I have my "period" to make sure they are there.  Periods are so light I sometimes don't even have to wear a tampon or pad. I only notice anything when I go to the bathroom but no other time. I do cramp a lot but I can handle that with some ibuprofen. I would highly recommend this to any women who just hate the pill like I did.  I love not having to worry about anything.  It is so great!!
