My sex drive has not been affected at all, fortunately. I've considered having it removed, but I have been advised to wait for my body to adjust to the hormone (3-6 months).  I take Naproxen Sodium on a daily basis to ease the pain and discomfort.  Hopefully I'll feel better and fully enjoy the benefits and convenience of this birth control method.

column2: Shawna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have not had one issue since having mirena inserted. I do not have regular periods i spot for about a day then I am good. I never feel it and never have to worry about birth control which is awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!

column2: klarmond, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I decided to use Mirena after giving birth to my second child. Getting this device inserted felt as if I was in labor again. My period lasts for two weeks now instead of the three days before I had the procedure done. I have no sex drive whatsoever, acne all over my body, backaches, mood swings, weight gain and headaches. On the plus side I have no cramping, no stress over missing the pill and I am giving this device a year to work before I decide to take it out. It works great against conception and that is a great plus for me.

column2: mommy2clarke, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: With my experience, the only good thing about this IUD is that I haven't gotten pregnant. Everything else about it, for lack of a better word, SUCKS...since I got the mirena inserted over a year ago after the birth of my first child, I have frequent headaches, frequent breakthrough bleeding, and no sex drive whatsoever. If you enjoy engaging in sex on a regular basis, you want to steer clear of the mirena.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have to children, after my second child I decided to go for Mirena. Most of my family has it and they recommended it. I had a bit of cramping when it was first put in but it was worth it. I don't have to worry about it, you don't feel it and it doesn't bother your partner. Just make sure you are not having intercourse before you but in the IUD. I heard that my friend had it inserted and she had intercourse about five days earlier and she was pregnant at the time of the IUD put in. But other that that I hear many bad things from friends who don't even have it hummm.... Try it! Its  been great since I put it in. I believe the only side effect I have in the acne.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this device insertd after 2 pregnancies. It was a little painful when inserted but not too bad. spotting for a while but eventually went away. after the first time of using it removal didnt hurt at all i got pregnant within a month.  I chose mirena again because i dont have to worry about remembering to take the pill. my sex drive was low for a while but its coming back. with the first one the doctor cut the strings too short i couldnt find them so i went to the doctor they done a sonogram and it was still in so if you have that problem see the doctor its very easy to check.  if you have it put in make sure they cut the strings long they eventually soften and will not hurt your partner.

column2: mlh0396, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the mirena for about two(after my second child). It was very pain upon insertion, spotted for a month or two off and on, but lately I have suffered with 3 to 4 vaginal itching in past 3 month and my blood sugar has been run kind of high. My sex drive is completely gone.I suffered with lot of mood swing (so my husband and son(17yrs old) tell me), have a rash on my chin and ear that I have been seen the dermatology for about 3 to for month (hard to get rid of. I have mild cramps sometimes.I am call my gyn tommorrow, think about having removed to many side effect going on, but overall very effect for prevention of pregancy and no period ( havent had a cycle in about 1 1/2 year.If you want to keep your sex drive no have it done.

I am very happy that I got the Mirena.  My cycle is light...if any.  I don't have the cramping and don't have to remember to take something everyday.  My one downer...my cycle seems to be higher when my stress level rises.
I have had it in for about 9 mos and its comming out Friday and it can't come soon enough.  I have mostly all the side effects plus more!  I CAN'T WAIT TILL ITS OUT!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i can't say enough about how happy I am I chose the mirena. DEfinitly an option you should consider rather than using another birth control that is systemic (running throughout your entire system) LOVE IT!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had minimal trouble and feel more "sane" than before. I had extreme bleeding with the copper device and hardly any with this one.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've had the Mirena properly placed for 5months. Ever since I've had it, I feel different. I'm having mood changes, nervousness and anxiety and 2 of my doctors don't think it's related. How can it be listed as a sympton in black and white and be totally ignored when complained about? Is anyone else having these issues???

column2: aebert97470, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my IUD for about 3 1/2 years and yesterday found out they don't know where the strings are or if its is even in my body anymore. Make sure everything is explained to you first!!!!!! It is effective but I am going thru alot of stress and unsurity about what is happening right now.

column2: Heather, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had this "anchor" put in 6 weeks ago, to help with the severity of my menstral cycle. Extremely painful to put in-to the point of shock (I was not warned of this previous to)...it wasn't pretty. Anyway, I have bled and had cramps everday since...and it's getting worse. I'm getting it removed next week. I figure going back to a few, predicted, days of heavy bleeding and cramps will be better than bleeding and cramps everyday. I would not recommend this, it was totally not worth it for me.

I had no problems at all with insertion. A little cramping that evening but thats all. I spotted the first 3 months right around my time of the month, and then my periods stopped completely. Every now and then I may spot for a day or so. After about 6 months I started getting acne and now (almost a year into it)my acne is still around and my breasts get sore every few weeks. But its great. I don't have to think about it. My mid wife told me to wait a week till I had intercourse, but we did a few days later and my husbad had no complaints about the string "poking" him. I don't think I would want to use then after I am done having babies, but it's great for in between. I recommend this to anyone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have two kids now and I had the IUD put in after my second child...i loved it. It was slightly painful to put in but I would do it again if i had to.  Its so nice, one less thing to worry about.  And lets be truthful, sometimes you go out and have a little to much to drink or whatever and you and your husband come home and forget the condom...well not a problem, not to mention when we get five minutes to be intimate with eachother we do not have time to mess around with condoms and such.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been very satisfied with this medication and would usee again.  It was painful to put in, but worth it.  I have very light periods now and they have regulated.  I also like the fact I can try for another child right after having it removed.  I also don't have the moon swings pills and patches give me!  After your first child, try it!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i have had mirena for almost 4 years and at first i loved it but now i have had a lot of irregular spotting and cramping. i think it is very effective but sometimes painful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i've had this thing for almost 4 month now. was very painful to have put in. my body went into shock. I haven't had any kids, but they thought this was the best for me. since i've had it, i've been told it can cause infections such as UTI's and also PID. I've had constant spotting since it was inserted and also constant cramping. As of tomorrow i get it removed, but i'm afraid of it hurting like it did going in. I def. would not suggest this to anyone

column2: moogiam, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
llg, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Insertion was painful, but went very quickly, it was not unbareable.  Only had light spotting for first few days.  Some mild cramping on and off since insertion.  So far so good.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had two attempts at placeing Mirena, both have failed.  Each device came out before a month had gone by. It was worth a try (two actually) but it didn't work for me.

column2: blewnee4924,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just got it put in a few days ago. It was very painful for me (i haven't had any kids and i have a small cervix). The pain subside a little by the end of the night. I have still had some cramping and back pains along with some spotting. So far, even with the pain, i am decently happy. Takes the stress of pregnancy out.
I have only had slight break through bleeding, which occurred mostly within the 1st year of insertion.  I have not had any periods or any pregnancy 'scares' like I did on the pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I love my IUD.  The insertion was painful but tolerable, and for two years now I have had much shorter and less painful periods - fantastic.  I don't have kids, which I know is when they usually like to do IUDs, but always hated the pill; Mirena has been great.

column2: Mainegirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had mirena inserted because Dr was concerned about long-term effects of Depo-Provera injections(which has worked beautifully for nearly 10 years).  The insertion wasn't bad, but I developed lesions that made urination incredibly painful.  Eventually medication cleared that up, but I was dry, itchy and uncomfortable - intercourse was painful.  Dr. removed it after four months.  My allergist suspects a nickel allergy was the problem.  So, if you have many allergies, this may not be the answer for you.

I have had my mirena for almost 2 years now. I had very little pain upon insertion, about the same as a pap smear. My periods are lighter, shorter, and less frequent. I had heavy and unpredictable periods for the first few months, but after that it has been great!

It was very painful during insertion, and I have had alot of side effects from weight gain, depression, heavy vaginal discharge, cramps, and breast tenderness.  On the plus side, no period and no pregnancy.  Want it removed but worry it will hurt just as much.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my mirena for 1 year and have absolutly no sex drive if i could do it all over again i wouldn't get it

column2: eviemylove567, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have had the mirena iud for 4 months, about 2 weeks after recieving i was in extreme pain and the doctor found a large cyst on my ovary, which was very painful...i bled for about 2 months straight and then skipped a week then have been bleeding ever since...i have gained 20 lbs and have absolutely no sex drive at all...the wires are very painful and sharp and uncomfortable, i hate this for ow but im hoping it will get better

column2: Mandy475, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have noticed that since using this product, I have less periods and when I do get them, they aren't very heavy. I would highly recommend this product to my friends and family.

column2: TiredMomma24, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I initially started using mirena as a way to control my outrageously long and heavy periods. It took a while but after a year I almost never even have a period. And thankfully am no longer anemic. And I havnt gotten pregnant yet so its pretty effective  in that way.Im thinking of having it removed. Side effects are mild but I have been hearing way too many horror stories about it. I already know they cant find the string so If i did accidentally get pregnant I would have to try to carry to term with Mirena in me. If I didnt miscarry there are still other risks to a baby. I just don't want to take that chance. Plus i also think its been negatively effecting my sex drive.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i've found out in the 3 months that i've had it, it can cause infections like UTI's and PID.

column2: Jadesart, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the Mirena for almost 4 Years, and am very satisfied with its efectiveness! After about 1 Year with the Mirena my Periods lessend,PMS went away along with all my worries!! No I have decided to have it removed since My husband and I have decided to try for another child (our 2nd) and I was wondering about the symptons and affects of the removal. Can any one help with answers??

column2: jgry, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
parker24, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Very good birth control. I've had it for almost 3 years and I have some pain,I spot it seems with the season change, nothing heavy.A little scared about having it removed although putting it in was not that bad.

column2: momoftwo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I did a ton of research on birth control options, and was really excited abour Mirena. The insertion was slightly uncomfortable, and I had fairly heavy spotting for the first month -- both of which weren't that big a deal. My big complaint: it FELL OUT after 30 days! Pretty expensive birth control for one month (I paid $150 and the insurance company paid $500). My insurance won't cover another one (they only pay for one IUD every five years, somewhat understandable) and there is no guarantee from Mirena or my clinic. Basically I'm SOL. Threw $150 out the window. But I'm not bitter or anything...  :-)  PLEASE ask your OB about "expulsion" (the IUD falling out) if you're considering Mirena. I've read that anywhere from 2% to 30% (!) of users experience this (source: Internet medical websites).

column2: momaf2, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had the IUD in for almost two years. The first 9 months was okay, there was a lot of spotting, but other than that it was fine. But in the last year I've gained 40 pounds, had trouble sleeping, I've totally lost my sex drive, gotten acne and been having horrible mood swings. The side effects are different for everyone, but I would really encourage anyone thinking about getting Mirena to seriously look into all the possible side effects. On the plus side, I haven't gotten pregnant.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It was simple to use, had it inserted by my doctor in about 10 min. I had pretty intense cramps for a few days afterward. I still do have cramping every once in a while during and after sex, but it is still worth it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
queend, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My husband and I have 3 beautiful children and needed a reliable method of birth control without giving up the option of having another later. I am over 35 and did not want the pill again. The procedure took only about 30 minutes and I don't have to think about it for another 5 years.
the easiest birth control ever invented

column2: JolieS, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I opted for the Mirena although I have not had children yet and the insertion was the most painful experience of my life.  What should have been a three minute in and out procedure took over thiry minutes and even with topical numbing, it was incredibly painful.  However, after a few days, all was back to normal and I've no problems over the past few years.  Would recommend to other women, and highly recommend to other women who have already had a child.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
trina1997, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Putting the Mirena "in" wasn't very painful...I had lots of spotting for about 3 months afterwards.  I did seem to gain some weight and I started getting acne on my face.  However, now I am having an extremely light spotting for about 2 days once a month and I'm only 5 months into having the Mirena.  It's great for me since I have a blood clotting problem and can't use any estrogen birth control.  I am not having the extremly heavy periods every 2-3 weeks.  Hopefully my acne clears up and the removal is not too painful as well.

column2: otterpup, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: "Installation" was pretty uncomfortable.  I'd even venture to say it was painful, but only for a moment.  Then I wasn't sure I was going to make it through the first 3 months of having it in, because I bled constantly for that 3 months.  HOWEVER, once the bleeding stopped, it has been an absolute dream!  I've had it now for almost 2 years and my periods are so light, they're almost non-existent (a plus, in my book!)  My severe period cramping and bloating have also almost disappeared!  I can't see why anyone would not choose a Mirena!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The initial spotting is bothersome.  Easy to use.  Painful to have removed.  Deffinitely recommended for anybody that is not ready to be steralized, but wants a long term birth control method that is easy to use.
